hebrew_text: כׇּל כִּינּוּיֵי נְזִירוּת — כִּנְזִירוּת.
human_translation: all substitutes of nazirite vows are like nazirite vows
llm_translation: All designations of Naziriteship - are like Naziriteship.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר ״אֱהֵא״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר, אוֹ ״אֱהֵא נָאֶה״ — נָזִיר, ״נָזִיק״, ״נָזִיחַ״, ״פָּזִיחַ״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר. ״הֲרֵינִי כָּזֶה״, ״הֲרֵינִי מְסַלְסֵל״, ״הֲרֵינִי מְכַלְכֵּל״, ״הֲרֵי עָלַי לְשַׁלֵּחַ פֶּרַע״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר.
human_translation: one who says: I will be, is a nazirite, Or, I will be beautiful, a nazirite. a nazik , nazi’aḥ , a pazi’aḥ , he is a nazirite. I am hereby like this, I am hereby curler, I am hereby growing hair; It is upon me to grow long hair, he is a nazirite.
llm_translation: The one who says "Eheh" - behold, this is a Nazir, or "Eheh Na'eh" - a Nazir, "Nazik," "Nazich," "Pazich" - behold, this is a Nazir. "Here I am like this," "Here I am wavering," "Here I am hesitating," "It is upon me to let my hair grow wild" - behold, this is a Nazir.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵי עָלַי צִיפּוֹרִים״ — רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: נָזִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ נָזִיר.
human_translation: is hereby upon me birds, Rabbi Meir says: He is a nazirite. And the Sages say: He is not a nazirite.
llm_translation: "Behold, upon me are birds" — Rabbi Meir says: a Nazirite. And the Sages say: he is not a Nazirite.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִכְּדֵי תַּנָּא בְּסֵדֶר נָשִׁים קָאֵי, מַאי טַעְמָא תָּנֵי נָזִיר?
human_translation: Now, the tanna is engaged in the order of Nashim , What is the reason teaches nazirite
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'ma mi'k'dei tana b'seider nashim ka'ei, mai ta'ama tanei nazir?" Translation: "A teaching from the order of women stands, what is the reason that it teaches about a Nazirite?"

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא אַקְּרָא קָאֵי: ״וְהָיָה אִם לֹא תִמְצָא חֵן בְּעֵינָיו כִּי מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: מִי גָּרַם לָהּ לָעֲבֵירָה — יַיִן, וְקָאָמַר: כׇּל הָרוֹאֶה סוֹטָה בְּקִלְקוּלָהּ יַזִּיר עַצְמוֹ מִן הַיַּיִן.
human_translation: The tanna is engaged in the verse “Then it comes to pass, if she finds no favor in his eyes, because he has found some unseemly matter about her” And this is what he is saying: What caused to transgression wine. And saying: Anyone who sees a sota in her disgrace should abstain from wine.
llm_translation: The text states: "It was if you do not find favor in his eyes because he found in her a matter of nakedness." And thus he said: What caused her to commit adultery? — Wine. And he said: Anyone who sees a Sotah in her disgrace should abstain from wine.

hebrew_text: פָּתַח בְּכִינּוּיִין, וּמְפָרֵשׁ יָדוֹת.
human_translation: began with substitutes but explains intimations
llm_translation: Opened with designations, and explained his hands.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא כְּדִי: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: כׇּל כִּינּוּיֵי נְזִירוּת — כִּנְזִירוּת, וִידוֹת נְזִירוּת — כִּנְזִירוּת, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן יָדוֹת: הָאוֹמֵר ״אֱהֵא״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר.
human_translation: Rava said, and some say without attribution [ kedi ]: is incomplete and is teaching the following: All substitutes of nazirite vows are like nazirite vows. And intimations of nazirite vows are like nazirite vows. And these are intimations: One who says: I will be, is a nazirite.
llm_translation: Rava said, and some say it was as follows: "Lacking" from "lacking," and thus it was taught: All designations of Naziriteship - like Naziriteship, and the hands of Naziriteship - like Naziriteship. And these are the hands: one who says "I shall be" - behold, this one is a Nazir.

hebrew_text: וְלִפְרוֹשׁ כִּינּוּיֵי בְּרֵישָׁא! תַּנָּא מֵהָהוּא דְּסָלֵיק — הָהוּא מְפָרֵשׁ בְּרֵישָׁא. כְּדִתְנַן: בַּמֶּה מַדְלִיקִין וּבַמָּה אֵין מַדְלִיקִין, וּמְפָרֵשׁ ״אֵין מַדְלִיקִין״ בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: But let explain substitutes first, tanna the with which it concludes is the one that it explains first, as we learned With what may one light and with what may one not light And explains one may not light first,
llm_translation: To explain the designations at the outset! It was taught from that which was raised — that one explains at the outset. As we learned: With what may one kindle, and with what may one not kindle, and one explains "may not kindle" at the outset.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה טוֹמְנִין וּבַמָּה אֵין טוֹמְנִין, וּמְפָרֵשׁ ״אֵין טוֹמְנִין״ בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: In what may one insulate and in what may one not insulate And explains one may not insulate first,
llm_translation: In what can we designate and in what can we not designate, and he explains "in what can we not designate" at the beginning.

hebrew_text: בַּמָּה אִשָּׁה יוֹצְאָה וּבַמָּה אֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה, וּמְפָרֵשׁ ״לֹא תֵּצֵא אִשָּׁה״ בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: With what a woman go out and with what she not go out? And explains a woman may not go out first,
llm_translation: In what cases a woman goes out, and in what cases she does not go out, and he explains "a woman shall not go out" at the beginning.

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: בַּמֶּה בְּהֵמָה יוֹצְאָה וּבַמָּה אֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה, וּמְפָרֵשׁ ״יוֹצֵא גָּמָל״ בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn With what may an animal go out and with what may it not go out? And it explains a camel may go out first,
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: In what can an animal go out, and in what can it not go out, and it explains "a camel can go out" at the beginning.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ נוֹחֲלִין וּמַנְחִילִין, נוֹחֲלִין וְלֹא מַנְחִילִין, מַנְחִילִין וְלֹא נוֹחֲלִין, לֹא נוֹחֲלִין וְלֹא מַנְחִילִין, וּמְפָרֵשׁ ״אֵלּוּ נוֹחֲלִין וּמַנְחִילִין״ בְּרֵישָׁא!
human_translation: There are inherit and bequeath, inherit but do not bequeath; bequeath but do not inherit; do not inherit and do not bequeath. And explains those inherit and bequeath first,
llm_translation: There are heirs and inheritors, heirs but not inheritors, inheritors but not heirs, neither heirs nor inheritors, and it explains "these are heirs and inheritors" at the beginning!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְעוֹלָם תָּנֵי הָכִי וְתָנֵי הָכִי.
human_translation: Rather, actually teaches this and teaches that
llm_translation: Rather, always teach like this and teach like this.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הָתָם, דְּאִיסּוּרָא דְנַפְשֵׁיהּ הוּא — מְפָרֵשׁ אִיסּוּרָא דְנַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּרֵישָׁא. גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה, דְּאִיסּוּרָא אַיְּידֵי בְּהֵמָה הוּא דְּאָתֵי — מְפָרֵשׁ הֶיתֵּירָא בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: However, There, where it is own prohibition explains own prohibition first. with regard to an animal where the prohibition comes by means of animal, explains permitted first.
llm_translation: Rather: there, since it is a prohibition that pertains to itself - it explains the prohibition that pertains to itself at the outset. Regarding an animal, since the prohibition comes through the animal - it explains the permission at the outset.

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי ״יֵשׁ נוֹחֲלִין״ נָמֵי, מְפָרֵשׁ עִיקַּר נַחֲלָה בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: with regard to there are inherit also explains the principal inheritance first.
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of "yes noḥalim," it was explained: the essence of inheritance is at the outset.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא [הָכָא] לִפְרוֹשׁ כִּינּוּיֵי בְּרֵישָׁא! אֶלָּא הַיְינוּ טַעַם: יָדוֹת, הוֹאִיל וְאָתְיָין לֵיהּ מִדְּרָשָׁא, חֲבִיבִין לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But here, let explain substitutes first. Rather, this is reason: Since intimations are derived from exposition dear to
llm_translation: Rather here to explain the designations at the beginning! Rather, that is the reason: hands, since they come to him from the study hall, are beloved to him.

hebrew_text: וְלִיפְתַּח בְּהוֹן בְּרֵישָׁא! תַּנָּא כִּי מַתְחִיל — מַתְחִיל בְּעִיקַּר קׇרְבָּן, וּלְעִנְיַן פָּירוּשֵׁי — מְפָרֵשׁ יָדוֹת בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: But let him begin with them first When tanna begins, he begins with the main offering But with regard explanation he explains intimations first,
llm_translation: And to begin with them at the outset! It was taught: when one begins — he begins with the main offering, and for the purpose of explanations — he explains the hands at the outset.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר ״אֱהֵא״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר. דִּלְמָא ״אֱהֵא בְּתַעֲנִית״ קָאָמַר? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה נָזִיר עוֹבֵר לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: One who says: I will be, is a nazirite. Perhaps he is saying: I will be fasting, Shmuel said: where a nazirite was passing before him,
llm_translation: The one who says "Let me be" - behold, this one is a Nazirite. Perhaps he meant "Let me be with fasting"? Shmuel said: For example, if he was a Nazirite passing before him.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא קָסָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל יָדַיִם שֶׁאֵינָן מוֹכִיחוֹת לָא הָוְויָין יָדַיִם? אָמְרִי: בִּזְמַן שֶׁנָּזִיר עוֹבֵר לְפָנָיו לֵיכָּא לְסַפּוֹקֵא בְּמִילְּתָא אַחֲרִינָא. אֲבָל וַדַּאי אֵין הַנָּזִיר עוֹבֵר לְפָנָיו, אָמְרִינַן: דִּלְמָא ״אֱהֵא בְּתַעֲנִית״ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Shall we say Shmuel holds ambiguous intimations are not intimations, Say when a nazirite is passing before him, there is no to doubt to another matter, However, certainly a nazirite is not passing before him, we say perhaps he is saying: I will be fasting.
llm_translation: Let us say, does Samuel hold that hands that do not prove anything are not considered hands? They said: When a Nazirite passes before him, there is no room to be in doubt about another matter. But if indeed the Nazirite does not pass before him, we say: Perhaps he meant "be on a fast."

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא לְפוֹטְרוֹ מִן קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו קָאָמַר? דְּקָאָמַר בְּלִבּוֹ.
human_translation: But perhaps he was saying exempt from his offerings. where he said in his heart
llm_translation: And perhaps he is saying to exempt it from his sacrifices? He is saying what is in his heart.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: בָּעִינַן פִּיו וְלִבּוֹ שָׁוִין, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If that is so, what of stating lest you say we require his mouth and heart identical. teaches us
llm_translation: If so, what is there to say? What you might say: "We need his mouth and heart to be equal," is what he implies to us.

hebrew_text: ״אֱהֵא נָאֶה״ — נָזִיר. וְדִלְמָא: אֶנָּאֶה לְפָנָיו בְּמִצְוֹת? כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״זֶה אֵלִי וְאַנְוֵהוּ״ — אֶנָּאֶה לְפָנָיו בְּמִצְוֹת. אֶעֱשֶׂה לְפָנָיו סוּכָּה נָאָה, לוּלָב נָאֶה, צִיצִית נָאָה, אֶכְתּוֹב לְפָנָיו סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה נָאֶה וְאֶכְרְכֶנּוּ בְּשִׁירָאִין נָאִים!
human_translation: I will be beautiful [ na’e ], a nazirite. But perhaps I will be beautiful before Him in mitzvot? As it is taught “This is my God and I will glorify Him [ anvehu ]” I will be beautiful before Him in mitzvot. I will make before Him a beautiful sukka , a beautiful lulav , beautiful ritual fringes. I will write before Him a beautiful Torah scroll, and I will wrap it in beautiful silk cloths [ shira’in ].
llm_translation: "May it be pleasing" - Nazir. And perhaps: should I please Him with commandments? As it was taught: "This is my God and I will beautify Him" - I will please Him with commandments. I will make before Him a beautiful sukkah, a beautiful lulav, a beautiful tzitzit, I will write before Him a beautiful Torah scroll and adorn it with beautiful crowns!

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שֶׁתָּפוּס בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, וְאָמַר ״אֶנָּאֶה״.
human_translation: Shmuel said: where one is holding his hair and says: I will be beautiful.
llm_translation: Said Shmuel: that he should grasp his hair, and say "I will be a Nazir."

hebrew_text: נְזִירָא מִילְּתָא דַעֲבֵירָה, וְאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ ״נָאֶה״?
human_translation: naziriteship a matter of transgression, we say about beautiful?
llm_translation: "Nazira, a matter of crossing, and we say to him, 'Is it fitting'?"

hebrew_text: אִין, דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַקַּפָּר דְּאָמַר: נָזִיר חוֹטֵא, הָנֵי מִילֵּי גַּבֵּי נָזִיר טָמֵא, דְּאַיְּידֵי דְּבָעֵי מִיסְתַּר, דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״וְהַיָּמִים הָרִאשֹׁנִים יִפְּלוּ כִּי טָמֵא נִזְרוֹ״, הָתָם הוּא, דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְמִיעְבַּר עַל נְזִירוּתֵיהּ, אֲבָל נָזִיר טָהוֹר — לָאו חוֹטֵא קָרֵי בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Yes, as even according to Rabbi Elazar HaKappar, who said a nazirite a sinner, that applies with regard to a ritually impure nazirite. because it is necessary to void as the Merciful One states “But the first days will be void, because his consecration was defiled” It is there perhaps come to transgress his naziriteship However, a ritually pure nazirite, does not call him a sinner.
llm_translation: There is, for even Rabbi Elazar HaKappar who said: A Nazirite sins, those matters regarding a defiled Nazirite, for since it requires hiding, as the Merciful One said: "And the former days shall fall because his consecration was defiled," there, perhaps it comes to break his Nazirite vow, but a pure Nazirite - he is not called a sinner in it.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵינִי כָּזֶה״ — נְהִי נָמֵי דְּתָפוּס בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, ״הֲרֵינִי כָּזֶה״ — לָא אָמַר! אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה נָזִיר עוֹבֵר לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: I am hereby like this, Though indeed where he is holding his hair he did not say: I am hereby like this, Shmuel said: where a nazirite was passing before him
llm_translation: "Here I am like this" - he indeed held onto his hair, "Here I am like this" - he did not say! Shmuel said: For example, if a Nazirite was passing before him.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵינִי מְסַלְסֵל״ — מִמַּאי דְּהָדֵין סִלְסוּל שַׂעְרָא? כְּדַאֲמַרָה לֵיהּ הָהִיא אַמְּתָא דְבֵי רַבִּי לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא: עַד מָתַי אַתָּה מְסַלְסֵל בִּשְׂעָרְךָ?
human_translation: I am hereby a hair curler From where that this curling [ silsul ] hair As that maidservant of the house of Rabbi said to a certain man Until when will you curl [ mesalsel ] your hair?
llm_translation: "I am swaying" - from what is the swaying of hair? As that certain maidservant said to that man of the house of Rabbi: Until when will you sway with your hair?

hebrew_text: אֵימָא תּוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב ״סַלְסְלֶהָ וּתְרוֹמְמֶךָּ״? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָכָא נָמֵי שֶׁתָּפוּס בִּשְׂעָרוֹ.
human_translation: Say Torah, as it is written “Extol her [ salseleha ] and she will exalt you” Shmuel said: Here too, where he was holding his hair
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima Torah, dikhtiv 'salsleha utrommekha'?" Amar Shmuel: Haka namei shetafus bisaro. English translation: "Say Torah, as it is written 'suspend it and elevate you'?" Said Shmuel: Here it means that one should grasp it with his hair.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵינִי מְכַלְכֵּל״ — מִמַּאי דְּהָדֵין כִּילְכּוּל שְׂעָרוֹ הוּא? כְּדִתְנַן: סִיד, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לָסוּד כִּילְכּוּל. וְאָמַר רַב: בַּת צִידְעָא.
human_translation: I am hereby growing hair From where that this is growing [ kilkul ] his hair? As we learned lime Rabbi Yehuda says: equivalent to spread on kilkul . And Rav said: the areas beneath the temple.
llm_translation: "I am m'kal'kel" - from what is his hair removal? As we learned: lime, Rabbi Yehuda says: for the foundation of hair removal. And Rav said: the daughter of Tzid'a.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא מֵיזַן עַנְיֵי, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״וַיְכַלְכֵּל יוֹסֵף אֶת אָבִיו וְאֶת אֶחָיו״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָכָא נָמֵי שֶׁתָּפוּס בִּשְׂעָרוֹ.
human_translation: Say sustain the poor, as it is written: “And Joseph sustained [ vaykhalkel ] his father and his brethren” Shmuel said: Here too, where the individual was holding his hair
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima meizan anyei, k'dichtiv: 'vayechalkel Yosef et aviv ve'et echav'." Amar Shmuel: "Haka namei shetafus bis'aro." English translation: "Why should the poor be fed, as it is written: 'And Joseph sustained his father and his brothers'." Shmuel said: "Here it is necessary to grab hold of his hair."

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵי עָלַי לְשַׁלֵּחַ פֶּרַע״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר. מִמַּאי דְּהָדֵין שִׁלּוּחַ רִיבּוּיָא הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״שְׁלָחַיִךְ פַּרְדֵּס רִמּוֹנִים״.
human_translation: It is upon me to grow [ leshale’aḥ ] long hair, he is a nazirite. From where that this shilu’aḥ , is increase As it is written: “Your tresses [ shelaḥayikh ] are a park of pomegranates”
llm_translation: "Behold upon me to send forth a Nazirite" — behold this is a Nazirite. From what is it derived that this is considered a sending forth with full consent? As it is written: "Your shoots are an orchard of pomegranates."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא מִידֵּי דְעַבּוֹרֵי, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״וְשֹׁלֵחַ מַיִם עַל פְּנֵי חוּצוֹת״!
human_translation: Say a matter transfer, as it is written: “And sends [ shole’aḥ ] water upon the earth”
llm_translation: "Why is it forbidden to carry on Shabbat because of the carriers, as it is written: 'And he shall pour water upon the hands of Elijah'!"

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא ״פֶּרַע״ ״פֶּרַע״ יָלֵיף. כְּתִיב הָכָא ״קָדֹשׁ יִהְיֶה גַּדֵּל פֶּרַע״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם גַּבֵּי כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט ״וּפֶרַע לֹא יְשַׁלֵּחוּ״.
human_translation: tanna derives long locks [ pera ] long locks [ pera ] It is written here, “He shall be holy, he shall let the grow [ gadel ] long locks [ pera ]” And it is written there, with regard to a common priest “And they will not let their locks grow long [ pera lo yeshaleḥu ]”
llm_translation: We learned in a Baraita: "Perah" "Perah" will be derived. It is written here "He shall be holy, he shall not let his hair grow wild," and it is written there regarding a lay priest, "nor shall he let his hair grow wild."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא הַאי ״שׁוֹלֵחַ מַיִם״ נָמֵי רִיבּוּי הוּא, (כְּדִמְתַרְגֵּם רַב יוֹסֵף:) דְּכַד מַשְׁקִין לֵיהּ מַיָּא לְפֵירָא וְרָבֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that Sends [ shole’aḥ ] water, is also increase as Rav Yosef translated When one waters produce, it grows.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This "sending of water" is also an expression of abundance, (as Rav Yosef translated:) for when they give him water to drink, it is for the benefit of the fruit and the Rabbi.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵי עָלַי צִיפֳּרִין״ — רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: נָזִיר. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: צִיפֳּרִין סְמוּכִין לְשֵׂיעָר קִיבֵּל עָלָיו, דִּכְתִיב ״עַד דִּי שַׂעְרֵיהּ כְּנִשְׁרִין רְבָה וְטִפְרוֹהִי כְצִפְּרִין״.
human_translation: is hereby upon me birds, Rabbi Meir says: He is a nazirite, What is the reason of Rabbi Meir? Reish Lakish said: He accepted upon himself birds juxtaposed to hair, as it is written: “Until his hair was grown like eagles’ feathers, and his nails like birds’ claws”
llm_translation: "Behold, upon me are tzipporin" — Rabbi Meir says: a Nazirite. What is the reason for Rabbi Meir's opinion? Resh Lakish said: Tzipporin are adjacent to hair, he accepted upon himself, as it is written, "Until his hair was like eagles' feathers and his nails like birds' claws."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: מַתְפֵּיס אִינִישׁ בְּמִידֵּי דִּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir holds a person associates something that is juxtaposed
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir holds: A person is apprehended with matters that are close to him.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: לָא מַתְפֵּיס אִינִישׁ בְּמִידֵּי דִּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis hold a person does not associate something that is juxtaposed to it
llm_translation: And the Rabbis hold: One does not apprehend a person with something adjacent to him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֲמַר: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא מַתְפֵּיס. אֶלָּא, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר: דְּחָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא צִפּוֹרֵי נָזִיר טָמֵא קִיבֵּל עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Everyone does not associate Rather, this is the reason of Rabbi Meir: We are concerned perhaps he accepted upon himself the birds of an impure nazirite.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The entire world does not apprehend. Rather, this is the reason of Rabbi Meir: We are concerned that perhaps the birds of a Nazirite became impure and he accepted upon himself.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי ״חָיְישִׁינַן״ קָאָמַר, דִּלְמָא צִפּוֹרֵי נְדָבָה קִיבֵּל עָלָיו? אִם כֵּן, ״הֲרֵי עָלַי קֵן״ מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Since said we are concerned perhaps he accepted upon himself a gift If so, he should have It is hereby upon a nest,
llm_translation: From the fact that he said "we are concerned," perhaps he accepted upon himself voluntary offerings of birds? If so, "behold, I have a nest" he should have requested.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא ״הֲרֵי עָלַי צִפּוֹרֵי מְצוֹרָע״ קָאָמַר? כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה נָזִיר עוֹבֵר לְפָנָיו. וְדִלְמָא נָזִיר טָמֵא, וּלְפוֹטְרוֹ מִן קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו קָאָמַר?! כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה נָזִיר טָהוֹר עוֹבֵר לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: But perhaps he saying: It is upon me birds of a leper, where a nazirite was passing before him But perhaps an impure nazirite, and he saying to exempt from his offerings where a pure nazirite was passing before him.
llm_translation: And perhaps he is saying, "Behold, upon me are the birds of the leper"? For example, if there was a Nazirite passing before him. And perhaps he is saying that a Nazirite who is impure exempts him from his offerings?! For example, if there was a Nazirite who is pure passing before him.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ?
human_translation: What is between
llm_translation: What is the difference between them?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר ״צִיפֳּרִין הַסְּמוּכִין לְשֵׂעָר עָלַי״, לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמַר הָכִי, אִי נָזִיר עוֹבֵר לְפָנָיו — אִין, אִי לָא — לָא. לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאֵין נָזִיר עוֹבֵר לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: There is between them where he said: upon me the birds juxtaposed to hair. According to Rabbi Yoḥanan, although he said this, if a nazirite was passing before him, yes, if not, no, according to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, although no nazirite was passing before him,
llm_translation: There is a difference between them, such as when one says, "Birds near the hair are upon me," according to Rabbi Yochanan, even though he said so, if a Nazirite passes before him - no, if not - no. According to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, even though a Nazirite does not pass before him.

hebrew_text: מִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לָא מַתְפֵּיס אִינִישׁ בְּמִילְּתָא דִּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ? וְהָתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר ״יָמִין״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ שְׁבוּעָה. מַאי טַעְמָא, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב ״וַיָּרֶם יְמִינוֹ וּשְׂמֹאלוֹ אֶל הַשָּׁמַיִם וַיִּשָּׁבַע בְּחֵי הָעוֹלָם״?
human_translation: Is there, anyone who says a person does not associate something juxtaposed to it Isn’t it taught one who says: Right [ yamin ], that is an oath? What is the reason not because it is written: “When he lifted up his right hand and his left hand unto heaven, and swore by Him that lives forever”
llm_translation: Who is there for the one who says a person is not bound by a matter that is adjacent to him? And it was taught: One who says "by the right hand" — this is an oath. What is the reason? Is it not because it is written, "and he raised his right hand and his left hand to heaven and swore by the living God"?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: לָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּיָמִין גּוּפֵיהּ אִיקְּרִי שְׁבוּעָה. דְּתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִין לָאוֹמֵר ״יָמִין״ שֶׁהִיא שְׁבוּעָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִשְׁבַּע ה׳ בִּימִינוֹ״, וּמִנַּיִין לָאוֹמֵר שְׂמֹאל שֶׁהִיא שְׁבוּעָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבִזְרוֹעַ עוּזּוֹ״.
human_translation: Say no, because right itself is called an oath, as it is taught From where that one who says: Right, that it is an oath? is stated: “The Lord has sworn by His right hand” And from where that one who says: Left, that it is an oath? is stated: “And by the arm of His strength”
llm_translation: They said: No, because the right side of the body is called an oath. As it was taught: From where do we derive that when one says "right" it is an oath? As it is stated: "The Lord swore by His right hand." And from where do we derive that when one says "left" it is an oath? As it is stated: "And by His strong arm."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מִן הַחַרְצַנִּים״ וּ״מִן הַזַּגִּים״ וּ״מִן הַתִּגְלַחַת״ וּ״מִן הַטּוּמְאָה״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר, וְכׇל דִּקְדּוּקֵי נְזִירוּת עָלָיו.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite from seeds, or: from skins, or: From shaving, or: From impurity, he is a nazirite. And all details of naziriteship upon him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Behold, I am a Nazirite from the earthenware vessels," and "from the winepresses," and "from shaving," and "from impurity" — this one is a Nazirite, and all the precise rules of Naziriteship apply to him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּדּוֹר מִכּוּלָּם. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ לָא נְזַר אֶלָּא בְּחַד מִנְּהוֹן — הָוֵי נָזִיר.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: is not obligated until he vows all to And the Rabbis say: Even if he vowed from only one of them, he is a nazirite.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara matnitin d'lo k'Rabbi Shimon. D'tanya, Rabbi Shimon omer: Einu chayav ad sheyidor mikulam. V'Rabanan amri: Afilu lo nezare ela b'chad minnehon — havei nazir. English translation: The Gemara of the Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Shimon. As it was taught, Rabbi Shimon says: One is not obligated until he vows from all of them. And the Rabbis say: Even if he only vows like one of them — he becomes a Nazir.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — אָמַר קְרָא: ״מִכֹּל אֲשֶׁר יֵעָשֶׂה מִגֶּפֶן הַיַּיִן מֵחַרְצַנִּים וְעַד זָג״. וְרַבָּנַן, מַאי טַעְמָא — אָמַר קְרָא: ״מִיַּיִן וְשֵׁכָר יַזִּיר״.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? The verse states from anything that is made of the grapevine, from pits to grape skin” And the Rabbis, what is the reason The verse states: “He shall abstain from wine and strong drink”
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon's opinion? — The verse says: "From the winepress and until the wine vat." And the Rabbis, what is the reason? — The verse says: "He shall abstain from wine and strong drink."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״מִיַּיִן וְשֵׁכָר יַזִּיר״! הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ — לֶאֱסוֹר יֵין מִצְוָה כְּיֵין הָרְשׁוּת.
human_translation: And also Rabbi Shimon, isn’t it written “he shall abstain from wine and strong drink”? requires that to prohibit wine a mitzva as wine optional.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon Nami said, it is written: "Wine and strong drink will make you forget!" That one asked him - to prohibit wine of mitzvah like wine of permission.

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא — קִדּוּשְׁתָּא וְאַבְדָּלְתָּא?
human_translation: What is kiddush and havdala ?
llm_translation: What is it? — Holiness and distinction?

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי מוּשְׁבָּע וְעוֹמֵד עָלָיו מֵהַר סִינַי!
human_translation: He is already sworn and obligated about it from Mount Sinai,
llm_translation: Behold, Mosheh stood upon Mount Sinai!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֶשְׁתֶּה״, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר״ — אָתְיָא נְזִירוּת חָיְילָא עַל שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Rather, like that which Rava said: an oath that I will drink and he then said: I am hereby a nazirite, naziriteship comes applies to the oath.
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rava said, "a vow to drink," and then he returned and said, "Behold, I am a Nazirite" — the Nazirite status comes upon the vow.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי, הָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לֶאֱסוֹר יֵין מִצְוָה כְּיֵין רְשׁוּת! אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא ״מִיַּיִן״. מַאי ״וְשֵׁכָר״? שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: And the Rabbis also, isn’t needed to prohibit wine a mitzva, like wine optional? If so, let the verse say from wine” What “and strong drink”? Learn from it two
llm_translation: The sages also say, this that he requires to prohibit wine of mitzvah like wine of permission! If so, let him say the verse "from wine." What is "and strong drink"? You learn two from it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב ״שֵׁכָר״ — לְאַלּוֹפֵי ״שֵׁכָר״ ״שֵׁכָר״ לְמִקְדָּשׁ. דִּכְתִיב: ״יַיִן וְשֵׁכָר אַל תֵּשְׁתְּ אַתָּה וּבָנֶיךָ אִתָּךְ״, מָה גַּבֵּי נָזִיר: יַיִן הוּא דְּלִיתְּסַר, אֲבָל שְׁאָר מַשְׁקִין — לָא, אַף גַּבֵּי מִקְדָּשׁ נָמֵי: יַיִן הוּא דְּלִיתְּסַר, אֲבָל שְׁאָר מַשְׁקִין הַמִּשְׁתַּכְּרִין — לָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon This is the reason that writes “strong drink”: to teach “strong drink” “strong drink” with regard to the Temple, as it is written “Do not drink wine or strong drink, you nor your sons with you, Just as with a nazirite, it is wine that is forbidden but other beverages not so too, with regard to Temple, it is wine that is forbidden but other intoxicating beverages not
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon, that is the reason why it is written "wine" - for those who are fit for "wine," "wine" for the Temple. As it is written: "Wine and strong drink you shall not drink, you and your sons with you." What about a Nazirite? Wine is what he may not drink, but other beverages - he may. So too regarding the Temple: wine is what one may not drink, but other intoxicating beverages - one may not.

hebrew_text: וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אָכַל דְּבֵילָה קְעִילִית, וְשָׁתָה דְּבַשׁ וְחָלָב, וְנִכְנַס לַמִּקְדָּשׁ — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And to the exclusion of of Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: ate a dried fig from Ke’ila, and drank honey or milk, and entered the Temple, he is liable
llm_translation: To go out from Rabbi Yehuda. For it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: One who ate a ke'ilita of fat, and drank honey and milk, and entered the Temple - is liable.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לֵית לֵיהּ אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר.
human_translation: If you wish, say Rabbi Shimon does not accept a prohibition takes effect upon prohibition.
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Rabbi Shimon does not hold that one prohibition takes effect on another prohibition.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הָאוֹכֵל נְבֵילָה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: One who eats an animal carcass on Yom Kippur is exempt
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: One who eats nevelah on Yom Kippur is exempt.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״מִכֹּל אֲשֶׁר יֵעָשֶׂה מִגֶּפֶן הַיַּיִן״! אָמְרִי לָךְ רַבָּנַן: הָתָם לִימֵּד עַל אִיסּוּרֵי נָזִיר שֶׁמִּצְטָרְפִים זֶה עִם זֶה.
human_translation: And also the Rabbis, isn’t it written: “Anything that is made of the grapevine” The Rabbis said to you: There taught the prohibitions of a nazirite combine with each other.
llm_translation: The Sages also said, as it is written: "From all that is made from the grapevine." The Sages say to you: There, it taught about the prohibitions of a Nazirite that combine with each other.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לֵית לֵיהּ צֵירוּף, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁהוּ לְמַכּוֹת, לֹא אָמְרוּ כְּזַיִת אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon he does not hold combination as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: the smallest quantity to lashes. stated an olive-bulk only with regard to an offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon does not have a partner, as it was taught, Rabbi Shimon says: Anyone who is liable for lashes, they did not say "like an olive" except for the matter of a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵינִי כְּשִׁמְשׁוֹן״, ״כְּבֶן מָנוֹחַ״, ״כְּבַעַל דְּלִילָה״, ״כְּמִי שֶׁעָקַר דַּלְתוֹת עַזָּה״, ״כְּמִי שֶׁנִּקְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת עֵינָיו״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נְזִיר שִׁמְשׁוֹן.
human_translation: I am hereby like Samson, like the son of Manoah, like the husband of Delilah, like the one who tore off the doors of Gaza, like the one whose eyes were gouged out by the Philistines, he is a nazirite Samson,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Behold I am like Samson," "like the son of Manoah," "like the owner of Delilah," "like one who uprooted the doors of Gaza," "like one whose eyes were gouged out by the Philistines" — this is a Nazirite like Samson.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנָא כׇּל הָלֵין? צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי כְּשִׁמְשׁוֹן״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: שִׁמְשׁוֹן אַחֲרִינָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן ״כְּבֶן מָנוֹחַ״.
human_translation: Why do I to teach all these are necessary because if one said I am hereby like Samson, I would say another Samson, teaches us Like the son of Manoah,
llm_translation: Gemara: Why do I need to learn all these things? I need it, for if one were to say, "I am like Samson," I would say: Samson is another, as it is heard for us, "like the son of Manoah."

hebrew_text: וְאִי תְּנָא ״כְּבֶן מָנוֹחַ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אִיכָּא דְּמִיתְקְרֵי הָכִי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן ״כְּבַעַל דְּלִילָה״ וּ״כְמִי שֶׁנִּקְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת עֵינָיו״.
human_translation: And if taught Like the son of Manoah, I would say there is who is called that teaches us Like the husband of Delilah, or: Like the one whose eyes were gouged out by the Philistines.
llm_translation: And if it were taught "like Ben Manoah," I would say: There is one who is called thus, it implies to us "like the owner of the night" and "like when the Philistines gouged out his eyes."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָה בֵּין נְזִיר עוֹלָם לְנָזִיר שִׁמְשׁוֹן? נְזִיר עוֹלָם, הִכְבִּיד שְׂעָרוֹ — מֵיקֵל בְּתַעַר, וּמֵבִיא שָׁלֹשׁ בְּהֵמוֹת. וְאִם נִטְמָא — מֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: What is between a permanent nazirite and a nazirite Samson, a permanent nazirite, his hair grows heavy he lightens with a razor, and he brings three animals And if he becomes ritually impure, he brings offering impurity
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: What is the difference between a lifelong Nazirite and Samson the Nazirite? A lifelong Nazirite, if he made his hair heavy - he shaves it with a razor and brings three animal offerings. And if he becomes impure - he brings a sin offering.

hebrew_text: נְזִיר שִׁמְשׁוֹן, הִכְבִּיד שְׂעָרוֹ — אֵינוֹ מֵיקֵל, וְאִם נִטְמָא — אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: a nazirite Samson, his hair grows heavy he may not lighten And if he becomes impure, he does not bring an offering impurity.
llm_translation: Nazir Shimshon, he made heavy his hair — he does not lighten, and if he becomes impure — he does not bring a sacrifice of impurity.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ נְזִיר עוֹלָם מַאן דְּכַר שְׁמֵיהּ? חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: הָאוֹמֵר ״הֲרֵינִי נְזִיר עוֹלָם״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר. מָה בֵּין נְזִיר עוֹלָם לִנְזִיר שִׁמְשׁוֹן? נְזִיר עוֹלָם, הִכְבִּיד שְׂעָרוֹ — מֵיקֵל בְּתַעַר, וּמֵבִיא שָׁלֹשׁ בְּהֵמוֹת, וְאִם נִטְמָא — מֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן טוּמְאָה. נְזִיר שִׁמְשׁוֹן, הִכְבִּיד שְׂעָרוֹ — אֵינוֹ מֵיקֵל בְּתַעַר,
human_translation: Who mentioned anything about a permanent nazirite? is incomplete and is teaching the following: one who says: I am hereby a permanent nazirite, he is nazirite. What is between a permanent nazirite and a nazirite Samson? a permanent nazirite, his hair grows heavy he lightens with a razor and he brings three animals And if he becomes ritually impure, he brings offering impurity. a nazirite Samson, his hair grows heavy he may not lighten with a razor,
llm_translation: Gemara: Who is considered a Nazir Olam? One who mentions his name? The lacking from the lacking, and thus it was taught: One who says, "Behold, I am a Nazir Olam" — this one is a Nazir. What is the difference between a Nazir Olam and a Nazir Shimshon? A Nazir Olam, he lets his hair grow long — he shaves it with a razor, and brings three animals as offerings, and if he becomes impure — he brings a sin offering. Nazir Shimshon, he lets his hair grow long — he does not shave it with a razor.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינוֹ מֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: but he does not bring offering impurity.
llm_translation: And he does not bring an offering impure.

hebrew_text: קׇרְבָּן הוּא דְּלָא מַיְיתֵי, אֲבָל נְזִירוּת חָיְילָא עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: it is the offering that he does not bring. However, naziriteship apply to him,
llm_translation: Sacrifice it is that not comes, but Nazirite-hood is incumbent upon it.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? לָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְלָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נְזִיר שִׁמְשׁוֹן — מוּתָּר לִיטַמֵּא לְמֵתִים, שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְּשִׁמְשׁוֹן שֶׁנִּטְמָא. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הָאוֹמֵר ״נְזִיר שִׁמְשׁוֹן״ — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם, שֶׁלֹּא מָצִינוּ בְּשִׁמְשׁוֹן שֶׁיָּצָאת נְזִירוּת מִפִּיו.
human_translation: Whose the mishna? not Rabbi Yehuda and not Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: A nazirite Samson is permitted to become impure from a corpse as we find with Samson that he became impure. Rabbi Shimon says: One who says a nazirite Samson has not said anything, since we do not find with Samson that naziriteship left his mouth.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the Tanna of the Mishnah? Not Rabbi Yehudah, and not Rabbi Shimon. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehudah says: "A Nazirite like Samson is permitted to become ritually impure for the dead, for we find that Samson became impure." Rabbi Shimon says: One who says, "A Nazirite like Samson," has said nothing, for we did not find that Samson declared his Naziriteship verbally.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — הָאָמַר אֲפִילּוּ לְכַתְּחִילָּה, וּמַתְנִיתִין קָתָנֵי ״אִם נִטְמָא״. אִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — הָאָמַר לָא חָיְילָא עֲלֵיהּ נְזִירוּת כְּלָל!
human_translation: Whose If Rabbi Yehuda, didn’t he say even ab initio , but the mishna teaches: If he becomes impure, if Rabbi Shimon, didn’t he say naziriteship does not apply to him at all?
llm_translation: Who is the authority? If it is Rabbi Yehuda - who said even initially, and the Mishnah teaches "if it becomes impure." If it is Rabbi Shimon - who said the prohibition does not apply to it as a general principle of Naziriteship!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וְאַיְּידֵי דְּקָתָנֵי גַּבֵּי נְזִיר עוֹלָם ״אִם נִטְמָא״, תְּנָא נָמֵי גַּבֵּי נְזִיר שִׁמְשׁוֹן ״אִם נִטְמָא״.
human_translation: Actually, is Rabbi Yehuda, And since it teaches with regard to a permanent nazirite: If he becomes impure, also taught with regard to a nazirite Samson If he becomes impure.
llm_translation: Forever Rabbi Yehuda she, and since it was taught in the matter of a Nazirite, "if he becomes impure," it was taught in the matter of a Nazirite Shimshon, "if he becomes impure."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דִּתְנַן: ״הֲרֵי עָלַי כִּבְכוֹר״, רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹסֵר, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר.
human_translation: Let us say that disagree with regard to the dispute between these tanna’im , as we learned is hereby to me like a firstborn, Rabbi Ya’akov prohibits And Rabbi Yosei permits
llm_translation: Let us say in the dispute of those Tannaim who argue, as we learned: "Behold, upon me is like a firstborn," Rabbi Yaakov prohibits, and Rabbi Yosei permits.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב, דְּאָמַר: לָא בָּעִינַן דָּבָר הַנִּידָּר. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: בָּעִינַן דָּבָר הַנִּידָּר?
human_translation: What, is it not Rabbi Yehuda holds in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov, who said we do not require an item a vow? And Rabbi Shimon holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who said we do require an item a vow.
llm_translation: What is the reason that Rabbi Yehuda does not agree with her like Rabbi Yaakov, who said: "We do not need a matter that was vowed"? And Rabbi Shimon agrees with her like Rabbi Yosei, who said: "We need a matter that was vowed"?

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בָּעִינַן דָּבָר הַנִּידָּר, וְשָׁאנֵי גַּבֵּי בְּכוֹר, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״לַה׳״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַבְּכוֹר.
human_translation: No, that everyone we require an item a vow. And is different with regard to a firstborn, as it is written about to the Lord” to include the firstborn
llm_translation: Not, that all in the world we require a matter that is vowed, and different regarding a firstborn, as it is written in it: "To the Lord" - to include the firstborn.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אָמַר לָךְ: הָהוּא ״לַה׳״, מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹת חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei said to you he needs that “To the Lord,” to include a sin-offering and a guilt-offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said to you: That "to the Lord," it is necessary to include both sin-offering and guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ לְרַבּוֹת חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם וּלְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַבְּכוֹר? מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם — שֶׁכֵּן מַתְפִּיסָן בְּנֶדֶר, וּמוֹצִיא אֲנִי אֶת הַבְּכוֹר — שֶׁאֵין מַתְפִּיסוֹ בְּנֶדֶר.
human_translation: And what did you see to include a sin-offering and a guilt-offering and to exclude a firstborn? I include a sin-offering and a guilt-offering, as one grants by a vow, And I exclude a firstborn, as one does not grant it by a vow.
llm_translation: And what did you see to include a sin offering, guilt offering, and to bring out the firstborn? I include a sin offering and guilt offering - for they are captured in a vow, and I bring out the firstborn - for it is not captured in a vow.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר לָךְ: בְּכוֹר נָמֵי מַתְפִּיסוֹ בְּנֶדֶר הוּא. דְּתַנְיָא: שֶׁל בֵּית רַבֵּינוּ אָמְרוּ: מִנַּיִן לְנוֹלַד לוֹ בְּכוֹר בְּתוֹךְ עֶדְרוֹ שֶׁמִּצְוָה עָלָיו לְהַקְדִּישׁוֹ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַזָּכָר תַּקְדִּישׁ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ya’akov said to you Also a firstborn, one grants it by a vow, as it is taught of the house of our Rabbi, said: From where that a firstborn is born in one’s herd, a mitzva for him to consecrate it, As it is stated: males you shall sanctify”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov said to you: A firstborn that is blemished is taken with a vow. As it was taught: The sages of our house said: From where do we know that if a firstborn is born among his flock, it is a commandment upon him to sanctify it? - As it is said: "The male you shall sanctify."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אָמַר לָךְ: נְהִי דְּמִצְוָה לְהַקְדִּישׁוֹ, אִי לָא מַקְדֵּישׁ לֵיהּ, מִי לָא קָדוֹשׁ?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei said to you Granted that a mitzva to consecrate it. if he does not consecrate it, is it not consecrated
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said to you: "Behold, it is a commandment to sanctify him; if one does not sanctify him, who is holy?"

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי נָזִיר נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״לַה׳״!
human_translation: With regard to a nazirite as well, isn’t it written: to the Lord”
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of a Nazirite, it is stated, "To the Lord!"

hebrew_text: הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא, אָמַר שִׁמְעוֹן הַצַּדִּיק: מִיָּמַי לֹא אָכַלְתִּי אֲשַׁם נָזִיר טָמֵא, חוּץ מֵאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁבָּא אֵלַי מִן הַדָּרוֹם, יְפֵה עֵינַיִם וְטוֹב רוֹאִי, וּקְווּצּוֹתָיו סְדוּרוֹת לוֹ תַּלְתַּלִּים. אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: בְּנִי, מָה רָאִיתָ לְשַׁחֵת שֵׂעָר נָאֶה זֶה?
human_translation: That is required by him for that which is taught Shimon HaTzaddik said: In my days I never ate the guilt-offering of a ritually impure nazirite, apart from one man who came to me from the South, beautiful eyes and a fine countenance, and his locks were arranged in curls. I said to him: My son, what did you see to destroy this beautiful hair,
llm_translation: That one asked him according to the teaching, Shimon the Righteous said: "Throughout my life, I have not eaten a defiled Nazirite guilt-offering, except from one man who came to me from the south, with beautiful eyes and good appearance, and his locks were arranged in curls. I said to him: My son, what did you see to ruin this beautiful hair?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לִי: רוֹעֶה הָיִיתִי לְאָבִי בְּעִירִי, וְהָלַכְתִּי לִשְׁאוֹב מַיִם מִן הַמַּעְיָין, וְנִסְתַּכַּלְתִּי בַּבָּבוּאָה שֶׁלִּי, וּפָחַז יִצְרִי עָלַי, וּבִיקֵּשׁ לְטוֹרְדֵנִי מִן הָעוֹלָם. אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: רֵיקָה! מִפְּנֵי מָה אַתָּה מִתְגָּאֶה בְּעוֹלָם שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלְּךָ, שֶׁסּוֹפְךָ לִהְיוֹת רִמָּה וְתוֹלֵעָה? הָעֲבוֹדָה שֶׁאֲגַלֵּחֲךָ לַשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: He said to me: I was a shepherd for my father in my town, and I went to draw water from the spring, and I looked at my reflection And my inclination quickly against me and sought to drive me from the world. I said to Empty one! For what are you proud in a world that is not yours, as your end is to be maggots and worms the service that I will shave you for Heaven.
llm_translation: He said to me: I was a shepherd for my father in my city, and I went to draw water from the spring, and I looked at my reflection in my flask, and my evil inclination stirred against me, and sought to destroy me from the world. I said to him: Empty one! Why do you boast in a world that is not yours, for in the end you will become a maggot and a worm? The work that will shear you to the heavens.

hebrew_text: עָמַדְתִּי וּנְשַׁקְתִּיו עַל רֹאשׁוֹ, אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: כְּמוֹתְךָ יִרְבּוּ נְזִירִים בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל — עָלֶיךָ הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״אִישׁ כִּי יַפְלִא לִנְדֹּר נֶדֶר נָזִיר לְהַזִּיר לַה׳״.
human_translation: I arose and kissed him on his head, said to him: May there be more nazirites like you in Israel, With regard to you the verse states: “When a man shall clearly utter a vow, the vow of a nazirite, to consecrate himself to the Lord”
llm_translation: I stood and kissed him on his head, I said to him: "May Nazirites increase in Israel like you." Upon you the Scripture says: "When a man makes a vow, the vow of a Nazirite, to separate himself for the Lord."

hebrew_text: וְשִׁמְשׁוֹן לָאו נָזִיר הֲוָה? וְהָכְתִיב: ״כִּי נְזִיר אֱלֹהִים יִהְיֶה הַנַּעַר מִן הַבֶּטֶן״! הָתָם מַלְאָךְ הוּא דְּקָאָמַר.
human_translation: And was Samson not a nazirite Isn’t it written: “For the child shall be a nazirite of God from the womb” There it was the angel who spoke.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Was Shimshon not a Nazirite? But it is written: "For the boy shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb!" There, it is an angel who is speaking.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּאִיטַּמִּי לְמֵתִים? אִילֵּימָא מִדִּכְתִיב ״בִּלְחִי הַחֲמוֹר הִכֵּיתִי אֶלֶף אִישׁ״ — דִּילְמָא גָּרוֹיֵי גָּרִי בְּהוּ וְלָא נְגַע בְּהוּ!
human_translation: And from where do we that became impure from corpses? If we say from that it is written: With the jawbone of an ass, I smote a thousand men” perhaps he thrust at them but did not touch them,
llm_translation: And from where do we know that it is permissible to feed the dead? If you say it is from what is written, "With the jawbone of a donkey, I have slain a thousand men" - perhaps the living were living, but not the dead!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וַיַּךְ מֵהֶם שְׁלֹשִׁים אִישׁ וַיִּקַּח אֶת חֲלִיצוֹתָם״. דִּילְמָא אַשְׁלְחִינּוּן בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר קַטְלִינֻּן? ״וַיַּךְ ... וַיִּקַּח״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Rather, from here: “And he smote thirty men of them, and took their garments” Perhaps he stripped them first and afterward killed them. It is written: “And he smote…and took,”
llm_translation: Rather, from here: "And he struck thirty men from among them and took their garments." Perhaps we should send him away at first and then kill him? "And he struck... and took" is written.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא גּוֹסְסִין שַׁוִּינֻן! אֶלָּא: גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ.
human_translation: But perhaps caused them dying, Rather, it is learned as a tradition
llm_translation: Perhaps we are mistaken! Rather: the Gemara is concluded for it.

hebrew_text: וּנְזִיר עוֹלָם הֵיכָא כְּתִיב? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אַבְשָׁלוֹם נְזִיר עוֹלָם הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי מִקֵּץ אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶל הַמֶּלֶךְ אֵלְכָה נָּא וַאֲשַׁלֵּם אֶת נִדְרִי אֲשֶׁר נָדַרְתִּי לַה׳ בְּחֶבְרוֹן״, וּמְגַלֵּחַ אֶחָד לִשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי מִקֵּץ יָמִים לַיָּמִים״.
human_translation: And where is a permanent nazirite written? As it is taught Rabbi says: Absalom was a permanent nazirite, as it is stated: “And it came to pass at the end of forty years, that Absalom said to the king: I pray to you, let me go and pay my vow, which I have vowed to the Lord, in Hebron” And he cut once twelve months, as it is stated: now it was at every year’s [ yamim ] end
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Where is it written that a Nazirite for life? For it was taught: Rabbi says: Absalom was a Nazirite for life, as it is stated: "And it came to pass after forty years, that Absalom said unto the king: 'I pray thee, let me go and pay my vow, which I have vowed unto the Lord, in Hebron,'" and he shaved once in twelve months, as it is stated: "And it came to pass at the end of days."

hebrew_text: וְיָלֵיף ״יָמִים״ ״יָמִים״ מִבָּתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה. מָה הָתָם שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ — אַף כָּאן שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: And derives yamim yamim of houses of walled cities, Just as there, twelve months, so too here, twelve months.
llm_translation: And he deduced "days" "days" from the walled cities. Just as there, twelve months - so too here, twelve months.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי אוֹמֵר: מְגַלֵּחַ אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מְגַלֵּחַ מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בִּבְנֵי מְלָכִים שֶׁמְּגַלְּחִים מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Nehorai says: cut once thirty days. Rabbi Yosei says: He cut from one Shabbat eve to Shabbat eve, as we find that the sons of kings cut from one Shabbat eve to Shabbat eve.
llm_translation: Rabbi Nehorai says: One should shave once every thirty days. Rabbi Yosei says: One should shave from Erev Shabbat to Erev Shabbat, for so we find with the sons of kings that they shave from Erev Shabbat to Erev Shabbat.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי — יָלֵיף מִבָּתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה. וְהָא רַבִּי הוּא דְּאָמַר: אֵין ״יָמִים״ פְּחוּתִין מִשְּׁנַיִם!
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi derives from houses of walled cities. But isn’t it Rabbi who said yamim not fewer than two
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yalif from the walled cities? But Rabbi is the one who said: "Days" cannot be less than two!

hebrew_text: הַאי גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה מִשּׁוּם כּוֹבֶד גְּמִיר, וּבִשְׁנֵי יָמִים לֵיכָּא כּוֹבֶד.
human_translation: He learned this verbal analogy due to weight and in two days there is no weight
llm_translation: This decree is similar to the principle of "koved g'mir," and within two days there is no "koved."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי מִקֵּץ שְׁנָתַיִם יָמִים״?! דָּנִין ״יָמִים״ שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהֶן שָׁנִים מִ״יָּמִים״ שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהֶן שָׁנִים, וְאַל יוֹכִיחַ זֶה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמּוֹ שָׁנִים.
human_translation: But say two years, as it is written: “And it came to pass at the end of two years of days [ yamim ]” We derive yamim where it does not have years with it, from yamim that does not have years with it, And this that does have years with it will not prove
llm_translation: And why say two years, as it is written: "And it came to pass at the end of two years"?! We interpret "days" that are not with them as "years" that are not with them, and let not this one prove that there are years with it.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, דִּכְתִיב: ״עַד חֹדֶשׁ יָמִים״! דָּנִין ״יָמִים״ שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהֶם חֳדָשִׁים מִ״יָּמִים״ שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהֶם חֳדָשִׁים, וְאַל יוֹכִיחַ זֶה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמּוֹ חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: But say thirty days, as it is written: “But a month of days [ yamim ]” We derive yamim where it does not have months with it from yamim that does not have months with it. And this that does have months with it will not prove
llm_translation: And why is it thirty days, as it is written: "until a month of days"! We judge "days" that do not have with them months from "days" that do not have with them months, and let not this one prove that there are with it months.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא מֵהָכָא: ״מִיָּמִים יָמִימָה וְגוֹ׳״, דָּנִין ״יָמִים״ מִ״יָּמִים״, וְאֵין דָּנִין ״יָמִים״ מִ״יָּמִימָה״.
human_translation: But say from here: from time to time [ yamim yamima ] We derive yamim from yamim , and we do not derive yamim from yamima .
llm_translation: And why not learn from here: "From days to days, etc.," we interpret "days" from "days," and we do not interpret "days" from "from days."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ, וְהָא תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְשָׁב הַכֹּהֵן״ ״וּבָא הַכֹּהֵן״, — זוֹ הִיא שִׁיבָה זוֹ הִיא בִּיאָה!
human_translation: And what is the difference Didn’t the school of Rabbi Yishmael teach “and the priest shall return [ veshav ]” “and the priest shall come [ uva ]” this is returning, this is coming,
llm_translation: And what is derived from it? And this is what was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "And the priest shall return" "and the priest shall come" - this is both returning and coming!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ — מִדְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: This applies where there are no that are identical to it. However, where there are that are identical to it, we derive from that are identical to it
llm_translation: These matters, where there is no similarity to it, but where there is a similarity to it - we derive from the similarity.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מְנָא יָדְעִינַן דְּכֹל תְּלָתָא יַרְחִין חַד זִימְנָא? דִּילְמָא אַרְבְּעָה זִימְנֵי בְּשַׁתָּא, (אִי נָמֵי) אַרְבְּעָה יַרְחִין חַד זִימְנָא, תְּרֵין יַרְחִין בְּחַד זִימְנָא!
human_translation: Some say From where do we know that once every three months, Perhaps four times a year, Alternatively, four months one time, two months one time,
llm_translation: There are those who say: How do we know that every three months is one time? Perhaps there are four times in a year, or even four months in one time, and two months in one time!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי אוֹמֵר: מְגַלֵּחַ אַחַת לִשְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. מַאי טַעְמָא? גַּבֵּי כֹהֲנִים מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא כּוֹבֶד, הָכָא נָמֵי אִיכָּא כּוֹבֶד.
human_translation: Rabbi Nehorai says cut once every thirty days. What is the reason with regard to priests, because there is weight Here, too, there is weight
llm_translation: Rabbi Nehorai says: One should shave once every thirty days. What is the reason? In the case of priests, because there is a weightiness; here too, there is a weightiness.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מְגַלֵּחַ מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת. מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּינֵיהּ לִשְׁאָר אֲחוֹהִי!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: cut from one Shabbat eve to Shabbat eve, what is there between and the rest of his brothers,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: One may shave from Erev Shabbat to Erev Shabbat. What is the difference between this and the opinion of his brothers!

hebrew_text: יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּאֶמְצַע שַׁבָּת, דַּאֲחוֹהִי מְגַלְּחִין, הוּא לָא מְגַלַּח. אִי נָמֵי: לְגַלּוֹחֵי מִן צַפְרָא דְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא, אֲחוֹהִי מְגַלְּחִין, אִיהוּ לָא מְגַלַּח עַד פַּנְיָא.
human_translation: a Festival that occurs in the middle of the week, as his brothers cut he not cut Alternatively, cutting on the morning of Shabbat eve. His brothers would cut he not cut until the evening,
llm_translation: Good day that falls in the middle of Shabbat, for he who shaves does not shave. Alternatively, regarding those who shave from the edge of Shabbat, for they shave, he does not shave until the face.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה, מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ? רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לְקֵץ אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה שֶׁשָּׁאֲלוּ לָהֶן מֶלֶךְ. תָּנָא: אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה שֶׁשָּׁאֲלוּ לָהֶן מֶלֶךְ הִיא שְׁנַת עֶשֶׂר לִשְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי.
human_translation: these forty years, what is their purpose Rabbi Nehorai says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: to the end of forty years, requested for themselves a king taught: That year when they requested for themselves a king was the tenth year of Samuel the Ramathite.
llm_translation: These forty years, what did they do? Rabbi Nehorai says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: At the end of forty years they asked for a king. It was taught: That year in which they asked for a king was the tenth year of Shmuel the Ramathite.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ סְתַם נְזִירוּת שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: unspecified naziriteship, thirty days.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A regular Nezirut is thirty days.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב מַתְנָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״קָדוֹשׁ יִהְיֶה״ — ״יִהְיֶה״ בְּגִמַטְרִיָּא תְּלָתִין הָווּ.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Mattana said: The verse states “He shall be [ yihye ] holy” the numerical value [ gimatriyya ] of yihye is thirty.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar menahanei milei? Amar Rav Matna, amar kra: "Kadosh yihyeh" — "yihyeh" begimatrya taltin havu. English translation: Is it complete in its matters? Rav Matna said, Scripture says: "He shall be holy" — "He shall be" in gematria is thirty.

hebrew_text: בַּר פְּדָא אָמַר: כְּנֶגֶד ״נָזִיר״ ״נִזְרוֹ״ הָאֲמוּרִים בַּתּוֹרָה, שְׁלֹשִׁים חָסֵר אַחַת.
human_translation: Bar Padda said: corresponds “nazirite,” “his naziriteship,” that are stated in the Torah Thirty less one
llm_translation: Bar Peda said: Corresponding to "nazir" and "his consecration" mentioned in the Torah, thirty less one.

hebrew_text: וְרַב מַתְנָא נָמֵי, נֵילַף מִ״נָּזִיר״ ״נִזְרוֹ״!
human_translation: And Rav Mattana should also derive from “nazirite” “his naziriteship”
llm_translation: And Rav Matna said similarly, we learn from "nazir" "his vow"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ, הַהוּא לִדְרָשָׁה: ״מִיַּיִן וְשֵׁכָר יַזִּיר״ — לֶאֱסוֹר יֵין מִצְוָה כְּיֵין רְשׁוּת, ״כִּי יַפְלִא לִנְדֹּר נֶדֶר נָזִיר לְהַזִּיר״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַנְּזִירוּת חָלָה עַל נְזִירוּת.
human_translation: said to you: That for exposition. “He shall abstain [ yazir ] from wine and strong drink” to prohibit wine a mitzva as wine optional. shall clearly utter a vow, the vow of a nazirite, to consecrate himself” teach that naziriteship takes effect where naziriteship
llm_translation: He said to you, that one for interpretation: "From wine and strong drink he shall abstain" — to prohibit wine of commandment like wine of permission, "when he shall separate himself to vow a vow of a Nazirite, to separate himself" — teaches that the Nazirite status applies to another Nazirite.

hebrew_text: וּבַר פְּדָא אָמַר לָךְ: לֵיכָּא חַד מִינְּהוֹן דְּלָאו לִדְרָשָׁא? אֶלָּא מִדְּהָהוּא לְמִנְיָינָא, כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי לְמִנְיָינָא.
human_translation: And bar Padda said to you there not one of them that is not for an exposition? Rather, since that to the number all of are also to the number
llm_translation: Bar Peda said to you: Is there one of them that is not for interpretation? Rather, from them for counting, all of them for counting.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: סְתַם נְזִירוּת שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב מַתְנָא — נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְבַר פְּדָא — קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: We learned unspecified naziriteship thirty days. Granted, to Rav Mattana works out well. However, according to bar Padda difficult,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: A regular Nazirite vow is thirty days. According to Rav Matna, this is understandable, but according to Bar Peda, it is difficult!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ בַּר פְּדָא: אַיְּידֵי דְּאִיכָּא יוֹם תְּלָתִין דִּמְגַלֵּחַ וּמֵבִיא קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי תְּנָא שְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: Bar Padda said to you: since there is the thirtieth day, when shaves and brings his offerings, due to that teaches thirty
llm_translation: Bar Pedah said to you: By the fact that there is a day of thirty days for shaving and bringing his sacrifices, therefore the Tanna taught thirty.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מִי שֶׁאָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר״ — מְגַלֵּחַ יוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים וְאֶחָד. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב מַתְנָא נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְבַר פְּדָא קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: We learned One who said: I am hereby a nazirite, shaves the thirty-first day. Granted, to Rav Mattana works out well, However, to bar Padda, difficult.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: One who says, "Behold, I am a Nazirite" — shaves on the thirty-first day. It is understandable according to Rav Matna, but according to Bar Peda it is difficult!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ בַּר פְּדָא, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אִם גִּילַּח לְיוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים — יָצָא. אֶלָּא סֵיפָא מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ, רֵישָׁא — נַעֲשָׂה כְּאוֹמֵר ״שְׁלֵימִין״.
human_translation: Bar Padda said to you Say the latter clause If he shaved on the thirtieth day, he has fulfilled Rather, the latter clause supports his the first clause, becomes like one who said complete
llm_translation: He said to you, Bar Pedah, say the latter part: if he shaved for thirty days - he fulfilled. Rather, the latter part supports him, the first part - it is done as it says "complete."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב מַתְנָא קַשְׁיָא סֵיפָא! קָסָבַר מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: And for Rav Mattana, the latter clause difficult, holds part of the day is like of an entire
llm_translation: And for Rav Matna it is difficult, the latter part! He holds that part of the day is like the whole.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״, אִם גִּילַּח יוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים — לֹא יָצָא! בְּאוֹמֵר ״שְׁלֵימִין״.
human_translation: We learned I am hereby a nazirite thirty days, if he shaved thirtieth day, he has not fulfilled to says complete
llm_translation: We learned: "Behold, I am a Nazirite for thirty days." If he shaved on the thirtieth day - he has not fulfilled his vow! This is said when he declares, "I am complete."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מִי שֶׁנָּזַר שְׁתֵּי נְזִירוּת — מְגַלֵּחַ אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה יוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים וְאֶחָד, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה לְיוֹם שִׁשִּׁים וְאֶחָד. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב מַתְנָא — נִיחָא.
human_translation: We learned One who accepted two naziriteship shaves the first thirty-first day, and the second on the sixty-first day. Granted, to Rav Mattana works out well,
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: One who takes a vow of two Nazirites - shaves the first one on the thirty-first day, and the second on the sixty-first day. According to Rav Matna - this is acceptable.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְבַר פְּדָא קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: However, according to bar Padda difficult.
llm_translation: Rather, to Bar Peda, it is difficult!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ בַּר פְּדָא, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וְאִם גִּילַּח אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה לְיוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים — מְגַלֵּחַ אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה לְיוֹם שִׁשִּׁים. אֶלָּא, סֵיפָא מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ, רֵישָׁא — בְּאוֹמֵר שְׁלֵימִים.
human_translation: Bar Padda said to you: Say the latter clause And if he shaved the first on the thirtieth day, he shaves the second on the sixtieth day. Rather, the latter clause supports his earlier clause to one who says complete
llm_translation: He said to you, Bar Pedah, say the latter part: "And if he shaved the first time for thirty days - he shaves the second time for sixty days." Rather, the latter part supports it, the former part - by saying "complete."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב מַתְנָא קַשְׁיָא סֵיפָא! אָמַר לְךָ רַב מַתְנָא, כִּדְקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: יוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים עוֹלֶה לְכָאן וּלְכָאן.
human_translation: And according to Rav Mattana, the latter clause difficult. Rav Mattana said to you that as the latter clause teaches: The thirtieth day counts for this and that,
llm_translation: And for Rav Matna, a difficulty in the latter part! Rav Matna said to you, as it is taught in the latter part: "The thirtieth day goes both here and there."

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא — מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ? הָא אַמְרַהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְעִנְיַן חֲדָא נְזִירוּת, אֲבָל לִשְׁתֵּי נְזִירוּת — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: What is part of the day is like of an entire But didn’t he say this once lest you say this applies with regard to one naziriteship, but to two naziriteship, no, teaches us
llm_translation: What is it? - Part of the day is like the whole day? This one said once! What do you think: those words for one Nazirite, but for two Nazirites - no, it does not teach us.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: אִם גִּילַּח יוֹם שִׁשִּׁים חָסֵר אֶחָד — יָצָא, שֶׁיּוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים עוֹלֶה לוֹ מִן הַמִּנְיָן. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב מַתְנָא — נִיחָא. אֶלָּא לְבַר פְּדָא לְמָה לִי? הָא אָמַר שְׁלֹשִׁים חָסֵר אֶחָד!
human_translation: We learned If he shaved day sixty less one, he has fulfilled as the thirtieth day counts of his tally. Granted, to Rav Mattana works out well, However, according to bar Padda, why do I Didn’t he say thirty less one?
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If one shaves off sixty days minus one, he has fulfilled his obligation, as thirty days count towards the total. According to Rav, the Mishnaic sage, this is well reasoned. But according to Bar Pedaya, why do I need it? Didn't he say thirty minus one!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: אֲנָא נָמֵי אַהָא סְמַכִי.
human_translation: said to you: I too rely on this.
llm_translation: He said to you: I, Naḥa, rely.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מִי שֶׁאָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר״, נִטְמָא יוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים — סוֹתֵר אֶת הַכֹּל. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב מַתְנָא — נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְבַר פְּדָא קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: We learned one who said: I am hereby a nazirite, became ritually impure thirtieth day, it negates the entire Granted, to Rav Mattana works out well, However, according to bar Padda difficult,
llm_translation: We learned: One who said, "Behold, I am a Nazirite," becomes impure for thirty days - he nullifies everything. According to Rav Matna it is understandable, but according to Bar Pedaya it is difficult!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ בַּר פְּדָא: אֵימָא סֵיפָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ סוֹתֵר אֶלָּא שִׁבְעָה. אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים בָּעִינַן, נִסְתּוֹר כּוּלְּהוּ!
human_translation: Bar Padda said to you: Say the latter clause Rabbi Eliezer says: It negates only seven If it enters your mind we require thirty should negate all of them,
llm_translation: He said to you, Bar Pedah: say the end, Rabbi Eliezer says: he only negates seven. If your mind thinks thirty we need, all of them are hidden!

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer holds part of the day is like of an entire
llm_translation: He holds Rabbi Eliezer: part of the day is like the whole.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מֵאָה יוֹם״, נִטְמָא יוֹם מֵאָה — סוֹתֵר אֶת הַכֹּל. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ סוֹתֵר אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ סָבַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ — נִסְתּוֹר שִׁבְעָה, וְאִי לָא סָבַר מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ — לִיסְתּוֹר כּוּלְּהוּ!
human_translation: We learned I am hereby a nazirite one hundred days, he became impure one hundredth day, it negates the entire Rabbi Eliezer says: It negates only thirty days. And if it enters your mind Rabbi Eliezer holds part of the day is like of an entire should negate seven And if he does not hold part of the day is like an entire he should negate all of
llm_translation: We learned: "Behold, I am a Nazirite for one hundred days," if he becomes impure on one of the one hundred days - he nullifies them all. Rabbi Eliezer says: He only nullifies thirty days. And if your mind inclines to think that Rabbi Eliezer holds that part of the day is like the whole day - seven are hidden. And if you do not think that part of the day is like the whole day - all of them are hidden!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם לָא אָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ. אִי הָכִי לִיסְתּוֹר כּוּלְּהוּ! אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַנָּזִיר בְּיוֹם מְלֹאת יְמֵי נִזְרוֹ״, הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: נִטְמָא בְּיוֹם מְלֹאת — תֵּן לוֹ תּוֹרַת נָזִיר.
human_translation: Actually, we do not say part of the day is like of an entire If that is so, let him negate all of Reish Lakish said this is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer: The verse states: “This is the law of the nazirite, on the day when the days of his consecration are complete” The Torah stated: he became impure on the day of the completion give him the halakha of nazirite,
llm_translation: We always do not say, "Part of the day is like the whole day." If so, let him shave all of them! Reish Lakish said, this is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer, as the verse says: "This is the law of the Nazirite on the day his consecration is complete." The Torah said: If he became impure on the day of his completion, give him the law of a Nazirite.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״עַד מְלֹאת הַיָּמִים״,
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im , “Until the days are complete,
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: "Until the completion of the days,"

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמְעַנִי מִיעוּט ״יָמִים״ שְׁנַיִם — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״קָדוֹשׁ יִהְיֶה גַּדֵּל פֶּרַע״, אֵין גִּידּוּל שֵׂעָר פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה.
human_translation: I hear least “days” two, the verse states: “He shall be holy, he shall let grow long,” there is no growth of hair less than thirty the statement of Rabbi Yoshiya.
llm_translation: Listen to me, regarding the few "days" two — Scripture says: "He shall be holy, let his hair grow long." Hair growth is not less than thirty, the words of Rabbi Yoshiyah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״עַד מְלֹאת הַיָּמִים״, אִי אֵלּוּ הֵן יָמִים שֶׁצְּרִיכִין לְמַלּאוֹת? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר שְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: not needed, as says: “Until the days are complete.” What are the days that require completion? You must say thirty
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: It is not necessary, for he says "until the days are fulfilled." If so, what are the days that need to be fulfilled? One must say thirty.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו: רַב מַתְנָא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה, וּבַר פְּדָא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן?
human_translation: What, is it not Rav Mattana said in accordance with Rabbi Yoshiya, and bar Padda said in accordance with Rabbi Yonatan,
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rav Matna said in the name of Rabbi Yoshiyah, and Bar Peda said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב מַתְנָא: כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא שְׁלֹשִׁים בָּעִינַן, וְהָכָא בְּ״עַד״ וְ״עַד״ בַּכְּלָל פְּלִיגִי. רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה סָבַר: ״עַד״ וְלֹא ״עַד״ בַּכְּלָל. וְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן סָבַר: ״עַד״ וְ״עַד״ בַּכְּלָל.
human_translation: Rav Mattana said to you: Everyone we require thirty and here they disagree with regard to “until” until and including. Rabbi Yoshiya holds “until until, but not including, And Rabbi Yonatan holds “until” until and including
llm_translation: Rav Matna said to you: The entire world requires thirty, and here in the case of "ad" and "ad" they disagree. Rabbi Yoshiyah holds: "ad" and not "ad" are included. And Rabbi Yonatan holds: "ad" and "ad" are included.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אִי אֵלּוּ הֵן יָמִים שֶׁצְּרִיכִין לְמַלּאוֹת — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר שְׁלֹשִׁים. וְאֵימָא שַׁבָּת! שַׁבָּת מִי אִיכָּא חַסִּירוּתָא?
human_translation: The Master, said: What are the days that require completion? You must say thirty But say a week. a week, is there lacking?
llm_translation: Master said: If you say, "Which are the days that require fulfillment?" - say thirty. But say, perhaps Shabbat! Is there a lack of Shabbat?

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא שָׁנָה? מִי מָנֵינַן לְיוֹמֵי?! וְהָא רַבָּנַן דְּקֵיסָרִי אָמְרִי: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין מוֹנִין יָמִים לְשָׁנִים — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְחׇדְשֵׁי הַשָּׁנָה״, חֳדָשִׁים מְחַשְּׁבִין לְשָׁנִים, וְלֹא יָמִים לְשָׁנִים.
human_translation: But say a year, Do we count by days? Didn’t the Sages of Caesarea say: From where that one does not count days toward years, As it is stated: “Of the months of the year” months are calculated to years, but days are not toward years.
llm_translation: And why should we change it? How do we count the days?! But the sages of Caesarea said: From where do we derive that we do not count days for years? — As it is stated: "For the months of the year," months are calculated for years, and not days for years.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה״, ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר אַחַת קְטַנָּה״, אֲפִילּוּ: ״מִכָּאן וְעַד סוֹף הָעוֹלָם״ — נָזִיר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: one said: I am hereby a nazirite one long I am hereby a nazirite one short even from now until the end of the world, a nazirite thirty days.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Behold, I am a Nazirite for thirty days," "Behold, I am a Nazirite for one day," even if it is said: "From here until the end of the world" — a Nazirite for thirty days.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַמַּאי? וְהָא ״מִכָּאן וְעַד סוֹף הָעוֹלָם״ קָאָמַר! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֲרִיכָא לִי הָדָא מִילְּתָא כְּמִכָּאן וְעַד סוֹף הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Why Didn’t he say: From now until the end of the world? This is what he is saying: this matter were as lengthy for me as from now until the end of the world.
llm_translation: Gemara: Why? And this, "from here to the end of the world," is what it says! This is what it says: This matter is as long to me as from here to the end of the world.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מִכָּאן עַד מָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״ — אוֹמְדִים כַּמָּה יָמִים מִכָּאן וְעַד מָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי, פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — נָזִיר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. וְאִם לָאו — נָזִיר כְּמִנְיַן הַיָּמִים. וְאֵימָא הָכָא נָמֵי: אֲרִיכָא לִי הָא מִילְּתָא כְּמִכָּאן וְעַד מָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי!
human_translation: We learned I am hereby a nazirite from here until such and such a place, one estimates how many days from here until such and such a place. less than thirty days, a nazirite thirty days, And if not, a nazirite in accordance with the number of days But here too, say This matter is as lengthy for me as from here until such and such a place.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "Behold, I am a Nazirite from here to a certain place" - One determines how many days from here to the place of the certain one, less than thirty days - the Nazirite is for thirty days. And if not - the Nazirite is according to the count of the days. And why not say here: The matter is lengthy to me from here to the place of the certain one!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שֶׁהֶחְזִיק בַּדֶּרֶךְ. וְלִיהְוֵי כׇּל פַּרְסָה וּפַרְסָה! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּאַתְרָא דְּלָא מָנֵי פַּרְסֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: who had set out on the way, And let each and every parasang [ parsa ] Rav Pappa said: with a place where do not measure parasangs.
llm_translation: Rava said: One who holds on the way. And it should be every foot and foot! Rav Papa said: In a place where footprints are not counted.

hebrew_text: וְלִיהְוֵי כׇּל אַוּוֹנָא וְאַוּוֹנָא! מִי לָא תְּנַן: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר כַּעֲפַר הָאָרֶץ״, וְ״כִשְׂעַר רֹאשִׁי״, וּ״כְחוֹל הַיָּם״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נְזִיר עוֹלָם, וּמְגַלֵּחַ אֶחָד לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם?!
human_translation: And let each and every way station [ avvana ], Didn’t we learn I am hereby a nazirite like the dust of the earth, or: Like the hair of my head, or: Like the sand of the sea, he is a nazirite forever, and he shaves once thirty days?
llm_translation: And it should be all sin and sin! Who not we learned: "Behold, I am a Nazirite like the dust of the earth," and "like the hair of my head," and "like the sand of the sea" - this is a perpetual Nazirite, and shaves once in thirty days?!

hebrew_text: כׇּל מִילְּתָא דְּאִית בַּיהּ קִיצּוּתָא לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Everything that has a fixed amount is not taught
llm_translation: Every matter that has a final point is not taught.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר כׇּל יְמֵי חַיַּי״, ״הֲרֵינִי נְזִיר עוֹלָם״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נְזִיר עוֹלָם. אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה שָׁנָה, אֲפִילּוּ אֶלֶף שָׁנִים — אֵין זֶה נְזִיר עוֹלָם, אֶלָּא נָזִיר לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: And it is taught I am hereby a nazirite all the days of my life, I am hereby a permanent nazirite, he is a permanent nazirite. even one hundred years even one thousand years, he is not a permanent nazirite. Rather, nazirite forever,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: "Behold, I am a Nazirite all the days of my life," "Behold, I am a Nazirite forever" - this is a Nazirite forever. Even a hundred years, even a thousand years - this is not a Nazirite forever, but a Nazirite for eternity.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה אָמַר: שָׁאנֵי שְׂעָרוֹת, הוֹאִיל וּמוּבְדָּלוֹת זוֹ מִזּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabba said Hairs different, since they are separated from each other.
llm_translation: Rabba said: "The hairs are different, since they are distinct from one another."

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי יוֹמֵי נָמֵי, הָא כְּתִיב ״וַיְהִי עֶרֶב וַיְהִי בֹקֶר יוֹם אֶחָד״!
human_translation: Also with regard to days, isn’t it written: “And there was evening and there was morning, one day”
llm_translation: Regarding the days of creation, it is written, "And there was evening, and there was morning, one day"!

hebrew_text: הָתָם לָאו דְּמִפַּסְקִי מֵהֲדָדֵי הוּא. מַאי קָאָמַר — יְמָמָא וְלֵילְיָא חַד יוֹמָא הוּא, וּלְעוֹלָם לָא מִפַּסְקִי מֵהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: there is not that are separated from each other, what it is saying day and night is one day, but actually are not separate from each other.
llm_translation: There, it is not that they are separated from each other. What is it saying? - Day and night are one day, and they never separate from each other.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְמָה לָךְ אַקְשׁוֹיֵי כּוּלֵּי הַאי, שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּהָא קָתָנֵי ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר אַחַת״.
human_translation: Rava said: Why you raise all these difficulties? It is different there, as it teaches I am hereby a nazirite one
llm_translation: Rava said: Why do you need to ask all of this? Because there it is written, "Behold, I will be a Nazirite."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר וְיוֹם אֶחָד״, ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר וְשָׁעָה אַחַת״, ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר אַחַת וּמֶחֱצָה״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite and one day, I am hereby a nazirite and one hour, I am hereby a nazirite one and a half, he a nazirite two
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Behold, I am a Nazir for one day," "Behold, I am a Nazir for one hour," "Behold, I am a Nazir for one and a half" - this is a Nazir for two periods.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנָא כׇּל הָנֵי? צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי תְּנָא ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר וְיוֹם אֶחָד״, הָכָא הוּא דְּאָמְרִינַן: אֵין נְזִירוּת לְיוֹם אֶחָד, אַמְּטוּ לְהָכִי קָמָנֵי תַּרְתֵּין. אֲבָל ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר וְשָׁעָה אַחַת״ — לִימְנֵי שְׁלֹשִׁים וְאֶחָד יוֹם, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Why do I to teach all these are necessary, as, if taught I am hereby a nazirite and one day, It is here that we say there is no naziriteship for one day, therefore he must count two However, I am hereby a nazirite and one hour, let him count thirty-one days. teaches us
llm_translation: Gemara: Why do I need all these Mishnayot? I need them, for if a Mishna were to teach, "Behold, I am a Nazirite for one day," here we say: There is no Nazirite vow for one day. Therefore, the Mishnayot are necessary to teach us this. But if one were to say, "Behold, I am a Nazirite for one hour," this implies counting thirty-one days, as we understand.

hebrew_text: וְאִי תְּנָא ״שָׁעָה אַחַת״, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא נָחֵית לְדַוְקָא. אֲבָל אַחַת וּמֶחֱצָה, דְּנָחֵית לְדַוְקָא — אֵימָא לָא לִימְנֵי תַּרְתֵּי, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן כּוּלְּהוּ — נָזִיר שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: And if taught one hour, because he did not go into specific detail [ davka ]. However, one and a half, where does go into specific detail, say he should not count two teaches us all these he is a nazirite two
llm_translation: "And if it were taught 'one hour,' it is because it did not come specifically. But one and a half, which did come specifically - say it is not included in the count of two, it teaches us all - a Nazir is two."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם וְשָׁעָה אַחַת״ — נָזִיר שְׁלֹשִׁים וְאֶחָד יוֹם, שֶׁאֵין נְזִירוּת לְשָׁעוֹת.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite thirty days and one hour, a nazirite thirty-one days, as there is no naziriteship for hours
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Behold, I am a Nazirite for thirty days and one hour" - a Nazirite for thirty-one days, for Naziriteship does not apply to hours.
