hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא דְּאָמַר ״שְׁלֹשִׁים וְאֶחָד יוֹם״, אֲבָל אָמַר ״שְׁלֹשִׁים [יוֹם] וְיוֹם אֶחָד״ — נָזִיר שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: Rav said: They taught only when he said: Thirty-one days. But he said: Thirty days and one day, a nazirite two
llm_translation: Gemara said Rav: They did not teach except that he said "thirty and one day," but if he said "thirty days and one day" — Nazir two.

hebrew_text: רַב סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּדָרֵישׁ לִישָּׁנָא יַתִּירָא.
human_translation: Rav holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who derives superfluous language.
llm_translation: Rav holds like Rabbi Akiva, who expounds on the extra word in the verse.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: לֹא אֶת הַבּוֹר וְלֹא אֶת הַדּוּת — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכָּתַב לוֹ עוּמְקָא וְרוּמָא. וְצָרִיךְ לִיקַּח לוֹ דֶּרֶךְ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: As we learned neither the pit nor the cistern [ dut ] although he wrote to him its depth and its height. And must purchase a path the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: We have learned: Not the pit and not the cistern - even though he wrote for him depth and height. And he must acquire for himself a path, the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִיקַּח לוֹ דֶּרֶךְ. וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ ״חוּץ מֵאֵלּוּ״ שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִיקַּח לוֹ דֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: He does not need to purchase a path, And Rabbi Akiva concedes that when he says to him Apart from these, that he does not need to purchase a path.
llm_translation: The sages say: He does not need to take for himself a path. And Rabbi Akiva agrees in a case where it was said to him, "Except for these," that he does not need to take for himself a path.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר כִּשְׂעַר רֹאשִׁי״, וְ״כַעֲפַר הָאָרֶץ״, וּ״כְחוֹל הַיָּם״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נְזִיר עוֹלָם, וּמְגַלֵּחַ אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite like the hair of my head, or: Like the dust of the earth, or: Like the sand of the sea, he is a nazirite forever. And shaves once thirty days.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Behold, I am a Nazirite like the hair of my head," and "like the dust of the earth," and "like the sand of the sea" — this one is a perpetual Nazirite, and shaves once every thirty days.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֵין זֶה מְגַלֵּחַ אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם. וְאֵיזֶהוּ מְגַלֵּחַ אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים? הָאוֹמֵר: ״הֲרֵי עָלַי נְזִירוּת כִּשְׂעַר רֹאשִׁי״, וְ״כַעֲפַר הָאָרֶץ״, וּ״כְחוֹל הַיָּם״.
human_translation: Rabbi says: This does not shave once thirty days, And who is shaves once thirty who says: It is hereby upon me naziriteships like the hair of my head, or: Like the dust of the earth, or: Like the sand of the sea.
llm_translation: Rabbi says: This is not considered shaving once in thirty days. And what is considered shaving once in thirty days? One who says, "Behold, upon me is the vow of a Nazirite like the hair of my head," and "like the dust of the earth," and "like the sand of the sea."

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מְלֹא הַבַּיִת״, אוֹ ״מְלֹא הַקּוּפָּה״ — בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ, אִם אָמַר: אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה נָזַרְתִּי — נָזִיר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. וְאִם אָמַר: סְתָם נָזַרְתִּי — רוֹאִין אֶת הַקּוּפָּה כְּאִילּוּ הִיא מְלֵאָה חַרְדָּל, וְנָזִיר כׇּל יָמָיו.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite the capacity of the house, or: The capacity of the basket, one checks him If he said: take a nazirite vow one long a nazirite thirty days, And if he said: I took a nazirite vow without specification, views the basket as though full of mustard and he is a nazirite his entire life.
llm_translation: "I hereby vow to be a Nazirite 'full of the house,' or 'full of the courtyard' - we examine him. If he says, 'I have vowed a large Nazirite vow' - he is a Nazirite for thirty days. But if he says, 'I have vowed a vague Nazirite vow' - we view the courtyard as if it were filled with mustard, and the Nazirite for all his days."

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מִכָּאן עַד מָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״ — אוֹמְדִין כַּמָּה יָמִים מִכָּאן עַד מָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי, אִם פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — נָזִיר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. וְאִם לָאו — נָזִיר כְּמִנְיַן הַיָּמִים.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite from here until such and such a place, one estimates how many days from here until such and such a place. If less than thirty days, a nazirite thirty days, And if not, a nazirite in accordance with the number of days
llm_translation: "I hereby vow to be a Nazirite from here to a certain place" - We determine how many days from here to the place of the certain one, if it is less than thirty days - the Nazirite is for thirty days. And if not - the Nazirite is according to the number of days.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר כְּמִנְיַן יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה״ — מוֹנֶה נְזִירוֹת כְּמִנְיַן יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה הָיָה, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִשְׁלִים — מֵת.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite in accordance with the number of days a solar counts naziriteships, in accordance with the number of days a solar Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident Once he completed he died.
llm_translation: "I hereby vow to be a Nazirite according to the count of the days of the sun" — one counts Nazirites according to the count of the days of the sun. Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident, once he completed his vow — he died.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רוֹאִין אֶת הַקּוּפָּה כְּאִילּוּ מְלֵאָה חַרְדָּל וְנָזִיר כׇּל יָמָיו. וְאַמַּאי? וְלִיחְזְיַיהּ כְּאִילּוּ מְלֵאָה קִישּׁוּאִין וְדִלּוּעִין, וְתִיהְוֵי לֵיהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא!
human_translation: views the basket as though full of mustard and he is a nazirite his entire life. But why Let us view it as though full of cucumbers or gourds, and there would be a remedy for him,
llm_translation: Gemara: They see the cup as if it were filled with mustard and nazar all his days. And why? To his merit as if it were filled with cucumbers and gourds, and it will be a remedy for him!

hebrew_text: אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: בְּמַחֲלוֹקֶת שְׁנוּיָה. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אָדָם מַכְנִיס אֶת עַצְמוֹ לְדָבָר שֶׁסְּפֵיקוֹ חָמוּר מִוַּדַּאי.
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya said: is taught a dispute and is Rabbi Shimon, who said: A person places himself in a state where uncertainty is more stringent than certainty,
llm_translation: Hezekiah said: In a dispute that is interchangeable. And Rabbi Shimon is the one who said: A person should involve himself in a matter where the doubt is more severe than the certainty.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר עַל מְנָת שֶׁיְּהֵא בִּכְרִי זֶה מֵאָה כּוֹר״, וְהָלַךְ וּמְצָאוֹ שֶׁנִּגְנַב אוֹ שֶׁאָבַד — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסֵר, שֶׁסְּפֵק נְזִירוּת לְהַחְמִיר.
human_translation: as it is taught I am hereby a nazirite on the condition that this pile will be one hundred kor , and he went and found that it was stolen or lost, Rabbi Shimon prohibits as uncertain naziriteship to stringently.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Behold, I undertake a Nazirite vow on the condition that this kor of mine contains one hundred kor." And if he went and found that it was stolen or lost — Rabbi Shimon prohibits, because in cases of doubt regarding Naziriteship, we are stringent.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר, שֶׁסְּפֵק נְזִירוּת לְהָקֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda permits as uncertain naziriteship to leniently.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah permits, that in a case of doubt regarding Naziriteship, one may be lenient.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָתָם לָא נָחֵית לֵיהּ לִנְזִירוּת. הָכָא נָחֵית לֵיהּ לִנְזִירוּת, בְּמַאי לְסַלּוֹקֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: You even say Rabbi Yehuda There, he does not enter naziriteship, here he enters naziriteship, how to remove from him
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yehuda, there he did not agree to the Nazirite vow. Here he agreed to the Nazirite vow, with what will he remove it from himself?

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי לָא? לִיחְזְיַהּ לְקוּפָּה כְּאִילּוּ מְלֵאָה קִישּׁוּאִין וְדִלּוּעִין, וְתִיהְוֵי לֵיהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא. הָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין, נְזִירוּת הוּא דְּקַבֵּיל עִילָּוֵיהּ!
human_translation: Why not Let us view the basket as though full of cucumbers or gourds, and there will be a remedy for him. It entered our minds it is naziriteships that he accepted upon himself,
llm_translation: "Why not? To see if it is fit for roofing, as if it were filled with straw and bran, and it would be a benefit to him. Is it not obvious? It is a Nazirite who has accepted upon himself vows!"

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֵין זֶה מְגַלֵּחַ אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם. וְאֵיזֶהוּ שֶׁמְּגַלֵּח אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם? הָאוֹמֵר ״[הֲרֵי] עָלַי נְזִירוֹת כִּשְׂעַר רֹאשִׁי״ וְ״כַעֲפַר הָאָרֶץ״ וּ״כְחוֹל הַיָּם״.
human_translation: as Rabbi Yehuda holds in accordance with Rabbi as we learned Rabbi says: This does not shave once thirty days, And who is who shaves once thirty days? who says: It is upon me naziriteships like the hair of my head, or: Like the dust of the earth, or: Like the sand of the sea.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds like Rabbi. For it was taught: Rabbi says, "This is not considered a single shaving within thirty days." And what is considered a single shaving within thirty days? One who says, "Behold, upon me are vows like the hair of my head," and "like the dust of the earth," and "like the sand of the sea."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי? וְהָתְנַן: הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר כְּמִנְיַן יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה הָיָה, וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִשְׁלִים — מֵת.
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yehuda hold in accordance with Rabbi But didn’t we learn I am hereby a nazirite in accordance with the number of days a solar Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident Once he completed he died.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, who does he hold like, like Rabbi? And we learned in a Mishnah: "Behold, I am a Nazirite according to the count of the days of the sun, etc." Rabbi Yehuda said: It was an incident, and once he completed it — he died.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא נְזִירוֹת קָא מְקַבֵּל עֲלֵיהּ, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּכֵיוָן דְּהִשְׁלִים — מֵת. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ חֲדָא נְזִירוּת קַבֵּל עִילָּוֵיהּ — מִי הָוֵי הַשְׁלָמָה כְּלָל?
human_translation: Granted, if you say he accepts upon himself naziriteships, that is the reason that once he completed he died. However, if you say he accepted upon himself one naziriteship is there completion at all?
llm_translation: If you say that he accepts Nazirites, that is the reason that since he completed - he dies. Rather, if you say that he accepts one Nazirite, would there be completion at all?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: מִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי? וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מִנְיַן הִילְקְטֵי קַיִץ״, וּ״מִנְיַן שְׁבִלֵי שְׁמִיטָּה״ — מוֹנֶה נְזִירוֹת כְּמִנְיַן הִילְקְטֵי קַיִץ וּכְמִנְיַן שְׁבִלֵי שְׁמִיטָּה!
human_translation: And furthermore, does hold in accordance with Rabbi But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: I am hereby a nazirite the number of piles [ helketei ] of figs [ kayitz ] or: the number of sheaves of the Sabbatical Year, count naziriteships as the number of piles of figs or as the number of sheaves of the Sabbatical Year?
llm_translation: And furthermore: Who holds like Rabbi? And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says, "Behold, I am a Nazir. From where do we learn the counting of summer gleanings and the counting of Sabbatical year produce?" — One counts Nazirites like the counting of summer gleanings and like the counting of Sabbatical year produce!

hebrew_text: ״מִנְיָן״ שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: number, is different,
llm_translation: "From where do we derive that they differ?"

hebrew_text: וּמִי שָׁאנֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מִנְיָן? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר כְּמִנְיַן יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה״ — מוֹנֶה נְזִירוֹת כְּמִנְיַן יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה. ״כִּימֵי הַלְּבָנָה״ — מוֹנֶה כִּימֵי הַלְּבָנָה. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״נְזִירוֹת עָלַי כְּמִנְיַן יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה וּכְמִנְיַן יְמוֹת הַלְּבָנָה״!
human_translation: And is number, different to Rabbi But isn’t it taught I am hereby a nazirite like the number of days a solar he counts naziriteships to the number of days a solar Like the days a lunar he counts to the days a lunar Rabbi says: until he says: upon me naziriteships like the number of days a solar or: Like the number of days a lunar
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who disputes with Rabbi about the count? And it was taught: 'Behold, I am a Nazirite according to the count of the days of the sun' — he counts his Naziriteship according to the count of the days of the sun. 'Like the days of the moon' — he counts like the days of the moon. Rabbi says: Until one says, 'My Naziriteship upon me is like the count of the days of the sun and like the count of the days of the moon!'" English translation:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר לַהּ כְּוָתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא. סָבַר לַהּ כְּוָתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא — נְזִירוּת קַבֵּיל עִילָּוֵיהּ. וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא — דְּאִילּוּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה שָׁנֵי לֵיהּ מוֹנֶה, וְרַבִּי לָא שָׁנֵי לֵיהּ מוֹנֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds in accordance with in one and disagrees with him in one He holds in accordance with his in one accepted upon himself naziriteship And he disagrees with him in one as Rabbi Yehuda, counts different Rabbi counts not different.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds according to his opinion in one aspect, and disagrees with her in one aspect. He holds according to his opinion in one aspect - the Nazirite vow accepts her. And he disagrees with her in one aspect - for even if Rabbi Yehuda changes it, Rabbi does not change it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר כֹּל יְמֵי חַיַּי״, ״הֲרֵינִי נְזִיר עוֹלָם״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נְזִיר עוֹלָם. אֲפִילּוּ ״מֵאָה שָׁנָה״, אֲפִילּוּ ״אֶלֶף שָׁנִים״ — אֵין זֶה נְזִיר עוֹלָם, אֶלָּא נָזִיר לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one says: I am hereby a nazirite all the days of my life, I am hereby a permanent nazirite, he is a permanent nazirite even One hundred years even: One thousand years, he is not a permanent nazirite. Rather, nazirite forever,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Behold, I am a Nazirite all the days of my life," "Behold, I am a Nazirite forever" — this is a Nazirite forever. Even "a hundred years," even "a thousand years" — this is not a Nazirite forever, but a Nazirite for eternity.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר וְאַחַת״ — מוֹנֶה שְׁתַּיִם. ״וְעוֹד״ — מוֹנֶה שָׁלֹשׁ. ״וְשׁוּב״ — מוֹנֶה אַרְבַּע. פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: ״וְשׁוּב״ כִּי כּוּלְּהוּ, וְהָוְיָא לֵיהּ שֵׁית, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught I am hereby a nazirite and one, he counts two and more, he counts three And again, he counts four. Isn’t obvious? Lest you say and again equal all the and he has six teaches us that not
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Behold, I am a Nazirite and one" - counts as two. "And furthermore" - counts as three. "And again" - counts as four. Is it not obvious? What might you have thought? "And again" when all of them, and it should be six for him, it teaches us that it is not so.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר״ — סוֹמְכוֹס אוֹמֵר: ״הֵן״ — אַחַת, ״דִּיגוֹן״ — שְׁתַּיִם, ״טְרִיגוֹן״ — שָׁלֹשׁ, ״טֶטְרָגוֹן״ — אַרְבַּע, ״פּוֹנְטִיגוֹן״ — חָמֵשׁ.
human_translation: The Sages taught I am hereby a nazirite, Sumakhos says: hen , one Digon , two Trigon , Tetragon , four Puntigon , five
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Behold, I am a Nazir" - Simeon says: "Yes" - one, "Digon" - two, "Trigon" - three, "Tetragon" - four, "Pontigon" - five.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֵּית עִגּוּל, דִּיגוֹן, טְרִיגוֹן, פּוֹנְטִיגוֹן — אֵינוֹ מִטַּמֵּא בִּנְגָעִים, טֶטְרָגוֹן — מִטַּמֵּא בִּנְגָעִים. מַאי טַעְמָא? לְמַטָּה הוּא אוֹמֵר ״קִיר״ ״קִירוֹת״. לְמַעְלָה הוּא אוֹמֵר ״קִיר״ ״קִירוֹת״. הֲרֵי כָּאן אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A round house, a two-sided a triangle- a pentagon- cannot become impure with leprosy, a quadrilateral become impure with leprosy. What is the reason below it states, a wall, walls: above it states, a wall, walls: there are four here
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Beit Igul, Digon, Trigon, Pontigon - do not convey impurity through skin afflictions; Tetragon - conveys impurity through skin afflictions. What is the reason? Below it says "wall" "walls." Above it says "wall" "walls." Here we have four.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ כׇּל כִּינּוּיֵי
llm_translation: We will return to you all the designations.

hebrew_text: ״ הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מִן הַגְּרוֹגְרוֹת וּמִן הַדְּבֵילָה״, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נָזִיר. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ נָזִיר. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אַף כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בְּאוֹמֵר ״הֲרֵי הֵן עָלַי קׇרְבָּן״.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite from dried figs and from cakes of dried figs, Beit Shammai say: nazirite, And Beit Hillel say: He is not a nazirite, Rabbi Yehuda said: Even when Beit Shammai said they said only in where said They are hereby to me an offering.
llm_translation: "I am a Nazirite from dried figs and from raisins," Beit Shammai says: Nazirite. And Beit Hillel says: Not a Nazirite. Rabbi Yehuda said: Even when Beit Shammai said, they only said it when he says, 'Behold, they are upon me as a sacrifice.'"

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מִן הַגְּרוֹגְרוֹת וּמִן הַדְּבֵילָה״ — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נָזִיר. וְאַמַּאי? ״מִכֹּל אֲשֶׁר יֵעָשֶׂה מִגֶּפֶן הַיַּיִן״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא! בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: אֵין אָדָם מוֹצִיא דְּבָרָיו לְבַטָּלָה.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite from dried figs and from cakes of dried figs, Beit Shammai say: nazirite. But why? The Merciful One states “From anything that is made of the grapevine Beit Shammai hold in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who says: A person does not utter a statement for naught.
llm_translation: Gemara: "He said, 'Behold, I am a Nazirite from the grapevines and from the stems.'" Beit Shammai says: He is a Nazirite. And why? "From all that is made from the grapevine" - the Merciful One said! Beit Shammai hold like Rabbi Meir, who said: A person does not bring forth his words to be nullified.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: בִּגְמַר דְּבָרָיו אָדָם נִתְפָּס. וְהַאי נֶדֶר וּפִתְחוֹ עִמּוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who says: A person is held accountable for the conclusion of his statement. And this is a vow with its opening,
llm_translation: House of Hillel hold like Rabbi Yosei, for he said: In the finalization of his words a person is caught. And this vow and its opening with him it is.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי נָמֵי, נֶדֶר וּפִתְחוֹ עִמּוֹ הוּא!
human_translation: And Beit Shammai too, it is a vow with its opening,
llm_translation: And Beit Shammai says, "Neder and pitcho imo hu!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: אֵין אָדָם מוֹצִיא דְּבָרָיו לְבַטָּלָה. וְכֵיוָן דְּאָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר״ — הֲוָה לֵיהּ נָזִיר, כִּי קָאָמַר ״מִן הַגְּרוֹגְרוֹת וּמִן הַדְּבֵילָה״ — לְאִיתְּשׁוֹלֵי הוּא דְּקָאָתֵי. וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּאָמְרִי: אֵין שְׁאֵלָה בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ. וְכֵיוָן דְּאֵין שְׁאֵלָה בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ — אֵין שְׁאֵלָה בִּנְזִירוּת.
human_translation: Rather, Beit Shammai hold in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who said: A person does not utter a statement for naught, and once he said: I am hereby a nazirite, he is a nazirite. When he says: from dried figs and from cakes of dried figs, he is coming to request And Beit Shammai follow their reasoning, as they say: cannot request of consecrated And since cannot request of consecrated cannot request of naziriteship,
llm_translation: Rather: Beit Shammai hold like Rabbi Meir, for he said: A person does not bring forth his words to be nullified. And once he said, "Behold, I am a Nazir," he becomes a Nazir, for he was speaking of "from dried figs and from pressed figs" - it is the stumbling block upon which he stumbled. And Beit Shammai, according to their reasoning, said: There is no inquiry in matters of consecration. And once there is no inquiry in matters of consecration - there is no inquiry in matters of Naziriteship.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דִּתְנַן: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר, שֶׁלֹּא הִתְנַדֵּב כְּדֶרֶךְ הַמִּתְנַדְּבִים.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel hold in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, as we learned and Rabbi Shimon exempts as he did not donate in the manner of donors.
llm_translation: House of Hillel hold like Rabbi Shimon, as we learned: "And Rabbi Shimon exempts, for he did not volunteer in the manner of volunteers."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי נָתָן: אוֹמֵר בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נָדוּר וְנָזִיר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: נָדוּר וְאֵין נָזִיר. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר וּכְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna . As it is taught Rabbi Natan says Beit Shammai say: forbidden by a vow, and a nazirite; and Beit Hillel say: forbidden by a vow, but not a nazirite. Beit Shammai hold in accordance with Rabbi Meir and as Rabbi Yehuda And Beit Hillel hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei
llm_translation: Mishnaic teaching: that not like this Tanna, as it was taught by Rabbi Natan: Beit Shammai say: vow and nazirite, and Beit Hillel say: vow but not nazirite. Beit Shammai hold like Rabbi Meir and like Rabbi Yehuda, and Beit Hillel hold like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא אָמְרִי לַהּ: רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נָדוּר וְאֵינוֹ נָזִיר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא נָדוּר וְלֹא נָזִיר. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וּבֵית הִלֵּל כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Some say a different version Rabbi Natan says Beit Shammai say: forbidden by a vow and he is not a nazirite; and Beit Hillel say: not forbidden by a vow, and not a nazirite. Beit Shammai is as Rabbi Yehuda and Beit Hillel hold in accordance with Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: The other sages said to her: Rabbi Nathan says, Beit Shammai says: Nazirite but not Nazir, and Beit Hillel says: Neither Nazirite nor Nazir. Beit Shammai is like Rabbi Yehuda, and Beit Hillel is like Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הָאוֹמֵר ״הֲרֵי עָלַי מִנְחָה לְהָבִיא מִן הַשְּׂעוֹרִים״ — יָבִיא מִן הַחִיטִּים. ״קֶמַח״ — יָבִיא סוֹלֶת. ״שֶׁלֹּא בְּשֶׁמֶן וּלְבוֹנָה״ — יְבִיאֶנָּה בְּשֶׁמֶן וּלְבוֹנָה. ״חֲצִי עִשָּׂרוֹן״ — יָבִיא עִשָּׂרוֹן שָׁלֵם. ״עִשָּׂרוֹן וּמֶחֱצָה״ — יָבִיא שְׁנַיִם. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר, שֶׁלֹּא הִתְנַדֵּב כְּדֶרֶךְ הַמִּתְנַדְּבִים.
human_translation: We learned there one who says: It is upon me to bring a meal-offering from barley, he must bring from wheat. flour, he must bring fine flour. without oil and frankincense, he must bring it with oil and frankincense, half of a tenth he must bring a full tenth, a tenth and a half, he brings two Rabbi Shimon exempts as he did not donate in the manner of donors.
llm_translation: We learned there: One who says, "I am obligated to bring a meal-offering from barley" - should bring it from wheat. "Flour" - should bring fine flour. "Not with oil and frankincense" - should bring it with oil and frankincense. "Half a tenth" - should bring a full tenth. "A tenth and a half" - should bring two. Rabbi Shimon exempts, for he did not volunteer in the manner of volunteers.

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא דְּכִי אָמַר ״הֲרֵי עָלַי מִנְחָה מִן הַשְּׂעוֹרִים״ מֵבִיא מִן הַחִיטִּים? אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: בְּמַחֲלוֹקֶת שְׁנוּיָה, וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי הִיא. לָאו אָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי כִּי אָמַר ״מִן הַגְּרוֹגְרוֹת וּמִן הַדְּבֵילָה״ הָוֵי נָזִיר, הָכִי נָמֵי כִּי אָמַר ״מִן הַשְּׂעוֹרִין״ — מֵבִיא מִן הַחִיטִּים.
human_translation: Who taught that when one said: It is upon me a meal-offering from barley, he brings from wheat? Ḥizkiyya said is taught as a dispute and it is Beit Shammai. Didn’t Beit Shammai say that when one said: from dried figs and from cakes of dried figs, he is a nazirite, So too, when he said from barley, he brings from wheat,
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that when he says, "Behold, upon me is a meal-offering of barley," brings from wheat? Chizkiyah said: In a dispute that is interchangeable, and it is the opinion of Beit Shammai. Did Beit Shammai not say that if one says, "from groats and from spelt," he becomes a Nazir? So too here, when he says, "from barley," he brings from wheat.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל — בְּאוֹמֵר ״אִילּוּ הָיִיתִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין נוֹדְרִין כָּךְ, לֹא נָדַרְתִּי כָּךְ אֶלָּא כָּךְ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: You even say all, agree with regard to one who says, Had I known that one cannot vow in this manner, I would not have vowed that way, only this way,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you say "the words of everyone," when one says, "If I had known that vows are not made in this way, I would not have vowed in this way."

hebrew_text: אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאָמַר ״מִן הַשְּׂעוֹרִים״, אֲבָל אָמַר ״מִן הָעֲדָשִׁים״ — לָא מַיְיתֵי וְלֹא כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya says: They taught only if he said from barley. But he said from lentils, he does not bring anything.
llm_translation: Hezekiah said: They only taught that it must be "from barley," but if one said "from lentils" — it is not brought and is not valid.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי חִזְקִיָּה כְּמַאן מוֹקֵים לָהּ לְמַתְנִיתִין — כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, וְהָא עֲדָשִׁים לְגַבֵּי מִנְחָה כִּגְרוֹגְרוֹת לְגַבֵּי נָזִיר דָּמוּ, וְקָאָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הָוֵי נָזִיר! הֲדַר בֵּיהּ חִזְקִיָּה.
human_translation: Now in accordance with whose does Ḥizkiyya establish the mishna in accordance with Beit Shammai. But lentils relative to a meal-offering are comparable to dried figs relative to a nazirite, and Beit Shammai say he is a nazirite. Ḥizkiyya retracted from it
llm_translation: From when did Hezekiah establish for her for the Mishnah? - Like the House of Shammai. And these lentils for a Minchah are like dried figs for a Nazirite, and the House of Shammai says, "He shall be a Nazirite!" Hezekiah reconsidered it.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי הֲדַר בֵּיהּ? אֲמַר רָבָא, מַתְנִיתִין קְשִׁיתֵיהּ: מַאי אִירְיָא דְּתָנֵי ״מִן הַשְּׂעוֹרִים״? לִיתְנֵי ״מִן הָעֲדָשִׁים״! אֶלָּא סָבַר חִזְקִיָּה: כִּי קָאָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הָתָם — כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And why did he retract from it? Rava said: mishna caused him difficulty why does specifically teach from barley? Let him teach from lentils Rather, Ḥizkiyya holds when Beit Shammai stated there, as Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: And why did he return to it? Rava said, the Mishnah challenges it: What is the reason that it teaches "from barley"? Let it teach "from lentils"! Rather, Hezekiah thought: When the House of Shammai says there — it is like Rabbi Judah.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ ״מִן הָעֲדָשִׁים״. וְהָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הוּא דְּאָמַר, בְּאוֹמֵר ״אִילּוּ הָיִיתִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין נוֹדְרִין כָּךְ, לֹא נָדַרְתִּי כָּךְ אֶלָּא כָּךְ״! לִדְבָרָיו דְּחִזְקִיָּה הוּא דְּקָאָמַר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even from lentils But Rabbi Yoḥanan is he who said who says: Had I known that one cannot vow in this manner, I would not have vowed that way, only this way? He stated in accordance with the statement of Ḥizkiyya.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even "from lentils." But isn't Rabbi Yochanan the one who said, when he says "If I had known that vows are not made in this way, I would not have made a vow in this way!" According to the words of Chizkiyah who said.

hebrew_text: אַתְּ מַאי טַעְמָא קָא הָדְרַתְּ בָּךְ — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא קָתָנֵי ״מִן הָעֲדָשִׁים״. דִּלְמָא לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא כִּי אָמַר ״מֵעֲדָשִׁים״, דְּמַיְיתֵי מִנְחָה מְעַלַּיְיתָא, דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר מִיהְדָּר הוּא דַּהֲדַר בֵּיהּ, וּתְפוֹס לָשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. אֶלָּא כִּי אָמַר ״מִן הַשְּׂעוֹרִין״, וַדַּאי דְּהָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי קָדְשָׁה כַּמִּנְחָת הָעוֹמֶר,
human_translation: What is the reason you retracted because it does not teach: From lentils. perhaps it is speaking It is not necessary, It is not necessary when one says: from lentils, that he brings a proper meal-offering it can be said he is retracting And held to the first statement, But if he said: from barley, certainly this is what he said: If is consecrated like the omer meal-offering,
llm_translation: You, what reason are you returning to it? — Because it does not teach "from the lentils." Perhaps it is not necessary that he said: It is not necessary when he said "from lentils," for it is similar to the meal offering of the Omer, that there is something to say that he will return to it, and grasp the first language. Rather, when he said "from barley," and certainly this is what he is saying: If it is sanctified like the meal offering of the Omer,

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּמִנְחַת סוֹטָה — תִּקְדּוֹשׁ, אִי לָא — לָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּמַיְיתֵי מִן הַחִיטִּים.
human_translation: or like the meal-offering of a sota , it should become consecrated, if not not teaches us that one brings from wheat.
llm_translation: Or like the meal offering of a suspected adulteress — it is sanctified, if not — not. This implies to us that it is derived from the wheat.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר: ״אָמְרָה פָּרָה זוֹ הֲרֵינִי נְזִירָה אִם עוֹמֶדֶת אֲנִי״, ״אוֹמֵר הַדֶּלֶת הַזֶּה הֲרֵינִי נְזִירָה אִם נִפְתָּח אֲנִי״ — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נָזִיר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ נָזִיר. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אַף כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, לֹא אוֹמְרִים אֶלָּא בְּאוֹמֵר ״הֲרֵי פָּרָה זוֹ עָלַי קׇרְבָּן, אִם עוֹמֶדֶת הִיא״.
human_translation: said: This cow said: I am hereby a nazirite if I stand up; This door says: I am hereby a nazirite if I am opened, Beit Shammai say a nazirite, and Beit Hillel say not a nazirite. Rabbi Yehuda said: Even when Beit Shammai say they say only one who said: This cow is hereby to me an offering if it stands up.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "She said, 'This cow is a nazirite offering if it stands.' He says, 'This door is a nazirite offering if it opens.' Beit Shammai says: it is a nazirite offering, and Beit Hillel says: it is not a nazirite offering." Rabbi Yehuda said: "Even when Beit Shammai said this, they only say it when one says, 'This cow is upon me as an offering if it stands.'"

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פָּרָה מִי קָא מִישְׁתַּעְיָא? אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה פָּרָה רְבוּצָה לְפָנָיו, וְאָמַר: ״כִּסְבוּרָה פָּרָה זוֹ אֵינָהּ עוֹמֶדֶת — הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מִבְּשָׂרָהּ אִם עָמְדָה מֵאֵלֶיהָ״. וְעָמְדָה מֵאֵלֶיהָ. וְהָלְכוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְשִׁיטָתָן וּבֵית הִלֵּל לְשִׁיטָתָן.
human_translation: Does a cow speak? Rami bar Ḥama said: With what are we dealing here? where there was a prone cow before him, and he said: This cow thinks it not stand; I am hereby a nazirite from its flesh if it stands of its own accord, and it stood of its own accord. Beit Shammai follow their approach and Beit Hillel follow their approach.
llm_translation: Gemara: From what does the cow become pregnant? Ramei bar Ḥama said: Here, what are we dealing with? For example, if a cow was lying before him, and he said, "I hold that this cow is not pregnant - I will be a Nazir from its meat if it stands from its place." And it stood from its place. Beit Shammai followed their opinion, and Beit Hillel followed their opinion.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי דְּאָמְרִי ״מִן הַגְּרוֹגְרוֹת וּמִן הַדְּבֵילָה״ — הָוֵי נָזִיר, הָכָא נָמֵי, כִּי אָמַר ״מִבְּשָׂרָהּ״ — הָוֵי נָזִיר. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לָא הָוֵי נָזִיר.
human_translation: Beit Shammai, who say from dried figs and from cakes of dried figs is a nazirite, here too, when he says: I am hereby a nazirite from its flesh, is a nazirite. And Beit Hillel say: He is not a nazirite.
llm_translation: House of Shammai who say, "From the dried figs and from the pressed fig-cakes" — he shall be a Nazirite, here it is stated, for he said, "from its flesh" — he shall be a Nazirite. And House of Hillel say: he shall not be a Nazirite.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַמְרוּהָ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי חֲדָא זִימְנָא! אָמַר רָבָא: תַּרְתֵּי תְּלָת. וְכֵן תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא תַּרְתֵּי תְּלָת. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא תַּרְתֵּי תְּלָת.
human_translation: But didn’t Beit Shammai say this one time? Rava said: two three And Rabbi Ḥiyya also taught two three And Rabbi Oshaya also said two three
llm_translation: The Gemara states: "And this was said by the House of Shammai once!" Rava said: "Two out of three." And so did Rabbi Chiya teach: "Two out of three." And likewise Rabbi Oshaya said: "Two out of three."

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא גְּרוֹגְרוֹת וּדְבֵילָה: הָתָם הוּא דְּאָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הָוֵי נָזִיר, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִיחַלְּפָן בַּעֲנָבִים. אֲבָל בָּשָׂר בַּעֲנָבִים — לָא מִיחַלַּף. וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בָּשָׂר: הָכָא הוּא דְּאָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הָוֵי נָזִיר בְּבִישְׂרָא וְחַמְרָא. אֲבָל גְּרוֹגְרוֹת וּדְבֵילָה — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And are necessary, as, if it were stated in this dried figs and cakes of dried figs, there that Beit Shammai say he is a nazirite, since are confused with grapes, But meat is not confused with grapes, And if it were stated meat it is here that Beit Shammai say he is a nazirite meat and wine, But dried figs and cakes of dried figs not teaches us
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if it were stated regarding this: "Grogrot and Deveilah," there, that is what Beit Shammai said, one should be a Nazirite, because they change through grapes. But with meat in grapes - it does not change. And if it were stated regarding meat: here, that is what Beit Shammai said, one should be a Nazirite with meat and wine. But with grogrot and deveilah - no, it is not evident to us.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיתְּמַר הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי: הָנֵי הוּא דְּקָאָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, אֲבָל דֶּלֶת אֵימָא מוֹדוּ לְהוּ לְבֵית הִלֵּל. וְאִי תַּנָּא דֶּלֶת: בְּהָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית הִלֵּל, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ תַּרְתֵּי אֵימָא מוֹדוּ לְהוּ לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא.
human_translation: And if it were stated these two these that Beit Shammai say but a door, I will say they concede to Beit Hillel And if taught a door, in this Beit Hillel say but in these two I will say they concede to Beit Shammai teaches us that not
llm_translation: And if it was stated: these two, these are the ones that Beit Shammai say, but as for the door, why not concede to Beit Hillel. And if a Mishna states: the door, in that case Beit Hillel says, but in these two cases why not concede to Beit Shammai, it teaches us that not so.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִי קָתָנֵי ״אִם עָמְדָה מֵאֵלֶיהָ״? אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה פָּרָה רְבוּצָה לְפָנָיו, וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵי עָלַי קׇרְבָּן״. בִּשְׁלָמָא פָּרָה — בַּת קׇרְבָּן הִיא, אֶלָּא דֶּלֶת — בַּת קׇרְבָּן הִיא?! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה פָּרָה רְבוּצָה לְפָנָיו,
human_translation: Rava said: Is teaching: If it stood of its own accord? Rather, Rava said: where there was a prone cow before him, and he said: It is upon me to bring offering, Granted, a cow be an offering, but a door be an offering? Rather, Rava said where there was a prone cow before him
llm_translation: Rava said: Who is the one who teaches "if it stood before him"? Rather, Rava said: For example, if a cow was lying before him, and he said, "Behold, I have a sacrifice upon me." But a cow — is it the daughter of a sacrifice? Rather, it is a door — is it the daughter of a sacrifice?! Rather, Rava said: For example, if a cow was lying before him,

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מִיַּיִן אִם לֹא עָמְדָה״, וְעָמְדָה מֵאֵלֶיהָ. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: תּוּרְפֵּיהּ דְּהַאי גַּבְרָא מִשּׁוּם אוֹקֹמַהּ בִּידֵיהּ הוּא, וְהָא לָא אוֹקְמַהּ. וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: מִשּׁוּם דִּרְבִיעָא הוּא, וְהָא קָמַת.
human_translation: and he said: I am hereby a nazirite from wine if it does not stand, and it stood of its own accord, Beit Shammai hold: This man’s intention [ turpeih ] is based upon him having it stand by his hand, and he did not have it stand. And Beit Hillel hold: is based upon that it was prone, and it has stood.
llm_translation: And he said: "Behold, I am a Nazirite from wine if she did not stand," and she stood from herself. Beit Shammai hold: the wine was mixed by this man because he set it up with his hands, but he did not set it up. And Beit Hillel hold: because it is a quarter-log, and she stood.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אַף כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בְּאוֹמֵר ״הֲרֵי הֵן עָלַי קׇרְבָּן״. פָּרָה מִי קָא מַתְפֵּיס בָּהּ מִידֵּי?
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause Rabbi Yehuda said: Even when Beit Shammai said they said only with regard to one who said: They are hereby to me an offering. does he extend any to the cow?
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: Rabbi Yehuda said: Even when Beit Shammai said, they only said when one says, "Behold, they are upon me as a sacrifice." Who is liable for the cow?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מִבְּשָׂרָהּ אִם לֹא עָמְדָה״, וְעָמְדָה מֵאֵלֶיהָ. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: תּוּרְפֵּיהּ דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא מִשּׁוּם אוֹקֹמַהּ בִּידֵיהּ הוּא, וְהָא לָא אוֹקְמַהּ. וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: תּוּרְפֵּיהּ דְּהַאי גַּבְרָא מִשּׁוּם דִּרְבִיעָא, וְהָא קָמַת.
human_translation: Rather, where he said: I am hereby a nazirite from its flesh if it does not stand, and it stood of its own accord. Beit Shammai hold: That man’s intention is based upon having it stand by his own hand, and he did not have it stand. And Beit Hillel hold: This man’s intention is based upon that it was prone, and it has stood,
llm_translation: Rather, for example, as he said, "Behold, I am a Nazirite from her flesh if she does not stand," and she stood from him. Beit Shammai hold: The healing of that man is because he established it in his hands, but he did not establish it. And Beit Hillel hold: The healing of this man is because of a quarter of a log, and she stood.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי אִי לָא קָמַת הָוֵי נָזִיר? וְהָאָמְרִי ״מִבְּשָׂרָהּ״ — לָא הָוֵי נָזִיר!
human_translation: And Beit Hillel hold if does not stand he will be a nazirite? But didn’t they say from flesh, he is not a nazirite,
llm_translation: House of Hillel hold: if not stood, be Nazir? And said: "from her flesh" - not be Nazir!

hebrew_text: לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי קָאָמְרִי: לְדִידַן אֲפִילּוּ לָא קָמַת, נָמֵי לָא הָוֵי נָזִיר. לְדִידְכוּ דְּאָמְרִיתוּ הָוֵי נָזִיר, אוֹדוֹ לַן מִיהַת דְּתוּרְפֵּיהּ דְּהָדֵין גַּבְרָא מִשּׁוּם דִּרְבִיעָא, וְהָא קָמַת. וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי: לָאו תּוּרְפֵּיהּ דְּהַאי גַּבְרָא מִשּׁוּם אוֹקֹמַהּ בִּידֵיהּ הוּא, וְהָא לָא אוֹקְמַהּ.
human_translation: They stated in accordance with the reasoning of Beit Shammai: According to our even does not stand he is also not a nazirite, according to your that you say he is a nazirite, in any event concede to us that this man’s intention is based upon that was prone, and it has stood, And Beit Shammai Isn’t this man’s intention based upon having it stand by his own hand, and he did not have it stand?
llm_translation: According to the reasoning of Beit Shammai they say: According to us, even if she did not arise, she is not a nazirite. According to you who say she is a nazirite, or let us say from the fact that a man is a fourth generation, and she did arise. And Beit Shammai: Her arising is not the cause that this man is a fourth generation, and this is not the cause.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָזְגוּ לוֹ אֶת הַכּוֹס, וְאָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מִמֶּנּוּ״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר. מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת שֶׁהָיְתָה שִׁיכּוֹרָה, וּמָזְגוּ לָהּ אֶת הַכּוֹס, וְאָמְרָה: ״הֲרֵינִי נְזִירָה מִמֶּנּוּ״. אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: לֹא נִתְכַּוְּונָה זוֹ אֶלָּא לוֹמַר ״הֲרֵי הוּא עָלַי קׇרְבָּן״.
human_translation: they poured one a cup and he said: I am hereby a nazirite from it, he is a nazirite An incident with regard to a certain woman who was intoxicated and they poured a cup for her and she said: I am hereby a nazirite from it. The Sages said: This did not intend but to say: It is hereby to me an offering.
llm_translation: They taught: If they poured him the cup, and he said, "Behold, I am a Nazirite from it" — behold, he is a Nazirite. There was an incident with a certain woman who was drunk, and they poured her the cup, and she said, "Behold, I am a Nazirite from it." The sages said: She did not intend anything except to say, "Behold, it is upon me as a sacrifice."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַעֲשֶׂה לִסְתּוֹר?! אָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר, וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת, אַלְמָא בְּהַאי הוּא דְּאָסוּר, הָא יֵינָא אַחֲרִינָא — שְׁרֵי!
human_translation: an incident to contradict You said in the first clause he is a nazirite. And then teaches: An incident with regard to a certain woman Apparently it is with regard to this that is forbidden consequently, other wine is permitted,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, ma'aseh listor?! Amarta reishah — harei zeh nazir, vahadar tanei: ma'aseh be'ishah achat, alma be'hahi hu de'asur, ha yena acharina — shrei!" English translation: "Gemara, an incident to conceal?! You said at first — this one is a Nazirite, and then you taught: there was an incident with one woman, implying with this one it is forbidden, but with another wine — it is permitted!"

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: מָזְגוּ לוֹ אֶת הַכּוֹס, וְאָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מִמֶּנּוּ״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר. וְאִם שִׁיכּוֹר הוּא, וְאָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר מִמֶּנּוּ״ — אֵינוֹ נָזִיר. מַאי טַעְמָא — כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר ״הֲרֵי עָלַי קׇרְבָּן״ הוּא, וְכִי תֵּימָא: לֵימָא הָכִי? סָבַר: מַיְיתִין לִי אַחֲרִינָא וּמְצַעֲרִן לִי, אֵימָא לְהוּ הָא מִילְּתָא דִּפְסִיקָא לְהוּ. וּמַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת.
human_translation: is incomplete and is teaching the following: they poured a cup for one and he said: I am hereby a nazirite from it, he is a nazirite. And if he is intoxicated and he said: I am hereby a nazirite from it, he is not a nazirite. What is the reason He is like one who said: is to me an offering. And if you would say let him say so he maintains: they will bring me another and aggravate me I say to them this statement, which is definitive to them, And an incident also with regard to a certain woman
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Hasorei miChasra ve'hakhi katanei: Mazgu lo et haKos, ve'amar 'Hareini nazir mimenu' — harei zeh nazir. Ve'im shikor hu, ve'amar 'Hareini nazir mimenu' — einu nazir. Mai ta'ama — ke'man de'amar 'Harei alai korban' hu, ve'chi teima: leima hachi? Savar: Maytein li acharina u'metzar'in li, eima lehu ha milta d'fesika lehu. U'ma'aseh namei be'isha achat."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֱהֵא שׁוֹתֶה יַיִן וּמִיטַּמֵּא לְמֵתִים״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר, וְאָסוּר בְּכוּלָּן.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite on the condition that I will drink wine and may become impure from corpses, he is a nazirite and is prohibited from all of the
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Behold, I am a Nazirite on the condition that I drink wine and defile myself for the dead" - this one is a Nazirite, and is forbidden in all of them.

hebrew_text: ״יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ נְזִירוּת, אֲבָל אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהַנָּזִיר אָסוּר בְּיַיִן״ — הֲרֵי זֶה אָסוּר, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר. ״יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי שֶׁהַנָּזִיר אָסוּר בְּיַיִן, אֲבָל סָבוּר הָיִיתִי שֶׁחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין לִי מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין אֲנִי יָכוֹל לִחְיוֹת אֶלָּא בְּיַיִן״, אוֹ ״מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֲנִי קוֹבֵר אֶת הַמֵּתִים״ — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּתָּר, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: I know that there is naziriteship, but I do not know that a nazirite is prohibited from wine, he is prohibited But Rabbi Shimon permits I know that a nazirite is prohibited from wine, but I thought that the Sages permit me because I cannot live without wine, or: because I bury the dead, he is permitted but Rabbi Shimon prohibits
llm_translation: "I know that there is a vow of abstinence, but I do not know if the Nazirite is prohibited with wine" — this is prohibited, and Rabbi Shimon permits. "I know that the Nazirite is prohibited with wine, but I thought that the sages would permit me because I can only live with wine," or "because I bury the dead" — this is permitted, and Rabbi Shimon prohibits.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְלִפְלוֹג נָמֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרֵישָׁא! אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: חָלוּק הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אַף בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: Let Rabbi Shimon disagree in the first clause as well, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Rabbi Shimon disagrees even in the first clause
llm_translation: Gemara: And to differentiate between them, the first opinion of Rabbi Shimon! Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Rabbi Shimon was also in disagreement at the outset.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: בְּרֵישָׁא לָא פְּלִיג רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ מַתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה, וְכׇל הַמַּתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה — תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר לָךְ: [הַאי] ״עַל מְנָת״ — כְּחוּץ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Ravina said: Rabbi Shimon does not disagree in the first clause What is the reason because one was stipulating counter to that which is written in the Torah and anyone who stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, his stipulation is void. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said to you: This On the condition, considered like Apart
llm_translation: Ravina said: At first, Rabbi Shimon did not argue. What is the reason? Because he had a condition on what is written in the Torah, and anyone who has a condition on what is written in the Torah - his condition is nullified. And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said to you: "On condition" - like outside money.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא: אָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֱהֵא שׁוֹתֶה יַיִן וּמִיטַּמֵּא לְמֵתִים״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר וְאָסוּר בְּכוּלָּן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בְּתוֹרָה, וְכׇל הַמַּתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה — תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Ravina. said: I am hereby a nazirite on the condition that I will be allowed to drink wine and may become impure from corpses, he is a nazirite and is prohibited from all of them because he stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, and anyone who stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, his stipulation is void.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Ravina: He said, "Behold, I am a Nazirite on the condition that I drink wine and become impure to the dead" — this one is a Nazirite and is prohibited in all of them, because he is stipulating based on what is written in the Torah, and anyone who stipulates based on what is written in the Torah — his stipulation is nullified.

hebrew_text: ״יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי שֶׁהַנָּזִיר אָסוּר בְּיַיִן״. וְהָאָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא אָסוּר, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר! אֵימָא נָמֵי: הֲרֵי זֶה אָסוּר, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ. הָתָם
human_translation: I know that a nazirite is prohibited from wine But didn’t you say in the earlier clause prohibited and Rabbi Shimon permits say as well: He is prohibited, and Rabbi Shimon permits And if you wish, say Actually, do not reverse there
llm_translation: "I know that a Nazirite is forbidden in wine." And you said at first it is forbidden, but Rabbi Shimon permits! Say instead: this is forbidden, and Rabbi Shimon permits. And if you wish, say: indeed, do not reverse. There, in that case

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא, כְּגוֹן דִּנְזַר מֵחֲדָא, לְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי דַּאֲפִילּוּ לֹא נָזַר אֶלָּא מֵאַחַת מֵהֶן — הָוֵי נָזִיר, וְאָסוּר. לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר עַד שֶׁיַּזִּיר מִכּוּלָּם — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: the earlier clause, where he vowed naziriteship one According to the Rabbis, who say that even if he vowed naziriteship only one of the he is a nazirite, he is prohibited According to Rabbi Shimon said unless he takes a vow of naziriteship all of them, permitted.
llm_translation: Beginning, for example, as he separates from one, to the Rabbis who say even if he only separated from one of them — he is a Nazirite, and it is forbidden. To Rabbi Shimon who says until he separates from all of them — it is permitted.

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא דִּנְדַר מִכּוּלְּהוּ, וְאִיתְּשִׁיל מֵחֲדָא.
human_translation: the last clause vowed all of them, and to request of one
llm_translation: The end of a vow is from all, and it is released from one.

hebrew_text: לְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי אֲפִילּוּ לֹא נָזַר אֶלָּא מֵאַחַת מֵהֶן הָוֵי נָזִיר, כִּי מִתְּשִׁיל מֵחֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ — אִישְׁתְּרִי. לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר עַד שֶׁיַּזִּיר מִכּוּלָּם, כִּי מִתְּשִׁיל נָמֵי מֵהָהוּא, עַד דְּמִתְּשִׁיל מִכּוּלְּהוּ. מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קָתָנֵי: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: According to the Rabbis, who say that even if he vowed naziriteship only one of the he is a nazirite, when he requests one of them, he is permitted According to Rabbi Shimon, who said unless he takes a vow of naziriteship all of them, when he requests of that until he requests of all of Due to this teaches: And Rabbi Shimon prohibits
llm_translation: The sages who say even if he only vowed from one of them, he becomes a Nazirite, for he includes one of them - Ishtri. According to Rabbi Shimon who says until he vows from all of them, for he includes also from that one, until he includes from all of them. Therefore it was taught: And Rabbi Shimon prohibits.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בְּנִדְרֵי אוֹנָסִין קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל וְרַב אַסִּי. דִּתְנַן: אַרְבָּעָה נְדָרִים הִתִּירוּ חֲכָמִים: נִדְרֵי זֵירוּזִין. נִדְרֵי הֲבַאי. נִדְרֵי שְׁגָגוֹת. נִדְרֵי אוֹנָסִין.
human_translation: And if you wish, say disagree with regard to vows circumstances beyond one’s control, and in the dispute between Shmuel and Rav Asi. As we learned The Sages dissolved four vows vows of exhortation, vows of exaggeration [ havai ], vows that are unintentional, vows circumstances beyond one’s control.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In the matter of vows of compulsion they are divided, and in the dispute of Shmuel and Rav Assi. For it was taught: The sages permitted four types of vows: vows of abstinence, vows of prohibition, vows of error, vows of compulsion.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אַרְבָּעָה נְדָרִים הַלָּלוּ, צְרִיכִין שְׁאֵלָה לַחֲכָמִים. כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר לִי: תַּנָּא קָתָנֵי ״הִתִּירוּ חֲכָמִים״, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ צְרִיכִין שְׁאֵלָה לַחֲכָמִים?!
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Rav Asi said: These four vows require a request to the halakhic authorities When I stated this before Shmuel, he said to me: The tanna teaches the Sages dissolved and you say they require a request to the halakhic authorities?
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav Assi: These four vows require consultation with the sages. For when you said it before Shmuel, he said to me: The Tanna teaches "the sages permitted," and you say they require consultation with the sages?!

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי כִּשְׁמוּאֵל. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן כְּרַב אַסִּי.
human_translation: The Rabbis hold in accordance with Shmuel, and Rabbi Shimon holds in accordance with Rav Asi
llm_translation: The sages hold like Shmuel. And Rabbi Shimon holds like Rav Assi.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר וְעָלַי לְגַלֵּחַ נָזִיר״, וְשָׁמַע חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר ״וַאֲנִי וְעָלַי לְגַלֵּחַ נָזִיר״. אִם הָיוּ פִּקְחִים — מְגַלְּחִין זֶה אֶת זֶה. וְאִם לָאו — מְגַלְּחִין נְזִירִים אֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite and it is upon me to shave a nazirite, and another heard and said: And I and it is upon me to shave a nazirite, If they were perspicacious they shave each other. And if not, they shave other nazirites,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Behold, I am a Nazirite, and it is upon me to shave the hair of a Nazirite." His friend heard and said, "And I am also upon me to shave the hair of a Nazirite." If they were wise, they may shave each other. But if not, they shave other Nazirites.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שָׁמַע חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר ״וַאֲנִי״, מַהוּ? ״וַאֲנִי״ — אַכּוּלֵּיהּ דִּיבּוּרָא מַשְׁמַע, אוֹ דִלְמָא אַפַּלְגֵיהּ דְּדִיבּוּרָא מַשְׁמַע. אִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר אַפַּלְגֵיהּ דְּדִיבּוּרָא מַשְׁמַע: אַרֵישָׁא, אוֹ אַסֵּיפָא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before another heard and said And I, what is And I, indicates of the entire statement or perhaps it indicates of half the statement If you say it indicates of half the statement, of the first clause, or the last clause,
llm_translation: Gemara: He raised a dilemma to them: If one hears his fellow say, "And I," what is the ruling? "And I" — does the eating of speech imply, or perhaps the division of speech implies. If you want to say that the division of speech implies: the first part, or the last part?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וַאֲנִי וְעָלַי לְגַלֵּחַ נָזִיר״, אִם הָיוּ פִּקְחִים מְגַלְּחִין זֶה אֶת זֶה. מִדְּקָאָמַר ״וַאֲנִי וְעָלַי״ — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ וַאֲנִי אַפַּלְגֵיהּ דְּדִיבּוּרָא אָמְרִי. אִין, אַפַּלְגֵיהּ דְּדִיבּוּרָא מַשְׁמַע, מִיהוּ: אַרֵישָׁא, אוֹ אַסֵּיפָא? מִינָּה, מִדְּקָאָמַר ״וְעָלַי לְגַלֵּחַ״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: ״וַאֲנִי״ — עַל תְּחִילַּת דִּיבּוּרָא מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: Come hear And I, and it is upon me to shave a nazirite, if they are perspicacious they shave each other. From that it says: And I, and it is upon me, learn from this And I, indicates of half the statement, say Yes, indicates of half the statement. However, to the first or to the last from itself. From that it says: And it is upon me to shave learn from this And I, indicates of the beginning of the statement
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And I am to shave the head of the Nazirite,' if they were both alert, they would shave each other. From where do we derive this? From the fact that it says 'and I' - learn from it that 'and I' means a division in speech. Is it a division in speech that is implied, or a division in the beginning or end of the statement? Learn from it, from the fact that it says 'to shave,' learn from it that 'and I' implies the beginning of the statement."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרָבָא: מִמַּאי דְּהָכִי? לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ ״וַאֲנִי״ — אַכּוּלֵּיהּ דְּדִיבּוּרָא, וְאִי מִשּׁוּם ״וְעָלַי״, מַאי קָאָמַר — ״וְעָלַי״ בְּהָא מִילְּתָא. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא ״הֲרֵי עָלַי לְגַלֵּחַ חֲצִי נָזִיר״ וְשָׁמַע חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר ״וַאֲנִי עָלַי לְגַלֵּחַ חֲצִי נָזִיר״, הָתָם מִי אִיכָּא תַּרְתֵּין מִילֵּי? אֶלָּא, מַאי קָאָמַר: ״עָלַי״ בְּהָא מִילְּתָא, הָכָא נָמֵי, כִּי קָאָמַר ״עָלַי״ — בְּהָא מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rava: From where that is so Actually, I will say to you And I, to the entire statement, and if because And it is upon me, what he is saying And it is on me this matter. As, if you do not say so, that which is taught in the last clause, It is upon me to shave half a nazirite, and another heard and said: And I, it is upon me to shave half a nazirite, there, are there two statements? Rather, what is he saying It is upon me? to that matter; here too, when he says: And it is upon me, to that matter.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said to Rava: From where do you know this? Always say to yourself, "And I" — the words of speech consume it, and if not for "and upon me," what is it saying — "and upon me" in this matter. For if you do not say this, as it is taught in the latter clause, "Behold, upon me to shave half a Nazirite," and his friend heard and said, "And I upon me to shave half a Nazirite," there, are there not two matters? Rather, what is it saying: "Upon me" in this matter, here too, when it says "upon me" — in this matter.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא רֵישָׁא צְרִיכָא סֵיפָא לָא צְרִיכָא — תָּנֵי סֵיפָא דְּלָא צְרִיכָא מִשּׁוּם רֵישָׁא דִּצְרִיכָא. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא לָא צְרִיכָא סֵיפָא לָא צְרִיכָא, תָּנֵי רֵישָׁא דְּלָא צְרִיכָא וְתָנֵי סֵיפָא דְּלָא צְרִיכָא?!
human_translation: Rava said to him: How can be compared? Granted, if you say the first clause is necessary the latter clause is not necessary he taught the unnecessary latter clause due to the necessary first clause, But if you say is not necessary the first clause not necessary the latter clause, teach an unnecessary first clause and teach an unnecessary latter clause?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Is this so?! If you say the beginning is necessary, the end is not necessary - teach the end that is not necessary because of the beginning that is necessary. Rather, if you say the beginning is not necessary, the end is not necessary - teach the beginning that is not necessary and teach the end that is not necessary?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Yosef said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who says to his agent:
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak bar Yosef said Rabbi Yochanan: One who says to his messenger

hebrew_text: ״צֵא וְקַדֵּשׁ לִי אִשָּׁה״ סְתָם — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַנָּשִׁים שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם. חֲזָקָה שָׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ, וְכֵיוָן דְּלָא פָּרֵישׁ לֵיהּ, הָא לָא יָדַע הֵי נִיהוּ קַדֵּישׁ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Go out and betroth a woman for me, without specifying forbidden to all the women in the world presumption an agent performs his agency and since did not clarify to him he does not know which is the one betrothed to him.
llm_translation: "Go and sanctify for me a woman" - a general statement - forbidden with all women in the world. It is a strong presumption that a messenger can fulfill his mission, and since he did not separate from her, if he did not know, let him sanctify her.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: קֵן סְתוּמָה שֶׁפָּרְחָה גּוֹזָל אֶחָד מֵהֶן לַאֲוִיר הָעוֹלָם, אוֹ שֶׁפָּרְחָה לְבֵין חַטָּאוֹת הַמֵּתוֹת, אוֹ שֶׁמֵּת אֶחָד מֵהֶן — יִקַּח זוּג לַשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan an unspecified nest, one fledgling of the flew away to the air of the world, or flew among sin-offerings that die, or if one of them died, purchases a partner for the second,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: If a nest that has been sealed produced one fledgling that flew away into the air of the world, or if it produced one between the dead sins, or if one of them died - he should take a pair for the second.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ קֵן מְפוֹרֶשֶׁת — אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה.
human_translation: But a specified nest, it has no remedy.
llm_translation: And if it is a clearly designated nest - it has no acquisition.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ שְׁאָר קִינִּין בְּעָלְמָא מִיתַּקְּנָן. וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא כׇּל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא דִּלְמָא הַאי נִיהוּ!
human_translation: But generally, other nests fit; then why Let us say each and every perhaps this is the one
llm_translation: And if other lamentations in general they recite. And why? Say, each and every one perhaps this is it!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קָאָמֵינָא אֲנָא אִשָּׁה דְּלָא נָיְידָא, וְאָמְרַתְּ לִי אַתְּ אִיסּוּרָא דְּנָיֵיד?
human_translation: said to I state a woman, who does not move And you speak to me a prohibition that moves
llm_translation: He said to him: I am saying, I am a woman who is not a nidah, and you are telling me the prohibition of nidah?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכָא נָמֵי נָיֵיד, אֵימוֹר בְּשׁוּקָא אַשְׁכַּח וְקַדֵּישׁ, הָתָם הָדְרָא לְנִיחוּתָא, גַּבֵּי קֵן מִי הָדְרָא?
human_translation: And if you would say: Here too, moves, say that found in the marketplace and betrothed her there returns to her rest, with regard to a nest, does return
llm_translation: And if you will say: Here it is different, for in the market one finds a coin and sanctifies it, there it is fitting for placement, but regarding a nest, who will find it fitting?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּאִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ לֹא בַּת, וְלֹא בַּת בַּת, וְלֹא בַּת בֵּן, וְלֹא אֵם, וְלֹא אֵם אֵם, וְלֹא אָחוֹת. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהָיְתָה לָהּ אָחוֹת וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה לְאַחַר מִכָּאן, דְּהָהִיא שַׁרְיָא.
human_translation: Rava said: And Rabbi Yoḥanan concedes a woman who does not have a daughter, nor a daughter of a daughter, nor a daughter of a son, nor a mother, nor a mother of a mother, nor a sister And even though she had, sister, and she was later divorced, that this permitted.
llm_translation: Rava said: And Rabbi Yochanan concedes regarding a woman who has neither a daughter, nor a granddaughter, nor a granddaughter's daughter, nor a son, nor a mother, nor a mother's mother, nor a sister. And even though she had a sister and was subsequently divorced, that hairnet is permitted.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא — דִּבְהָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא דְּקָא אָמַר לֵיהּ, הֲוָה נְסִיבָן לְגַבְרֵי. כִּי מְשַׁוֵּי שָׁלִיחַ — בְּמִילְּתָא דְּקָיְימָא קַמֵּיהּ. בְּמִילְּתָא דְּלָא קָיְימָא קַמֵּיהּ — לָא מְשַׁוֵּי שָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: What is the reason that at that moment, when he told were married to men. when one appoints an agent, with regard to a matter present before him. he does not appoint an agent with regard to a matter that is not present before him.
llm_translation: "What is the reason?" - because at that moment he said to him, 'You were married to men.' When he appoints a messenger - in a matter that stands before him. In a matter that does not stand before him - he does not appoint a messenger."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר וְעָלַי לְגַלֵּחַ נָזִיר״, וְשָׁמַע חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר: ״וַאֲנִי, וְעָלַי לְגַלֵּחַ נָזִיר״, אִם הָיוּ פִּקְחִין — מְגַלְּחִין זֶה אֶת זֶה, וְאִם לָאו — מְגַלְּחִין נְזִירִים אֲחֵרִים. בִּשְׁלָמָא בָּתְרָאָה — אִיכָּא קַדְמָאָה קַמֵּיהּ. אֶלָּא קַדְמָאָה — מִי אִיכָּא בָּתְרָאָה קַמֵּיהּ?
human_translation: We learned I am hereby a nazirite and it is upon me to shave a nazirite, and another heard and said: And I and it is upon me to shave a nazirite, if they are perspicacious they shave each other; and if not, they shave other nazirites. Granted, the last has the first one before him but the first is the last one before him?
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "Behold, I am a Nazirite and upon me is to shave a Nazirite," and his friend heard and said: "And I, upon me is to shave a Nazirite." If they were wise - they shave each other, and if not - they shave other Nazirites. If it is after the latter one - there is one before it. But if it is before it - is there one after it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי מַשְׁכַּחְנָא דְּהָוֵי נָזִיר, אֲגַלְּחֵיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ דְּמִיגָּרְשָׁה, קַדֵּישׁ לִי.
human_translation: Rather, this is what he is saying: If I find who becomes a nazirite, I will shave him. Here too, this is what is saying to if you find has divorced betroth to me.
llm_translation: Rather, thus he said: If we find that he was a nazirite, we shave him. Here, similarly, thus he said to him: If you find that she is divorced, she is sanctified to me.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: לָא מְשַׁוֵּי אִינִישׁ שָׁלִיחַ אֶלָּא בְּמִילְּתָא דְּמָצֵי עָבֵיד הַשְׁתָּא, בְּמִילְּתָא דְּלָא מָצֵי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ הַשְׁתָּא — לָא מְשַׁוֵּי.
human_translation: say A person appoints an agent only for a matter that he can perform now, but for a matter that he cannot perform now, he does not appoint
llm_translation: They said: A person does not appoint a messenger except for a matter that he could do now, for a matter that he cannot do now, he does not appoint him now - he does not appoint.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? תָּא שְׁמַע, הָאוֹמֵר לְאַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס שֶׁלּוֹ: ״כׇּל נְדָרִים שֶׁתִּדּוֹר אִשְׁתִּי מִכָּאן עַד שֶׁאָבוֹא מִמָּקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי — הָפֵר לָהּ״, וְהֵפֵר לָהּ, יָכוֹל יְהוּ מוּפָרִין — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישָׁהּ יְקִימֶנּוּ וְאִישָׁהּ יְפֵרֶנּוּ״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה. וְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר: מָצִינוּ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁשְּׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: And not Come hear One who says to the steward [ apotropos ] of his All vows that my wife will vow from now until I come from such and such a place, nullify for her, and nullified for her, might they are nullified. the verse states: “Her husband sustains and her husband nullifies the statement of Rabbi Yoshiya. And Rabbi Yonatan says: We have found in all places that a person’s agent is like himself.
llm_translation: And no? Come and hear: One who says to his apotropos: "All vows that my wife will make from now until I come from such and such a place - be annulled for her," and he annulled them for her, can they be annulled? The Talmud teaches: "Her husband can establish them and her husband can annul them," the words of Rabbi Yoshiyah. And Rabbi Yonatan says: We find in every place that a person's messenger is like himself.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״אִישָׁהּ יְקִימֶנּוּ וְאִישָׁהּ יְפֵירֶנּוּ״, הָא לָאו הָכִי — אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס מֵיפֵר. וְאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי דִידֵיהּ תַּנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשְׁתּוֹ ״כׇּל נְדָרִים שֶׁתִּדּוֹרִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שֶׁאָבֹא מִמָּקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי יְהוּ קַיָּימִין״ — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. ״הֲרֵי הֵן מוּפָרִין״, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מוּפָר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ מוּפָר.
human_translation: the reason is that the Merciful One states “Her husband sustains and her husband nullifies but if not so, steward could nullify However, with regard to himself is taught One who says to his wife: All vows that you will vow from now until I come from such and such a place shall be ratified, he has not said anything. they are hereby nullified, Rabbi Eliezer says: It is nullified, and the Rabbis say: It is not nullified.
llm_translation: Reason for which said the Merciful One "her husband shall establish it and her husband shall annul it," this is not so — Apotropos annuls. And if regarding his own matters it was taught: one who says to his wife "all vows that you may make from now until I come from a certain place are valid" — he did not say anything. "Behold, they are annulled," Rabbi Eliezer says: annulled, and the Sages say: not annulled.

hebrew_text: קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין כִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה — אַלִּיבָּא דְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי לָא מָצֵי מֵיפֵר, וְאִי לָאו דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״אִישָׁהּ יְקִימֶנּוּ וְאִישָׁהּ יְפֵירֶנּוּ״, אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס הֲוָה מֵיפַר.
human_translation: It enters our mind when Rabbi Yoshiya said in accordance with the Rabbis, who say is not able to nullify and if the Merciful One had not stated “Her husband sustains and her husband nullifies steward would nullify
llm_translation: The mind has become settled that Rabbi Yoshiyah said - according to the opinion of the sages who say it cannot be annulled, and if not for what the Merciful One said, "Her husband may establish it, or her husband may annul it," Apotropos would have annulled it.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר מָצֵי מֵיפַר! אִי הָכִי, לְמָה לִי לְשַׁוּוֹיֵי שָׁלִיחַ? לֵיפַר לַהּ אִיהוּ! קָסָבַר דִּלְמָא מִשְׁתְּלֵינָא, אוֹ רָתַחְנָא, אוֹ מִיטְּרִידְנָא.
human_translation: And perhaps in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who says can nullify If so, why do I to make him into an agent; let him nullify for her He thinks, perhaps I will forget, or become angry, or be occupied
llm_translation: Perhaps according to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer, who says it is permissible to break Shabbat! If so, why do I need to rely on a messenger? Let him break Shabbat himself! He may have thought that perhaps we will be delayed, or encounter danger, or be pursued.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵי עָלַי לְגַלֵּחַ חֲצִי נָזִיר״, וְשָׁמַע חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר ״וַאֲנִי עָלַי לְגַלֵּחַ חֲצִי נָזִיר״ — זֶה מְגַלֵּחַ נָזִיר שָׁלֵם, וְזֶה מְגַלֵּחַ נָזִיר שָׁלֵם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זֶה מְגַלֵּחַ חֲצִי נָזִיר, וְזֶה מְגַלֵּחַ חֲצִי נָזִיר.
human_translation: It is upon me to shave half a nazirite, and another heard and said: And I, it is upon me to shave half a nazirite, this shaves a whole nazirite and that shaves a whole nazirite, the statement of Rabbi Meir, And the Rabbis say: This shaves half a nazirite and that shaves half a nazirite;
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "One says, 'I am obligated to shave half of a Nazirite's head,' and his fellow heard and said, 'And I am obligated to shave half of a Nazirite's head' — this one shaves the head of a complete Nazirite, and this one shaves the head of a complete Nazirite, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. But the Sages say: this one shaves half of a Nazirite's head, and this one shaves half of a Nazirite's head."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאָמַר ״חֲצִי קׇרְבָּנוֹת נָזִיר עָלַי״ — חֲצִי קׇרְבָּן מַיְיתֵי. ״קׇרְבְּנוֹת חֲצִי נָזִיר עָלַי״ — כּוּלֵּיהּ קׇרְבָּן בָּעֵי אֵיתוֹיֵי. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּהָא לָא אַשְׁכְּחַן נְזִירוּת לְפַלְגָא.
human_translation: Rava said: All concede whenever one said: Half of the offerings of a nazirite are upon me, he brings half of the offerings, The offerings of half a nazirite are upon me, he needs to bring all of the offerings What is the reason that we have not found half a naziriteship.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said: Everyone agrees, wherever it says "half of the Nazirite's sacrifices are upon me" - half a sacrifice is brought. "The sacrifices of half a Nazirite are upon me" - all of the sacrifice is required. What is the reason? - Because we do not find Naziriteship divided in half.

hebrew_text: וְכִי פְּלִיגִי, בְּלִישָּׁנָא דְמַתְנִיתִין פְּלִיגִי. רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר ״הֲרֵי עָלַי״ — אִיחַיַּיב אַכּוּלֵּיהּ קׇרְבַּן נְזִירוּת, וְכִי קָאָמַר חֲצִי נְזִירוּת — לָאו כֹּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: נֶדֶר וּפֶתַח עִמּוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: And when they disagree, in the wording of the mishna. Rabbi Meir holds once he said: It is upon me, he is obligated in all of the naziriteship offerings, and when he says: Half a naziriteship, is not in his power And the Rabbis hold it is a vow with opening.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And when they dispute, they dispute in the language of the Mishnah. Rabbi Meir holds: Since he said, 'Behold upon me,' he is obligated to bring the offering of a Nazirite. And when he says 'half of a Nazirite,' it is not like its kind. And the Rabbis hold: A vow and its opening are with him."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר לִכְשֶׁיִּהְיֶה לִי בֵּן״, וְנוֹלָד לוֹ בֵּן — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר. נוֹלַד לוֹ בַּת, טוּמְטוּם, וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — אֵינוֹ נָזִיר. אִם אָמַר ״כְּשֶׁיִּהְיֶה לִי וָלָד״ — אֲפִילּוּ נוֹלַד לוֹ בַּת, טוּמְטוּם, וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite when I will have a son, and a son was born to him, he is a nazirite. a daughter, a tumtum , or a hermaphrodite [ androginos ] is born to him, he is not a nazirite, if he says: when I will have a child, even if a daughter, a tumtum , or a hermaphrodite is born to him, he is a nazirite.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If one says, 'I am a Nazirite when I have a son,' and a son is born to him - this one is a Nazirite. If a daughter, a hermaphrodite, or an androgynous is born to him - he is not a Nazirite. If he says, 'When I have offspring' - even if a daughter, a hermaphrodite, or an androgynous is born to him - this one is a Nazirite."

hebrew_text: הִפִּילָה אִשְׁתּוֹ — אֵינוֹ נָזִיר. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יֹאמַר ״אִם הָיָה בֶּן קַיָּימָא — הֲרֵי אֲנִי נְזִיר חוֹבָה, וְאִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אֲנִי נְזִיר נְדָבָה״.
human_translation: his wife miscarried he is not a nazirite, Rabbi Shimon says: he should say If was viable I am hereby an obligatory nazirite and if not I am hereby a voluntary nazirite.
llm_translation: He caused his wife to become a nazirite — he is not a nazirite. Rabbi Shimon says: One should say, "If it was a valid vow — behold, I am a nazirite by obligation, and if not — behold, I am a nazirite by voluntary offering."

hebrew_text: חָזְרָה וְיָלְדָה — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יֹאמַר ״אִם הָרִאשׁוֹן בֶּן קַיָּימָא — הָרִאשׁוֹן חוֹבָה וְזוֹ נְדָבָה. וְאִם לָאו — הָרִאשׁוֹן נְדָבָה וְזוֹ חוֹבָה״.
human_translation: gave birth again, he is a nazirite, Rabbi Shimon says, he should say: If the first viable the first obligatory, and this voluntary; and if not the first voluntary and this obligatory.
llm_translation: She returned and gave birth - this one is a Nazirite. Rabbi Shimon says: It should be said, "If the first child is a male - the first child is an obligation and this one is a voluntary offering. And if not - the first child is a voluntary offering and this one is an obligation."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַאי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מִשּׁוּם סֵיפָא: בַּת, טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — אֵינוֹ נָזִיר. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: ״לִכְשֶׁאֶבָּנֶה״ הוּא דְּקָאָמַר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא.
human_translation: What of stating this due to the latter clause a daughter, a tumtum , or a hermaphrodite he is not a nazirite. Isn’t obvious, lest you say he meant to say: When I will be built up teaches us that not
llm_translation: Gemara: What is this case coming to teach us? Because of the latter part of the Mishnah: a daughter, a tumtum, and an androgynous — he is not a nazir. It is obvious! What might you have thought? When it says "when he builds," it is coming to teach us that it is not so.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אָמַר כְּשֶׁיִּהְיֶה לִי וָלָד כּוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא וָלָד דְּמִיחֲשַׁב בֵּינֵי אִינָשֵׁי בָּעִינַן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And if he said: When I have a child, Isn’t obvious lest you say we require a child that is considered by people, teaches us
llm_translation: "And if he said, 'When I will have a son.' Obviously! What might you have thought, that we require a son who is considered among people's eyes? It is teaching us."

hebrew_text: הִפִּילָה אִשְׁתּוֹ — אֵינוֹ נָזִיר. מַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה דִּכְרִי הוּא.
human_translation: his wife miscarried he is not a nazirite, whose is this taught? It is Rabbi Yehuda with regard to a heap
llm_translation: He caused his wife to become defiled - he is not a Nazirite. Who is the Tanna that teaches this? It is Rabbi Yehuda who is a reader of the Torah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יֹאמַר ״אִם הָיָה בֶּן קַיָּימָא — הֲרֵינִי נְזִיר חוֹבָה, וְאִם לָאו — הֲרֵינִי נְזִיר נְדָבָה״. בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא מֵרַב הוּנָא: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר לִכְשֶׁיִּהְיֶה לִי בֵּן״, וְהִפִּילָה אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְהִפְרִישׁ קׇרְבָּן, וְחָזְרָה וְיָלְדָה, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says should say: If was viable I am hereby an obligatory nazirite and if not I am hereby a voluntary nazirite. Rabbi Abba inquired of Rav Huna: I am hereby a nazirite when I will have a son, and his wife miscarried, and he separated an offering and gave birth again what is
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "He shall say, 'If he will be a son of obligation, behold I am a Nazirite by obligation, and if not, behold I am a Nazirite by vow.'" Rabbi Abba asked Rav Huna: "Behold I am a Nazirite when I will have a son," and his wife miscarried, and he separated a sacrifice, and she conceived and gave birth, what is the law?"

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן? אִי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, מַאי תִּיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ? הָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: סְפֵק נְזִירוּת לְהַחֲמִיר. וְאֶלָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: סְפֵק נְזִירוּת לְהָקֵל. מַאי: קָדוֹשׁ, אוֹ לָא קָדוֹשׁ?
human_translation: In accordance with whose If in accordance with of Rabbi Shimon, what dilemma is he raising? Didn’t Rabbi Shimon say: uncertainty naziriteship, to be stringent? Rather, in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, who said uncertainty naziriteship, to be lenient. What consecrated or not consecrated
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Alibba d'man? Iy alibba d'Rabbi Shimon, mai tibei lei? Ha amar Rabbi Shimon: safeik nezirut lehachmir. Ve'ela alibba d'Rabbi Yehuda, d'amar: safeik nezirut lehakel. Mai: kadosh, o lo kadosh?" English translation: "On whose authority? If on the authority of Rabbi Shimon, what does he require of it? For Rabbi Shimon said: In a case of doubt regarding Naziriteship, one should be stringent. But if on the authority of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: In a case of doubt regarding Naziriteship, one should be lenient. What is the ruling: holy, or not holy?"

hebrew_text: מַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ! לְגִיזָּתוֹ וְלַעֲבוֹד בּוֹ. תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: What difference is there? to its shearing and its labor. shall stand
llm_translation: What is derived from it? For its shearing and for labor with it. Let it stand.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ בֶּן רְחוּמִי מֵאַבָּיֵי: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר לִכְשֶׁיְּהֵא לִי בֵּן״, וְשָׁמַע חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר ״וְעָלַי״, מַהוּ? אַדִּיבּוּרֵיהּ מַשְׁמַע, אוֹ אַגּוּפֵיהּ מַשְׁמַע?
human_translation: ben Reḥumi inquired of Abaye: I am hereby a nazirite when I will have a son, and another heard and said: And it is upon me, what is the implication to the statement or the implication about himself,
llm_translation: Ben Rehumi asked Abaye: "I vow to be a Nazirite when I have a son." His friend heard and said, "And upon me." What is the ruling? Do we go by his words or by his actions?

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר אַגּוּפֵיהּ מַשְׁמַע, אָמַר: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר לִכְשֶׁיְּהֵא לִי בֵּן״, וְשָׁמַע חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר ״וַאֲנִי״, מַהוּ? אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ קָאָמַר, אוֹ דִילְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: רָחֵימְנָא לָךְ כְּווֹתָיךְ. אִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר, כֹּל בְּאַנְפֵּיהּ
human_translation: if you say the implication about himself, what is said: I am hereby a nazirite when I will have a son, and another heard and said: And I? he is speaking of himself, or perhaps this is what he is saying: I love you as you yourself; If you say anything in front of him
llm_translation: If you want to say "his body implies," he said: "Behold, I am a Nazirite when I have a son," and his friend heard and said, "And I." What is the ruling? Is he speaking about himself, or perhaps he is saying: "We are merciful to you like your own parents." If you want to say, "all by himself."

hebrew_text: כְּסִיפָא לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא, אָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר לִכְשֶׁיְּהֵא לִפְלוֹנִי בֵּן״, וְשָׁמַע חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר ״וַאֲנִי״, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן: שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ קָאָמַר, אוֹ דִילְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: רָחֵימְנָא לֵיהּ כְּווֹתָיךְ. תִּיבְּעֵי.
human_translation: the matter is embarrassing for him, said: I am hereby a nazirite when so-and-so will have a son, and another heard and said: And I, what is Do we say did not in front of speaks of himself Or perhaps this is what he is saying to him: I love him as you do, the dilemma remains
llm_translation: The end of the matter, he said, "Behold, I am a Nazirite when Ploni's son is." And his friend heard and said, "And I." What is the law? Do we say: "Not in his presence," he was saying to himself, or perhaps he was saying to him: "We are merciful to you as your fathers." It should be asked.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר, וְנָזִיר כְּשֶׁיִּהְיֶה לִי בֵּן״, הִתְחִיל מוֹנֶה אֶת שֶׁלּוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹלַד לוֹ בֵּן — מַשְׁלִים אֶת שֶׁלּוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מוֹנֶה אֶת שֶׁל בְּנוֹ. ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר כְּשֶׁיִּהְיֶה לִי בֵּן, וְנָזִיר״, הִתְחִיל מוֹנֶה אֶת שֶׁלּוֹ וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹלַד לוֹ בֵּן — מַנִּיחַ אֶת שֶׁלּוֹ, וּמוֹנֶה אֶת שֶׁל בְּנוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַשְׁלִים אֶת שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite and a nazirite when I will have a son, he began counting his and afterward a son was born to him, completes his and afterward he counts of his son.
