The value of peace offerings - he shall bring peace offerings, and they are eaten in one day, and they are not required to be eaten with bread.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלְּאַחַר כַּפָּרָה — סְבָרָא הוּא, שֶׁלְּאַחַר הַמִּיתָה מַאי טַעַם — דְּלָא חַזְיָא לְכַפָּרָה, שֶׁלְּאַחַר כַּפָּרָה נָמֵי — הָא לָא חַזְיָא לְכַפָּרָה.
human_translation: that is after atonement, is logical reasoning: What is the reason that is after the death not fit for atonement, that is after atonement too, it is no fit for atonement,
llm_translation: After atonement - it is a matter of opinion, after death what is the reason - because it is not seen for atonement, after atonement also - behold, it is not seen for atonement.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ לֵיכָּא? וְהָאִיכָּא: וּשְׁאָר כׇּל שַׁלְמֵי נָזִיר שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִצְוָתָן — כְּשֵׁרִים, וְלֹא עוֹלִין לַבְּעָלִים לְשׁוּם חוֹבָה, וְנֶאֱכָלִין לְיוֹם אֶחָד, וְאֵינָן טְעוּנִין לֹא לֶחֶם וְלֹא זְרוֹעַ!
human_translation: And is there nothing else? But isn’t there And all the other peace-offerings of a nazirite that were slaughtered not in accordance with their mitzva, fit but they do not count toward the owner’s obligation, And are eaten for one day, and they require neither bread nor foreleg,
llm_translation: And is there a place? And there is a place: And all the rest of the peace offerings of a Nazirite that they slaughter not according to their commandments — are valid, and do not ascend to the owners as an obligation, and are eaten in one day, and they do not require either bread or arm!

hebrew_text: כְּמִצְוָתָן קָא חָשֵׁיב, שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִצְוָתָן לָא קָא חָשֵׁיב.
human_translation: includes in accordance with their mitzva; he does not include not in accordance with their mitzva.
llm_translation: As their commandment, it is considered, not as their commandment, not considered.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ לוֹ מָעוֹת סְתוּמִים — יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה,
human_translation: he had unallocated funds, they are allocated for gift
llm_translation: If he had sealed coins - they shall fall as a donation.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דְּמֵי חַטָּאת מְעוֹרָבִין בָּהֶן? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: ״לְכׇל נִדְרֵיהֶם וּלְכׇל נִדְבוֹתָם״, הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: מוֹתַר נֶדֶר יְהֵא לִנְדָבָה.
human_translation: But the money for the sin-offering is mingled with these Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is halakha with regard to a nazirite Reish Lakish said: for any of their vows or for any of their gift offerings, the Torah states the surplus of a vow shall be for a gift offering.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And aren't the monetary values of sin-offerings mixed in with them? Rabbi Yochanan said: It is a halacha regarding a Nazirite. Reish Lakish said: 'For all their vows and for all their freewill offerings,' the Torah said: A vow may be made into a freewill offering." English translation:

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר, אַמְּטוּ לְהָכִי סְתוּמִין — אִין, מְפוֹרָשִׁין — לָא. אֶלָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ ״לְכׇל נִדְרֵיהֶם וּלְכׇל נִדְבוֹתָם״, מַאי אִירְיָא סְתוּמִין? אֲפִילּוּ מְפוֹרָשִׁין!
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said it is a halakha with regard to a nazirite, for this reason were unallocated, yes, allocated, no, However, according to Reish Lakish, “For any of their vows or for any of their gift offerings,” why specifically unallocated even allocated
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Yochanan, who said: "The halacha follows the opinion of the Nazir, when it comes to this matter - whether they are closed (i.e., unspecified) or open (i.e., specified) - no, they are not. Rather, according to Reish Lakish, 'for all their vows and all their freewill offerings,' what is the meaning of 'closed'? Even if they are specified!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְפוֹרָשִׁין לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ, כְּבָר פַּסְקַהּ תַּנָּא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״רַק קׇדָשֶׁיךָ אֲשֶׁר יִהְיוּ לְךָ וּנְדָרֶיךָ״ — בְּוַלְדֵי קָדָשִׁים וּבִתְמוּרָתָם הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: Rava said: You cannot say allocated the tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael has already ruled this “Only your sacred things that you have, and your vows” The verse is speaking of the offspring of consecrated and their substitutes,
llm_translation: Rava said: Explicitly you did not find it stated, you said, as it has already been resolved by the Mishna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "Only your holy things that are yours and your vows" — referring to consecrated animals and their substitutes the verse speaks.

hebrew_text: מָה תַּקָּנָתָן — ״תִּשָּׂא וּבָאתָ אֶל הַמָּקוֹם אֲשֶׁר יִבְחַר ה׳״. יָכוֹל יַעֲלֵם לְבֵית הַבְּחִירָה, וְיִמְנַע מֵהֶם מַיִם וּמָזוֹן בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁיָּמוּתוּ, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ עֹלֹתֶיךָ הַבָּשָׂר וְהַדָּם״.
human_translation: what is their remedy? “You shall take and go to the place that the Lord shall choose” might he must bring them up to the Temple, and withholds water and food from them so that they should die. the verse states: “And you shall sacrifice your burnt-offerings, the flesh and the blood,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What is their remedy? 'You shall offer and come to the place that the Lord will choose.' One might think that they should ascend to the chosen House and abstain from water and food so that they die. Therefore, Scripture teaches: 'And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood.'" English translation: "What is their remedy? 'You shall offer and come to the place that the Lord will choose.' One might think that they should ascend to the chosen House and abstain from water and food so that they die. Therefore, Scripture teaches: 'And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood.'"

hebrew_text: לוֹמַר לָךְ: כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁאַתָּה נוֹהֵג בָּעוֹלָה — נְהוֹג בִּתְמוּרָתָהּ, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁאַתָּה נוֹהֵג בַּשְּׁלָמִים — נְהוֹג בְּוַלְדֵיהֶם. יָכוֹל אַף וְלַד חַטָּאת וּתְמוּרַת אָשָׁם כֵּן, — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״רַק״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: to say to you: In the manner that you treat a burnt-offering you must treat its substitute, in the manner that you treat a peace-offering you must treat their offspring, might the offspring of a sin-offering and the substitute of a guilt-offering also so, the verse states: “Only” the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: To say to you: as the way you conduct yourself in the world - conduct yourself in its exchange, as the way you conduct yourself with peace offerings - conduct yourself with their offspring. One might think that the offspring of a sin offering and the exchange of a guilt offering are likewise so - the Talmud teaches: "only," the words of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״אָשָׁם הוּא״ — בַּהֲוָיָיתוֹ יְהֵא.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: not necessary, as it says: “It is a guilt-offering” It shall be in its state,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary, as he says, "It is a guilt offering" - in its existence it shall be.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי: יָכוֹל יַעֲלֵם לְבֵית הַבְּחִירָה וְיִמְנַע מֵהֶם מַיִם וּמָזוֹן בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁיָּמוּתוּ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ עֹלֹתֶיךָ״. אַמַּאי? הָא וְלַד חַטָּאת הוּא דִּגְמִירִין בָּהּ מִיתָה? אִי לָאו קְרָא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא וְלַד חַטָּאת בְּכׇל מָקוֹם,
human_translation: teaches: might one must bring them up to the Temple and withhold water and food from them so that they should die. The verse states: “And you shall sacrifice your burnt-offerings.” Why it is the offspring of a sin-offering that we learned die, If not verse, I would say the offspring of a sin-offering anywhere,
llm_translation: It was taught: Can one bring them (the children) to the House of Selection and withhold water and food from them so that they die? — The Torah says: "And you shall make your burnt offerings." Why? Is it not a sin-offering child that we learn from it (the verse) that death (penalty) applies? If not for the verse, I would have said that a sin-offering child is (liable to death) everywhere.

hebrew_text: וּוַלְדֵי קָדָשִׁים בְּבֵית הַבְּחִירָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא.
human_translation: but the offspring of sacred to the Temple teaches us that not
llm_translation: Offspring of consecrated animals in the Temple courtyard, it is heard to us that they are not.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי: יָכוֹל אַף וְלַד חַטָּאת וּתְמוּרַת אָשָׁם כֵּן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״רַק״. לְמָה לִי קְרָא? הִילְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ: וְלַד חַטָּאת לְמִיתָה אָזֵיל! הָכִי נָמֵי, וּקְרָא לְאָשָׁם הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: teaches: might the offspring of a sin-offering and the substitute of a guilt-offering also so, the verse states: “Only” Why do I a verse this halakha is learned the offspring of a sin-offering goes to death. So too, and the verse comes to a guilt-offering
llm_translation: The text states: It was taught in a Baraita: One might have thought that the offspring of a sin-offering and the substitute of a guilt-offering are also subject to the law of "only" - Scripture therefore states: "only." Why do I need the verse? The halakha is derived from it: The offspring of a sin-offering goes to death! This is indeed so, and the verse comes for the guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: אָשָׁם נָמֵי הִילְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לָהּ: כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ בְּחַטָּאת מֵתָה, בְּאָשָׁם רוֹעֶה!
human_translation: a guilt-offering as well, this halakha is learned Any that if it were with a sin-offering die, it with a guilt-offering it graze
llm_translation: Guilt-offering, a matter of tradition learned for her: everything that if in sin-offering would die, in guilt-offering it grazes!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אִי מֵהִילְכְתָא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הִילְכְתָא, וְאִי אַקְרְיבֵיהּ — לָא לִיחַיַּיב עֲלֵיהּ וְלֹא כְּלוּם, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן קְרָא דְּאִי מַקְרֵיב לֵיהּ — קָאֵים עֲלֵיהּ בַּעֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: Rather, If from the halakha I would say: the halakha but if he sacrificed it he would not be liable to any for it. The verse teaches us that if he sacrifices he transgresses a positive mitzva by it,
llm_translation: Rather: if he went, I would say: he went, and if he did not bring it close — he is not liable for it and not at all, the verse indicates to us that if one brings it close — he is liable for it through an action.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״אָשָׁם הוּא״ — בַּהֲוָיָיתוֹ יְהֵא. לְמָה לִי קְרָא? גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִין לַהּ: כׇּל שֶׁבְּחַטָּאת מֵתָה — בְּאָשָׁם רוֹעֶה!
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: not necessary, as it says: “It is a guilt-offering” It shall be in its state, Why do I a verse We learned it halakha : Any that if it were with a sin-offering die, it with a guilt-offering it graze.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary. Behold, he says, "It is a guilt offering" - in its existence it shall be. Why do I need a verse? The Gemara concludes for it: All that in a sin offering dies - in a guilt offering it grazes!

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי, וְכִי אֲתָא קְרָא — לִדְרַב. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: אָשָׁם שֶׁנִּיתַּק לִרְעִיָּיה, וּשְׁחָטוֹ לְשֵׁם עוֹלָה — כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: So too, and when the verse comes for by Rav. As Rav Huna said Rav said: a guilt-offering that was consigned to grazing, and slaughtered for the sake of a burnt-offering it is valid.
llm_translation: So it was stated: And when the verse comes — for Rav. For Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: A guilt-offering that was separated for a different purpose, and then slaughtered for the sake of a burnt-offering — it is valid.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּנִיתַּק, הָא לֹא נִיתַּק — לָא. דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״הוּא״ — בַּהֲוָיָיתוֹ יְהֵא.
human_translation: The reason that consigned if not consigned not the verse states: “It it shall be in its state,
llm_translation: Reason of being cut off, this not cut off - no. As scripture says "He" - in his existence he shall be.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר. וְתוּ לֵיכָּא? וְהָתַנְיָא: וּשְׁאָר חַיָּיבֵי קִינִּין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה,
human_translation: The Master, said It is a halakha with regard to a nazirite but is there no other But isn’t it taught And the rest of those liable to nests by Torah law,
llm_translation: Master said: It is a halakha regarding a Nazirite. And is there a contradiction? But it was taught: "And the rest of those obligated in the laws of bird offerings in the Torah,"

hebrew_text: שֶׁהִפְרִישׁוּ מָעוֹת לְקִינֵּיהֶם, רָצָה לְהָבִיא בָּהֶן חַטַּאת בְּהֵמָה — יָבִיא, עוֹלַת בְּהֵמָה — יָבִיא. מֵת וְהָיוּ לוֹ מָעוֹת סְתוּמִין — יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה!
human_translation: who separated money for their nests wishes to bring an animal sin-offering with them, he may bring an animal burnt-offering he may bring died and he had unallocated funds, will be allocated for gift
llm_translation: They set aside funds for their nests, if one wishes to bring with them a sin offering of an animal - let them bring it, a burnt offering of an animal - let them bring it. If one dies and has sealed funds - let them fall as a donation!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא נָזִיר וְחַיָּיבֵי קִינִּין דְּדָמוּ לֵיהּ, וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מֵהָא דְּתַנְיָא: מִי שֶׁהָיָה מְחוּיָּיב חַטָּאת, וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵי עָלַי עוֹלָה״, וְהִפְרִישׁ מָעוֹת וְאָמַר ״הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לְחוֹבָתִי״,
human_translation: He taught a nazirite and those obligated to nests, which is similar to to exclude that which is taught one who was obligated to a sin-offering and he said: It is upon me burnt-offering, and he separated money and said: These are hereby for my obligatory
llm_translation: We learned in a Baraita: A Nazirite and those obligated in bird offerings, their blood is poured out, and to resolve this from what was taught: One who was obligated in a sin offering, and he said: "Behold, upon me is a burnt offering," and he separated money and said, "Behold, these are for my obligation."

hebrew_text: רָצָה לְהָבִיא בָּהֶן חַטַּאת בְּהֵמָה — לֹא יָבִיא. עוֹלַת בְּהֵמָה — לֹא יָבִיא. מֵת וְהָיוּ לוֹ מָעוֹת סְתוּמִים — יֵלְכוּ לְיָם הַמֶּלַח.
human_translation: wishes to bring an animal sin-offering with it, he may not bring an animal burnt-offering, he may not bring died and had unallocated funds, take the Dead Sea.
llm_translation: He desired to bring with them a sin offering of an animal - he shall not bring. A burnt offering of an animal - he shall not bring. If one dies and has sealed coins - they shall go to the Dead Sea.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ מְפוֹרָשִׁין לָא — לָא תֵּימָא דְּאָמַר ״אֵלּוּ לְחַטָּאתִי, וְאֵלּוּ לְעוֹלָתִי, וְאֵלּוּ לִשְׁלָמַי״. אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אָמַר ״אֵלּוּ לְחַטָּאתִי וּלְעוֹלָתִי וְלִשְׁלָמַי״ — מְפוֹרָשִׁין הֵן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: That you said allocated not do not say that said: These are for my sin-offering, and these are for my burnt-offering, and these are for my peace-offering, Rather, even he said: These are for my sin-offering and for my burnt-offering and for my peace-offering, they are allocated
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: This that you said "explicitly stated" — do not say that it means he said, "These are for my sin-offering, and these are for my burnt-offering, and these are for my peace-offering." Rather, even if he said, "These are for my sin-offering, and my burnt-offering, and my peace-offering" — they are explicitly stated.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לָא תֵּימָא עַד דְּאָמַר ״אֵלּוּ לְחַטָּאתִי וּלְעוֹלָתִי וְלִשְׁלָמַי״, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אָמַר: ״אֵלּוּ לְחוֹבָתִי״ — הֲרֵי הֵן כִּמְפוֹרָשִׁין.
human_translation: And some say Rav Ashi said: Do not say only if he says: These are for my sin-offering and for my burnt-offering and for my peace-offering; rather, even if he said These are for my obligation, they are as allocated.
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Rav Ashe said: Do not say until he says "These are for my sin offering, burnt offering, and guilt offering," rather even if he says "These are for my obligation," they are considered as explicitly stated.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָא דַּאֲמַרַן מָעוֹת סְתוּמִין יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה, אִם נָפְלָה דְּמֵי חַטָּאת מִבֵּינֵיהֶן — הֲרֵי הֵן כִּמְפוֹרָשִׁין.
human_translation: Rava said: That we said, unallocated funds will be allocated for gift if the money for the sin-offering fell from is as allocated.
llm_translation: Rava said: This that we said, "Hidden coins shall fall to charity," if the atonement money for a sin-offering fell among them, behold, they are like explicitly designated ones.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: ״אֵלּוּ לְחַטָּאתִי וְהַשְּׁאָר לִשְׁאָר נְזִירוּתִי״, דְּמֵי חַטָּאת — יֵלְכוּ לְיָם הַמֶּלַח, וְהַשְּׁאָר — יָבִיא חֶצְיוֹ לְעוֹלָה וְחֶצְיוֹ לִשְׁלָמִים. וּמוֹעֲלִין בְּכוּלָּן, וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין בְּמִקְצָתָן.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with Rava: This is for my sin-offering and the rest is for the rest of my naziriteship, the money for the sin-offering taken Dead Sea, and the rest, he brings a burnt-offering with half of it, and half of it for a peace-offering. And from all of it misuse But one is not misuse of some
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rava: "These are for my sin-offering, and the rest for my Nazirite vow." The value of the sin-offering should go to the Dead Sea, and the rest should bring half for a burnt offering and half for peace offerings. They are all considered trespassers, but they are not considered trespassers in part.

hebrew_text: ״אֵלּוּ לְעוֹלָתִי וְהַשְּׁאָר לִשְׁאָר נְזִירוּתִי״, דְּמֵי עוֹלָה — יָבִיאוּ עוֹלָה, וּמוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן. וְהַשְּׁאָר יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה, וּמוֹעֲלִין בְּכוּלָּן, וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין בְּמִקְצָתָן.
human_translation: This is for my burnt-offering and the rest is for the rest of my naziriteship, the money for the burnt-offering goes for a burnt-offering, and from it misuse And the rest is allocated for gift And from all of it misuse but one is not misuse of some
llm_translation: "These are for my burnt offerings, and the rest for the remaining Nazirites," - the value of the burnt offering - they shall bring a burnt offering, and they are considered trespassers. And the rest shall be dedicated as voluntary offerings, and they are all considered trespassers, and one does not trespass with only some of them."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מָעוֹת, אֲבָל בְּהֵמָה — הֲרֵי הִיא כִּמְפוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rav said: They taught only money However, an animal it is as allocated.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: They only specified regarding coins, but with regard to an animal - it is as it is explicitly stated.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הָא דְּאָמְרִי בְּהֵמָה הֲרֵי הִיא כִּמְפוֹרֶשֶׁת, לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא תְּמִימָה, אֲבָל בַּעֲלַת מוּם — הֲרֵי הִיא כִּסְתוּמָה. אֲבָל נְסָכָא — לָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: When they say an animal it is as allocated, they taught only unblemished However, a blemished is as unallocated. However, not a bar of silver [ naskha ].
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: This that they say regarding an animal, "Behold, it is as if it is explicitly stated," they only said it regarding an unblemished one, but regarding a blemished one — behold, it is as if it is concealed. But regarding a libation — no.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ נְסָכָא, אֲבָל סְוָאר שֶׁל קוֹרוֹת — לָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי לְרַב פָּפָּא: מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן — דְּאָמְרִי: מָעוֹת, וְלֹא בְּהֵמָה וְלָא נְסָכָא, מָעוֹת וְלָא סְווֹרָא? אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: מָעוֹת וְלֹא עוֹפוֹת!
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Even a silver bar however, a pile [ sevar ] of beams not. Rav Shimi bar Ashi said to Rav Pappa: What is the reasoning of the Rabbis, who say: Money and not an animal, and not a silver bar; money and not a pile? However, if that is so, money and not birds.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Even a libation offering, but a hairbrush made of reeds - no. Rav Shimi bar Ashei said to Rav Papa: What is the reason of the Rabbis - that they say: money, and not an animal or a libation offering, money and not a hairbrush? Rather, from now on: money and not birds!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֵין הַקִּינִּין מִתְפָּרְשׁוֹת, אֶלָּא אִי בִּלְקִיחַת בְּעָלִים, אִי בַּעֲשִׂיַּית כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: And if you would say: So too, but this that Rav Ḥisda said: Nests, are allocated only by either the acquisition of the owner, or by the actions of the priest
llm_translation: And if you will say so, it is thus indeed, but this that Rav Ḥisdah said: The betrothals are not separated, rather either by the acquisition of the husband, or by the act of the priest.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? הָא מָעוֹת גְּמִירִין לָהּ!
human_translation: Why we learn this money,
llm_translation: What is the reason? This is a tradition that we have learned!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, הָא דִּתְנַן: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הֵבִיא שָׁלֹשׁ בְּהֵמוֹת וְלֹא פֵּירֵשׁ, הָרְאוּיָה לְחַטָּאת — תִּקְרַב חַטָּאת, לְעוֹלָה — תִּקְרַב עוֹלָה, לִשְׁלָמִים — תִּקְרַב שְׁלָמִים. אַמַּאי? הָא אָמְרַתְּ: בְּהֵמָה לָאו כִּמְפוֹרֶשֶׁת דָּמְיָא!
human_translation: said to him: And according to your reasoning, that which we learned Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: brought three animals and did not specify that which is fit for a sin-offering, is sacrificed as a sin-offering; for a burnt-offering, is sacrificed as a burnt-offering; for a peace-offering, is sacrificed as a peace-offering. why Didn’t you say an animal is not considered as allocated,
llm_translation: He said to him: And according to your reasoning, what we learned: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If one brought three animals and did not specify, if it is fit for a sin offering - it shall be brought as a sin offering, if for a burnt offering - it shall be brought as a burnt offering, if for peace offerings - it shall be brought as peace offerings. Why? Because you said: An animal is not like money!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָתָם: ״וְלָקַח ... וְעָשָׂה״.
human_translation: said to him: there: “And he shall take “And he shall sacrifice
llm_translation: He said to him, there: "And he shall take... and he shall do."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: אִי בִּלְקִיחַת בְּעָלִים, אִי בַּעֲשִׂיַּית כֹּהֵן. הָכָא נָמֵי,
human_translation: The Merciful One states either by the acquisition of the owner, or by the action of the priest. Here too,
llm_translation: The Merciful One said: Whether through acquisition of the owners or through the action of the priest. Here it is stated,

hebrew_text: מִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ הָדֵין דְּחַטָּאת תִּקְרַב עוֹלָה? הָכָא נְקֵבָה, הָכָא זָכָר.
human_translation: how can you say this that for the sin-offering shall be sacrificed a burnt-offering? Here, a female here, male.
llm_translation: Who found you saying the same thing, that a sin offering should be brought as a burnt offering? Here it is female, here it is male.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב הַמְנוּנָא: וּמִי אָמְרִינַן בְּהֵמָה בַּעֲלַת מוּם כִּסְתוּמָה דָּמְיָא? תָּא שְׁמַע: כֵּיצַד אָמְרוּ הָאִישׁ מְגַלֵּחַ עַל נְזִירוּת אָבִיו? בִּזְמַן שֶׁהָיָה הוּא וְאָבִיו נְזִירִים, וְהִפְרִישׁ אָבִיו מָעוֹת לִנְזִירוּתוֹ וָמֵת, וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲגַלֵּחַ עַל מְעוֹת אַבָּא״.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna raised an objection And do we say a blemished animal is considered like unallocated Come hear How, say a man shaves, for his father’s naziriteship? When he and his father were nazirites, and his father separated money for his naziriteship and died, and said: I am hereby a nazirite on the condition that I will shave, through the money father
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Did we say that an animal with a blemish is considered as if it were sealed? Come and hear: How did they say that a man shaves his father's nezirut? When he and his father were both nezirim, and his father designated money for his nezirut and then died, and he said, "Behold, I am a nezirite on the condition that I shave with the money of my father."

hebrew_text: הָיוּ לוֹ מָעוֹת סְתוּמוֹת — יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה. הָיְתָה לוֹ בְּהֵמָה מוּפְרֶשֶׁת חַטָּאת — תָּמוּת. עוֹלָה — תִּקְרַב עוֹלָה, וּשְׁלָמִים — יְקָרְבוּ שְׁלָמִים. מַאי לָאו, אֲפִילּוּ בַּעֲלַת מוּם?
human_translation: had unallocated funds, they are allocated for gift he had allocated animals, a sin-offering must die, a burnt-offering is sacrificed a burnt-offering, and a peace-offering is sacrificed a peace-offering. What, is it not even a blemished
llm_translation: If he had sealed coins - they shall fall for a donation. If he had a designated sin-offering animal - it shall die. An elevation-offering - bring an elevation-offering, and peace-offerings - bring peace-offerings. What is the reason? Even if it has a blemish?

hebrew_text: לֹא, תְּמִימָה. אֲבָל בַּעֲלַת מוּם, כִּסְתוּמָה דָּמְיָא? מַאי אִירְיָא מָעוֹת? לֵימָא: הָיְתָה לוֹ בְּהֵמָה בַּעֲלַת מוּם — יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה!
human_translation: No; an unblemished However, a blemished considered like unallocated why specifically funds? Let say had a blemished animal is allocated for gift
llm_translation: Not, complete. But, owner of blemish, concealed similar? What called money? Say: If he had a blemished animal - let them fall for donation!

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי, בַּעֲלַת מוּם לְמַאי קַדִּישָׁא — לִדְמֵי, דְּמֵי הַיְינוּ — מָעוֹת.
human_translation: So too, For what a blemished consecrated? for the value value is money.
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: "A blemished animal, for what purpose is it sanctified? — For its value, that is its value — its monetary worth."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: ״קׇרְבָּנוֹ״, בְּקׇרְבָּנוֹ הוּא יוֹצֵא, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא בְּקׇרְבַּן אָבִיו. יָכוֹל לֹא יֵצֵא בְּקׇרְבָּנוֹ שֶׁל אָבִיו שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה, אוֹ מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַקַּלָּה,
human_translation: Rava raises an objection his offering” He fulfills with his offering, but he does not fulfill with his father’s offering, might does not fulfill with an offering that his father separated from a minor for major or from a major for minor
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "His offering," he goes out with his offering, but he does not go out with his father's offering. One might have thought that he does not go out with his offering of his father, which he designated from a lenient offering to a stringent offering, or from a stringent offering to a lenient offering.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל יוֹצֵא בְּקׇרְבָּן שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ אָבִיו מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַקַּלָּה אוֹ מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״קׇרְבָּנוֹ״, ״קׇרְבָּנוֹ״. בְּקׇרְבָּנוֹ הוּא יוֹצֵא, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא בְּקׇרְבָּנוֹ שֶׁל אָבִיו.
human_translation: However, he does fulfill with an offering that his father separated from a minor for minor or from a major for major the verse states: “His offering” “His offering” he fulfills with his offering, and he does not fulfill with his father’s offering
llm_translation: Talmudic text: However, one fulfills his obligation with the offering that his father designated from the lighter animal for the lighter animal, or from the heavier animal for the heavier animal — the Talmud teaches: "his offering," "his offering." With his offering he fulfills his obligation, but he does not fulfill his obligation with his father's offering.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יֵצֵא בְּקׇרְבַּן אָבִיו בִּבְהֵמָה שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ אֲפִילּוּ מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַקַּלָּה, מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי אֵין אָדָם מְגַלֵּחַ עַל בֶּהֱמַת אָבִיו בִּנְזִירוּת, אֲבָל יוֹצֵא בְּמָעוֹת שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ אָבִיו, אֲפִילּוּ מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַקַּלָּה, אוֹ מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָדָם מְגַלֵּחַ עַל מְעוֹת אָבִיו בִּנְזִירוּת,
human_translation: might does not fulfill with his father’s offering, with an animal that separated, even from a minor for minor or from a major for major as a person cannot shave, for naziriteship with his father’s animal. However, fulfill with money that his father separated even from a major for a minor or from a minor for a major as a person can shave, with the money his father for naziriteship,
llm_translation: One might have thought that he does not fulfill his obligation with the offering of his father if it was designated from an animal, even if it was designated from a light animal for a light animal, or from a heavy animal for a heavy animal, since a person does not shave for the animals of his father in his state of nezirut. But he does fulfill his obligation with the money that his father designated, even if it was designated from a heavy animal for a light animal, or from a light animal for a heavy animal, since a person shaves for the money of his father in his state of nezirut.

hebrew_text: בִּזְמַן שֶׁהֵן סְתוּמִין וְלֹא בִּזְמַן שֶׁהֵן מְפוֹרָשִׁין — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״קׇרְבָּנוֹ״. בְּקׇרְבָּנוֹ הוּא יוֹצֵא, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא בְּקׇרְבַּן אָבִיו.
human_translation: when they are unallocated and not when they are allocated. the verse states: “His offering” He fulfills with his offering, but he does not fulfill with his father’s offering.
llm_translation: In a time when they are concealed and not in a time when they are revealed - the Talmud teaches: "his offering." With his offering he fulfills his obligation, but he does not fulfill his obligation with the offering of his father.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יֵצֵא בְּמָעוֹת שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ אֲפִילּוּ מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַקַּלָּה, מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה, אֲבָל יוֹצֵא בְּקׇרְבָּן שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ לְעַצְמוֹ מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה, מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַקַּלָּה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״קׇרְבָּנוֹ ... עַל חַטָּאתוֹ״, עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא קׇרְבָּנוֹ לְשׁוּם חֶטְאוֹ.
human_translation: might he does not fulfill with the money that separated from a minor for a minor or from a major for a major However, fulfill with the offering he separated for himself. From a minor for a major or from a major for a minor the verse states: his offering for his sin” unless his offering is for the sake of his sin,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: One might have thought that he does not fulfill his obligation with money that he designated, even if he designated from a lenient offering for a lenient offering, from a stringent offering for a stringent offering. But he does fulfill his obligation with a sacrifice that he designated for himself, even if he designated from a lenient offering for a stringent offering, from a stringent offering for a lenient offering — the verse teaches: "his offering... for his sin," until his offering is for the purpose of his sin.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יֵצֵא בִּבְהֵמָה שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ לְעַצְמוֹ מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַקַּלָּה אוֹ מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה, אֲפִילּוּ מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה אוֹ מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַקַּלָּה,
human_translation: might does not fulfill with the animal he separated for himself, from a minor for a minor or from a major for a major even from a minor for a major or from a major for a minor
llm_translation: One might have thought that one may not fulfill one's obligation with an animal that one designated for oneself from a lenient category to another lenient category, or from a stringent category to another stringent category, even from a lenient category to a stringent category or from a stringent category to a lenient category.

hebrew_text: שֶׁכֵּן אִם הִפְרִישׁ בְּהֵמָה עַל הַחֵלֶב וְהֵבִיא עַל הַדָּם, אוֹ עַל הַדָּם וְהֵבִיא עַל הַחֵלֶב — שֶׁהֲרֵי לֹא מָעַל וְלֹא כִּיפֵּר,
human_translation: that if he separated an animal for fat and he brought for blood, or for blood and brought for fat, has not misused And does not atone
llm_translation: So too, if one separated an animal for the fat and brought it upon the blood, or for the blood and brought it upon the fat - for he has not transgressed and has not atoned.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל יוֹצֵא בְּמָעוֹת שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ לְעַצְמוֹ מִן הַקַּלָּה לַקַּלָּה, וּמִן הַחֲמוּרָה לַחֲמוּרָה, מִן הַחֲמוּרָה לַקַּלָּה, וּמִן הַקַּלָּה לַחֲמוּרָה,
human_translation: However, fulfills with the money he separated for himself, from a minor to minor or from a major to major from a major to a minor one; or from a minor to a major
llm_translation: But one may go out with coins that he designated for himself from one leniency to another leniency, and from one stringency to another stringency, from a stringency to a leniency, and from a leniency to a stringency.

hebrew_text: שֶׁכֵּן אִם הִפְרִישׁ לְעַצְמוֹ מָעוֹת מִן הַחֵלֶב וְהֵבִיא עַל הַדָּם, עַל הַדָּם וְהֵבִיא עַל הַחֵלֶב, שֶׁהֲרֵי מָעַל וְכִיפֵּר —
human_translation: that if he separated money for himself for fat and he brought for blood, or for blood and brought for fat, has misused And atones
llm_translation: So too, if he separated for himself coins from the fat and brought them upon the blood, upon the blood and brought them upon the fat, for he has transgressed and atoned—

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַל חַטָּאתוֹ״ — עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא קׇרְבָּנוֹ לְשֵׁם חֶטְאוֹ.
human_translation: the verse states: “For his sin” unless his offering is for the sake of his sin,
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Upon his sin-offering" - until his offering is for the sake of his sin.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת בְּהֵמָה, מַאי לָאו אֲפִילּוּ בַּעֲלַת מוּם? לָא, תְּמִימָה.
human_translation: In any event, teaches an animal What, is it not even a blemished No; an unblemished
llm_translation: It was taught in one of the mishnayot regarding an animal, what is the reason it does not apply even to an animal with a blemish? No, it must be unblemished.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בַּעֲלַת מוּם מַאי — כִּסְתוּמָה דָּמְיָא? מַאי אִירְיָא דְּקָתָנֵי מָעוֹת שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ אָבִיו? לִיתְנֵי בַּעֲלַת מוּם! הָכִי נָמֵי, דִּלְמַאי חַזְיָא — לִדְמֵי, דְּמֵי הַיְינוּ מָעוֹת.
human_translation: However, what a blemished considered like an unallocated why specifically teach funds that his father separated? Let teach a blemished So too, that what is fit for? for value, value is money.
llm_translation: But a blemished animal, what is it considered? Is it like a sealed vessel? What is the meaning of the Mishnah that teaches about the coins that his father designated? It should have taught about a blemished animal! This is also correct, for perhaps he might see - it is considered as if it were coins.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נִזְרַק עָלֶיהָ אֶחָד מִן הַדָּמִים, אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהָפֵר. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ נִשְׁחֲטָה עָלֶיהָ אַחַת מִכׇּל הַבְּהֵמוֹת — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהָפֵר.
human_translation: the blood one of was sprinkled on her behalf, cannot nullify Rabbi Akiva says: Even he cannot nullify any one of the animals has been slaughtered on her behalf.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one drop of blood was sprinkled on it, he cannot annul it. Rabbi Akiva says: Even if one of all the animals was slaughtered on it, he cannot annul it.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּתִגְלַחַת הַטׇּהֳרָה, אֲבָל בְּתִגְלַחַת הַטּוּמְאָה — יָפֵר, שֶׁהוּא יָכוֹל לוֹמַר: אִי אֶפְשִׁי בְּאִשָּׁה מְנֻוֶּולֶת. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אַף בְּתִגְלַחַת הַטׇּהֳרָה יָפֵר, שֶׁהוּא יָכוֹל לוֹמַר: אִי אֶפְשִׁי בְּאִשָּׁה מְגַלַּחַת.
human_translation: In what is this statement, said? for shaving of ritual purity, However, for shaving of impurity, can nullify that he can say: I do not want a downcast [ menuvvelet ] wife, Rabbi Meir says: He can nullify even of shaving of purity, as he can say: I do not want a shaven wife,
llm_translation: In what matters are these words spoken? — In the shaving of purity, but in the shaving of impurity, he invalidates it, for he can say: "I am repulsed by a woman who is bald." Rabbi Meir says: Even in the shaving of purity, he invalidates it, for he can say: "I am repulsed by a woman who shaves."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאִי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, הָאָמַר: תִּגְלַחַת מְעַכֶּבֶת. וְכֵיוָן דְּלָא גִּילְּחָה — אֲסִירָה בְּחַמְרָא. וְכֵיוָן דְּאִית לַהּ נִיוּוּל — מָצֵי מֵיפַר (וּבְהָא פְּלִיגִי),
human_translation: The mishna, is not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. As, if Rabbi Eliezer, didn’t he say shaving is indispensable And since she has not shaved, she prohibited from wine. And since she becomes downcast can nullify
llm_translation: Gemara: A Tannaic teaching that does not follow the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer, for if it were in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said: "Shaving impedes," and since she did not shave, she is prohibited with wine. And since she has a remedy, she can be redeemed (and in this they disagree).

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא דִידַן סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּאִיזְדְּרִיק עֲלַהּ דָּם, לְאַלְתַּר שַׁרְיָא בְּחַמְרָא, וְהָא לֵית לַהּ נִיוּוּל. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ אִישְׁתְּחִיטַת בְּהֵמָה — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהָפֵר, מִשּׁוּם הֶפְסֵד קָדָשִׁים.
human_translation: The tanna of our holds: Once blood has been sprinkled on her behalf immediately permitted wine, and she is not downcast. And Rabbi Akiva holds: Even an animal is slaughtered can no nullify due to the loss of consecrated
llm_translation: We have learned in our Mishnah: Our sages hold the opinion that once the blood has been sprinkled, it is immediately permissible to drink wine, and there is no need for any waiting period. However, Rabbi Akiva maintains that even if one has slaughtered an animal, he cannot nullify the sanctity of the offering due to the potential loss of consecrated items.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: וְאַמַּאי? לִזְרוֹק דָּמָן שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָן, וְיַתִּיר בָּשָׂר בַּאֲכִילָה! מִי לָא תַּנְיָא: כִּבְשֵׂי עֲצֶרֶת שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָן, אוֹ שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן לִפְנֵי זְמַנָּן אוֹ לְאַחַר זְמַנָּן — הַדָּם יִזָּרֵק וְהַבָּשָׂר יֵאָכֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira objects to this: And why sprinkling their blood not for the sake and he will permit the meat be eaten, Isn’t it taught sheep Shavuot , if one slaughtered them not for the sake or slaughtered them before their time, or after their time, the blood shall be sprinkled, and the meat is eaten.
llm_translation: Rebbe Zeira objects to her: And why? To sprinkle the blood not for its intended purpose, and to permit the flesh for consumption! Who did not teach: Like the offerings of the festival that were slaughtered not for their intended purpose, or that were slaughtered before their designated time or after their designated time - the blood shall be sprinkled and the flesh shall be eaten.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיְתָה שַׁבָּת — לֹא יִזָּרֵק. וְאִם זָרַק — הוּרְצָה, לְהַקְטִיר אֵימוּרִין לָעֶרֶב!
human_translation: And if it was a Shabbat, may not be sprinkled. And if he sprinkled is accepted, to burn parts in the evening,
llm_translation: And if it was Shabbat — he shall not sprinkle. And if he sprinkled — it is acceptable, to offer the daily incense in the evening!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: אִי דִּשְׁחַט עוֹלָה אוֹ שְׁלָמִים — הָכִי נָמֵי. אֶלָּא הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁשָּׁחַט חַטָּאת בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: say If he had slaughtered burnt-offering or peace-offering, so too, However, with what are we dealing here? where he slaughtered the sin-offering first.
llm_translation: They said: If one slaughtered a burnt offering or peace offerings - so too here. Rather, here we are dealing with what, for example, he slaughtered a sin offering initially.

hebrew_text: כְּדִתְנַן: אִם גִּילַּח עַל אַחַת מִשְּׁלׇשְׁתָּן — יָצָא.
human_translation: As we learned If he shaved of one of the three he has fulfilled
llm_translation: As we have learned: If he shaved one of the three - he fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּתִגְלַחַת טׇהֳרָה. אֲבָל בְּתִגְלַחַת טוּמְאָה — יָפֵר (מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לוֹמַר: אִי אֶפְשִׁי בְּאִשָּׁה מְנֻוֶּולֶת). וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּתִגְלַחַת טׇהֳרָה — יָפֵר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לוֹמַר: אִי אֶפְשִׁי בְּאִשָּׁה מְגַלַּחַת.
human_translation: In what is this statement, said? with regard to a shaving of ritual purity; however, with regard to a shaving of impurity nullify And Rabbi Meir says: He may even nullify at shaving of purity because he can say: I do not want a shaven wife.
llm_translation: In what matters are these words spoken? — In the shaving of purity. But in the shaving of impurity — he may desist (because he can say: I am repulsed by a woman who is bald). And Rabbi Meir says: Even in the shaving of purity — he may desist, because he can say: I am repulsed by a woman who shaves.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא אָמַר לָךְ: אֶפְשָׁר בְּפֵאָה נׇכְרִית. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: בְּפֵאָה נׇכְרִית, אַיְּידֵי דְּזוּהֲמָא — לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And the first tanna said to you possible by a wig, And Rabbi Meir holds: by a wig, since dirty he is not amenable
llm_translation: The first Tanna said to you: It is possible with a foreign corner. And Rabbi Meir holds: With a foreign corner, since it is dyed - it is not pleasing to him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִישׁ מַדִּיר אֶת בְּנוֹ בְּנָזִיר, וְאֵין הָאִשָּׁה מַדֶּרֶת אֶת בְּנָהּ בְּנָזִיר. כֵּיצַד? גִּילַּח, אוֹ שֶׁגִּילְּחוּהוּ קְרוֹבָיו. מִיחָה, אוֹ שֶׁמִּיחוּ קְרוֹבָיו.
human_translation: A man can vow his son should be a nazirite, but a woman cannot vow her son should be a nazirite. How so; shaved or his relatives shaved him; objected or if his relatives objected
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A man may vow his son as a Nazirite, but a woman may not vow her son as a Nazirite. How so? If he shaved, or if his relatives shaved him. If he became defiled, or if his relatives defiled him.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה לוֹ בְּהֵמָה מוּפְרֶשֶׁת, הַחַטָּאת — תָּמוּת, וְהָעוֹלָה — תִּקְרַב עוֹלָה. וּשְׁלָמִים — יִקְרְבוּ שְׁלָמִים, וְנֶאֱכָלִין לְיוֹם אֶחָד, וְאֵינָן טְעוּנִין לֶחֶם.
human_translation: had animals separated the sin-offering must die, and the burnt-offering is sacrificed as a burnt-offering, and peace-offering is sacrificed as a peace-offering. And is eaten for one day, and it does not require bread,
llm_translation: If he had a designated animal, the sin offering - shall die, and the burnt offering - shall be brought as a burnt offering. And peace offerings - shall be brought as peace offerings, and they shall be eaten on the same day, and they are not required to be eaten as bread.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ לוֹ מָעוֹת סְתוּמִין — יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה. מָעוֹת מְפוֹרָשִׁים, דְּמֵי חַטָּאת — יֵלְכוּ לְיָם הַמֶּלַח, לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין. דְּמֵי עוֹלָה — יָבִיאוּ עוֹלָה, וּמוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן, דְּמֵי שְׁלָמִים — יָבִיאוּ שְׁלָמִים וְנֶאֱכָלִין לְיוֹם אֶחָד, וְאֵינָן טְעוּנִין לֶחֶם.
human_translation: he had unallocated funds, will be allocated for gift allocated funds the money for the sin-offering is taken into the Dead Sea, not benefit but from it, not misuse the money for burnt-offering they bring a burnt-offering; and from it, misuse the money for peace-offering they bring a peace-offering, and is eaten for one day and does not require bread.
llm_translation: If he has sealed coins - they shall fall for a donation. Explicit coins, the money of a sin-offering - shall go to the Dead Sea, they are not enjoyed and not misused. The money of a burnt offering - shall bring a burnt offering, and they are misused. The money of peace offerings - shall bring peace offerings and they are eaten in one day, and they do not require bread.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִישׁ — אִין, אֲבָל אִשָּׁה — לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא
human_translation: a man but a woman cannot What is the reason Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is a halakha with regard to a nazirite. And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina,
llm_translation: Gemara: A man - yes, but a woman - no. What is the reason? Rabbi Yochanan said: It is a halacha regarding a Nazirite. And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כְּדֵי לְחַנְּכוֹ בְּמִצְוֹת. אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ אִשָּׁה נָמֵי! סָבַר: אִישׁ חַיָּיב לְחַנֵּךְ בְּנוֹ בְּמִצְוֹת, וְאֵין הָאִשָּׁה חַיֶּיבֶת לְחַנֵּךְ אֶת בְּנָהּ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: in order to educate him in mitzvot, If so, even a woman as well holds a man is obligated to educate his son in mitzvot, but a woman is not obligated to educate her son
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: In order to educate him in commandments. If so, even a woman also! He holds: A man is obligated to educate his son in commandments, and a woman is not obligated to educate her son.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר, אַמְּטוּ לְהָכִי: בְּנוֹ — אִין, בִּתּוֹ — לָא. אֶלָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, אֲפִילּוּ בִּתּוֹ! קָסָבַר: בְּנוֹ — חַיָּיב לְחַנְּכוֹ, בִּתּוֹ — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְחַנְּכָהּ.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, said it is a halakha with regard to a nazirite, for that reason his son, yes, his daughter, no, However, according to Reish Lakish, even his daughter holds: is obligated to educate his son, he is not obligated to educate his daughter,
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Yochanan, who said: It is a halacha regarding a Nazirite, they said to him thus: His son - yes, his daughter - no. Rather, according to Reish Lakish, even his daughter! For he holds: His son - he is obligated to educate him, his daughter - he is not obligated to educate her.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר, אַהָכִי: בִּנְזִירוּת — אִין, בִּנְדָרִים — לָא. אֶלָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ — אֲפִילּוּ נְדָרִים נָמֵי!
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, said it is a halakha with regard to a nazirite, this is why with regard to naziriteship, yes, with regard to vows, no, However, according to Reish Lakish, even vows as well.
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Yochanan, who said: It is a halacha in regards to Nazirites, thus: in regards to Naziriteship — yes, in regards to vows — no. Rather, according to Reish Lakish — even in regards to vows, yes!

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא בִּנְדָרִים, דְּלֵית לֵיהּ נִיוּוּל, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ בִּנְזִירוּת, דְּאִית לֵיהּ נִיוּוּל — אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי חַיָּיב לְחַנְּכוֹ.
human_translation: is speaking It is not necessary, It is not necessary vows where there is no deprivation but even naziriteship, where there is deprivation even so is obligated to educate him,
llm_translation: He is not asking a question: He is not asking about vows, for it does not have specification, but even about Naziriteship, which has specification - even so, one is obligated to dedicate it.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי: מִיחָה אוֹ שֶׁמִּיחוּהוּ קְרוֹבָיו.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said it is a halakha with regard to a nazirite, this is that which teaches: he objected, or his relatives objected for him,
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Yochanan, who said: It is a halacha regarding a Nazir, as it is taught: "He may anoint or have his close ones anoint him."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, כׇּל כְּמִינֵיהוֹן קְרוֹבִים דְּאָמְרִין לֵיהּ: לָא תַּיגְמְרֵיהּ מִצְוֹת?! קָסָבַר: כֹּל חִינּוּךְ דְּלָא חֲשִׁיב — לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: However, according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, Reish Lakish said is this in the power of the relatives to say to Do not teach him mitzvot? holds any education not important, is not amenable
llm_translation: Rather, to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, Reish Lakish said, "All those similar to them are close, as they say to him: 'Should the commandments not be completed?!' He holds: All education that is not considered important — is not pleasing to him."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מְגַלֵּחַ וְעָבֵיד הַקָּפָה.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said it is a halakha with regard to a nazirite, due to that shave he performs the rounding
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Yochanan, who said: It is a halacha in regards to a Nazirite, therefore he shaves and performs the atonement.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ כְּדֵי לְחַנְּכוֹ בְּמִצְוֹת, הָא קָעָבֵיד הַקָּפָה!
human_translation: However, according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, Reish Lakish said in order to educate him in mitzvot, performs the rounding
llm_translation: Rather, to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, Reish Lakish said: "In order to train him in the commandments, behold, he roasted the locust!"

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר: הַקָּפַת כׇּל הָרֹאשׁ מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וְחִינּוּךְ מִדְּרַבָּנַן. וְאָתֵי חִינּוּךְ דְּרַבָּנַן, וְדָחֵי הַקָּפָה דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: holds the rounding of the entire head by rabbinic law, and the mitzva of education by rabbinic law. And education, by rabbinic law, comes and overrides rounding by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: He holds: the shaving of the entire head is from the Rabbis, and the education is from the Rabbis. And comes the education of the Rabbis, and pushes away the shaving of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר, אַהָכִי מְגַלֵּחַ מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said it is a halakha with regard to a nazirite, this is why shaves he brings an offering,
llm_translation: In peace to Rabbi Yochanan, who said: It is a halacha regarding a Nazir, so when he shaves, he brings a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, כְּדֵי לְחַנְּכוֹ בְּמִצְוֹת — הָא קָא מַיְיתֵי חוּלִּין לָעֲזָרָה! קָסָבַר: חוּלִּין בַּעֲזָרָה לָאו דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: However, according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, Reish Lakish said in order to educate him in mitzvot, that he brings non-sacred into the Temple courtyard holds non-sacred in the Temple courtyard not by Torah law
llm_translation: Rather, to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, Reish Lakish said, in order to inaugurate him with commandments — behold, he brings secular items into the Temple courtyard! He holds: Secular items in the Temple courtyard are not of biblical origin.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר, אַהָכִי כִּי מִיטַּמֵּא מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבַּן צִיפֳּרִין, וְאָכֵיל כֹּהֵן מְלִיקָה.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said it is a halakha with regard to a nazirite, this is why when becomes ritually impure he brings an offering of birds, and priest eat pinching,
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Yochanan, who said: It is a halacha in regard to a Nazir, so when he becomes defiled, he shall bring a sin offering, and a priest shall perform the offering.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, הָא קָאָכֵיל נְבֵילָה!
human_translation: However, according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, Reish Lakish said eats animal carcass.
llm_translation: Rather, to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, Reish Lakish said, "He is eating neveilah!"

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאֵין שְׁחִיטָה לָעוֹף מִן הַתּוֹרָה. וְחוּלִּין בַּעֲזָרָה לָאו דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, that slaughter of a bird is not by Torah law. And non-sacred in the Temple courtyard not by Torah law.
llm_translation: He holds like Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, that ritual slaughter for birds is not from the Torah. And mundane animals in the Temple courtyard are not of biblical origin.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הָכִי? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לְחַטַּאת הָעוֹף שֶׁהִיא בָּאָה עַל הַסָּפֵק שֶׁאֵינָהּ נֶאֱכֶלֶת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהַזָּב אֶת זוֹבוֹ לַזָּכָר וְלַנְּקֵבָה״, מַקִּישׁ נְקֵבָה לְזָכָר: מָה זָכָר מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל הַוַּדַּאי — אַף נְקֵבָה מְבִיאָה קׇרְבָּן עַל הַוַּדַּאי, וּמָה זָכָר מֵבִיא עַל הַסָּפֵק — אַף נְקֵבָה מְבִיאָה עַל הַסָּפֵק.
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yosei hold this But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: From where that the bird sin-offering that comes due to uncertainty is not eaten? The verse states: “And they who have an issue, whether a male or a female” juxtaposes a female to a male: Just as a male brings an offering for a definite so too, a female brings an offering for a definite And just as a male brings for uncertain so too, a female brings for uncertainty.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yosei thought so? And it was taught, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: From where do we derive the sin-offering of a bird that comes for a doubt that it is not eaten? The verse teaches: "And he shall offer it, the male and the female," equating the female to the male: Just as a male brings a definite offering — so too, a female brings a definite offering, and just as a male brings an offering for a doubt — so too, a female brings an offering for a doubt.

hebrew_text: וּמָה זָכָר, מִמִּין שֶׁהוּא מֵבִיא עַל הַוַּדַּאי מֵבִיא עַל הַסָּפֵק — אַף נְקֵבָה מִמִּין שֶׁהִיא מְבִיאָה עַל הַוַּדַּאי מְבִיאָה עַל הַסָּפֵק. אִי: מָה זָכָר מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן וְנֶאֱכָל — אַף נְקֵבָה מְבִיאָה קׇרְבָּן וְנֶאֱכָל! אָמַרְתָּ:
human_translation: And Just as a male brings for uncertain from type from he brings a definite so too, a female brings for her uncertainty from type from she brings for a definite If Just as a male brings an offering and is eaten, so too, a female brings an offering and eaten you say:
llm_translation: "And what is the male? From a species that when it brings definitely, it brings; from a species that when it brings doubtfully, it brings. So too, the female, from a species that when it brings definitely, it brings; from a species that when it brings doubtfully, it brings. If: What is the male brings an offering and it is eaten — so too the female brings an offering and it is eaten! You said:"

hebrew_text: לֹא, אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּזָכָר — שֶׁכֵּן אִיסּוּר אֶחָד, תֹּאמַר בִּנְקֵבָה — שֶׁשְּׁנֵי אִיסּוּרִין.
human_translation: No, if you say with regard to a male, when one prohibition, shall you say with regard to a female, whose two prohibitions?
llm_translation: Not, if you said in male — so one prohibition, say in female — two prohibitions.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנֵי אִיסּוּרִין? לָאו אִיסּוּר נְבֵילָה וְחוּלִּין בַּעֲזָרָה? מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: וְדִילְמָא מִיחַיַּיב עֲלֵיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִיתְחֲזֵי כִּתְרֵין אִיסּוּרִין מִדְּרַבָּנַן!
human_translation: What two prohibitions? not the prohibition animal carcass and non-sacred into the courtyard? Rav Aḥa, son Rav Ika, objects to this: And perhaps is liable for this because it appears like two prohibitions, by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: What is the difference between two prohibitions? Is it not that the prohibition of neveilah and hullin in the Temple courtyard? Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, objects: Perhaps one would be liable for it, because it appears like two prohibitions of Rabbinic origin!

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: עַד מָתַי מַדִּיר אֶת בְּנוֹ בְּנָזִיר — עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ לְעוֹנַת נְדָרִים.
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im . Until when can vow his son be a nazirite? until develops two hairs; the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: until he reaches the age of vows,
llm_translation: Let us say according to the Tannaim: Until when does one vow his son as a Nazirite? Until he brings two hairs, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Until he reaches the age of vows.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו תַּנָּאֵי הִיא? דְּרַבִּי סָבַר הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּהִגִּיעַ לְעוֹנַת נְדָרִים, מַדִּיר לֵיהּ וְאָזֵיל עַד דְּמַיְיתֵי שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ לְעוֹנַת נְדָרִים, סָבַר כְּדֵי לְחַנְּכוֹ בְּמִצְוֹת, וְכֵיוָן דְּנָפֵיק מֵרְשׁוּתֵיהּ — תּוּ לָא מִיחַיַּיב?
human_translation: What, is it not is tanna’im : As Rabbi holds it is a halakha with regard to a nazirite, and even though reached the age of vows continues to vow for him until he develops two hairs, And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, who says until he reaches the age of vows, holds in order to educate him in mitzvot, and since has left supervision is no longer obligated
llm_translation: What is the reason that it is not taught? For Rabbi holds that it is a halacha in regards to a Nazirite, and even though he has reached the time of vows, he makes it a dwelling for him until he grows two hairs. And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: Until he reaches the time of vows, he holds that it is in order to train him in commandments, and once he departs from his domain - is he not liable?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: לָא. דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר, וְהָכָא בְּ״מוּפְלָא הַסָּמוּךְ לְאִישׁ״ קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: say No; that everyone, it is a halakha with regard to a nazirite, and here they disagree with regard to a minor one year before reaches majority.
llm_translation: They said: No. For the general rule is that the law regarding a Nazirite is lenient, but here, in a case of "an extraordinary occurrence adjacent to a person," they disagree.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי סָבַר: מוּפְלָא הַסָּמוּךְ לְאִישׁ — דְּרַבָּנַן, וְאָתְיָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא דָּחֲיָא דְּרַבָּנַן. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: מוּפְלָא הַסָּמוּךְ לְאִישׁ — דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Rabbi holds a minor one year before reaches majority by rabbinic law, and by Torah law comes and overrides by rabbinic law. And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds a minor one year before reaches majority by Torah law.
llm_translation: Rabbi Savar: A wonder the one adjacent to a man - of the Rabbis, and it comes from the Torah that supports the Rabbis. And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds: A wonder the one adjacent to a man - from the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא כְּדֵי לְחַנְּכוֹ בְּמִצְוֹת, וּמוּפְלָא הַסָּמוּךְ לְאִישׁ — דְּרַבָּנַן הִיא. רַבִּי סָבַר: אָתֵי חִינּוּךְ דְּרַבָּנַן וְדָחֵי מוּפְלָא הַסָּמוּךְ לְאִישׁ דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone in order to educate him in mitzvot, and a minor one year before reaches majority is by rabbinic law. Rabbi holds education, by rabbinic law, comes and overrides a minor one year before reaches majority, by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: that the whole world is like to prepare him in commandments, and wondrous is the one close to a man — it is of the Rabbis. Rabbi holds: the education of the Rabbis comes and pushes aside the wondrous one close to a man of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ לְעוֹנַת נְדָרִים, קָסָבַר: לָא אָתֵי חִינּוּךְ דְּרַבָּנַן וְדָחֵי מוּפְלָא הַסָּמוּךְ לְאִישׁ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, who said until he reaches the age of vows, holds education by rabbinic law does not come and override a minor one year before reaches majority.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda said: Until he reaches the time of vows, he holds that the training of the Rabbis does not come and pushes off a wonder close to a person.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי כִּי הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא שֶׁהִדִּירוֹ אָבִיו בְּנָזִיר, וֶהֱבִיאוֹ לִפְנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. וְהָיָה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בּוֹדְקוֹ לֵידַע אִם הֵבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, אִם לֹא הֵבִיא.
human_translation: Shall we say these tanna’im is like those tanna’im , as it is taught An incident involving Rabbi Ḥanina which his father vowed be a nazirite and they brought him before Rabban Gamliel, and Rabban Gamliel examined him to discern if he had developed two hairs, if he had not developed
llm_translation: Let us say, these Tannaim, like these Tannaim, as it was taught: There was an incident with Rabbi Chanina, whose father had made him a Nazirite, and they brought him before Rabban Gamliel. And Rabban Gamliel would examine him to know if he brought two hairs or not.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לֵידַע אִם הִגִּיעַ לְעוֹנַת נְדָרִים, אִם לָאו. אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, אַל תִּצְטַעֵר לְבוֹדְקֵנִי, אִם קָטָן אֲנִי — אֶהְיֶה בִּשְׁבִיל אַבָּא, אִם גָּדוֹל אֲנִי — אֶהְיֶה בִּשְׁבִיל עַצְמִי. עָמַד רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וּנְשָׁקוֹ עַל רֹאשׁוֹ, אָמַר: מוּבְטָח אֲנִי בָּזֶה שֶׁמּוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. אָמְרוּ: לֹא הָיוּ יָמִים מוּעָטִים עַד שֶׁהוֹרָה הוֹרָאָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says to discern whether he had reached the age of vows or not, said to My teacher, do not go to the trouble of examining me, if I am a minor I shall be due to father’s if I am an adult, I shall be due to my own Rabban Gamliel arose and kissed on his head. He said: I am certain of this that an authority of halakha for the Jewish people. They said: it was only a few years that issued rulings for the Jewish people.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: To know if the time of vows has arrived, or not. He said to him: Rabbi, do not be distressed to examine me, if I am young - I will be for the sake of my father, if I am old - I will be for my own sake. Rabban Gamliel stood up and kissed him on his head, and said: I am confident in this one that he teaches the halakha in Israel. They said: There were not many days until he was teaching halakha in Israel.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ לְעוֹנַת נְדָרִים, הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר ״אִם קָטָן אֲנִי אֶהְיֶה בִּשְׁבִיל אַבָּא״. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי, דְּאָמַר: עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת — ״וְאִם גָּדוֹל אֲנִי אֶהְיֶה בִּשְׁבִיל עַצְמִי״,
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, who said until he reaches the age of vows, this is said: If I am a minor I shall be due to father, However, according to Rabbi who said until he develops two hairs, And if I am an adult, I shall be due to my own vow?
llm_translation: In truth, regarding Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: Until the time of vows arrives, that is what he meant by saying, "If I am a minor, it is for the sake of my father." But regarding Rabbi, who said: Until he brings two hairs - "And if I am an adult, it is for my own sake."

hebrew_text: הָא בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ דַּאֲבוּהּ קָאֵים! אֶלָּא דְּאָמַר: אֱהֵא בִּשְׁבִיל אַבָּא, אֱהֵא בִּשְׁבִיל עַצְמִי.
human_translation: remains under his father’s authority Rather, that he said I shall be due to father; I shall be due to my own
llm_translation: Here in the domain of his father he stands! Rather, he said: Be here for the sake of father, be here for the sake of myself.

hebrew_text: אִי אַיְיתִי שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת מֵעִיקָּרָא — קָאֵים בִּנְזִירוּת דִּילֵיהּ, וּלְבַסּוֹף — קָאֵים בִּנְזִירוּת דַּאֲבוּהּ. וְאִי אַיְיתִי בְּמִצְעֵי מַאי?
human_translation: if he had developed two hairs from the outset, stand by his own naziriteship, and at the end, stand by his father’s naziriteship. But if he developed in the middle what
llm_translation: If one brings two hairs from the root - he stands in the nazirite status of his own accord, and ultimately - he stands in the nazirite status of his father's accord. And if he brings them in the middle, what is the law?

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר: עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ לְעוֹנַת נְדָרִים.
human_translation: This works out well according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, who said until he reaches the age of vows.
llm_translation: He left it for Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: "Until the time of the vows."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי דְּאָמַר: עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אָמְרִי: לְרַבִּי לֵיכָּא תַּקַּנְתָּא עַד דְּיָתֵיב דִּילֵיהּ וְיָתֵיב דַּאֲבוּהִי.
human_translation: However, according to Rabbi who said until he develops two hairs, what can be said? say to Rabbi has no rectification until he sits for his and sits for of his father,
llm_translation: Rather, to Rabbi who said: Until he brings two hairs, what is there to say? They said: To Rabbi, there is no remedy until his beard grows and his father's beard.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִישׁ מְגַלֵּחַ עַל נְזִירוּת אָבִיו, וְאֵין הָאִשָּׁה מְגַלַּחַת עַל נְזִירוּת אָבִיהָ. כֵּיצַד? מִי שֶׁהָיָה אָבִיו נָזִיר, וְהִפְרִישׁ מָעוֹת סְתוּמִים עַל נְזִירוּתוֹ וָמֵת, וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲגַלֵּחַ עַל מְעוֹת אַבָּא״.
human_translation: A man can shave, by his father’s naziriteship, but a woman cannot shave by her father’s naziriteship. How so; one whose father was a nazirite and separated unallocated money for his naziriteship, and he died and said I am hereby a nazirite on the condition that I will shave by the money father
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A man shaves the hair of his father's Nazirite vow, but a woman does not shave the hair of her father's Nazirite vow. How so? If his father was a Nazirite, and he designated sealed coins for his Nazirite vow and then died, and he said, "Behold, I am a Nazirite on the condition that I shave the hair of my father's coins."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה, אֵין זֶה מְגַלֵּחַ עַל נְזִירוּת אָבִיו. אֵיזֶהוּ שֶׁמְּגַלֵּח עַל נְזִירוּת אָבִיו? מִי שֶׁהָיָה הוּא וְאָבִיו נְזִירִים, וְהִפְרִישׁ אָבִיו מָעוֹת סְתוּמִים לִנְזִירוּתוֹ וָמֵת — זֶה הוּא שֶׁמְּגַלֵּחַ עַל נְזִירוּת אָבִיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: these allocated for gift this is not can shave by his father’s naziriteship. who is who can shave by his father’s naziriteship? and his father who were nazirites and his father separated unallocated money for his naziriteship and died; this is the one who may shave by his father’s naziriteship.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: "These may be offered as voluntary offerings; this is not considered shaving the consecrated hair of his father's Naziriteship. Who is considered to be shaving the consecrated hair of his father's Naziriteship? One whose father and he were both Nazirites, and his father had set aside sealed coins for his own Naziriteship and then died - this is the one who shaves the consecrated hair of his father's Naziriteship."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַאי לְמֵימְרָא: דְּבֵן יוֹרֵשׁ אֶת אָבִיו, בַּת לָא?
human_translation: What is the reason Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is a halakha with regard to a nazirite. obvious What of stating that a son inherits his father a daughter not,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? Rabbi Yochanan said: It is a halacha regarding a Nazirite. It is obvious! What is there to say: that a son inherits his father, but a daughter does not?

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אֶלָּא בַּת. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: יוֹרְשִׁין גְּמִירִין לָהּ,
human_translation: No, necessary when he has only a daughter, Lest you say we learned heirs,
llm_translation: Not necessary, for it has only a daughter. What might you say? Inheritors are learned for her.

hebrew_text: קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן הֲלָכָה.
human_translation: teaches us a halakha
llm_translation: We have heard a tradition regarding Jewish law.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אוֹ לָא פְּלִיגִי? וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר פְּלִיגִי, אַרֵישָׁא אוֹ אַסֵּיפָא? תָּא שְׁמַע: כֵּיצַד אָמְרוּ הָאִישׁ מְגַלֵּחַ עַל נְזִירוּת אָבִיו?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Yosei, or do not disagree? If you say disagree, with the first clause or with the latter clause Come hear How did say a man can shave by his father’s naziriteship?
llm_translation: The scholars raised a question: Do the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Yosei, or do they not disagree? And if you want to say they disagree, is it in the first part or the latter part? Come and hear: How did they say, "The man shaves his father's Naziriteship?"

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁהָיָה אָבִיו נָזִיר, וְהִפְרִישׁ אָבִיו מָעוֹת לִנְזִירוּתוֹ וָמֵת, וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲגַלֵּחַ עַל מְעוֹת אַבָּא״ — זֶהוּ שֶׁמְּגַלֵּחַ עַל מְעוֹת אָבִיו. אֲבָל מִי שֶׁהָיָה הוּא וְאָבִיו נְזִירִים, וְהִפְרִישׁ אָבִיו מָעוֹת לִנְזִירוּתוֹ וָמֵת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: one whose father was a nazirite and his father separated money for his naziriteship and died, and said: I am hereby a nazirite on the condition that I can shave by father’s money, this is the one who can shave by his father’s money. However, and his father were nazirites, and his father separated money for his naziriteship and died, this allocated for gift the statement of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: One whose father was a Nazirite, and his father designated money for his Nazirite vow and then died, and he said: "Behold, I am a Nazirite on the condition that I shave for the money of my father" - this is one who shaves for the money of his father. But if he and his father were both Nazirites, and his father designated money for his Nazirite vow and then died - these shall fall as voluntary offerings, the words of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָמְרוּ: זֶה הוּא שֶׁמְּגַלֵּחַ עַל מְעוֹת אָבִיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, and Rabbi Meir, and Rabbi Yehuda said: This is the one who can shave by his father’s money.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda said: This is one who shaves the corners of his father's head.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבָּה: יֵשׁ לוֹ שְׁנֵי בָנִים נְזִירִים, מַהוּ? הִילְכְתָא גְּמִירִין לַהּ: כֹּל דִּקְדֵים גַּלַּח — גַּלַּח, אוֹ דִילְמָא: יְרוּשָּׁה גְּמִירִין לַהּ, וּפַלְגָא הָוֵי?
human_translation: Rabba raised a dilemma: has two nazirite sons, what is we learned it a halakha any who precedes and shaves shaved Or perhaps we learned inheritance, and a half?
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ravva: Yesh lo shnei banim nezirim, mahu? Hilchata gemirin la: kol dikdeim galach - galach, o dilma: yerusha gemirin la, u'falga havei?

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: בְּכוֹר וּפָשׁוּט, מַאי? הִילְכְתָא גְּמִירִין לַהּ, וְהִילְכָּךְ לָא בָּעֵי גַּלּוֹחֵי לְפוּם מַאי דְּשָׁקֵיל. אוֹ דִילְמָא: יְרוּשָּׁה הִיא, וְכִי הֵיכִי דְּשָׁקֵיל פִּי שְׁנַיִם, הָכִי מְגַלַּח?
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma: a firstborn and a regular what is we learned it a halakha and therefore he does not need to shave in accordance with what he receives Or perhaps it is an inheritance, and just as takes a double portion so too he shaves
llm_translation: Rava asked: With regard to a firstborn and a simple case, what is the law? Is it a tradition that we have learned, and therefore we do not require a razor to the mouth? Or perhaps it is because it is an inheritance, and how can one use two mouths to shave? Is this how one shaves?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר: יְרוּשָּׁה הִיא, וּלְפוּם דְּשָׁקֵיל מְגַלַּח, וּבְחוּלִּין הוּא דְּאִית לֵיהּ פִּי שְׁנַיִם, אֲבָל בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ לָא. אוֹ דִילְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּקָנֵי לֵיהּ לְגִלּוּחַ, לָא שְׁנָא?
human_translation: And if you say it is an inheritance and he shaves in accordance with he receives, it is to non-sacred that has a double portion, but with regard to consecrated not Or perhaps, since he acquires that for shaving is no different,
llm_translation: And if you might say: it is an inheritance, and since he is balding, and in secular matters he has two mouths, but in matters of sanctity he does not. Or perhaps: since he acquires it for shaving, is it not different?

hebrew_text: אָבִיו נְזִיר עוֹלָם וְהוּא נָזִיר סְתָם, אָבִיו נָזִיר סְתָם וְהוּא נְזִיר עוֹלָם, מַאי? כִּי גְּמִירִין הִילְכְתָא, בִּסְתָם נְזִירוּת, אוֹ דִילְמָא לָא שְׁנָא?
human_translation: his father a permanent nazirite and he was an unspecified nazirite, his father was an unspecified nazirite and he was a permanent nazirite, what is when we learned the halakha in unspecified nazirites, or perhaps is no different,
llm_translation: His father was a Nazirite for life, and he is a Nazirite indefinitely. His father was a Nazirite indefinitely, and he is a Nazirite for life. What is the reason? Perhaps they learned the halakha in general terms, regarding indefinite Naziriteship, or maybe it is not different?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר: הָכָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי, נְזִירוּת טׇהֳרָה, בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: אָבִיו נָזִיר טָמֵא, וְהוּא נָזִיר טָהוֹר. אָבִיו נָזִיר טָהוֹר, וְהוּא נָזִיר טָמֵא, מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: And if you say: Here, both ritually pure naziriteship, Rav Ashi raises dilemma: his father an impure nazirite and he was a pure nazirite, his father was a pure nazirite and he was an impure nazirite, what shall stand
llm_translation: And if you will say: here it is a case of "both this and this," the purity of the Nazirite, Rav Ashi asks: his father was a Nazirite who became impure, and he is a Nazirite who is pure. His father was a Nazirite who is pure, and he is a Nazirite who is impure. What is the resolution? Let it stand undecided.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ מִי שֶׁאָמַר
llm_translation: We will return to you, saying "Who said..."

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: הֶקְדֵּשׁ טָעוּת — הֶקְדֵּשׁ,
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: Consecration error consecrated,
llm_translation: Beit Shammai say: "Hekdesh ta'ut - hekdesh."

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הֶקְדֵּשׁ. כֵּיצַד? אָמַר ״שׁוֹר שָׁחוֹר שֶׁיֵּצֵא מִבֵּיתִי רִאשׁוֹן הֲרֵי הוּא הֶקְדֵּשׁ״, וְיָצָא לָבָן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: הֶקְדֵּשׁ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ הֶקְדֵּשׁ. ״דִּינַר זָהָב שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה בְּיָדִי רִאשׁוֹן הֲרֵי הוּא הֶקְדֵּשׁ״, וְעָלָה שֶׁל כֶּסֶף, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: הֶקְדֵּשׁ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ הֶקְדֵּשׁ. ״חָבִית שֶׁל יַיִן שֶׁתַּעֲלֶה בְּיָדִי רִאשׁוֹנָה הֲרֵי הִיא הֶקְדֵּשׁ״, וְעָלְתָה שֶׁל שֶׁמֶן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: הֶקְדֵּשׁ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ הֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: and Beit Hillel say not consecrated. How so; said: A black bull that will emerge from my house first is consecrated, and a white emerged Beit Shammai say consecrated and Beit Hillel say not consecrated. A gold dinar that will come up first in my hand is consecrated, and of silver came up, Beit Shammai say consecrated and Beit Hillel say not consecrated. A barrel of wine that will come up first in my hand is consecrated, and of oil came up Beit Shammai say consecrated and Beit Hillel say not consecrated.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And Beit Hillel say: it is not consecrated. How so? He said, 'A black ox that comes out first from my house, behold it is consecrated,' and a white one came out. Beit Shammai say: it is consecrated, and Beit Hillel say: it is not consecrated. 'A golden dinar that will come into my hand first, behold it is consecrated,' and it turned out to be silver. Beit Shammai say: it is consecrated, and Beit Hillel say: it is not consecrated. 'A barrel of wine that will come into my hand first, behold it is consecrated,' and it turned out to be oil. Beit Shammai say: it is consecrated, and Beit Hillel say: it is not consecrated."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים הֶקְדֵּשׁ כּוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי — דְּיָלְפִינַן תְּחִלַּת הֶקְדֵּשׁ מִסּוֹף הֶקְדֵּשׁ. מָה תְּמוּרָה אֲפִילּוּ בְּטָעוּת — אַף הֶקְדֵּשׁ אֲפִילּוּ בְּטָעוּת.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say consecration What is the reason of Beit Shammai? that we derive the initial of consecration from the final of consecration. Just as substitution even in error, so too, consecration even in error.
llm_translation: Gemara: Beit Shammai say, "Sanctify as is." What is the reasoning of Beit Shammai? - That we elevate the beginning of sanctification from the end of sanctification. What is the exchange, even in error - so too sanctification, even in error.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: הָנֵי מִילֵּי תְּמוּרָה. אֲבָל אַחוֹתֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּטָעוּת — לָא מַחֲתִינַן.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: This matter, substitution, However, we do not have consecration descend in error.
llm_translation: House of Hillel says: Those are matters of exchange. But the sisters of the Sanctuary in error - we do not disqualify.

hebrew_text: וּלְבֵית שַׁמַּאי, מָה אִילּוּ אָמַר ״הָרֵי זֶה תַּחַת זֶה לַחֲצִי הַיּוֹם״ מִי הָוְיָא תְּמוּרָה מֵהַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא? אֶלָּא עַד דְּמָטֵי חֲצִי הַיּוֹם הוּא דְּהָוְיָא תְּמוּרָה. הָכִי נָמֵי לְכִי מִיגַּלְּיָא מִילְּתָא!
human_translation: And according to Beit Shammai, just as if one said, This is in exchange for this in the middle of the day, would it become a substitute from that time Rather, until the middle of the day arrives, it becomes a substitution. So too, when the situation is revealed
llm_translation: To the House of Shammai, what if he said, "Behold, this is considered as being under this for half the day," who would exchange it for that hour? Rather, until half the day passes, it is considered an exchange. So it is also stated: "Go and learn the matter from the Megillah!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר ״רִאשׁוֹן״ לִכְשֶׁיֵּצֵא רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: for this states: first, When first will emerge
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Therefore it is stated "first" when the first one goes out first.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״שׁוֹר שָׁחוֹר״ קָאָמַר, מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אֶלָּא הַאי? לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִית לֵיהּ תְּרֵין תְּלָתָא. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אִם כֵּן, ״שֶׁיֵּצֵא בָּרִאשׁוֹן״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But he said: Black bull, are we not dealing where he only has this No; necessary where he has two three And Beit Hillel say: If so, he should have first that will emerge
llm_translation: The text says: "And regarding the 'black ox,' who are we dealing with that it only has this one? It is not necessary, for it has two or three. And Beit Hillel says: If so, 'that which comes out first' is required for it."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא מִבַּרְנִישׁ לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הַאי הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּטָעוּת הוּא? הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּכַוּוֹנָה הוּא! מִשּׁוּם דְּאַטְעֲיֵיהּ לְדִיבּוּרֵיהּ קַמָּא.
human_translation: Rava from Barnish said to Rav Ashi, this erroneous consecration? It is intentional consecration. because he erred in his first statement.
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Ashi: Is this consecration accidental? It is consecrated intentionally! Because he consecrated it for his words beforehand.

hebrew_text: וְסָבְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּטָעוּת לָא הָוֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ? וְהָתְנַן: מִי שֶׁנָּדַר בְּנָזִיר וְנִשְׁאַל לַחֲכָמִים וְהִתִּירוּ, וְהָיְתָה לוֹ בְּהֵמָה מוּפְרֶשֶׁת — תֵּצֵא וְתִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר.
human_translation: And Beit Shammai hold erroneous consecration is not consecration? But didn’t we learn one who took a vow of naziriteship and made a request to the halakhic authorities and they dissolved and he had separated an animal it shall go out and graze among the flock,
llm_translation: The House of Shammai holds: Consecration through error is not considered consecration? But we learned in a Mishnah: If one vowed to be a Nazirite, and he asked the sages and they permitted it, and he had a designated animal - he should go out and graze with the flock.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: אִי אַתֶּם מוֹדִים שֶׁהֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּטָעוּת הוּא, וְתֵצֵא וְתִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר?! מִכְלָל דְּסָבְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּטָעוּת הָוֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ!
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: Don’t you concede that it is an erroneous consecration, and it shall go out and graze among flock? by inference that Beit Shammai hold erroneous consecration is consecration,
llm_translation: The House of Hillel said to the House of Shammai: If you admit that the consecration is in error, shall she go out and graze with the flock?! By inference, the House of Shammai holds that a consecration made in error is a valid consecration!
