hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בֵּית הִלֵּל הוּא דְּקָא טָעוּ, סָבְרִי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי מִשּׁוּם דְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּטָעוּת הָוֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ. וְאָמְרִי לְהוֹן בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: לָאו מִשּׁוּם הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּטָעוּת הוּא, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּאַטְעֲיֵיהּ לְדִיבּוּרֵיהּ קַמָּא.
human_translation: rather, it is Beit Hillel who erred They thought Beit Shammai’s reasoning because an erroneous consecration is consecration, And Beit Shammai said to them: not because an erroneous consecration. Rather, because he erred in his first statement,
llm_translation: Rather, it is Beit Hillel who erred, for they hold that if one sanctifies unintentionally, it is considered sanctified. And Beit Shammai say to them: It is not because it is sanctified unintentionally, but because he intended for his words to take effect.

hebrew_text: וְסָבְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּטָעוּת לָא הָוֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ? תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ,
human_translation: And Beit Shammai hold erroneous consecration is not consecration? Come hear were walking along the way,
llm_translation: House of Shammai hold that sanctification by mistake is not sanctification? Come and hear: They were walking on the road,

hebrew_text: וְאֶחָד בָּא כְּנֶגְדָּן, וְאָמַר אֶחָד: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁזֶּה פְּלוֹנִי״, וְאֶחָד אָמַר: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁאֵין זֶה פְּלוֹנִי״, ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁאֶחָד מִכֶּם נָזִיר״, ״שֶׁאֵין אֶחָד מִכֶּם נָזִיר״, ״שֶׁשְּׁנֵיכֶם נְזִירִים״, ״שֶׁכּוּלְּכֶם נְזִירִים״ — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: כּוּלָּם נְזִירִים.
human_translation: and one approaching them, and one said: I am hereby a nazirite if this is so-and-so. And one said: I am hereby a nazirite if this is not so-and-so, I am hereby a nazirite if one of you is a nazirite, if neither of you is a nazirite, if both of you are nazirites. if all you are nazirites. Beit Shammai say they are all nazirites,
llm_translation: One came and stood against them, and one said: "Behold, I am a Nazirite, this is Ploni," and one said: "Behold, I am a Nazirite, this is not Ploni," "Behold, I am a Nazirite, one of you is a Nazirite," "none of you is a Nazirite," "all of you are Nazirites," "none of you are Nazirites" - Beit Shammai says: all of them are Nazirites.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּטָעוּת הוּא, וְקָתָנֵי: כּוּלָּם נְזִירִים! אָמְרִי: סָבְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּטָעוּת הָוֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ, הָכָא לָא.
human_translation: But here, it is an erroneous consecration, and teaches they are all nazirites. say Beit Shammai hold an erroneous consecration is consecration, here, not
llm_translation: And here, he sanctified in error, and it teaches: all of them are nazirites! They said: The House of Shammai holds that sanctifying in error constitutes sanctification, but here it does not.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: לָא קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ דְּקָאֵים בְּצַפְרָא, אֶלָּא הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּקָאֵים בְּטִיהֲרָא, וְאָמַר: שׁוֹר שָׁחוֹר שֶׁיָּצָא מִבֵּיתִי רִאשׁוֹן לֶיהֱוֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ. וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לָבָן נְפַק. וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן: אִי הֲוָה יָדַעְנָא דְּלָבָן נְפַק לָא אֲמַרִי שָׁחוֹר.
human_translation: Abaye said not enter your mind who was standing in the morning Rather, with what are we dealing here? who is standing at noon, and said: black bull that emerged first from my house first shall be consecrated. And said to him: A white emerged And he said to them: Had I known a white emerged, I would not said black.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Your mind did not ascend that we are dealing with a bird here, rather, here we are dealing with what? We are dealing with purity. And he said: "A black ox that comes out first from my house shall be holy." And they said to him: "A white one came out." And he said to them: "Had I known that only a white one came out, I would not have said black."

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ דְּקָאֵים בְּטִיהֲרָא עָסֵיק? וְהָקָתָנֵי: ״דִּינָר שֶׁל זָהָב שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה״! תְּנִי ״שֶׁעָלָה״. ״חָבִית שֶׁל יַיִן שֶׁתַּעֲלֶה״! תְּנִי ״שֶׁעָלְתָה״.
human_translation: How can you say deals who is standing at noon But teaches: A gold dinar that will come up teach: that came up, A barrel of wine that will come up teach that came up.
llm_translation: And who found that you say that he is engaged in purification? And it was taught: "A golden dinar that will ascend!" Teach: "that it ascended." "A barrel of wine that will ascend!" Teach: "that it ascended."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אוּכָּמָא בְּחִיוָּרָא — לַקְיָא, חִיוָּרָא בְּאוּכָּמָא — לַקְיָא. תְּנַן: ״שָׁחוֹר שֶׁיֵּצֵא מִבֵּיתִי רִאשׁוֹן הֶקְדֵּשׁ״. קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין: כִּי מַקְדִּישׁ — בְּעַיִן רָעָה מַקְדִּישׁ, וְאָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הָוֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ!
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A black among white ones deficient, a white on a black a deficiency. We learned black that will emerge from my house first is consecrated, It entered our minds when consecrates he consecrates sparingly, And Beit Shammai say is consecrated,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: If the black is in the white, it is considered black; if the white is in the black, it is considered white. We learned in a Mishnah: "The black that emerges first from my house is holy." The minds of the Sages were unsettled: When one sanctifies, does he need an evil eye to sanctify? And the House of Shammai says: It is considered sanctified!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי, בְּעַיִן יָפָה מַקְדִּישׁ? ״דִּינָר שֶׁל זָהָב שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה בְּיָדִי רִאשׁוֹן״ וְעָלָה כֶּסֶף, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: הֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: Rather, what then? consecrates generously gold dinar that will come up in my hand first, and a silver one came up, Beit Shammai say it is consecrated.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather what, with a beautiful eye sanctifies? "A golden dinar that will rise in the hand first" and silver rose, Beit Shammai say: sanctify.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי — בְּעַיִן רָעָה מַקְדִּישׁ? חָבִית שֶׁל יַיִן שֶׁתַּעֲלֶה בְּיָדִי רִאשׁוֹן, וְעָלָה שֶׁל שֶׁמֶן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: הֶקְדֵּשׁ. וְהָא שֶׁמֶן עָדִיף מִיַּיִן! אִי מִשּׁוּם הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: בְּגָלִילָא שָׁנוּ, דְּחַמְרָא עָדִיף מִמִּשְׁחָא.
human_translation: Rather, what then? consecrate sparingly? A barrel of wine that will come up in my hand first, and one of oil came up, Beit Shammai say consecrated. But oil is preferable to wine, If due to that, this not difficult, was taught in the Galilee, where wine is preferable to oil.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather what — with an evil eye does one sanctify? A barrel of wine that ascends first in my hand, and ascends of oil, Beit Shammai say: it is sanctified. But oil is superior to wine! If because of this it is not difficult: in Galilee they taught, that wine is superior to oil.

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא קַשְׁיָא לְרַב חִסְדָּא! אָמַר לְךָ רַב חִסְדָּא: כִּי אֲמַרִי — בְּתוֹרָא דְקַרְמְנָאֵי.
human_translation: the first clause a difficulty to Rav Ḥisda, Rav Ḥisda said to you: When I said to a Karmanian bull,
llm_translation: The beginning is difficult for Rav Ḥisda! Rav Ḥisda said to you: As it is stated - in the Torah of the vineyards.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אוּכָּמָא — לְמַשְׁכֵּיהּ, סוּמָּקָא — לְבִשְׂרֵיהּ, חִיוָּרָא — לְרִדְיָא. וְהָאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אוּכָּמָא בְּחִיוָּרָא לַקְיָא! כִּי אֲמַרִי, בְּתוֹרָא דְקַרְמוֹנָאֵי.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said A black for its hide; a red one for its meat; a white for plowing. But didn’t Rav Ḥisda say: A black among white ones deficient, When I said to a Karmanian bull,
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: Ukkama - to its pull, Sumaka - to its flesh, Ḥivyara - to its rind. And did Rav Ḥisda say: Ukkama in Ḥivyara for the basket! For they say, in the Torah of the vineyards.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁנָּדַר בְּנָזִיר, וְנִשְׁאַל לְחָכָם וַאֲסָרוֹ — מוֹנֶה מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנָּדַר. נִשְׁאַל לְחָכָם וְהִתִּירוֹ, הָיְתָה לוֹ בְּהֵמָה מוּפְרֶשֶׁת — תֵּצֵא וְתִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר.
human_translation: one who took a vow of naziriteship, and requested of a halakhic authority and ruled he is bound counts from the time that he vowed, he requested of a halakhic authority and dissolved it, he had an animal separated it shall go out and graze among flock.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows to become a Nazirite, and he asked a sage who prohibited it - he counts from the moment he vowed. If he asked a sage who permitted it, and he had a designated animal - it should go out and graze with the flock.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: אִי אַתֶּם מוֹדִים בָּזֶה שֶׁהוּא הֶקְדֵּשׁ טָעוּת שֶׁתֵּצֵא וְתִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר?! אָמַר לָהֶן בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: אִי אַתֶּם מוֹדִים בְּמִי שֶׁטָּעָה וְקָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״, וְלָעֲשִׂירִי ״תְּשִׁיעִי״, וְלָאַחַד עָשָׂר ״עֲשִׂירִי״, שֶׁהוּא מְקוּדָּשׁ?
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: Don’t you concede with regard to this that it is an erroneous consecration, and that it shall go out and graze among flock? Beit Shammai said to Don’t you concede with regard to one that erred and called the ninth Tenth; and the tenth: Ninth; and the eleventh: Tenth, that is consecrated?
llm_translation: The House of Hillel said to the House of Shammai: Do you agree with this, that one who made a mistake in designating an animal as holy should let it go out and graze with the flock? The House of Shammai said to them: Do you agree with one who erred and called the ninth "tenth," and the tenth "ninth," and the eleventh "tenth," that it should be considered consecrated?

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל: לֹא הַשֵּׁבֶט קִידְּשׁוֹ. וּמָה אִילּוּ טָעָה וְהִנִּיחַ אֶת הַשֵּׁבֶט עַל שְׁמִינִי וְעַל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר, שֶׁמָּא עָשָׂה כְּלוּם? אֶלָּא, כָּתוּב שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ הָעֲשִׂירִי — הוּא קִידֵּשׁ הַתְּשִׁיעִי
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to them: not the rod consecrates it. And what if he had erred and placed the rod on the eighth or on the twelfth, perhaps he performed anything Rather, verse that consecrated the tenth consecrated the ninth
llm_translation: They said to them, Beit Hillel: "The tribe did not sanctify it." And what if he erred and left the tribe on the eighth and on the twelfth, perhaps he did nothing? Rather, it is written that he sanctified the tenth - he sanctified the ninth.

hebrew_text: וְאֶת אַחַד עָשָׂר.
human_translation: and the eleventh.
llm_translation: And one eleven.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? לָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְלָא רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Whose the mishna, neither Rabbi Yosei, nor the Rabbis.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: What is the law according to the Mishnah? Not according to Rabbi Yosei, and not according to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: מִי שֶׁנָּדַר וְעָבַר עַל נְזִירוּתוֹ — אֵין נִזְקָקִין לוֹ, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן מוֹנֶה בָּהֶן אִיסּוּר כַּיָּמִים שֶׁנָּהַג בָּהֶם הֶיתֵּר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: דַּיּוֹ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: As it is taught one who took a vow and transgressed his naziriteship do not attend to his unless he counted, prohibitions for the same days in which he behaved with permissiveness Rabbi Yosei says: Thirty days is enough for him.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who takes a vow and violates his Nazirite status - we do not require him to bring offerings, unless he counted the prohibitions like the days that he observed the permissibilities. Rabbi Yosei says: Thirty days are sufficient.

hebrew_text: אִי רַבָּנַן, קַשְׁיָא נְזִירוּת מוּעֶטֶת. אִי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, קַשְׁיָא נְזִירוּת מְרוּבָּה!
human_translation: If the Rabbis, difficult a short naziriteship, If Rabbi Yosei, difficult a lengthy naziriteship,
llm_translation: If we follow the opinion of the Rabbis, the prohibition of Naziriteship is minimal. If we follow the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, the prohibition of Naziriteship is extensive!

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית תֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְאִיבָּעֵית תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן. אִיבָּעֵית תֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כָּאן בִּנְזִירוּת מְרוּבָּה, כָּאן בִּנְזִירוּת מוּעֶטֶת.
human_translation: If you wish, say Rabbi Yosei, and if you wish, say the Rabbis. If you wish, say Rabbi Yosei: Here, of a lengthy naziriteship; there, to a short naziriteship.
llm_translation: If you wish, say it was Rabbi Yosei, and if you wish, say it was the Rabbis. If you wish, say it was Rabbi Yosei: here in the case of a Nazirite with excessive hair, here in the case of a Nazirite with minimal hair.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן: לָא תֵּימָא מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנָּזַר, אֶלָּא אֵימָא כְּמִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנָּזַר.
human_translation: And if you wish, say the Rabbis, Do not say from the time that he vowed; rather, say: Like from the time that he vowed.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say the Rabbis: Do not say "from the time he vowed," rather say "like the time he vowed."

hebrew_text: נִשְׁאַל לַחֲכָמִים וְהִתִּירוּהוּ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: מִדְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי נִשְׁמַע לִדְבֵית הִלֵּל. לָאו אָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּטָעוּת הָוֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דְּלָאו שַׁפִּיר נָזַר — תֵּצֵא וְתִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר.
human_translation: requested of the halakhic authorities and they dissolved for him, Rabbi Yirmeya said: From of Beit Shammai one can learn to of Beit Hillel. not Beit Shammai say an erroneous consecration is consecration, once the matter is revealed that his vow of naziriteship not right, shall go out and graze among flock.
llm_translation: He asked the sages and they permitted him, etc. Rabbi Yirmiyah said: From the house of Shammai it was heard to the house of Hillel. Did the house of Shammai not say, "Sanctify in error, be sanctified"? Since the matter that is not beautiful is revealed, go out and graze with the flock.

hebrew_text: לְבֵית הִלֵּל נָמֵי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמְרִי תְּמוּרָה בְּטָעוּת הָוְיָא תְּמוּרָה — הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ לְעִיקַּר הֶקְדֵּשׁ. אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּמִיתְעֲקַר עִיקַּר הֶקְדֵּשׁ — אִיתְעֲקַר נָמֵי תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: According to Beit Hillel as well, even though say a substitution in error is substitute, this applies when the initial consecration, is However, where the initial consecration has been uprooted, substitute is also uprooted,
llm_translation: To the House of Hillel, they also say, even though they said "an exchange made in error is considered an exchange," those matters apply where the principal remains intact. But where the principal is lost, the exchange is indeed considered nullified.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אִי אַתֶּם מוֹדִים שֶׁאִילּוּ קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי עֲשִׂירִי כּוּ׳. אִיתְּמַר: מַעֲשֵׂר, רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: טָעוּתוֹ, וְלֹא כַּוּוֹנָתוֹ. רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמְרִי: טָעוּתוֹ, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן כַּוּוֹנָתוֹ.
human_translation: The Master said Don’t you concede with regard to one who called the ninth Tenth, was stated tithe, Rav Naḥman said: his error, but not his intentional Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna say: His error and all the more so his intentional
llm_translation: Master said: If you admit that he read the ninth as the tenth, it is a mistake. Rav Nahman said: His intention was not as his action. Rav Hisda and Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: It is a mistake, and all the more so his intention.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: לְדִידָךְ דְּאָמְרַתְּ טָעוּתוֹ וְלֹא כַּוּוֹנָתוֹ, דְּקָאָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְבֵית הִלֵּל: אִי אַתֶּם מוֹדִים שֶׁאִילּוּ קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי עֲשִׂירִי, וְלָעֲשִׂירִי תְּשִׁיעִי, וְלָאַחַד עָשָׂר עֲשִׂירִי, שֶׁשְּׁלָשְׁתָּן מְקוּדָּשִׁין? וְאִישְׁתִּיקוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: According to your that you say his error and not his intentional that Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel Don’t you concede that if he called the ninth: Tenth; the tenth: Ninth; and the eleventh: Tenth, that all three are consecrated? And Beit Hillel were silent
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava to Rav Nachman: According to your opinion that you said, his mistake and not his intention, for they say Beit Shammai to Beit Hillel: If you agree that if he read the ninth as the tenth, and the tenth as the ninth, and the eleventh as the tenth, are they all consecrated? And Beit Hillel remained silent.

hebrew_text: לֵימְרוּ לְהוֹן: מָה לְמַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁכֵּן אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ בְּכַוּוֹנָה.
human_translation: let say to what about tithe is that it is not consecrated intentional,
llm_translation: Say to them: What for tithe so it is not holy in intention.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּלָא אָמְרִי לְהוֹן, דְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא: מָה מַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁאֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ בְּכַוּוֹנָה — קָדוֹשׁ בְּטָעוּת, הֶקְדֵּשׁ, שֶׁקָּדוֹשׁ בְּכַוּוֹנָה — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: This is the reason that did not say to that it is an a fortiori If tithe, which is not consecrated intentionally, consecrated erroneously; consecration, which are consecrated intentionally, not all the more so
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashe said: This is the reason they did not say, for it is a fortiori argument: Just as tithes that are not sanctified intentionally are sanctified unintentionally, consecrated offerings that are sanctified intentionally — how much more so?!

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, דְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּדַעְתָּא דְמָרֵיהּ תְּלֵי.
human_translation: And this is not so, as consecration depends on the intention of the owner,
llm_translation: And not it is, for he consecrated with the knowledge of his master depends.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁנָּדַר בְּנָזִיר, וְהָלַךְ לְהָבִיא אֶת בְּהֶמְתּוֹ, וּמְצָאָהּ שֶׁנִּגְנְבָה. אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִגְנְבָה בְּהֶמְתּוֹ נָזַר — הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר.
human_translation: one who took a vow of naziriteship and went to bring his animal and discovered that it was stolen, if he took a vow of naziriteship before his animal was stolen, he is a nazirite,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows to become a Nazirite and goes to bring his animal, but finds that it has been stolen. If he vowed to become a Nazirite before his animal was stolen, he is indeed a Nazirite.

hebrew_text: וְאִם מִשֶּׁנִּגְנְבָה בְּהֶמְתּוֹ נָזַר — אֵינוֹ נָזִיר. וְזוֹ טָעוּת טָעָה נַחוּם הַמָּדִי: כְּשֶׁעָלוּ נְזִירִים מִן הַגּוֹלָה וּמָצְאוּ בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ חָרֵב, אָמַר לָהֶם נַחוּם הַמָּדִי: אִילּוּ הֱיִיתֶם יוֹדְעִין שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ חָרֵב, הֱיִיתֶם נוֹזְרִים? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא. וְהִתִּירָן נַחוּם הַמָּדִי.
human_translation: But if he took a vow of naziriteship after his animal was stolen, he is not a nazirite, And this error Naḥum the Mede erred When nazirites were ascending from the exile and they found the Temple destroyed, Naḥum the Mede said to them: If you had known that the Temple destroyed, would you have taken a vow of naziriteship? They said to him: not, And Naḥum the Mede dissolved for them.
llm_translation: "And if one stole his animal, he is not a Nazirite. And this is the mistake that Nahum the Mede made: When the Nazirites ascended from exile and found the Temple destroyed, Nahum the Mede said to them: If you had known that the Temple was destroyed, would you have become Nazirites? They said to him: No. And Nahum the Mede permitted them."

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁבָּא הַדָּבָר אֵצֶל חֲכָמִים אָמְרוּ: כׇּל שֶׁנָּזַר עַד שֶׁלֹּא חָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ — נָזִיר. וּמִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ — אֵינוֹ נָזִיר.
human_translation: And when the matter came before the Rabbis, they said: whoever took a vow of naziriteship before the Temple was destroyed, a nazirite, after the Temple was destroyed is not a nazirite,
llm_translation: And when the matter came before the sages, they said: "Anyone who vows to abstain from wine until the Temple is destroyed is a Nazirite. But once the Temple is destroyed, he is not a Nazirite."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבָּה: שַׁטְפוּהוּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְאוֹקְמֻיהּ בְּשִׁיטְתַיְיהוּ. דִּתְנַן: פּוֹתְחִין בְּנוֹלָד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: Rabba said: The Rabbis overwhelmed Rabbi Eliezer and established in accordance with their opinion. As we learned may broach by a new situation, the statement of Rabbi Eliezer; but the Rabbis prohibit
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said: The Rabbis washed Rabbi Eliezer and established him in their ranks. As we learned in a Mishnah: One may open a barrel of wine that was born on Shabbat, the words of Rabbi Eliezer, but the Sages prohibit it.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: אַף עַל גַּב דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן אֵין פּוֹתְחִין בְּנוֹלָד, אֲבָל פּוֹתְחִין בִּתְנַאי נוֹלָד. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אָמְרִי לְהוֹן: אִילּוּ אֲתָא אִינִישׁ וַאֲמַר לְכוֹן דְּחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, מִי הֲוָה נָדְרִיתוּן?
human_translation: And Rava said, Even though the Rabbis said may not broach by a new situation, however, may broach by the conditions of a new situation, What are the circumstances say to If a person had come and said to you that the Temple destroyed, would you have vowed?
llm_translation: And Rava said: Even though the Rabbis said we do not open with what is born, but we open with the conditions of what is born. What is the case? They said to him: If a person were to come and say to you that the Temple has been destroyed, would you have taken vows?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אִי הֲוַאי הָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לְהוֹן: הָכְתִיב ״הֵיכַל ה׳ הֵיכַל ה׳ הֵיכַל ה׳ הֵמָּה״ — זֶה מִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן וּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: If I had been there, I would have said to them, Isn’t it written: “The Sanctuary of the Lord, the Sanctuary of the Lord, the Sanctuary of the Lord, are these” This First Temple and Second Temple
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: If I were there, I would say to them: It is written, "The temple of Hashem, the temple of Hashem, the temple of Hashem, they are" - this refers to the First Temple and the Second Temple.

hebrew_text: נְהִי דְּיָדְעִין לְהוֹן דְּיִחְרוּב, מִי יוֹדְעִין לְאִימַּתִּי?! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וְלָא יָדְעִין לְאִימַּת? וְהָכְתִיב: ״שָׁבוּעִים שִׁבְעִים נֶחְתַּךְ עַל עַמְּךָ וְעַל עִיר קׇדְשֶׁךָ״! וְאַכַּתִּי מִי יָדְעִינַן בְּהֵי יוֹמָא?!
human_translation: Although they known would be destroyed, did they know when Abaye said: And they not know when? But isn’t it written: “Seventy sevens are decreed upon your people and upon your sacred city” And still, did we know on which day
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If they know that they will be destroyed, who knows when?! Abaye said: And they do not know when? But it is written: "Seventy weeks are decreed upon your people and upon your holy city"! And yet, who knows in what hour?!

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְאֶחָד בָּא כְּנֶגְדָּן, אָמַר אֶחָד מֵהֶן: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁזֶּה פְּלוֹנִי״, וְאֶחָד אָמַר: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁאֵין זֶה פְּלוֹנִי״, ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁאֶחָד מִכֶּם נָזִיר״, ״שֶׁאֵין אֶחָד מִכֶּם נָזִיר״, ״שֶׁשְּׁנֵיכֶם נְזִירִים״, ״שֶׁכּוּלְּכֶם נְזִירִים״.
human_translation: were walking along the way, and one approaching them, one said: I am hereby a nazirite if this is so-and-so. And one said: I am hereby a nazirite if this is not so-and-so, I am hereby a nazirite if one of you is a nazirite, if neither of you is a nazirite, if both of you are nazirites. if all you are nazirites.
llm_translation: They taught: They were walking on the road, and one of them came opposite them. One of them said, "Behold, I am a Nazirite, that this is so-and-so." And one said, "Behold, I am a Nazirite, that this is not so-and-so." "Behold, I am a Nazirite, that one of you is a Nazirite." "That none of you is a Nazirite." "That you are all Nazirites." "That you are all not Nazirites."

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: כּוּלָּן נְזִירִין. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ נָזִיר אֶלָּא מִי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְקַיְּימוּ דְּבָרָיו. וְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵין אֶחָד מֵהֶם נָזִיר.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say they are all nazirites, And Beit Hillel say: Only he whose statement was not fulfilled is a nazirite. And Rabbi Tarfon says: Not one of them is a nazirite,
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: all are nazirites. And House of Hillel says: he is not a nazirite unless his words have not been fulfilled. And Rabbi Tarfon says: none of them is a nazirite.

hebrew_text: הִרְתִּיעַ לַאֲחוֹרָיו — אֵינוֹ נָזִיר. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יֹאמַר ״אִם הָיָה כִדְבָרַי — הֲרֵינִי נְזִיר חוֹבָה, וְאִם לָאו — הֲרֵינִי נְזִיר נְדָבָה״.
human_translation: turned back not a nazirite. Rabbi Shimon says should say: If it was in accordance with my statement, I am hereby an obligatory nazirite, and if not, I am hereby a voluntary nazirite,
llm_translation: He who retracts is not a Nazirite. Rabbi Shimon says: Let him say, "If it was as my words, behold I am a Nazirite by obligation, and if not, behold I am a Nazirite voluntarily."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְקַיְּימוּ דְּבָרָיו, אַמַּאי הָוֵי נָזִיר? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אֵימָא: מִי שֶׁנִּתְקַיְּימוּ דְּבָרָיו.
human_translation: Why is he whose statement was not fulfilled a nazirite? Rav Yehuda said: says: he whose statement was fulfilled
llm_translation: Gemara: If his words were not fulfilled, why should he be a Nazir? Rav Yehudah said: Say, if his words were fulfilled.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר, כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר: ״אִי נָמֵי לָאו פְּלוֹנִי הוּא — אִי הָוֵי נָזִיר״. וּמַאי ״לֹא נִתְקַיְּימוּ דְּבָרָיו״ — לֹא נִתְקַיְּימוּ דְּבָרָיו הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, אֶלָּא דְּבָרָיו אַחֲרוֹנִים.
human_translation: Abaye said: where he said: Even if it is not so-and-so, I shall be a nazirite. And what is statement was not fulfilled? His first statement was not fulfilled, rather, his last statement
llm_translation: Abaye said, for example, as he said: "If indeed he is not so-and-so, he will not be a Nazirite." And what is meant by "his words were not fulfilled"? - His earlier words were not fulfilled, but rather his later words.

hebrew_text: הִרְתִּיעַ לַאֲחוֹרָיו אֵינוֹ נָזִיר כּוּ׳. טַעְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּהִרְתִּיעַ לַאֲחוֹרָיו, הָא אָתֵי לְקַמַּן — הָוֵי נָזִיר. מַנִּי?
human_translation: turned back, not a nazirite. The reason is because he turned back, comes before us is a nazirite. whose
llm_translation: He who turns back is not a Nazirite. The reason is that since he turns back, when he comes later - he will be a Nazirite. Who is the authority?

hebrew_text: אִילֵימָא רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן — מִי הָוֵי נָזִיר? כֵּיוָן דִּבְשַׁעְתָּא דְּקָא נָזַר לָא יָדַע אִי פְּלוֹנִי הוּא וְאִי לָא, מִי חָלָה עֲלֵיהּ נְזִירוּת? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: אֵין אֶחָד מֵהֶן נָזִיר, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְּנָה נְזִירוּת אֶלָּא לְהַפְלָאָה!
human_translation: If we say Rabbi Tarfon, is a nazirite? Since at the time when he vowed he did not know whether is so-and-so or not, does naziriteship take effect with regard to him? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Tarfon: not one of is a nazirite, since naziriteship is imposed only if explicitness [ hafla’a ]
llm_translation: If you say Rabbi Tarfon - who would be a Nazirite? Since at the time he vowed, he did not know whether he is a specific individual or not, who should take upon himself Naziriteship? And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Tarfon: None of them is a Nazirite, because Naziriteship was only given for wonderment!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה דִּכְרִי הוּא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר עַל מְנָת שֶׁיְּהֵא בַּכְּרִי הַזֶּה מֵאָה כּוֹר״, וְהָלַךְ וּמְצָאוֹ שֶׁנִּגְנַב אוֹ שֶׁאָבַד — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסֵר, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yehuda, as a heap As it is taught I am hereby a nazirite on the condition that this heap contains one hundred kor , and he went he discovered that was stolen or lost, Rabbi Shimon deems prohibited And Rabbi Yehuda deems him permitted,
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yehuda of Kiri is he. As it was taught: "Behold, I am a Nazirite on the condition that there be in this pile one hundred kor." And if he went and found it was stolen or lost — Rabbi Shimon prohibits, and Rabbi Yehuda permits.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ לֹא נִגְנַב, דִּלְמָא הֲווֹ בֵּיהּ מְאָה כּוֹר וְהָוֵי נָזִיר — הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי הָוֵי נָזִיר. וְהָכָא נָמֵי כֵּיוָן דְּאִי אֲתָא לְקַמַּן וְיָדְעִינַן דִּפְלוֹנִי הֲוַאי, הָוֵי נָזִיר — הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי הָוֵי נָזִיר.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon, holds Since if not been stolen perhaps it might have contained one hundred kor and he a nazirite, now too, he is a nazirite And here too, since if come before us and we known that he was so-and-so, would have been a nazirite, now too, he is a nazirite
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds: Since if it had not been stolen, perhaps there were one hundred kor of wine and he would have been a Nazir — now, he is a Nazir. And here, since if he comes later and we know that so-and-so is such, he is a Nazir — now, he is a Nazir.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רָאָה אֶת הַכּוֹי וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁזֶּה חַיָּה״, ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁזֶּה אֵינוֹ חַיָּה״, ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁזֶּה בְּהֵמָה״, ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁאֵין זֶה בְּהֵמָה״.
human_translation: saw a kosher animal with characteristics of both a domesticated animal and a non-domesticated animal [ koy ], and said: I am hereby a nazirite if this is a non-domesticated animal; I am hereby a nazirite if this is not a non-domesticated animal; I am hereby a nazirite if this is a domesticated animal; I am hereby a nazirite if this not a domesticated animal.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one sees a corpse and says, "Behold, I am a Nazirite, that this is a living being," or "Behold, I am a Nazirite, that this is not a living being," or "Behold, I am a Nazirite, that this is a beast," or "Behold, I am a Nazirite, that this is not a beast."

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁזֶּה חַיָּה וּבְהֵמָה״, ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁאֵין זֶה לֹא חַיָּה וְלֹא בְּהֵמָה״, ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁאֶחָד מִכֶּם נָזִיר״, ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁאֵין אֶחָד מִכֶּם נָזִיר״, ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר שֶׁכּוּלְּכֶם נְזִירִין״ — הֲרֵי כּוּלָּן נְזִירִין.
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite if this is a non-domesticated animal and a domesticated animal, I am hereby a nazirite if this is neither a non-domesticated animal nor a domesticated animal. I am hereby a nazirite if one of you is a nazirite, I am hereby a nazirite if not one of you is a nazirite, I am hereby a nazirite if all of you are nazirites. they are all nazirites.
llm_translation: "I am a Nazirite, this is a wild animal and a domestic animal," "I am a Nazirite, this is neither a wild animal nor a domestic animal," "I am a Nazirite, one of you is a Nazirite," "I am a Nazirite, none of you is a Nazirite," "I am a Nazirite, all of you are Nazirites" - behold, all of them are Nazirites.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנֵי חֲדָא: תִּשְׁעָה נְזִירִים, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: תֵּשַׁע נְזִירִיּוֹת. בִּשְׁלָמָא תִּשְׁעָה נְזִירִין — כְּגוֹן דְּהָוֵי גַּבְרֵי טְפֵי, דְּאִיתְּפִיס וְאָזֵיל בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: is taught one nine nazirites, and is taught the other nine naziriteship Granted, nine nazirites, for example, if there were many people who associated this
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches one: Nine Nazirites, and another Tanna teaches: Nine Nazirite women. Granted, nine Nazirites - for example, when they are men of little importance, who become angry and then go away.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא תֵּשַׁע נְזִירִיּוֹת לְחַד גַּבְרָא הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? בִּשְׁלָמָא שֵׁית מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, כְּדִתְנַן.
human_translation: However, how can you find these nine naziriteship in one person? Granted, you find six, as we learned
llm_translation: Rather, nine nazirites for one man, how does she find for him? But six she finds for him, as we learned.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל תְּלָת הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר, וּנְזִירוּת הַכֹּל עָלַי״.
human_translation: However, how can you find these three Rav Sheshet said: where said: I am hereby a nazirite and the naziriteship of all of them are upon me.
llm_translation: But three how find to her! Said Rav Sheshet: For example, that he said, "Behold I am a Nazirite, and the Naziriteship all upon me."

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי
llm_translation: We will return to you, House of Shammai.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה מִינִין אֲסוּרִין בַּנָּזִיר: הַטּוּמְאָה, וְהַתִּגְלַחַת, וְהַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַגֶּפֶן. וְכׇל הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַגֶּפֶן מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה. וְאֵין חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל מִן הָעֲנָבִים כַּזַּיִת.
human_translation: Three types are prohibited for a nazirite: The ritual impurity and the shaving and that emerge from the vine. And all that emerge from the vine combine with one another And he is liable only if he eats an olive-bulk of the grapes.
llm_translation: Three types are prohibited for a Nazirite: impurity, shaving, and deriving benefit from the vine. And all that derives from the vine combine with each other. And one is not liable until he eats from the grapes the size of an olive.

hebrew_text: מִשְׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה אוֹמֶרֶת: עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁתֶּה רְבִיעִית יַיִן. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ שָׁרָה פִּיתּוֹ בְּיַיִן וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ כְּדֵי לְצָרֵף כְּזַיִת — חַיָּיב, וְחַיָּיב עַל הַיַּיִן בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, וְעַל הָעֲנָבִים בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן, וְעַל הַחַרְצַנִּים בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן, וְעַל הַזַּגִּים בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל שְׁנֵי חַרְצַנִּים וְזָג.
human_translation: An initial mishna says only if he drinks a quarter wine. Rabbi Akiva says: Even soaked his bread in wine and contain enough to combine an olive-bulk, liable. And liable for wine by itself, and for grapes by themselves, and for ḥartzannim by themselves, and for zaggim by themselves, Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: He is liable only if he eats two ḥartzannim and zag ,
llm_translation: First Mishnah says: Until he drinks a revi'it of wine. Rabbi Akiva says: Even if he soaks his bread in wine and it contains the size of an olive - he is liable, and he is liable for the wine by itself, and for the grapes by themselves, and for the grape skins by themselves, and for the grape seeds by themselves. Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah says: One is not liable until he eats two grape seeds and a grape skin.

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ הֵן חַרְצַנִּים וְאֵלּוּ הֵן זַגִּים? הַחַרְצַנִּים — אֵלּוּ הַחִיצוֹנִים, הַזַּגִּים — אֵלּוּ הַפְּנִימִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר, שֶׁלֹּא תִּטְעֶה: כְּזוֹג שֶׁל בְּהֵמָה; הַחִיצוֹן זוֹג, וְהַפְּנִימִי עִינְבָּל.
human_translation: Which are ḥartzannim and which are zaggim ? The ḥartzannim are the outside the zaggim are the inner the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: that you should not err: like a bell [ zog ] by an animal, the outer zog , and the inner inbal .
llm_translation: These are the Charatzanim and these are the Zagim? The Charatzanim - these are the outer ones, the Zagim - these are the inner ones, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says, "Do not err: like the pairing of an animal; the outer one is the pair, and the inner one is the womb."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִינִין אֲסוּרִין בַּנָּזִיר: הַטּוּמְאָה כּוּ׳. הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַגֶּפֶן — אִין. גֶּפֶן עַצְמוֹ — לָא. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ עָלִין וְלוּלָבִין בַּמַּשְׁמָע.
human_translation: three types are prohibited for a nazirite: ritual impurity, That which emerges from the vine, yes, the vine itself, no, The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. as it is taught Rabbi Elazar says: Even leaves and tendrils are included
llm_translation: Gemara: Three types are forbidden for a Nazirite: impurity, yes. That which comes from the grapevine — no. The grapevine itself — no. This is the teaching that does not follow Rabbi Eliezer. As it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even with regard to the leaves and branches of the grapevine in the vineyard.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל מִן הָעֲנָבִים כְּזַיִת. מִן הָעֲנָבִים — אִין, מֵהַגֶּפֶן עַצְמוֹ — לָא. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ עָלִין וְלוּלָבִין בַּמַּשְׁמָע.
human_translation: Some say this to the latter clause He is liable only if he eats an olive-bulk of the grapes. from the grapes, yes, from the vine itself, no, the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. as it is taught Rabbi Elazar says: Even leaves and tendrils are included
llm_translation: There are those who say to her in the latter part: He is not liable until he eats from the grapes like an olive. From the grapes - no, from the vine itself - yes. The Mishnah that does not follow Rabbi Eliezer, as it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer says: Even if they are on the top and the lulavs are in the basket.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דָּרֵישׁ רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי, רַבָּנַן דָּרְשִׁי כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דָּרֵישׁ רִבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי: ״מִיַּיִן וְשֵׁכָר יַזִּיר״ — מִיעֵט, ״מִכֹּל אֲשֶׁר יֵעָשֶׂה מִגֶּפֶן הַיַּיִן״ — רִיבָּה.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree; Rabbi Elazar interprets amplifications and restrictions, the Rabbis interpret generalizations and details. Rabbi Elazar interprets amplifications and restrictions, “He shall abstain from wine and strong drink” restricts “Anything that is made of the grapevine” amplifies
llm_translation: Talmudic text: With what do they argue? Rabbi Elazar expounded inclusively and exclusively, the Rabbis expounded generalizations and specifications. Rabbi Elazar expounded inclusively and exclusively: "He shall abstain from wine and strong drink" - he specified, "from everything that is made from the grapevine" - he generalized.

hebrew_text: מִיעֵט וְרִיבָּה, רִיבָּה הַכֹּל. מַאי רִיבָּה — רִיבָּה כֹּל מִילֵּי. מַאי מִיעֵט — מִיעֵט שְׁבִישָׁתָא.
human_translation: restricts and amplifies, amplifies all What amplify amplifies all matters What restrict? restricts the branches.
llm_translation: From the text: "Mi'et ve'ribah, ribah hakol. Mai ribah - ribah kol milei. Mai mi'et - mi'et shebishata." Translation: "If it diminishes and increases, it increases everything. What is 'increases'? - It increases all matters. What is 'diminishes'? - It diminishes the seventh."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן דָּרְשִׁי כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי: ״מִיַּיִן וְשֵׁכָר יַזִּיר״ — פָּרַט, ״מִכֹּל אֲשֶׁר יֵעָשֶׂה מִגֶּפֶן הַיַּיִן״ — כָּלַל, ״מֵחַרְצַנִּים וְעַד זָג״ — חָזַר וּפָרַט. פְּרָט וּכְלָל וּפְרָט, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט: מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ פְּרִי וּפְסוֹלֶת פְּרִי — אַף כֹּל פְּרִי וּפְסוֹלֶת פְּרִי.
human_translation: And the Rabbis interpret generalizations and details, “He shall abstain from wine and strong drink” a detail, “anything that is made of the grapevine” a generalization, “From pits to grape skin,” a detail again. a detail, and a generalization, and a detail. you may deduce only similar to the detail: Just as the detail defined as a fruit or fruit waste, so too, everything a fruit or fruit waste,
llm_translation: The sages expounded generalizations and specifics: "He shall abstain from wine and strong drink" - this is a specification. "From all that is made from the grapevine, wine" - this is a generalization. "From grape seeds to grape skins" - he repeated and specified. Specification, generalization, and specification - you must judge only in the manner of the specification: Just as the specification explicitly mentions fruit and its peel - so too, all fruit and its peel.

hebrew_text: אִי: מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ פְּרִי גָּמוּר — אַף כֹּל פְּרִי גָּמוּר. אָמַרְתָּ: אִם כֵּן מָה הִנִּיחַ לְךָ הַכָּתוּב בְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ שֶׁלֹּא אֲמָרוֹ? עֲנָבִים לַחִים וִיבֵשִׁים — הָא כְּתִיבִי? יַיִן וָחוֹמֶץ — הָא כְּתִיבִי? הָא אֵין עָלֶיךָ לָדוּן כְּלָשׁוֹן אַחֲרוֹן, אֶלָּא כְּלָשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: If Just as the detail defined as a complete, fruit, so too, everything a complete fruit, You say If so, what has the verse left you from its meaning that it has not stated? grapes and raisins, written; wine and vinegar, written. you cannot learn in accordance with the last version, rather, in accordance with the first version,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If: what the detail explicit fruit complete — also all fruit complete. You said: if so what left for you the scripture in implication that not said? Grapes moist and dried — this written? Wine and vinegar — this written? This you not to judge as language latter, rather as language former.

hebrew_text: וּמֵאַחַר שֶׁסּוֹפֵינוּ לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל דָּבָר, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״מֵחַרְצַנִּים וְעַד זָג״? לוֹמַר לָךְ: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא פְּרָט וּכְלָל — אִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לְמׇשְׁכוֹ וּלְדוּנוֹ כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט.
human_translation: And as we eventually include everything what the verse states: “From pits to grape skin”? to tell you Wherever you find a detail and a generalization, you cannot broaden it and learn like the detail,
llm_translation: And after that we have included everything, what is the Talmud to say "from Hartzanim to Zag"? To tell you: Any place where you find a detail and a generalization - you are not permitted to draw it out and judge it like the detail.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא נַעֲשֶׂה כְּלָל מוּסָף עַל הַפְּרָט, עַד שֶׁיִּפְרוֹט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁפָּרַט לְךָ בַּנָּזִיר.
human_translation: Rather, the generalization becomes added to the detail until the verse specifies in the manner that it specified with regard to a nazirite,
llm_translation: Rather, let us make a generalization of the additional offering upon the specific, until the Scripture specifies for you, as it specified for you in the case of the Nazirite.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ פְּרִי וּפְסוֹלֶת פְּרִי — אַף כֹּל פְּרִי וּפְסוֹלֶת פְּרִי. ״פְּרִי״ — עִינְבֵי, ״פְּסוֹלֶת פְּרִי״ מַאי הִיא — חוֹמֶץ.
human_translation: The Master said Just as the detail defined as a fruit or fruit waste, so too everything a fruit or fruit waste. The fruit grapes. What is fruit waste? Vinegar,
llm_translation: Master said: What is the explicit detail of "fruit" and "blemish of fruit" - just as all fruit and blemish of fruit. "Fruit" - grapes, "blemish of fruit" - what is it? - vinegar.

hebrew_text: ״אַף כֹּל פְּרִי״ מַאי הִיא — גּוּהַרְקֵי. ״אַף כֹּל״ דִּפְסוֹלֶת פְּרִי, מַאי הִיא? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: לְאֵיתוֹיֵי עִינְבֵי דִּכְרִין. ״וְעַד זָג״, אָמַר רָבִינָא: לְאֵיתוֹיֵי דְּבֵין הַבֵּינַיִם.
human_translation: What is So too everything a fruit, unripe what is So too everything to fruit waste, Rav Kahana said: to include grapes that have become wormy. to grape skin,” Ravina said: to include that in between
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Even all fruit," what is it? — Guharkay. "Even all" of disqualified fruit, what is it? Rav Kahana said: To include male grapes. "And until wax," Ravina said: To include those between the branches.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: [אִי] מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ פְּרִי גָּמוּר — אַף כֹּל פְּרִי גָּמוּר. אָמַרְתָּ: אִם כֵּן מָה הִנִּיחַ הַכָּתוּב בְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ שֶׁלֹּא אֲמָרוֹ? עֲנָבִים לַחִים וִיבֵשִׁים — הָא כְּתִיבִי, יַיִן וָחוֹמֶץ — הָא כְּתִיבִי, הָא אֵין עָלֶיךָ לָדוּן כְּלָשׁוֹן אַחֲרוֹן אֶלָּא כְּלָשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. וּמֵאַחַר שֶׁסּוֹפֵינוּ לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל דָּבָר, מַה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״מֵחַרְצַנִּים וְעַד זָג״? לוֹמַר לָךְ: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא פְּרָט וּכְלָל, אִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לְמוֹשְׁכוֹ וּלְדוּנוֹ כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט, אֶלָּא נַעֲשֶׂה כְּלָל מוּסָף עַל הַפְּרָט, עַד שֶׁיִּפְרוֹט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב
human_translation: The Master said If just as the detail defined as a complete fruit, so too everything a complete fruit. You say: If so, what has the verse left you from its meaning that it has not stated? Grapes and raisins, written; wine and vinegar, written. You cannot learn in accordance with the last version; rather, in accordance with the first version. And as we eventually include everything, what the verse states: “From pit to grape skin”? to tell you wherever you find a detail and a generalization, you cannot broaden it and learn like the detail; rather, the generalization becomes added to the detail, until the verse specifies for you
llm_translation: The Master said: If what the specific explicit fruit is - so too all specific explicit fruit. You said: If so, what did the Scripture leave to imply that it did not say? Grapes, moist and dried - here it is written, wine and vinegar - here it is written, you are not to judge in a later language but in the original language. And since we conclude to include everything, what does the Talmud mean to say "from hartsanim to zog"? To tell you: Every place where you find a specific and a general, you are not permitted to draw it out and judge it like the specific, but rather make it a supplementary general to the specific, until the Scripture clarifies it for you.

hebrew_text: כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁפָּרַט לְךָ בְּנָזִיר ״מֵחַרְצַנִּים וְעַד זָג״. וּלְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה דְּקָא מוֹקֵים לְהַאי ״מֵחַרְצַנִּים וְעַד זָג״ לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל שְׁנֵי חַרְצַנִּים וְזַג, פְּרָטָא מְנָא לֵיהּ! סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּדָרֵישׁ מִיעֵט וְרִיבָּה.
human_translation: in the manner that it specified with regard to a nazirite: “From pits to grape skin” And according to Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, who establishes this “From pits to grape skin” to say that is liable only if he eats two grape seeds and a grape skin, from where does he the detail? holds in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, who interprets restricts and amplifies.
llm_translation: In the manner that it specifies for you in the case of a Nazirite, "from the hair tips to the end." And according to Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, who interprets this "from the hair tips to the end," to say that one is not liable until he consumes two hair tips and an end, a specific exclusion is derived for him! He holds like Rabbi Elazar who expounds from the minor to the major.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא כְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, לִיכְתְּבֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְהַאי ״מֵחַרְצַנִּים וְעַד זָג״ גַּבֵּי פְּרָטֵי, לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא כַּתְבֵיהּ בָּתַר כְּלָל? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְמֵידַּיְינֵיהּ בִּכְלָל וּפְרָט.
human_translation: And if you wish, say in accordance with the Rabbis As, if it should enter your mind which was stated Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, let the Merciful One write this “From pits to grape skin,” alongside details For what halakha did write: after the generalization? Conclude from it that derive by a generalization and a detail.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say like Rabbanan, for if it enters your mind as Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said, "Let the Merciful One write for this 'from Hartsanim to Zag' regarding particulars, for what halakha does He write it afterwards as a general rule? Learn from it to include the particulars in the general rule.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא כּוּלֵּיהּ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא! אִם כֵּן לִכְתּוֹב אוֹ שְׁנֵי חַרְצַנִּים, אוֹ שְׁנֵי זַגִּים, אוֹ חַרְצַן וְזָג. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״מֵחַרְצַנִּים וְעַד זָג״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְמִידְרַשׁ בֵּיהּ כְּלָל וּפְרָט, וְאִיכָּא נָמֵי לְמִידְרַשׁ בֵּיהּ: עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל שְׁנֵי חַרְצַנִּים וְזָג.
human_translation: But say entire comes for this If so, let write either two grape seeds and two grape skins, or a grape seed and a grape skin, For what halakha did the Merciful One write: “From pits to grape skin”? Learn from it interpret it a generalization and a detail, and can also interpret it only if he eats two grape seeds and a grape skin.
llm_translation: And why is all this necessary? If so, let it be written: either two cheratznim, or two zagim, or one cheretz and one zag. For what halacha did the Merciful One write "from cheratznim to zag"? Learn from it to include and exclude, and there is a matter to learn from it: until one eats two cheratznim and a zag.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּדָרֵישׁ מִיעֵט וְרִיבָּה, פְּרָט וּכְלָל וּפְרָט מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, who interprets restriction and amplification from where does he a detail, a generalization, and a detail?
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar expounds from "mi'et" and "ribah," excluding and including and excluding - how does he derive it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵהַאי קְרָא: ״וְכִי יִתֵּן אִישׁ אֶל רֵעֵהוּ חֲמוֹר אוֹ שׁוֹר אוֹ שֶׂה״ — פָּרַט, ״וְכׇל בְּהֵמָה״ — כָּלַל, ״לִשְׁמוֹר״ — חָזַר וּפָרַט. פְּרָט וּכְלָל וּפְרָט, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְעֵין הַפְּרָט.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: He derives it from this verse, “And if a man deliver to his neighbor a donkey, or an ox, or a sheep, a detail; “or any animal” a generalization “to guard” detailed again. a detail, and a generalization, and a detail. you may deduce only similar to the detail;
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said, he derived from this verse: "If a man gives his neighbor a donkey, an ox, or a sheep" - this is a specification, "and any animal" - this is a generalization, "to keep" - he repeated and specified. Specification, generalization, and specification, you can only judge according to the nature of the specification.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵהַאי קְרָא: ״וְאִם מִן״ — פָּרַט. ״הַצֹּאן״ — כָּלַל, ״כְּבָשִׁים וְעִזִּים״ — חָזַר וּפָרַט,
human_translation: Rava said: derives from this verse: “and if from” a detail, “the flock” a generalization “Sheep,” and: “Goats,” detailed again.
llm_translation: Rava said: He derived it from this verse: "And if from" - excluding. "The flock" - inclusive, "of sheep and goats" - he repeated and excluded.

hebrew_text: פְּרָט וּכְלָל וּפָרַט, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְעֵין הַפְּרָט.
human_translation: a detail, and a generalization, and a detail, you may deduce only similar to the detail.
llm_translation: Detail and generalization and detail, if you judge only like the detail.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה מִדִּיסְקַרְתָּא לְרָבָא, וְלֵילַף מִן הָדֵין קְרָא: ״מִן״ — פָּרַט, ״הַבְּהֵמָה״ — כָּלַל, ״בָּקָר וָצֹאן״ — חָזַר וּפָרַט. פְּרָט וּכְלָל וּפְרָט, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְעֵין הַפְּרָט.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda of Diskarta said to Rava: And let derive from this verse, “From” a detail “animals” a generalization “Herd,” and: “Flock,” has detailed again. a detail, and a generalization, and a detail, you may deduce only similar to the detail,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yehudah from Diskarta to Rava, and he derived from the same verse: "from" - exclusion, "the animal" - inclusion, "cattle and sheep" - exclusion and inclusion. Exclusion, inclusion, and exclusion, you only judge according to the specific case.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִן הַאי לֵיכָּא לְמִשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, דְּאִי מֵהָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: ״הַבְּהֵמָה״ —
human_translation: said to cannot derive from this as if from there, I would say “animals”
llm_translation: He said to him: From this you can infer, for if from there, I would have said: "the animal" —

hebrew_text: חַיָּה בִּכְלַל בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: an undomesticated animal is included animal.
llm_translation: A living creature is included in the category of an animal.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חַיָּה בִּכְלַל בְּהֵמָה? הָא כְּתִיב ״בָּקָר וָצֹאן״, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ פְּרָט וּכְלָל, וְאִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְעֵין הַפְּרָט!
human_translation: said to an undomesticated animal is included animal? written: “Herd” and: “Flock,” and this is a detail, and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail,
llm_translation: He said to him: A wild animal is included in the category of domestic animal? But it is written "cattle and sheep," which provides for him a specific and a general category, and you should only judge according to the specific case!

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּהָכִי הוּא? דְּתַנְיָא:
human_translation: And from where do we that it is so, as it is taught
llm_translation: And from where do we know this? For it was taught:

hebrew_text: ״וְנָתַתָּ הַכֶּסֶף בְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר תְּאַוֶּה נַפְשְׁךָ״ — כָּלַל, ״בַּבָּקָר וּבַצֹּאן וּבַיַּיִן וּבַשֵּׁכָר״ — פָּרַט, ״וּבְכֹל אֲשֶׁר תִּשְׁאָלְךָ נַפְשֶׁךָ״ — חָזַר וְכָלַל.
human_translation: “And you shall bestow the money on all that your heart desires” a generalization, “on cattle, on sheep, on wine, and on strong drink” a detail, “On whatever your soul requests,” then generalized
llm_translation: "And you shall give the silver for all that your soul desires" - this is a general principle. "In cattle and in sheep and in wine and in strong drink" - this is a specification. "And in all that your soul may ask of you" - it repeated and included.

hebrew_text: כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט: מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ פְּרִי מִפְּרִי וְגִידּוּלֵי קַרְקַע — אַף כֹּל פְּרִי מִפְּרִי וְגִידּוּלֵי קַרְקַע.
human_translation: a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail. Just as the detail defined as the produce of produce, and grown from the ground, so too, all the produce of produce and are grown from the ground.
llm_translation: General and specific and general, if you judge only like the specific: just as the specific is explicit, fruit from fruit and growths of the soil — so too all fruit from fruit and growths of the soil.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל כְּעֵין פְּרָטָא דָּיְינִינַן, כְּלָלָא בָּתְרָא מַאי אַהֲנִי? אַהֲנִי לְאוֹסוֹפֵי כׇּל דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Now, a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, one derives like the detail what purpose does the last generalization purpose to add all that is similar to it,
llm_translation: From a general principle and a specific case, and a general principle similar to a specific case, we learn. What benefit is there in the final general principle? It benefits for all that are similar to it.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ: פְּרָט וּכְלָל וּפְרָט כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט דָּיְינִינַן, פְּרָטָא בָּתְרָאָה מַאי אַהֲנִי! אִי לָאו פְּרָטָא בָּתְרָאָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: נַעֲשֶׂה כְּלָל מוּסָף עַל הַפְּרָט.
human_translation: And furthermore, a detail, and a generalization, and a detail, one derives like the detail what purpose does the last detail If not the last detail, I would say the generalization becomes added to the detail,
llm_translation: And come: detail and general and detail like the detail we judge, detail after what is the benefit! If not detail after, I would say: let the general be an addition to the detail.

hebrew_text: וּמִכְּדֵי, תְּרֵין כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטָא וּתְרֵין פְּרָטֵי וּכְלָלָא — (כְּלָלָא) כְּעֵין פְּרָטָא דָּיְינִינַן, מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּינֵי וּבֵינֵי?
human_translation: And now two generalizations and a detail, and two details and a generalization, one derives like the detail what is there between this and that
llm_translation: And from that, two general and one specific, and two specific and one general - (general) like a specific that we evaluate, what is the difference between them?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאִילּוּ תַּרְתֵּין כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטָא, אִי אִיכָּא פְּרָטָא דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ אֲפִילּוּ בְּחַד צַד — מְרַבִּינַן, תְּרֵי פְּרָטֵי וּכְלָלָא, אִי אִיכָּא פְּרָטָא דְּדָמֵי מִשְּׁנֵי צְדָדִין — מְרַבִּינַן, בְּחַד צַד — לָא מְרַבִּינַן.
human_translation: There is as whereas two generalizations and a detail, if there is detail that is similar to even in one aspect, one includes two details and a generalization, if there is detail that is similar to in two aspects, one includes it. in one aspect one does not include
llm_translation: There is a case where if there are two general principles and a specific detail, if there is a detail that resembles one of the general principles even on one side - we expand the ruling. Two specific details and a general principle, if there is a detail that resembles both sides - we expand the ruling, if on one side - we do not expand the ruling.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי פְּרָט וּכְלָל — נַעֲשֶׂה כְּלָל מוּסָף עַל הַפְּרָט, וְאִיתְרַבִּי כֹּל מִילֵּי. וּמִיעֵט וְרִיבָּה נָמֵי — רִיבָּה הַכֹּל, וְאִיתְרַבִּי כֹּל מִילֵּי. מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין מִיעֵט וְרִיבָּה לִפְרָט וּכְלָל?
human_translation: Now, a detail and a generalization, the generalization becomes added to the detail, and all matters are included And restriction and amplification also amplifies everything, and all matters are included what is there between restriction and amplification and a detail and a generalization?
llm_translation: From the specific to the general — the general is made as an addition to the specific, and all matters are included. And from the particular to the general, and from the general to the particular — the general includes everything, and all matters are included. What is the difference between going from the particular to the general and from the general to the particular?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא, דְּאִילּוּ פְּרָט וּכְלָל — מְרַבִּינַן אֲפִילּוּ עָלִין וְלוּלָבִין. וּמִיעֵט וְרִיבָּה, לוּלָבִין — אִין, עָלִין — לָא.
human_translation: There is as whereas a detail and a generalization one includes even leaves and tendrils restriction and amplification tendrils, yes, leaves, no,
llm_translation: There is a case where, if it includes both specific and general — we include even 'alim and lulavin. But if it excludes and specifies, lulavin — no, 'alim — yes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל אִיסּוּרִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה אֵין הֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר, חוּץ מֵאִיסּוּרֵי נָזִיר, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״מִשְׁרַת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: all prohibitions that are in the Torah, a permitted does not combine with a forbidden except for the prohibitions of a nazirite, as the Torah said soaked
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Avahu said Rabbi Yochanan: All prohibitions in the Torah not permitted combined to prohibition, except for prohibitions of a Nazirite, as Torah said: "from wine."

hebrew_text: זְעֵירִי אָמַר: אַף שְׂאוֹר בְּבַל תַּקְטִירוּ. כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּדָרֵישׁ ״כֹּל״?
human_translation: Ze’eiri says: the prohibition against offering leaven as well, In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who derives kol
llm_translation: Zeiri said: Even leaven in Babylon you should burn. According to whom? According to Rabbi Elazar, who interprets "all."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי לְעִנְיַן חָמֵץ נָמֵי! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. אֶלָּא לְאַפּוֹקֵי מֵאַבָּיֵי דְּאָמַר: יֵשׁ הַקְטָרָה בְּפָחוֹת מִכְּזַיִת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: אֵין הַקְטָרָה בְּפָחוֹת מִכְּזַיִת.
human_translation: If so, to the matter of leavened bread also Yes, indeed it is so. Rather, to exclude of Abaye, who says: There is sacrificing less than an olive-bulk teaches us there is no sacrificing less than an olive-bulk,
llm_translation: So it is regarding vinegar, it is considered vinegar! It is not considered vinegar. Rather, to resolve the statement of our Rabbis who said: "There is incense in quantities less than the size of an olive," we understand: There is no incense in quantities less than the size of an olive.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב דִּימִי וְקָאָמַר לַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הַמִּקְפָּה שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, וְהַשּׁוּם וְהַשֶּׁמֶן שֶׁל חוּלִּין, וְנָגַע טְבוּל יוֹם בְּמִקְצָתָן — פָּסַל אֶת כּוּלָּן. מִקְפָּה שֶׁל חוּלִּין, וְהַשּׁוּם וְהַשֶּׁמֶן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, וְנָגַע טְבוּל יוֹם בְּמִקְצָתָן — לֹא פָּסַל אֶלָּא מְקוֹם מַגָּעוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Dimi sat and stated this halakha Abaye raised an objection to his the thick soup of teruma but the garlic and oil of non-sacred and one who immersed that day touched some of he disqualified all the thick soup produce of non-sacred but the garlic and the oil of teruma and one who immersed himself that day touched some of them, he disqualified only place that he touched.
llm_translation: Sitting Rav Dimi and saying to her that thing you heard. Abaye raised an objection: The covering of Terumah, and the garlic and the oil of common food, and if a Tevul Yom touched some of them — he invalidates all of them. The covering of common food, and the garlic and the oil of Terumah, and if a Tevul Yom touched some of them — he only invalidates the place of his touch.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: מְקוֹם מַגָּעוֹ אַמַּאי פָּסוּל? וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָה טַעַם — הוֹאִיל וְזָר לוֹקֶה עָלֶיהָ בִּכְזַיִת.
human_translation: And we discussed Why place that he touched disqualified? And Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: What is the reason due to a non-priest is flogged for an olive-bulk
llm_translation: And we ask in it: the place of its contact, why is it invalid? And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: What is the reason? Because a stranger touched it with a pitchfork.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ?
human_translation: What is reason
llm_translation: What is its reasoning?

hebrew_text: לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּהֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא, מַאי ״כְּזַיִת״ — דְּאִיכָּא כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס.
human_translation: not due to that the permitted combines with the forbidden said to him: No; what an olive-bulk that there is an olive-bulk to eat a half-loaf
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Lav mishum deheiteir mitztaref le'issur? Amar lei: La, mai 'kezayit' - de'ika kezayit bichdei achilat peras." English translation: "Is it not because the permitted item combines with the prohibited item? He said to him: No, what is 'like an olive' - that there is an olive's worth for the consumption of a half loaf."

hebrew_text: וַאֲכִילַת פְּרָס דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּכוּתָּח הַבַּבְלִי?
human_translation: But is to eat a half-loaf by Torah law, said to him: Yes. If so, why do the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Eliezer with regard to Babylonian kutaḥ ,
llm_translation: Eating a half-ripe date is from the Torah? He said to him: No. If so, why do the Rabbis argue with regard to the statement of Rabbi Elazar in the marketplace of Babylon?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַנַּח לְכוּתָּח הַבַּבְלִי, דְּלֵיכָּא כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס. אִי דְּקָא שָׂרֵיף לֵיהּ מִישְׂרָף — בָּטְלָה דַּעְתּוֹ אֵצֶל כׇּל אָדָם. אִי מִישְׁטָר קָא שָׁטַר — לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס.
human_translation: said to Leave Babylonian kutaḥ , as there is no olive-bulk to eat a half-loaf If by swallowing [ shareif ] it his intention is irrelevant by all people. if he dips [ shatar ] not found an olive-bulk in to eat a half-loaf
llm_translation: He said to him: Leave the Babylonian, for there is no olive in the measure of a Persian meal. If he is burning it from a burning one - his mind is nullified before all men. If he is a scribe, he will not forget the measure of an olive for a Persian meal.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: שְׁתֵּי מְדוֹכוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה וְאַחַת שֶׁל חוּלִּין. וּלְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי קְדֵירוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה וְאַחַת שֶׁל חוּלִּין, וְנָפְלוּ אֵלּוּ לְתוֹךְ אֵלּוּ — שְׁתֵּיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: חוּלִּין לְתוֹךְ חוּלִּין נָפְלוּ, וּתְרוּמָה לְתוֹךְ תְּרוּמָה נָפְלָה.
human_translation: raised an objection to two mortars, one for teruma and one for non-sacred before which two pots, one of teruma and one of non-sacred and these fell into these both are permitted; because I say, non-sacred fell into the non-sacred and teruma fell into the teruma .
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: Two pots, one of terumah and one of common food. And before him are two cauldrons, one of terumah and one of common food, and these fell into those — both are permitted, for I say: common food fell into common food, and terumah fell into terumah.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אַמַּאי אָמְרִינַן ״שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר״?
human_translation: And if it would enter your mind an olive-bulk to eat a half-loaf by Torah law, why do we say Because I say
llm_translation: If your mind arose like an olive in the measure of the eating of a Persian melon of the Torah, why do we say "that I say"?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי, הֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר? אַמַּאי אָמְרִינַן ״שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר״?! אֶלָּא הַנַּח לִתְרוּמַת תַּבְלִין דְּרַבָּנַן הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, what permitted combines with the forbidden why we say Because I say Rather, leave teruma from spices, is by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the reason that the excess joins with the prohibition? Why do we say "that I say"?! Rather, leave it for the terumah of spices, for it is a Rabbinic decree.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: שְׁתֵּי קוּפּוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה וְאַחַת שֶׁל חוּלִּין. וּלְפָנֵיהֶן שְׁתֵּי סְאִין, אַחַת שֶׁל חוּלִּין וְאַחַת שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, וְנָפְלוּ אֵלּוּ לְתוֹךְ אֵלּוּ — שְׁנֵיהֶן מוּתָּרִין. שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: חוּלִּין לְתוֹךְ חוּלִּין נָפְלוּ, תְּרוּמָה לְתוֹךְ תְּרוּמָה נָפְלָה.
human_translation: raised an objection to two baskets, one with teruma and one with non-sacred and before them two a se’a one of non-sacred and one of teruma , and these, fell into those, both permitted; because I say the non-sacred fell into the non-sacred and the teruma fell into the teruma .
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: Two baskets, one of terumah and one of common produce. And before them were placed two se'ahs, one of common produce and one of terumah, and these fell into those — both are permitted. For I say: Common produce fell into common produce, terumah fell into terumah.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס אָסוּר, אַמַּאי אָמְרִינַן ״שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר״?
human_translation: And if it would enter your mind an olive-bulk to eat a half-loaf prohibited why do we say Because I say
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind like an olive in the time it takes to eat a Persian meal is forbidden, why do we say "that I say"?

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי דְּאָמֵינָא מִשּׁוּם דְּהֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר, כְּגוֹן דִּנְפִישִׁי חוּלִּין. אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ דְּאָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס — כִּי נְפִישִׁי חוּלִּין מַאי הָוֵי?
human_translation: Granted, according to my as I say because permitted combines with forbidden where is more non-sacred However, according to your that you say because there is an olive-bulk to eat a half-loaf if is more non-sacred what of it?
llm_translation: In truth, according to my opinion, because the excess joins with the prohibition, such as a large piece of non-sacred meat. But according to your opinion, since there is an olive's bulk for the eating of a half loaf — what is the status of a large piece of non-sacred meat?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַנַּח לִתְרוּמָה בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: said to Leave teruma in the present, by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Leave it for the offering at this time of the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִמַּאי דְּהַאי ״מִשְׁרַת״ לְהֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר הוּא דַּאֲתָא? דִּילְמָא לִיתֵּן טַעַם כְּעִיקָּר הוּא דַּאֲתָא!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: From where that this soaked comes permitted combines with forbidden Perhaps it comes to establish flavor like substance.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: From what does this "serving" come to be joined with prohibition that it comes? Perhaps to give a reason as the essence it comes!

hebrew_text: וּלְאַבָּיֵי, מֵעִיקָּרָא קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ מַאי דְּקָאָמַר רַב דִּימִי, וְקָא מוֹתֵיב לֵיהּ כׇּל הָלֵין תְּיוּבָתָא. הֲדַר אֲמַר לֵיהּ, לִיתֵּן טַעַם כְּעִיקָּר?
human_translation: And according to Abaye, initially that which Rav Dimi said was difficult for him. and had objected all these refutations he then said to him establishes flavor like substance.
llm_translation: To Abbaye, from the outset it is difficult for him. What is it that Rav Dimi said, and he responded to him: "All these are secondary." Afterwards he said to him, "Shouldn't the reason be like the primary?"

hebrew_text: בָּתַר דְּשַׁנִּי לֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּילְמָא לִיתֵּן טַעַם כָּעִיקָּר הוּא דַּאֲתָא?
human_translation: After resolved he said perhaps comes to establish flavor like substance,
llm_translation: After he repeated it to him, he said to him: Perhaps he should give a reason as to why he came?

hebrew_text: לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״מִשְׁרַת״ לִיתֵּן טַעַם כְּעִיקָּר, שֶׁאִם שָׁרָה עֲנָבִים בְּמַיִם וְיֵשׁ בָּהֶן טַעַם יַיִן — חַיָּיב. וּמִכָּאן אַתָּה דָּן כׇּל אִיסּוּרִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: for that which is taught “soaked” to establish flavor like substance. As, if grapes in water and has the taste of wine, is liable And from here you derive to all prohibitions of the Torah;
llm_translation: The Tanna teaches: "If it serves to give flavor like the original, that if one soaks grapes in water and they have the flavor of wine - he is liable. And from here you can infer all prohibitions in the Torah."

hebrew_text: וּמָה נָזִיר שֶׁאֵין אִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם, וְאֵין אִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר הֲנָאָה, וְיֵשׁ הֶיתֵּר לְאִיסּוּרוֹ — עָשָׂה בּוֹ טַעַם כְּעִיקָּר. כִּלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם, שֶׁאִיסּוּרָן אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם, וְאִיסּוּרָן אִיסּוּר הֲנָיָיה, וְאֵין הֶיתֵּר לְאִיסּוּרָן — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה בּוֹ טַעַם כְּעִיקָּר?!
human_translation: And just as a nazirite, whose prohibition is not a permanent prohibition, and his prohibition is not a prohibition benefit and there is to permit his prohibition his rendered flavor like substance. diverse kinds in a vineyard, whose prohibition is a permanent prohibition and whose prohibition is a prohibition benefit, and there is no to permit their prohibition, is it not right that should render flavor like substance?
llm_translation: "And what is the case of a Nazirite whose prohibition is an eternal prohibition, and his prohibition is not a prohibition of benefit, and there is permission for his prohibition - he acted with a reason like the original. Like the laws of vineyards, whose prohibition is an eternal prohibition, and their prohibition is a prohibition of benefit, and there is no permission for their prohibition - is it not the law that he should act with a reason like the original?!"

hebrew_text: וְהוּא הַדִּין לְעׇרְלָה בִּשְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: And the same is true for the prohibition against eating the fruit of a tree during the first three years after its planting [ orla ], on two
llm_translation: And it is the same for Orlah with two.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ כִּי קָאָמַר לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּהָכָא, דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ שָׁרָה פִּיתּוֹ בְּיַיִן וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ כְּדֵי לְצָרֵף כְּזַיִת — חַיָּיב, וּמִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא הוּא דְּאִיכָּא כְּזַיִת בָּעֵינָא!
human_translation: One of the Sages said to When Rabbi Abbahu said of Rabbi Akiva. which Rabbi Akiva If we say Rabbi Akiva of this as we learned Rabbi Akiva says: Even a nazirite soaked his bread in wine, and contain to combine to an olive-bulk, he is liable; but from where Perhaps that when there is an olive-bulk as is,
llm_translation: He said to him, that certain sage from the rabbis: "Rabbi Avahu, when he was saying to Rabbi Akiva, 'Be Rabbi Akiva?' If you will say, Rabbi Akiva from here, as we learned: Rabbi Akiva says, 'Even if one soaks his bread in wine and it contains an olive's worth - he is liable.' And why? Perhaps it is because there is an olive's worth in his eyes!"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִתַּנָּא קַמָּא, דְּאָמַר: עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁתֶּה רְבִיעִית יַיִן!
human_translation: And if you would say: what of stating to exclude the first tanna , who said only if he drinks a quarter of wine.
llm_translation: And if you will say: What is meant to be said? To go out from the first teaching, as it says: "Until he drinks a revi'it of wine!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּבָרַיְיתָא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: נָזִיר שֶׁשָּׁרָה פִּתּוֹ בְּיַיִן, וְאָכַל כְּזַיִת מִפַּת וּמִיַּיִן — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Akiva in a baraita . As it is taught Rabbi Akiva says: A nazirite who soaked his bread in wine and ate an olive-bulk of bread and wine is liable.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Akiva of the school of Yavne. As it was taught: Rabbi Akiva says: A Nazirite who soaked his bread in wine, and ate an olive's bulk of bread and an olive's bulk of wine - is liable.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַוְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּקָא מוֹקֵים לֵיהּ לְהַאי ״וְכׇל מִשְׁרַת״ לְהֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר, לִיתֵּן טַעַם כְּעִיקָּר מְנָא לֵיהּ? יָלֵיף מִבָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב. לָאו טַעַם בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, וְאָסוּר? הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, said to Rav Ashi: According to Rabbi Akiva, who establishes “neither anything soaked” to permitted combines with the forbidden, from where does he flavor like substance He derives from meat in milk. not is merely taste and is prohibited? Here too, is no different,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rav Avya said to Rav Ashi: Regarding Rabbi Akiva who establishes the principle that "and any service" is included in the prohibition, what is the reason for his opinion? Should we derive it from "meat cooked in milk"? Is it not a mere reason and yet it is prohibited? Here too, it is no different.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, מִבָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב לָא גָּמְרִינַן, דְּחִידּוּשׁ הוּא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, we do not derive from meat in milk, as is a novelty,
llm_translation: And the Rabbis, from meat in milk not we conclude, for it is a novelty.

hebrew_text: מַאי חִידּוּשֵׁיהּ? אִילֵּימָא דְּהַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ וְהַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ שְׁרֵי, וּבַהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי אָסוּר, כִּלְאַיִם נָמֵי: הַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ שְׁרֵי וְהַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ שְׁרֵי, וּבַהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי אָסוּר!
human_translation: What is novelty If we say that that this alone and that alone permitted, and together they are forbidden, diverse kinds too, this alone and that alone permitted, and together they are forbidden.
llm_translation: What are its innovations? If you say that this one is for its own and that one is for its own, it is permitted, but when they are together, it is forbidden. Rather, it is obvious: this one is for its own and that one is for its own, but when they are together, it is forbidden!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דְּאִי תָּרוּ לֵיהּ כּוּלֵּי יוֹמָא בַּחֲלָבָא — שְׁרֵי, וּמְבַשֵּׁיל לֵיהּ בַּשּׁוֹלֵי — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rather, that if one soaks in milk all day, it is permitted one cooked is forbidden
llm_translation: Rather: if you soak it all day in milk - it is permitted, but if you cook it in hot water - it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נָמֵי, בָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב חִידּוּשׁ הוּא? אֶלָּא
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva too, meat in milk is a novelty. Rather,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva said, "Is meat cooked in milk a novelty? Rather..."

hebrew_text: יָלֵיף מִגִּיעוּלֵי גוֹיִם, דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״כׇּל דָּבָר אֲשֶׁר יָבֹא בָאֵשׁ״, לְמֵימְרָא דַּאֲסִירִי. גִּיעוּלֵי גוֹיִם לָאו טַעְמָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא וְאָסוּר, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: derives from of gentiles purging [ gi’ulei ], As the Merciful One states “Every thing that passes through the fire, That is to say that of gentiles purging are forbidden Isn’t mere taste And forbidden Here, too, is no different;
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "Yalif from the taxes of the nations, as the Merciful One said: 'Anything that comes into fire,' to say that it is prohibited. The taxes of the nations are not inherently forbidden, and here too it is not different."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי תִּיפּוֹק לְהוּ מִגִּיעוּלֵי גוֹיִם? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם חִידּוּשׁ הוּא. דְּהָא בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ נוֹתֵן טַעַם לִפְגָם מוּתָּר,
human_translation: And according to the Rabbis, let them also derive from gentiles purging, said to him: there is a novelty. As to all Torah, anything that gives flavor, tainted, permitted.
llm_translation: And for the sages, is it fitting to go out to the non-Jews? He said to him: There it is a novelty. For in the entire Torah, giving a reason for a blemish is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְגַבֵּי גִּיעוּלֵי גוֹיִם אָסוּר.
human_translation: But with regard to gentiles purging, forbidden.
llm_translation: And regarding the wine of idolaters, it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נָמֵי הָא חִידּוּשׁ הוּא! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִיָּיא: לֹא אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא לִקְדֵירָה בַּת יוֹמָא, דְּלָאו נוֹתֵן טַעַם לִפְגָם הוּא.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Akiva too, is a novelty. Rav Huna, son of Ḥiyya, said: The Torah prohibited only in a pot on that day, which is not gives flavor tainted.
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Akiva, it is a novelty! Rav Huna son of Hiyya said: The Torah only prohibited cooking on the festival day, for not giving taste is a blemish.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? קְדֵירָה בַּת יוֹמָא נָמֵי, אִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלָא פָּגְמָה פּוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis even a pot on that day, it is impossible that does not slightly taint
llm_translation: The sages? A pot on the day of its making is superior, for it is impossible that it did not spoil the food.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַוְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מִדְּרַבָּנַן נִשְׁמַע לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. לָאו אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הַאי ״מִשְׁרַת״ — לִיתֵּן טַעַם כְּעִיקָּר, וּמִכָּאן אַתָּה דָּן לְכׇל אִיסּוּרִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה. לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נָמֵי, דְּקָא מוֹקֵים לֵיהּ לְהַאי ״מִשְׁרַת״ לְהֶיתֵּר מִצְטָרֵף לְאִיסּוּר — לֵימָא מִכָּאן אַתָּה דָּן לְכׇל אִיסּוּרִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, said to Rav Ashi: From the Rabbis, we infer Rabbi Akiva. Don’t the Rabbis say “soaked” teaches flavor like substance from here you derive to all prohibitions of the Torah? According to Rabbi Akiva as well, who establishes this “Soaked,” as the permitted combines with the forbidden let us say from here you derive to all prohibitions of the Torah.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha son of Rav Avya said to Rav Ashi: From the Rabbis it is heard for Rabbi Akiva. Did the Rabbis not say this word "mishrat" - to give a reason like the essence, and from here you judge for all the prohibitions in the Torah. Also for Rabbi Akiva, who establishes this word "mishrat" to be permitted to join with a prohibition - let us say from here you judge for all the prohibitions in the Torah!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי נָזִיר וְחַטָּאת שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד, וְכׇל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין: נָזִיר — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. חַטָּאת מַאי הִיא?
human_translation: said to him: due to that a nazirite and a sin-offering two verses that come as one, and any two verses that come as one do not teach a nazirite that which we stated, a sin-offering, what is
llm_translation: He said to him: Because it is a Nazirite and a sin offering, two Scriptures that come as one, and any two Scriptures that come as one do not teach: Nazirite - this is what we said. What is a sin offering?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״כֹּל אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע בִּבְשָׂרָהּ יִקְדָּשׁ״. יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בָּלַע — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בִּבְשָׂרָהּ״, עַד שֶׁיִּבָּלַע בִּבְשָׂרָהּ.
human_translation: as it is taught “Anything that touches in its flesh shall become consecrated” might even if it did not absorb the verse states: “In its flesh,” until is absorbed within its flesh.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught in a Baraita: "Whatever touches her flesh shall be holy." One might have thought even if he did not swallow it - the Torah teaches: "in her flesh," meaning it must be swallowed in her flesh.

hebrew_text: ״יִקְדָּשׁ״ — לִהְיוֹת כָּמוֹהָ, שֶׁאִם פְּסוּלָה הִיא — יִפָּסֵל, וְאִם כְּשֵׁרָה — תֵּאָכֵל כֶּחָמוּר שֶׁבָּהּ.
human_translation: “Shall become consecrated,” becomes like that if is disqualified, will be disqualified. And if is valid, may be eaten in accordance with the more stringent of
llm_translation: "Yikdash" - to be like it, that if it is invalid - it will invalidate, and if it is valid - it shall be eaten like its strictest form.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי חַטָּאת, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: נָזִיר לָא אָתֵי מִינַּהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּנָזִיר מִקֳּדָשִׁים לָא יָלְפִינַן.
