human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rav Kahana, son of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, to her he becomes impure but he does not become impure to limbs. exclude an olive-bulk from a corpse, and an olive-bulk of fluid and a full spade of dust
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Rav Kahana, son of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, said: For her, she becomes ritually impure, but does not render impurity to others. This excludes a "kazayit" from a corpse, and a "kazayit" of roasted meat, and a "meloh tarvod" of decay. English translation: And it was taught: Rav Kahana, son of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, said: For her, she becomes ritually impure, but does not render impurity to others. This excludes a "kazayit" from a corpse, and a "kazayit" of roasted meat, and a "meloh tarvod" of decay.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יִטַּמֵּא לַשִּׁדְרָה וְלַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת וּלְרוֹב בִּנְיָינָהּ וּלְרוֹב מִנְיָינָהּ — כְּתִיב: ״וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵיהֶם״, הוֹסִיף לְךָ הַכָּתוּב טוּמְאָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: might he may not become impure for a spine and a skull, or for most of the skeleton or most of the number written and say to them” the verse added a different impurity
llm_translation: He is able not to become impure to the shedra and to the gulgoleth and to the majority of its construction and to the majority of its countenance — it is written: "And you shall say to them," the Scripture added for you another impurity.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יִטַּמֵּא לַשִּׁדְרָה וְלַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת וּלְרוֹב בִּנְיָינוֹ וּלְרוֹב מִנְיָינוֹ שֶׁל אֲחֵרִים. אָמַרְתָּ: מָה אֲחוֹתוֹ מְיוּחֶדֶת שֶׁגּוּפָה תָּלוּי בּוֹ, וּמִיטַּמֵּא לַשִּׁדְרָה וְלַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת וּלְרוֹב בִּנְיָינָהּ וּלְרוֹב מִנְיָינָהּ, אַף כֹּל שֶׁגּוּפוֹ תָּלוּי בּוֹ — מִיטַּמֵּא לַשִּׁדְרָה וְלַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת וּלְרוֹב בִּנְיָינוֹ וּלְרוֹב מִנְיָינוֹ.
human_translation: might he may not become impure to a spine, or for a skull, or to most of the skeleton or most of the number of other You say Just as his sister is unique that her body is dependent upon and he becomes impure to a spine, or to a skull, or to most of her skeleton, or to most of her number so too, every whose body is dependent upon him, he becomes impure to a spine, or to a skull, or to most of his skeleton, or to most of his number
llm_translation: Talmudic text: He is able not to become impure for the lintel, the threshold, the majority of its construction, and the majority of the construction of others. You said: His sister, who is connected to him, and he becomes impure for the lintel, the threshold, the majority of its construction, and the majority of its construction, so too, anyone whose body is connected to him - he becomes impure for the lintel, the threshold, the majority of its construction, and the majority of the construction. English translation:

hebrew_text: הָהִיא נָמֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא. וְרַב דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא דְּתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁמֵּת אָבִיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יִצְחָק בְּגִינְזַק, וּבָאוּ וְהוֹדִיעוּהוּ לְאַחַר שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, וּבָא וְשָׁאַל אֶת רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן אֱלִישָׁע וְאַרְבָּעָה זְקֵנִים [שֶׁעִמּוֹ],
human_translation: That also Rabbi Yehuda. And Rav stated in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught An incident which the father of Rabbi Yitzḥak died in Ginzak, and they came and informed him after three years and he came and asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Elisha and four Elders who were with him
llm_translation: That one, her name is Rabbi Yehuda. And Rav said, as this Tanna taught in a Baraita: There was an incident where the father of Rabbi Yitzchak died in Ginzaq, and they informed him after three years, and he came and asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Elisha and four elders who were with him.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרוּ: ״לְאָבִיו״ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּא שָׁלֵם, וְלֹא בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּא חָסֵר.
human_translation: And they said “For his father” when is whole, and not when he is lacking.
llm_translation: And they said: "to his father" - when he is whole, and not when he is lacking.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִינִין אֲסוּרִין בַּנָּזִיר: הַטּוּמְאָה, וְהַתִּגְלַחַת, וְהַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַגֶּפֶן. חוֹמֶר בַּטּוּמְאָה וּבַתִּגְלַחַת מִבַּיּוֹצֵא מִן הַגֶּפֶן, שֶׁהַטּוּמְאָה וְהַתִּגְלַחַת — סוֹתְרִין, וְהַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַגֶּפֶן — אֵינוֹ סוֹתֵר.
human_translation: Three types are prohibited for a nazirite: ritual impurity and shaving and that emerge from the vine. stricture with regard to impurity and shaving than that emerge from the vine, as impurity and shaving negate But that emerges from the vine, does not negate
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Three things are prohibited for a Nazirite: impurity, shaving, and deriving benefit from grapes. The stringency of impurity and shaving is greater than that of deriving benefit from grapes, for impurity and shaving invalidate the Nazirite vow, whereas deriving benefit from grapes does not invalidate it.

hebrew_text: חוֹמֶר בַּיּוֹצֵא מִן הַגֶּפֶן מִבַּטּוּמְאָה וּבַתִּגְלַחַת, שֶׁהַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַגֶּפֶן לֹא הוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ, וְטוּמְאָה וְתִגְלַחַת הוּתְּרוּ מִכְּלָלָן בְּתִגְלַחַת מִצְוָה וּבְמֵת מִצְוָה.
human_translation: stricture with regard to that emerge from the vine than impurity and shaving, as that emerge from the vine nothing is exempted from its general prohibition But impurity and shaving are exempted from their general prohibition. of obligatory shaving, and of a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ].
llm_translation: Material that comes from the grapevine, whether in its natural state or shaven, that which comes from the grapevine is not permitted at all, but natural and shaven are permitted from the general rule, in shaving it is a commandment and in a corpse it is a commandment.

hebrew_text: וְחוֹמֶר בַּטּוּמְאָה מִבַּתִּגְלַחַת, שֶׁהַטּוּמְאָה סוֹתֶרֶת אֶת הַכֹּל, וְחַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ קׇרְבָּן. וְתִגְלַחַת אֵינָהּ סוֹתֶרֶת אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשִׁים, וְאֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: And stricture with regard to impurity than shaving, as impurity negates all and he is liable to an offering for it, But shaving negates only thirty and he is not liable to an offering for it.
llm_translation: And a stringency in impurity from a bald patch, for impurity nullifies everything, and one is obligated to bring a sacrifice for it. But a bald patch only nullifies thirty, and one is not obligated to bring a sacrifice for it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְטוּמְאָה לֹא תּוּתַּר מִכְּלָלָהּ, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִיַּיִן: וּמָה יַיִן שֶׁאֵינוֹ סוֹתֵר לֹא הוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ, טוּמְאָה שֶׁסּוֹתֶרֶת — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תּוּתַּר מִכְּלָלָהּ?
human_translation: And ritual impurity should not be exempted from its general prohibition an a fortiori from wine: And if wine, as it does not negate is not exempted from its general prohibition, impurity, as it does negate is it not logical that it should not be exempted from its general prohibition?
llm_translation: Gemara: And impurity will not be permitted from its entirety, a fortiori from wine: And just as wine that does not nullify is not permitted from its entirety, impurity that nullifies - is it not logical that it will not be permitted from its entirety?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ לֹא יִטַּמָּא״. לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ לֹא יִטַּמָּא, אֲבָל מִיטַּמֵּא הוּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה.
human_translation: the verse states, “For his father or his mother, he shall not become impure to his father or for his mother he may not become impure; however, he becomes impure to a met mitzva .
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "To his father and to his mother he shall not become impure." To his father and to his mother he shall not become impure, but he becomes impure for a deceased relative as a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: וְיַיִן יוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִטּוּמְאָה: מַה טוּמְאָה שֶׁהִיא סוֹתֶרֶת — הוּתְּרָה מִכְּלָלָהּ, יַיִן שֶׁאֵינוֹ סוֹתֵר — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיּוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ? אָמַר קְרָא: ״מִיַּיִן וְשֵׁכָר יַזִּיר״, לֶאֱסוֹר יֵין מִצְוָה כְּיֵין רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: And let wine be exempted from its general prohibition an a fortiori from impurity: If impurity, which negates exempted from its general prohibition; wine, which does not negate is it not logical that it should be exempted from its general prohibition the verse states “He shall abstain from wine and strong drink” to prohibit obligatory wine like optional wine.
llm_translation: And wine more than its general category, light and heavy than impurity: Just as impurity that it nullifies — permitted from its general category, wine that does not nullify — is it not the law that it is permitted from its general category? The verse says: "From wine and strong drink he shall abstain," to prohibit wine of mitzvah like wine of permission.

hebrew_text: וְיַיִן יִסְתּוֹר אֶת הַכֹּל, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִטּוּמְאָה: מָה טוּמְאָה שֶׁהוּתְּרָה מִכְּלָלָהּ — סוֹתֶרֶת אֶת הַכֹּל, יַיִן שֶׁלֹּא הוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁיִּסְתּוֹר?
human_translation: And let wine negate all an a fortiori from impurity: If impurity, which is exempted from its general prohibition, negates all wine, which is not exempted from its general prohibition, is it not all the more so that it should negate
llm_translation: "And wine will conceal everything, a fortiori from impurity: Just as impurity that was permitted from its entirety — nullifies everything, wine that was not permitted from its entirety — all the more so that it will conceal?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהַיָּמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים יִפְּלוּ כִּי טָמֵא נִזְרוֹ״, טוּמְאָה סוֹתֶרֶת וְאֵין הַיַּיִן סוֹתֵר.
human_translation: the verse states: “But the former days shall be void, for his naziriteship was rendered impure” impurity negates and wine does not negate
llm_translation: The verse says: "And the former days shall be void, because his consecration was defiled." Impurity nullifies, but wine does not nullify.

hebrew_text: וְהַתִּגְלַחַת תִּסְתּוֹר אֶת הַכֹּל, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִטּוּמְאָה: וּמָה טוּמְאָה שֶׁלֹּא עָשׂוּ בָּהּ מְטַמֵּא כַּמִּיטַּמֵּא — סוֹתֶרֶת אֶת הַכֹּל, תִּגְלַחַת, שֶׁעָשׂוּ בָּהּ מְגַלֵּחַ כַּמִּתְגַּלֵּחַ — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁתִּסְתּוֹר אֶת הַכֹּל?
human_translation: And let shaving negate all an a fortiori from impurity: And if impurity, in which the one who renders impure is not like the one who becomes impure, negates all shaving, in which the one who shaves is like the one who is shaved, is it not logical that it should negate all
llm_translation: The shaving hides everything, a fortiori from impurity: And just as impurity that was not done in it makes impure like impurity that was done in it - it hides everything, shaving, that was done in it like one who shaves - is it not logical that it should hide everything?

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהַיָּמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים יִפְּלוּ כִּי טָמֵא נִזְרוֹ״, טוּמְאָה סוֹתֶרֶת אֶת הַכֹּל, וְאֵין תִּגְלַחַת סוֹתֶרֶת אֶת הַכֹּל.
human_translation: the verse states: “But the former days shall be void, for his naziriteship was rendered impure” impurity negates all, and shaving does not negate all.
llm_translation: The verse says: "And the former days shall fall, for his consecration is defiled." Impurity invalidates everything, but shaving does not invalidate everything.

hebrew_text: וְטוּמְאָה נַעֲשֶׂה בָּהּ מְטַמֵּא כַּמִּיטַּמֵּא, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִתִּגְלַחַת: וּמָה תִּגְלַחַת שֶׁאֵינָהּ סוֹתֶרֶת אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשִׁים — עָשָׂה בָּהּ מְגַלֵּחַ כַּמִּתְגַּלֵּחַ, טוּמְאָה, שֶׁהִיא סוֹתֶרֶת אֶת הַכֹּל — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשֶׂה בָּהּ מְטַמֵּא כַּמִּיטַּמֵּא?
human_translation: But impurity, let the one who renders impure be like the one who becomes impure, an a fortiori from shaving: If shaving, which negates only thirty the one who shaves is like the one who is shaved; impurity, which negates all, is it not logical that the one who renders impure should be like the one who becomes impure?
llm_translation: "And impure it becomes in it impurifies like impurifies, light and heavy from shaving: and what shaving that it does not nullify except thirty — he did in it shaving like shaves, impure, that it nullifies everything — is it not the law that impure it becomes in it impurifies like impurifies?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְטִמֵּא רֹאשׁ נִזְרוֹ״, לִמְטַמֵּא רֹאשׁ נִזְרוֹ.
human_translation: the verse states: and he renders impure his consecrated head” to one who renders impure his consecrated head,
llm_translation: The verse says: "And he shall defile the head of his consecration," to defile the head of his consecration.

hebrew_text: וְתִגְלַחַת לֹא נַעֲשֶׂה בָּהּ מְגַלֵּחַ כַּמִּתְגַּלֵּחַ, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִטּוּמְאָה: וּמָה טוּמְאָה, שֶׁהִיא סוֹתֶרֶת אֶת הַכֹּל — לֹא עָשׂוּ בָּהּ מְטַמֵּא כַּמִּיטַּמֵּא, תִּגְלַחַת, שֶׁאֵינָהּ סוֹתֶרֶת אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁלֹּא נַעֲשֶׂה מְגַלֵּחַ כַּמִּתְגַּלֵּחַ?
human_translation: But And shaving, let the one who shaves not be like the one who is shaved, an a fortiori from impurity: And if impurity, which negates all the one who renders impure is not like the one who becomes impure; shaving, which negates only thirty days, not all the more so that one who shaves should not be like the one who is shaved?
llm_translation: And shaving not done in it with a razor as one who shaves, a fortiori from impurity: And what is impurity, that it nullifies everything - not done in it making impure as one who makes impure, shaving, which only nullifies for thirty days - all the more so that shaving not done as one who shaves?

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״תַּעַר לֹא יַעֲבוֹר עַל רֹאשׁוֹ״, קְרִי בֵּיהּ: לֹא יַעֲבוֹר הוּא, וְלֹא יַעֲבוֹר לְאַחֵר.
human_translation: the verse states: “No razor shall come upon his head” read into he, shall not come upon and to other shall not come upon
llm_translation: The verse says: "A razor shall not pass over his head." Read it as: "He shall not pass over," and not pass over to another.

hebrew_text: וְתִגְלַחַת לֹא תּוּתַּר מִכְּלָלָהּ, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִיַּיִן: וּמָה יַיִן שֶׁאֵינוֹ סוֹתֵר — לֹא הוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ, תִּגְלַחַת שֶׁסּוֹתֶרֶת — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תּוּתַּר מִכְּלָלָהּ? אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״רֹאשׁוֹ״, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״זְקָנוֹ״.
human_translation: And let shaving not be exempted from its general prohibition an a fortiori from wine: And if wine, which does not negate is not exempted from its general prohibition; shaving, which does negate is it not logical that it should not be exempted from its general prohibition? the Merciful One states his head” And the Merciful One states: his beard,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And the beard shall not be destroyed from its entirety, a fortiori from wine: And just as wine that does not negate — it is not destroyed from its entirety, a beard that negates — is it not a law that it should not be destroyed from its entirety? The Merciful One said: "His head," and the Merciful One said: "His beard." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְתִגְלַחַת לֹא תִּסְתּוֹר כְּלָל, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִיַּיִן: וּמָה יַיִן שֶׁלֹּא הוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ — אֵינוֹ סוֹתֵר, תִּגְלַחַת שֶׁהוּתְּרָה מִכְּלָלָהּ — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תִּסְתּוֹר? בָּעִינַן גִּידּוּל שֵׂעָר, וְהָא לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: And let shaving not negate at all, an a fortiori from wine: And if wine, which is not exempted from its general prohibition, does not negate shaving, which is exempted from its general prohibition, is it not logical that it should not negate We require hair growth, and there is none
llm_translation: And shaving not will cover at all, light and heavy from wine: and what wine that not permitted from its entirety — it does not negate, shaving that permitted from its entirety — it is not the same as not will cover? We require the growth of hair, and there is none.

hebrew_text: וְיַיִן יִסְתּוֹר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִתִּגְלַחַת: וּמָה תִּגְלַחַת שֶׁהוּתְּרָה מִכְּלָלָהּ — סוֹתֶרֶת, יַיִן, שֶׁלֹּא הוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיִּסְתּוֹר? מִידֵּי הוּא טַעְמָא אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם גִּידּוּל שֵׂעָר, גַּבֵּי יַיִן הָא קָאֵים שְׂעָרוֹ.
human_translation: And let wine negate thirty days, an a fortiori from shaving: And if shaving, which is exempted from its general prohibition, negates wine, which is not exempted from its general prohibition, is it not logical that it should negate As that reason only due to hair growth, with regard to wine, his hair remains
llm_translation: Wine will be covered for thirty days, a fortiori from shaving: And what is the law of shaving that it is permitted from its category — it is a contradiction, wine, that was not permitted from its category — is it not the law that it should be covered? It is immediately a reason, but because of the growth of hair, regarding wine, its hair stands.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ תִּגְלַחַת טוּמְאָה כֵּיצַד? הָיָה מַזֶּה בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי וּבַשְּׁבִיעִי וּמְגַלֵּחַ בַּשְּׁבִיעִי, וּמֵבִיא קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו בַּשְּׁמִינִי. וְאִם גִּילַּח בַּשְּׁמִינִי — מֵבִיא קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: מָה בֵּין זֶה לִמְצוֹרָע?
human_translation: shaving of ritual impurity how would sprinkle on the third and the seventh And he shaves on the seventh and brings his offerings on the eighth And if he shaved on the eighth he brings his offerings on that day, the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Tarfon said to him: What is between this and a leper?
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Shaving impurity, how so? If one shaves on the third and seventh days, and shaves on the seventh day, and brings his sacrifices on the eighth day. And if he shaves on the eighth day - he brings his sacrifices on that day, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Tarfon said to him: What is the difference between this and a metzora?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: זֶה טׇהֳרָתוֹ תְּלוּיָה בְּיָמָיו, וּמְצוֹרָע טׇהֳרָתוֹ תְּלוּיָה בְּתִגְלַחְתּוֹ. וְאֵינוֹ מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה מְעוֹרַב שֶׁמֶשׁ.
human_translation: said to him: The purification of this depends on his days, But a leper, his purification depends on his shaving. And brings offering only if the sun has set
llm_translation: He said to him: "This is his purification dependent on his days, and the leper's purification is dependent on his shaving. And he does not bring an offering unless he was mixed with the sun."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קַיבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ אוֹ לָא? תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּתָנֵי הִלֵּל: גִּילַּח בַּשְּׁמִינִי — מֵבִיא קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו בַּתְּשִׁיעִי. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ קַיבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ, לַיְתֵי קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו בַּשְּׁמִינִי!
human_translation: accept from or not Come hear that Hillel taught: shaved on the eighth he brings his offerings on the ninth. And if it should enter your mind accepted from let bring his offerings on the eighth
llm_translation: Gemara: Did she accept it or not? Come and hear: For Hillel taught: If he shaved on the eighth day, he brings his sacrifices on the ninth. And if you were to suggest that she accepted it, he should bring his sacrifices on the eighth!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּטָבַל בַּשְּׁבִיעִי, הָא — דְּלֹא טָבַל בַּשְּׁבִיעִי.
human_translation: Rava said: not difficult, this who immersed on the seventh that who did not immerse on the seventh.
llm_translation: Rava said, it is not difficult: this one — who immersed on the seventh day, this one — who did not immerse on the seventh day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אַשְׁכַּחְתִּינְהוּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן בַּר הוֹשַׁעְיָא דְּיָתְבִין וְקָאָמְרִין: ״וּבָא לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֶל פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד וּנְתָנָם אֶל הַכֹּהֵן״, אֵימָתַי הוּא [בָּא]? בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּא טָבַל וְעָשָׂה הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ — אִין, לֹא טָבַל וְעָשָׂה הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ — לָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: I encountered the assembly of Rav Natan bar Hoshaya sitting and saying and come before the Lord to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and give them to the priest” When he come when he has immersed and performed sunset. yes, has not immersed and performed sunset, no,
llm_translation: Abaye said: I found them discussing among the colleagues of Rav Natan bar Hoshaya who were sitting and saying: "And he shall come before the Lord to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and give them to the kohen." When is this fulfilled? When he immerses and performs the evening service - yes; if he does not immerse and perform the evening service - no.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא קָסָבַר טְבוּל יוֹם שֶׁל זָב — כְּזָב דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Apparently, maintains one who immersed himself that day of a zav is considered like zav .
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Alma kasavar tevul yom shel zav - kezav damei." English translation: "The reason he holds that a tevul yom of a zav is like the blood of a zav."

hebrew_text: אָמֵינָא לְהוֹן אֲנָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה גַּבֵּי נָזִיר טָמֵא נָמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״(וְהֵבִיא אוֹתָם) אֶל הַכֹּהֵן אֶל פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״. אֵימָתַי הוּא [בָּא] — בִּזְמַן שֶׁטָּבַל וְעָשָׂה הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ.
human_translation: I said to If that is so, with regard to an impure nazirite too, as it is written: And he shall bring them, to the priest, to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting” When he come When he has immersed and performed sunset.
llm_translation: I said to them: Rather, from now on, regarding a defiled Nazirite, he is considered impure, as it is written: "(And he shall bring them) to the priest, to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting." When is this applicable? - When he immersed and made the evening sun.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי שַׁעֲרֵי נִיקָנוֹר הֵיכָא קָיְימִין — בְּשַׁעֲרֵי לְוִיָּיה.
human_translation: Now the Gate of Nicanor, where is it located? In the gates of the Levites.
llm_translation: From where are the gates of Nikanor standing? In the gates of the Levites.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: טְמֵא מֵת מוּתָּר לִיכָּנֵס בְּמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּיה, וְלֹא טְמֵא מֵת בִּלְבַד אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ מֵת עַצְמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף עִמּוֹ״, מַאי ״עִמּוֹ״ — עִמּוֹ בִּמְחִיצָתוֹ, עִמּוֹ בְּמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּיה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught impure a corpse is permitted to enter the Levite camp; and not only one impure a corpse, but even a corpse itself as it is stated: “And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him” What is “with him”? “with him” within boundary, with him in the Levite camp.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: One who is impure due to contact with a dead body is permitted to enter the camp of the Levites, and not only one impure due to contact with a dead body, but even if he himself is dead, as it is stated: "And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him." What is meant by "with him"? — With him in his partition, with him in the camp of the Levites.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא (אָמַר אַבָּיֵי): טְבוּל יוֹם שֶׁל זָב — כְּזָב דָּמֵי. וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, כֵּיוָן דִּמְחוּסַּר כַּפָּרָה — לָא עָיֵיל.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye says: One who immersed himself that day of a zav , is considered like a zav But even so, since lacking atonement, may not enter
llm_translation: Rather (Abaye) said: A Tevul Yom of a Zav - like the blood of a Zav. And even so, since he lacks atonement - it does not come.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בְּמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּיה קָאֵי, אַמַּאי קָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״? לְמֵימְרָא: מָה הָתָם — מְחוּסַּר כַּפָּרָה לָא עָיֵיל, אַף לְמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּיה נָמֵי — מְחוּסַּר כַּפָּרָה לָא עָיֵיל.
human_translation: and if he is standing in the Levite camp, why does call it “the Tent of Meeting”? to say: Just as there, one who is lacking atonement may not enter so too, the Levite camp as well, one who is lacking atonement may not enter
llm_translation: In the camp of the Levites he stands, why is it called "Tent of Meeting" for him? To say: Just as there, if lacking atonement, he does not enter, so too in the camp of the Levites, if lacking atonement, he does not enter.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם מְנָלַן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״טָמֵא יִהְיֶה״ — לְרַבּוֹת טְבוּל יוֹם, ״עוֹד טוּמְאָתוֹ בּוֹ״ — לְרַבּוֹת מְחוּסַּר כַּפָּרָה.
human_translation: And from where do we there, As it is taught “he shall be impure” to include one who immersed himself that day “His impurity is yet upon him” to include one who lacks atonement,
llm_translation: And there, how do we derive it? For it was taught: "He shall remain impure" - to include one who has immersed that day; "His uncleanness is still upon him" - to include one who lacks atonement.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ תִּגְלַחַת הַטׇּהֳרָה כֵּיצַד? הָיָה מֵבִיא שָׁלֹשׁ בְּהֵמוֹת: חַטָּאת, עוֹלָה, וּשְׁלָמִים. וְשׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַשְּׁלָמִים וּמְגַלֵּחַ עֲלֵיהֶם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיָה מְגַלֵּחַ אֶלָּא עַל הַחַטָּאת, שֶׁהַחַטָּאת קוֹדֶמֶת בְּכׇל מָקוֹם. וְאִם גִּלַּח עַל אַחַת מִשְּׁלׇשְׁתָּן — יָצָא.
human_translation: shaving of purity how He would bring three animals: a sin-offering, a burnt-offering, and a peace-offering. And he slaughters the peace-offering and shaves after them. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Elazar says: He would shave only after the sin-offering, as the sin-offering precedes in all places, And if he shaved after one of the three of them, he has fulfilled
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How is the shaving of the purification offering performed? One would bring three animals: a sin offering, a burnt offering, and peace offerings. And one would slaughter the peace offerings and shave over them, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Elazar says: He would only shave over the sin offering, for the sin offering takes precedence everywhere. And if he shaved over any one of the three - he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הֵבִיא שָׁלֹשׁ בְּהֵמוֹת וְלֹא פֵּירֵשׁ, הָרְאוּיָה לְחַטָּאת — תִּקְרַב חַטָּאת, לְעוֹלָה — תִּקְרַב עוֹלָה, לִשְׁלָמִים — תִּקְרַב שְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: brought three animals without specifying that is fit for a sin-offering, is sacrificed as a sin-offering; for a burnt-offering, is sacrificed as a burnt-offering; for a peace-offering, is sacrificed as a peace-offering.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He brought three animals and did not specify, if fit for sin offering — bring a sin offering, for burnt offering — bring a burnt offering, for peace offering — bring a peace offering.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְגִלַּח הַנָּזִיר פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד וְגוֹ׳״, בִּשְׁלָמִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּשְׁחָטוֹ פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״.
human_translation: The Sages taught “And the nazirite shall shave at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting” the verse is speaking of the peace-offering, as it is stated: and he shall slaughter it at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting”
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And the Nazirite shall shave the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, etc." In peace offerings the Scripture speaks, as it is said: "And they shall slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting."

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בִּשְׁלָמִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד מַמָּשׁ? אָמַרְתָּ: אִם כֵּן — דֶּרֶךְ בִּזָּיוֹן הוּא.
human_translation: you say the verse is speaking of the peace-offering, Or it is only the actual entrance to the Tent of Meeting, You say If so, that is a degrading manner
llm_translation: You say in regards to peace offerings, does the verse speak, or is it specifically the entrance of the Tent of Meeting itself? You said: If so — it is a way of disgrace.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״לֹא תַעֲלֶה בְמַעֲלוֹת עַל מִזְבְּחִי״, קַל וָחוֹמֶר לְדֶרֶךְ בִּזָּיוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoshiya says: not necessary, as the Torah states: you shall not ascend by steps to My altar, an a fortiori in a degrading manner
llm_translation: Rabbi Yoshiyah says: It is not necessary, for the Torah has said, "You shall not ascend with steps upon My altar," a fortiori for the way of disgrace.

hebrew_text: [נ״‎א בַּמִּדְרָשׁ בְּפָרָשָׁה נָשֹׂא (דַּף רמ״‎ב): ״וְגִלַּח הַנָּזִיר״, רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁלָמִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. אוֹ אֵינוֹ וְכוּ׳. אִם כָּךְ, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״לֹא תַעֲלֶה וְכוּ׳״ — קַל וָחוֹמֶר לַדָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא יְגַלֵּחַ פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד, אֶלָּא בִּשְׁלָמִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.]
human_translation: A different version in the midrash to the portion of Naso . “And the nazirite shall shave Rabbi Yoshiya says: The verse is speaking of the peace-offering. Or it is only If so, the Torah said: you shall not ascend an a fortiori to matter that he should not shave entrance to the Tent of Meeting. Rather, the verse is speaking of the peace-offering.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In the Midrash on Parashat Naso (page 42): "And the Nazirite shall shave," Rabbi Yoshiyah says: The Scripture speaks of peace offerings. Or is it not so, and so forth. If this is the case, the Torah said, "He shall not go out," and so forth - an a fortiori argument for the matter that one should not shave the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, except in the case of peace offerings the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְלָקַח אֶת שְׂעַר רֹאשׁ נִזְרוֹ וְנָתַן עַל הָאֵשׁ וְגוֹ׳״, מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְחוּסָּר אֶלָּא לְקִיחָה וּנְתִינָה. יָצָא זֶה, שֶׁהוּא מְחוּסָּר לְקִיחָה, הֲבָאָה, וּנְתִינָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: not necessary as states “And he shall take the hair of his consecrated head and put it on the fire one who has not yet only taking and placing excludes this one, as he has not yet taking, bringing and placing
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak says: It is not necessary. Behold, it says: "And he shall take the hair of the head of his Nazirite vow and put it on the fire, etc." One who is lacking only in taking and giving. This one is exempt, as he is lacking in taking. Coming in, and giving.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, רַבִּי יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁלָמִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בִּשְׁלָמִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד מַמָּשׁ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְלָקַח אֶת שְׂעַר רֹאשׁ נִזְרוֹ״, מְקוֹם שֶׁהָיָה מְבַשֵּׁל — שָׁם הָיָה מְגַלֵּחַ.
human_translation: Some say Rabbi Yitzḥak says: The verse is referring to the peace-offering. you say the verse is speaking of the peace-offering, or is it only the actual entrance to the Tent of Meeting? The verse states: “And he shall take the hair of his consecrated head place where he would cook there he would shave.
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rabbi Yitzchak says: The Scripture speaks regarding peace offerings. Do you say the Scripture speaks regarding peace offerings, or is it only referring to the entrance of the Tabernacle itself? The Talmud teaches: "And he shall shave his consecrated head," in the place where he cooked - there he shaves.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא חָנָן אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: ״וְגִלַּח הַנָּזִיר פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאֵין פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד פָּתוּחַ — אֵינוֹ מְגַלֵּחַ.
human_translation: Abba Ḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer “And the nazirite shall shave at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting” as long as the entrance to the Tent of Meeting is not open, he may not shave.
llm_translation: Abba Hanan says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: "And the Nazirite shall shave the entrance of the Tent of Meeting." As long as the entrance of the Tent of Meeting is not open - he does not shave.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי אוֹמֵר: ״וְגִלַּח הַנָּזִיר פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״, וְלֹא נְזִירָה,
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: “And the nazirite shall shave at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting” and not a female nazirite.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: "And the Nazirite shall shave the entrance of the Tent of Meeting," and not the Nazirite.

hebrew_text: שֶׁמָּא יִתְגָּרוּ בָּהּ פִּרְחֵי כְהוּנָּה. אָמַר לוֹ: לִדְבָרֶיךָ סוֹטָה תּוֹכִיחַ, דִּכְתִיב בָּהּ ״וְהֶעֱמִידָהּ לִפְנֵי ה׳״, וְלָא חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא יִתְגָּרוּ בָּהּ פִּרְחֵי כְהוּנָּה!
human_translation: lest young priests [ pirḥei khehuna ] will become aroused by her said to According to your statement, a sota will prove as it is written with regard to her: “And he shall set her before the Lord” and we are not concerned perhaps young priests will become aroused by her
llm_translation: Perhaps the flowers of the priesthood will rebel against her. He said to him: By your words shall you rebuke a suspected adulteress, as it is written in her, "And he shall stand her before the Lord," and we are not concerned that the flowers of the priesthood will rebel against her!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: זוֹ כּוֹחֶלֶת וּפוֹקֶסֶת, זוֹ אֵינָהּ כּוֹחֶלֶת וּפוֹקֶסֶת.
human_translation: said to them: This paints blue [ koḥelet ] and applies blush [ fokeset ] that does not apply blue and apply blush.
llm_translation: He said to them: "This is kochellet and pokezet, this is not kochellet and pokezet."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה נוֹטֵל שְׂעַר רֹאשׁ נִזְרוֹ וּמְשַׁלֵּחַ תַּחַת הַדּוּד. וְאִם גִּילַּח בַּמְּדִינָה — לֹא הָיָה מְשַׁלֵּחַ תַּחַת הַדּוּד. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? בְּתִגְלַחַת הַטׇּהֳרָה, אֲבָל בְּתִגְלַחַת הַטּוּמְאָה — לֹא הָיָה מְשַׁלֵּחַ תַּחַת הַדּוּד.
human_translation: he would take the hair of his consecrated head and throw under the pot And if shaved in the country, he would not throw under the pot. In what is this statement said? with regard to the shaving of purity. However, with regard to the shaving of impurity, he would not throw under the pot
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one would take the hair of his Nazirite vow and shave it beneath the cauldron, and if he shaved it in the province, he would not be required to shave it beneath the cauldron. In what case are these words said? In the case of shaving for purity, but in the case of shaving for impurity, he would not be required to shave it beneath the cauldron.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הַכֹּל מְשַׁלְּחִין תַּחַת הַדּוּד, חוּץ מִן הַטָּמֵא שֶׁבַּמְּדִינָה בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Everyone throws under the pot, except for an impure who shaved in the the country. alone
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: All send under the pot, except for the impure one in the province alone.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ נוֹטֵל שְׂעַר רֹאשׁ נִזְרוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹטֵל אֶת הָרוֹטֶב וְנוֹתֵן עַל שְׂעַר רֹאשׁ נִזְרוֹ, וּמְשַׁלֵּחַ תַּחַת הַדּוּד שֶׁל שְׁלָמִים. וְאִם שִׁילַּח תַּחַת הַדּוּד שֶׁל חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם — יָצָא. אָשָׁם בְּנָזִיר [טָהוֹר] מִי אִיכָּא? אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְאִם נָזִיר טָמֵא מְשַׁלֵּחַ תַּחַת הַדּוּד שֶׁל אָשָׁם — יָצָא.
human_translation: take the hair of his consecrated head. The Sages taught: And afterward, takes the gravy [ rotev ] places on the hair of his consecrated head, and throws under the pot of peace-offering. And if he threw under the pot of sin-offering or guilt-offering, he has fulfilled Is there a guilt-offering by a pure nazirite? Rava said this is what said, And if an impure nazirite threw under the pot of guilt-offering, he has fulfilled
llm_translation: Gemara: One takes the hair of his Nazirite vow. The Rabbis taught: And afterwards he takes the moistening of the offering and places it on the hair of his Nazirite vow, and sends it beneath the pot of peace offerings. And if he sent it beneath the pot of sin and guilt offerings - he has fulfilled his obligation. In the case of a Nazirite who is pure, what is there to discuss? Rava said: This is what he meant to say: And if a Nazirite who is impure sent it beneath the pot of guilt offerings - he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רָבָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֲשֶׁר תַּחַת זֶבַח הַשְּׁלָמִים״, מִזִּבְחוֹ יְהֵא תַּחְתָּיו.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rava said the verse states: which is under the sacrifice of the peace-offering” of his sacrifice must be under
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mena hanei millei? Amar Rava, amar kera: 'Asher tachat zevach hashlamim', mizbachו yehi tachto." English translation: "What are these words? Rava said, the verse says: 'Which is under the sacrifice of peace offerings,' it shall be beneath his altar."

hebrew_text: וְאִם שִׁילַּח תַּחַת הַדּוּד שֶׁל חַטָּאת — יָצָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״זֶבַח״, לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם. וְהָא אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ לְהַאי ״זֶבַח״ מֵרוֹטֶב! אִם כֵּן לֵימָא קְרָא ״מֵרוֹטֶב הַשְּׁלָמִים״, מַאי ״זֶבַח״ — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְרַבּוֹת חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם.
human_translation: And if he threw under the pot of sin-offering he has fulfilled What is the reason the verse states: sacrifice to include the sin-offering and guilt-offering, But you have derived this “sacrifice” of the gravy If so, let the verse say From the gravy of the peace-offering. Why “Sacrifice”? Learn from here to include the sin-offering and guilt-offering.
llm_translation: If he sent it beneath the cauldron of the sin-offering - he has fulfilled his obligation. What is the reason? The verse says: "sacrifice," to include the sin-offering and guilt-offering. But you have excluded this "sacrifice" from the liquid! If so, let the verse say "from the liquid of the peace-offerings," what is "sacrifice" for? Understand from it to include the sin-offering and guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא כּוּלָּהּ לְחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם הוּא דַּאֲתָא! אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא ״שְׁלָמִים וְזֶבַח״, מַאי ״זֶבַח הַשְּׁלָמִים״ — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: And say comes entirely about the sin-offering and guilt-offering, If so, let it state: Peace-offering and a sacrifice; what “The sacrifice of the peace-offering”? Conclude two from
llm_translation: And why not say that it is all for a sin offering and guilt offering that he came! If so, let us say "peace offerings and sacrifice," what is "sacrifice of peace offerings" - infer from it two.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַכֹּל הָיוּ מְשַׁלְּחִין תַּחַת הַדּוּד, חוּץ מִטָּמֵא שֶׁגִּילַּח בִּמְדִינָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשְּׂעָרוֹ נִקְבָּר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: טְהוֹרִים כָּאן וְכָאן — הָיוּ מְשַׁלְּחִין. טְמֵאִים כָּאן וְכָאן — לֹא הָיוּ מְשַׁלְּחִין. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הַכֹּל לֹא הָיוּ מְשַׁלְּחִין תַּחַת הַדּוּד, חוּץ מִן טָהוֹר שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה כְּמִצְוָתוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught All would throw under the pot, except for an impure who shaved in the country, because hair is buried. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Pure here or there, would throw impure here or there, would not throw And the Rabbis say: None would throw under the pot, except for a pure in the Temple, because is performed properly,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Everyone would send items under the pot, except for a ritually impure person who shaved in the province, because his hair is buried, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Pure people here and there - they would send items. Impure people here and there - they would not send items. And the Sages say: Everyone would not send items under the pot, except for a pure person in the Temple, because he fulfilled his commandment.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה מְבַשֵּׁל אֶת הַשְּׁלָמִים אוֹ שׁוֹלְקָן. הַכֹּהֵן נוֹטֵל אֶת הַזְּרוֹעַ בְּשֵׁלָה מִן הָאַיִל, וְחַלָּה מַצָּה אַחַת מִן הַסַּל, וּרְקִיק מַצָּה אַחַת, וְנוֹתֵן עַל כַּפֵּי הַנָּזִיר, וּמְנִיפָן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הוּתַּר הַנָּזִיר לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן וּלְהִטַּמֵּא לַמֵּתִים.
human_translation: would cook the peace-offering or overcook it, The priest takes the cooked foreleg from the ram, and one unleavened loaf from the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and places on the palms of the nazirite and waves them, And afterward the nazirite is permitted to drink wine and to contract ritual impurity by a corpse.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one was cooking the peace offerings or boiling them, the priest takes the foreleg cooked from the ram, one matzah loaf from the basket, and one unleavened cake, and places them on the hands of the Nazirite. He waves them, and afterwards the Nazirite is permitted to drink wine and become impure through contact with the dead.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּזְרַק עָלָיו אֶחָד מִן הַדָּמִים — הוּתַּר הַנָּזִיר לִשְׁתּוֹת בְּיַיִן וּלְהִיטַּמֵּא לְמֵתִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Once the blood one has been sprinkled on behalf, the nazirite is permitted to drink wine and to contract ritual impurity by a corpse.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Once one of the bloods is sprinkled upon him - the Nazirite is permitted to drink wine and to defile himself for the dead.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְאַחַר יִשְׁתֶּה הַנָּזִיר יַיִן״ — אַחַר הַמַּעֲשִׂים כּוּלָּן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַחַר מַעֲשֶׂה יְחִידִי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And after that the nazirite may drink wine” after all the actions, the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. And the Rabbis say: After a single action.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And after the Nazirite shall drink wine" - after all the actions, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the sages say: "After an individual action."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן? כְּתִיב הָכָא ״וְאַחַר יִשְׁתֶּה הַנָּזִיר יָיִן״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״אַחַר הִתְגַּלְּחוֹ אֶת נִזְרוֹ״. מָה הָתָם ״אַחַר״ — מַעֲשֶׂה יְחִידִי, אַף כָּאן ״אַחַר״ — מַעֲשֶׂה יְחִידִי.
human_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis? It is written here: “And after that the nazirite may drink wine,” and it is written there, after he has shaven his naziriteship” Just as there after a single action, here too, after a single action,
llm_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis? It is written here "and after the Nazirite shall drink wine," and it is written there "after he shaves his consecrated head." Just as there "after" refers to an individual act, so too here "after" refers to an individual act.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא עַד דְּאִיכָּא תַּרְוַויְיהוּ! אִי הָכִי, גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: say until there are both If so, why do I verbal analogy?
llm_translation: "Why until there are both of them! If so, why do I need a similar decree?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: תְּנוּפָה בְּנָזִיר מְעַכֶּבֶת. אַלִּיבָּא דְמַאן? אִילֵימָא אַלִּיבָּא דְרַבָּנַן — תִּגְלַחַת אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן לָא מְעַכְּבָא, תְּנוּפָה מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: Rav said: waving of a nazirite precludes According to whose opinion If we say in accordance with of the Rabbis, the Rabbis say shaving does not preclude Is necessary, waving,
llm_translation: Rav said: "Waving in a Nazirite offering is invalid." According to whom? If you say according to the opinion of the Rabbis - they said that shaving does not invalidate, so why would waving be necessary?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — פְּשִׁיטָא, הָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אַחַר מַעֲשִׂים כּוּלָּם! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כֵּיוָן דִּלְעִנְיַן כַּפָּרָה שְׁיָרֵי מִצְוָה הִיא, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא תְּעַכֵּב, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with of Rabbi Eliezer, is obvious; didn’t Rabbi Eliezer say after all the actions lest you say: Since with regard to atonement is a peripheral aspect of the mitzva, here too does not preclude teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, in the school of Rabbi Eliezer - it is obvious, for Rabbi Eliezer said: "After the actions, all of them!" What might you say? Since regarding the matter of the Red Heifer it is a mitzvah, here too it should not delay, this is implied to us.

hebrew_text: וּמֵי מְעַכְּבָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַנָּזִיר״, בֵּין שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ כַּפַּיִם, בֵּין שֶׁאֵין לוֹ כַּפַּיִם!
human_translation: And does preclude But isn’t it taught “This is the law of the nazirite,” whether he has palms, whether he does not have palms.
llm_translation: And what is the case of Me'akva? And it was taught: "This is the law of the Nazirite," whether he has hands, or whether he does not have hands!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַנָּזִיר״, בֵּין שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שֵׂעָר, בֵּין שֶׁאֵין לוֹ שֵׂעָר — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא מְעַכְּבָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: נָזִיר מְמוֹרָט, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהַעֲבִיר תַּעַר עַל רֹאשׁוֹ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: צָרִיךְ לְהַעֲבִיר תַּעַר עַל רֹאשׁוֹ.
human_translation: But that which is taught “This is the law of the nazirite” whether he has hair whether he does not have hair; so too, not preclude But isn’t it taught bald nazirite, Beit Shammai say: He need not pass a razor over his head, and Beit Hillel say: He must pass a razor over his head.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather, this that it was taught: "This is the law of the Nazirite," whether he has hair, or whether he does not have hair - is it not so that it does not prevent? And it was taught: A Nazirite who is bald, Beit Shammai say: He does not need to pass a razor over his head, and Beit Hillel say: He needs to pass a razor over his head.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבִינָא: מַאי ״אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ״ לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ — אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה. הָא לְבֵית הִלֵּל יֵשׁ לוֹ תַּקָּנָה!
human_translation: And Ravina said: What Need not, by Beit Shammai? he need not he has no remedy, according to Beit Hillel he does have a remedy,
llm_translation: And Rabinah said: What is "he does not need" according to Beit Shammai: He does not need - he does not have acquisition. But according to Beit Hillel, he has acquisition!

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּרַבִּי פְּדָת. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי פְּדָת: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אָמְרוּ דָּבָר אֶחָד.
human_translation: And this is of Rabbi Pedat. As Rabbi Pedat said: Beit Shammai and Rabbi Eliezer said the same thing,
llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Pedat said: Beit Shammai and Rabbi Eliezer said one thing.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין לוֹ בֹּהֶן יָד וָרֶגֶל — אֵין לוֹ טׇהֳרָה עוֹלָמִית, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יַנִּיחֶנּוּ עַל מְקוֹמוֹ וְיֵצֵא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יַנִּיחַ עַל שֶׁל שְׂמֹאל וְיֵצֵא.
human_translation: what Rabbi Eliezer As it is taught does not have a thumb or big toe, never ritual purity. the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Shimon says: puts it on the spot and fulfills The Rabbis say: Let him put it on the left and fulfill
llm_translation: What is the ruling of Rabbi Eliezer, as it was taught: "If an animal has no hand or foot - it has no eternal purity," the words of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Shimon says: "Let it rest in its place and it will depart." And the Sages say: "Let it rest on its left side and it will depart."

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא אָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַב: תְּנוּפָה בְּנָזִיר מְעַכֶּבֶת. אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן? אִילֵימָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — פְּשִׁיטָא, הָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אַחַר מַעֲשִׂים כּוּלָּם! אֶלָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְרַבָּנַן: הַשְׁתָּא יֵשׁ לוֹמַר תִּגְלַחַת אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן לָא מְעַכְּבָא, תְּנוּפָה מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: another version Some say Rav said: waving of a nazirite precludes According to whose If we say in accordance with of Rabbi Eliezer, is obvious; didn’t Rabbi Eliezer say after all actions, Rather, in accordance with of the Rabbis. Now one can say shaving, the Rabbis say does not preclude is necessary waving
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Another teaching they said to her, Rav said: The waving of the Nazirite offering is invalid. Whose opinion is this? If you say it is the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer - it is obvious, for didn't Rabbi Eliezer say that all actions are effective! Rather, it is the opinion of the Rabbis: Now, regarding shaving, the Rabbis said it does not invalidate, but waving, what is the reason for it?

hebrew_text: וּמִי לָא מְעַכְּבָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַנָּזִיר״ — בֵּין שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ כַּפַּיִם וּבֵין שֶׁאֵין לוֹ כַּפַּיִם! וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַנָּזִיר״ — בֵּין שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שֵׂעָר וּבֵין שֶׁאֵין לוֹ שֵׂעָר, הָכִי נָמֵי דִּמְעַכְּבָא?
human_translation: And doesn’t preclude But isn’t it taught “This is the law of the nazirite,” whether he has palms whether he does not have palms But that which is taught “This is the law of the nazirite,” whether he has hair or whether he does not have hair; so too, that precludes
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who does not delay? And it was taught: "This is the law of the Nazirite" - whether he has hands or whether he does not have hands! But rather, this that was taught: "This is the law of the Nazirite" - whether he has hair or whether he does not have hair, is this not what causes delay?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: נָזִיר מְמוֹרָט, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהַעֲבִיר תַּעַר עַל רֹאשׁוֹ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: צָרִיךְ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבִינָא: מַאי ״צָרִיךְ״ לְבֵית הִלֵּל — צָרִיךְ, וְאֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה,
human_translation: But isn’t it taught bald nazirite, Beit Shammai say: He need not pass a razor over his head, and Beit Hillel say: He must Rabbi Avina said: What is He must, by Beit Hillel? he must he has no remedy,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: A nazirite who is a mourner, Beit Shammai say: He does not need to pass a razor over his head, and Beit Hillel say: He does need to! Rabbi Avina said: What is the meaning of "he needs to" according to Beit Hillel? He needs to, but he does not have a remedy.

hebrew_text: לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי יֵשׁ לוֹ תַּקָּנָה. וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי פְּדָת.
human_translation: according to Beit Shammai he has a remedy, And disagrees Rabbi Pedat.
llm_translation: To the house of Shammai, it has a enactment. And a dispute of Rabbi Pedat.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ גִּילַּח עַל הַזֶּבַח, וְנִמְצָא פָּסוּל — תִּגְלַחְתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה, וּזְבָחָיו לֹא עָלוּ לוֹ. גִּילַּח עַל הַחַטָּאת שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הֵבִיא קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו לִשְׁמָן, תִּגְלַחְתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה, וּזְבָחָיו לֹא עָלוּ לוֹ. גִּילַּח עַל הָעוֹלָה אוֹ עַל הַשְּׁלָמִים שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הֵבִיא קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו לִשְׁמָן — תִּגְלַחְתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה, וּזְבָחָיו לֹא עָלוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: shaved upon the offering, and was found invalid his shaving is invalid and his offerings do not count his shaved upon the sin-offering, that not for its own sake, and afterward he brought his offerings for their own sake, his shaving is invalid and his offerings do not count his shaved upon the burnt-offering or brought the peace-offering, these not for their own sake, and afterward he brought his offerings for their own sake, his shaving is invalid and his offerings do not count his
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one shaves his head over the sacrifice, and it is found to be disqualified - his shaving is invalid, and his sacrifices do not count for him. If one shaves his head over the sin-offering without intent, and then brings his offerings with intent - his shaving is invalid, and his sacrifices do not count for him. If one shaves his head over the burnt-offering or peace-offerings without intent, and then brings his offerings with intent - his shaving is invalid, and his sacrifices do not count for him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אוֹתוֹ הַזֶּבַח לֹא עָלָה לוֹ, אֲבָל שְׁאָר זְבָחִים עָלוּ. וְאִם גִּילַּח עַל שְׁלָשְׁתָּן, וְנִמְצָא אֶחָד מֵהֶן כָּשֵׁר — תִּגְלַחְתּוֹ כְּשֵׁרָה, וְיָבִיא שְׁאָר זְבָחִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: that offering, does not count his however, other offerings do count. And if he shaved upon all three of them, and one of them was found valid, his shaving is valid, but he must bring other offerings
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: That sacrifice did not ascend for him, but other sacrifices ascended. And if he shaved on three of them, and one of them was found valid - his shaving is valid, and he should bring other sacrifices.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, קָסָבַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: נָזִיר שֶׁגִּילַּח עַל שַׁלְמֵי נְדָבָה יָצָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְנָתַן עַל הָאֵשׁ אֲשֶׁר תַּחַת זֶבַח הַשְּׁלָמִים״, וְלֹא כָּתַב ״עַל שְׁלָמָיו״.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: That is to say Rabbi Shimon maintains a nazirite who shaved upon voluntary peace-offerings has fulfilled What is the reason as the verse states: “And put it on the fire which is under the sacrifice of the peace-offering” and it is not written: On his peace-offering.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Adda Bar Ahava said: This means, Rabbi Shimon holds: A Nazir who shaved for the sake of voluntary peace offerings has fulfilled his obligation. What is the reason? As the verse states: "And he shall place it on the fire under the sacrifice of the peace offerings," and it does not write "on his peace offerings."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁנִּזְרַק עָלָיו אֶחָד מִן הַדָּמִים וְנִטְמָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: סוֹתֵר אֶת הַכֹּל. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יָבִיא שְׁאָר קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו וְיִטְהָר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּמִרְיָם הַתַּרְמוֹדִית שֶׁנִּזְרַק עָלֶיהָ אֶחָד מִן הַדָּמִים, וּבָאוּ וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ עַל בִּתָּהּ שֶׁהָיְתָה מְסוּכֶּנֶת, וְהָלְכָה וּמָצְאָה שֶׁמֵּתָה. וְאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: תָּבִיא שְׁאָר קׇרְבְּנוֹתֶיהָ וְתִטְהָר.
human_translation: one on whose behalf the blood of one was sprinkled and he became ritually impure Rabbi Eliezer says: negates the entire And the Rabbis say: Let him bring the rest of his offerings and be purified. said to An incident involving Miriam of Tarmod that the blood of one was sprinkled on her behalf, and they came and told her that her daughter was mortally ill. And she went and found was dead, And the Rabbis said: Let her bring the rest of her offerings and be purified.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one of the bloods was sprinkled upon him and he became impure, Rabbi Eliezer says: He invalidates all. And the Sages say: Let him bring his other offerings and become purified. They said to him: There was an incident with Miriam the hairdresser, to whom one of the bloods was sprinkled, and they came and informed her about her daughter who was dangerously ill, and she went and found that she had died. And the Sages said: Let her bring her other offerings and become purified.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קָתָנֵי, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: סוֹתֵר אֶת הַכֹּל. וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: כׇּל אַחַר מְלֹאת שִׁבְעָה סוֹתֵר! אָמַר רַב: מַאי ״סוֹתֵר״ נָמֵי דְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — סוֹתֵר קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו.
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Eliezer says negates the entire But didn’t Rabbi Eliezer say any after the completion negates seven days. Rav said: What Negates, that Rabbi Eliezer said negates his offerings.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Rabbi Eliezer says: He nullifies everything. And didn't Rabbi Eliezer say: Anyone after fulfilling seven nullifies! Rav said: What is 'nullifies'? Also what Rabbi Eliezer said - nullifies his sacrifices." English translation: "Gemara: Rabbi Eliezer says: He nullifies everything. And didn't Rabbi Eliezer say: Anyone after fulfilling seven nullifies! Rav said: What is 'nullifies'? Also what Rabbi Eliezer said - nullifies his sacrifices."

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים תָּבִיא שְׁאָר קׇרְבְּנוֹתֶיהָ וְתִטְהָר, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as teaches: And the Rabbis said: Let her bring the rest of her offerings and be purified. Learn from here
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: for it was taught: "And the sages say, 'She shall bring the remainder of her offerings and be purified.' Learn from it."

hebrew_text: וּמַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי בְּמִרְיָם הַתַּרְמוֹדִית שֶׁנְּזָרֵק עָלֶיהָ אֶחָד מִן הַדָּמִים, וּבָאוּ וְהוֹדִיעוּהָ עַל בִּתָּהּ שֶׁהָיְתָה מְסוּכֶּנֶת, וְהָלְכָה וּמָצְאָה שֶׁמֵּתָה, וְאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: תָּבִיא שְׁאָר קׇרְבְּנוֹתֶיהָ וְתִטְהָר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And an incident also involving Miriam of Tarmod, that the blood of one was sprinkled on her behalf, and they came and notified her that her daughter was mortally ill. And she went and found was dead, And the Rabbis said: Let her bring the rest of her offerings and be purified. learn from
llm_translation: And the incident with Miriam the embroiderer, upon whom one of the blood was splattered, and they came and informed her about her daughter who was in danger, and she went and found that she had died. And the sages said: "Bring the rest of her sacrifices and she shall become purified." Learn from this.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִינִין
llm_translation: We will return to you, three types.

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וְנָזִיר אֵין מִיטַּמְּאִין לִקְרוֹבֵיהֶן, אֲבָל מִיטַּמְּאִין לְמֵת מִצְוָה. הָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ וּמָצְאוּ מֵת מִצְוָה — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יִטַּמֵּא כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְאַל יִטַּמֵּא נָזִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יִטַּמֵּא נָזִיר, וְאַל יִטַּמֵּא כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: A High Priest and a nazirite may not become ritually impure to their relatives. However, they become impure to a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ]. were walking along the way and they found a met mitzva , Rabbi Eliezer says: Let High Priest become impure, and not let nazirite become impure. And the Rabbis say: Let nazirite become impure, and not let a common priest become impure.
llm_translation: High Priest and Nazirite do not become impure for their relatives, but they become impure for a dead body as a mitzvah. If they were walking on the road and found a dead body as a mitzvah - Rabbi Eliezer says: The High Priest should become impure, and the Nazirite should not become impure. And the Sages say: The Nazirite should become impure, and the common priest should not become impure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: יִטַּמֵּא כֹּהֵן — שֶׁאֵינוֹ מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל טוּמְאָתוֹ, וְאַל יִטַּמֵּא נָזִיר — שֶׁהוּא מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל טוּמְאָתוֹ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: יִטַּמֵּא נָזִיר — שֶׁאֵין קְדוּשָּׁתוֹ קְדוּשַּׁת עוֹלָם, וְאַל יִטַּמֵּא כֹּהֵן — שֶׁקְּדוּשָּׁתוֹ קְדוּשַּׁת עוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to let priest become impure, as he does not bring an offering for his impurity, and not let nazirite become impure, as he brings an offering for his impurity. said to him: let nazirite become impure, as his sanctity is not permanent, and not let a priest become impure, as his sanctity is permanent.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rabbi Eliezer: Let a Kohen become impure - for he does not bring an offering while impure, and let a Nazirite not become impure - for he brings an offering while impure. They said to him: Let a Nazirite become impure - for his holiness is not eternal holiness, and let a Kohen not become impure - for his holiness is eternal holiness.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וְנָזִיר, הַאי סָבַר: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל עָדִיף, וְהַאי סָבַר: נָזִיר עָדִיף.
human_translation: Granted, a High Priest and a nazirite, This holds preferable a High Priest And this holds preferable a nazirite
llm_translation: Gemara: With regard to a Kohen Gadol and a Nazir, this one opinion holds: A Kohen Gadol is superior, and this one opinion holds: A Nazir is superior.

hebrew_text: מָשׁוּחַ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה
human_translation: anointed with the anointing oil,
llm_translation: Anointed with the anointing oil.

hebrew_text: וּמְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים — מָשׁוּחַ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה עָדִיף, דְּאִילּוּ מָשׁוּחַ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה — מֵבִיא פַּר הַבָּא עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת, וְאִילּוּ מְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים — אֵין מֵבִיא.
human_translation: and of many garments, preferable the one who was anointed with the anointing oil As anointed with the anointing oil brings bull brought for all the mitzvot, while of many garments does not bring
llm_translation: And one who is abundant in garments - anointed with anointing oil is preferable, for even if anointed with anointing oil - he brings a bull that comes for all the commandments, but if one is abundant in garments - he does not bring.

hebrew_text: מָשׁוּחַ שֶׁעָבַר וּמְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים — מְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים עָדִיף, דִּמְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים — עָבֵיד עֲבוֹדָה, וְאִילּוּ מָשׁוּחַ שֶׁעָבַר — לָאו בַּר עֲבוֹדָה הוּא.
human_translation: a former anointed many garments, preferable many garments that many garments performs the service, whereas a former anointed is no able service.
llm_translation: Anointed one who passed and many garments - many garments superior, for many garments - he performs labor, but if anointed one who passed - it is not considered labor.

hebrew_text: עָבַר מֵחֲמַת קֵירוּיוֹ וְעָבַר מֵחֲמַת מוּמוֹ — עָבַר מֵחֲמַת קֵירוּיוֹ עָדִיף, דְּאִילּוּ הַאי חֲזִי לַעֲבוֹדָה לְמָחָר, וְאִילּוּ עָבַר מֵחֲמַת מוּמוֹ לֹא חֲזִי לָעֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: left due to his seminal emission due to his blemish, preferable left due to his seminal emission as this one, is fit for the service the following day, while left due to his blemish is no fit for the service
llm_translation: He passed due to its wall and he passed due to its blemish - he passed due to its wall is preferable, for if he sees it for service tomorrow, but if he passed due to its blemish, he does not see it for service.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה וּסְגָן, הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ עֲדִיף? מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה עֲדִיף — דַּחֲזֵי לְמִלְחָמָה, אוֹ דִּלְמָא סְגָן עֲדִיף — דַּחֲזֵי לַעֲבוֹדָה?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before which of these preferable anointed for war, or the deputy [ segan ] preferable anointed for war as he is fit for war? Or, perhaps preferable deputy as he is fit for service
llm_translation: He asked them: If one is appointed as a commander of the army and a deputy, which one is superior? The commander of the army is superior - for he is fit for warfare, or perhaps the deputy is superior - for he is fit for service?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין בֵּין מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה לִסְגָן, אֶלָּא שֶׁאִם הָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין בְּדֶרֶךְ וּמָצְאוּ מֵת מִצְוָה — יִטַּמֵּא מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה וְאַל יִטַּמֵּא הַסְּגָן.
human_translation: Come hear as it is taught The difference between anointed for war and a deputy is only that if they were walking along the way and found a met mitzva , Let the one anointed for war become impure, and not let the deputy become impure.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: There is no difference between an anointed for war and a deputy, except that if they were walking on the road and found a corpse - the anointed for war becomes impure and the deputy does not become impure.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה קוֹדֵם לִסְגָן! אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: לְעִנְיַן הַחֲיוֹתוֹ — מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה עֲדִיף, מַאי טַעְמָא — דִּתְלוּ בֵּיהּ רַבִּים,
human_translation: But isn’t it taught anointed for war takes precedence over the deputy Mar Zutra said: With regard to preserving his life preferable the one anointed for war. What is the reason that the public depends on him
llm_translation: And it was taught: One anointed for war takes precedence over a deputy! Mar Zutra said: Regarding the sustenance of his livelihood — one anointed for war is preferable, what is the reason? Because many depend on him.

hebrew_text: וּלְעִנְיַן טוּמְאָה סְגָן עֲדִיף. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: לָמָּה תִּקְּנוּ סְגָן לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל — שֶׁאִם אֵירַע בּוֹ פְּסוּל הֲרֵי נִכְנָס וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ תַּחְתָּיו.
human_translation: But with regard to ritual impurity, preferable deputy as it is taught Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: Why did institute a deputy for the High Priest? that if a disqualification befalls can enter and serve in his stead.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for the matter of impurity, a deputy is preferable. As it was taught: Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: Why was a deputy appointed for the High Priest? So that if something disqualifying occurs with him, the deputy can enter and serve in his place.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל וְנָזִיר כִּי קָא אָזְלִי בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, אֲבָל חַד חַד לְחוֹדֵיהּ בַּר אִיטַּמּוֹיֵי אִינּוּן. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: disagree only with regard to a High Priest and a nazirite who are walking together However, each of them separately, they are able, to become impure. From where are these matters
llm_translation: Until here, they only argue regarding the High Priest and the Nazirite, for they went together in the paths of Hadadei, but each one separately, the sons of Ittammoyei are not. From where are these matters?

hebrew_text: דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״עַל כׇּל נַפְשׁוֹת מֵת לֹא יָבֹא״, בַּמָּה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר? אִי בִּרְחוֹקִים — קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא: וּמָה כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט שֶׁהוּא מִיטַּמֵּא לִקְרוֹבִים אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא לִרְחוֹקִים, כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא לִקְרוֹבִים, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא לִרְחוֹקִים? אֶלָּא בִּקְרוֹבִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: as the Sages taught: “Neither shall he go in to any dead bodies; With regard to what is the verse speaking? If to distant that an a fortiori And if a common priest, who becomes impure to close may not become impure to distant a High Priest, who does not become impure to close is it not logical that he does not become impure to distant Rather, the verse is speaking of close
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Upon any dead person he shall not come," in what context is the verse speaking? If regarding those who are distant - it is a logical inference: Just as a common priest who becomes impure for close relatives does not become impure for distant relatives, so too, a high priest who does not become impure for close relatives, is it not logical that he does not become impure for distant relatives? Rather, the verse is speaking about close relatives.

hebrew_text: וּלְאָבִיו הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא, הָא מִיטַּמֵּא הוּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה.
human_translation: And It is to his father that he may not become ritually impure, he becomes impure to a met mitzva .
llm_translation: And to his father, he is the one who does not become impure, behold, he becomes impure for the sake of a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: ״וּלְאִמּוֹ״ — לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה, לְכִדְרַבִּי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: גַּבֵּי נָזִיר ״בְּמוֹתָם״ אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא, אֲבָל מִיטַּמֵּא הוּא לְנִגְעָם וּלְזִיבָתָם. וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּנָזִיר, בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: “or for his mother” as a verbal analogy, in accordance with Rabbi as it is taught Rabbi says: with regard to a nazirite: when die he may not become impure However, he may become impure for their leprosy and for their emission of a zav , And I have only to a nazirite, From where to a High Priest
llm_translation: "and to his mother" — for a similar decree, in accordance with Rabbi. As it was taught: Rabbi says: Regarding a Nazirite, "in their death" does not render him impure, but he does become impure due to their afflictions and their emissions. And I only have this regarding a Nazirite, but how do we know this regarding a High Priest?

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתָּ: לֹא יֵאָמֵר ״אִמּוֹ״ בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר, שֶׁהֲרֵי קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא: וּמָה אִם בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁכֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט מִיטַּמֵּא לְאָחִיו מֵאָבִיו — אֵין כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מִיטַּמֵּא לְאָבִיו, מָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט מִיטַּמֵּא לְאָחִיו מֵאִמּוֹ — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁאֵין כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מִיטַּמֵּא לְאִמּוֹ?
human_translation: You say not say “his mother” with regard to a High Priest, as no the verse to state since is a fortiori : And if in a case where a common priest becomes impure to his paternal brother, a High Priest may not become impure to his father, in a case where a common priest may not become impure to his maternal brother, is it not logical that a High Priest may not become impure to his mother
llm_translation: You said: "Do not say 'his mother' regarding the High Priest, for there is no Talmudic basis to say so, for it is a logical inference: And if in a case where a common priest defiles himself for his brother from his father - the High Priest does not defile himself for his father, in a case where a common priest does not defile himself for his brother from his mother - it is not logical that the High Priest would defile himself for his mother?"

hebrew_text: אִם זָכִיתָה מֵהַדִּין, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אִמּוֹ״ בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל? מוּפְנֶה לְהַקִּישׁ וְלָדוּן הֵימֶנּוּ גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה: נֶאֱמַר ״אִמּוֹ״ בְּנָזִיר, וְנֶאֱמַר ״אִמּוֹ״ בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל,
human_translation: And if you have successfully from the inference, what the verse states “his mother” with regard to a High Priest? free to compare and learn a verbal analogy from it It is stated “his mother” with regard to a nazirite and it is stated “his mother” with regard to a High Priest
llm_translation: If you have succeeded in the judgment, what does the Talmud say "his mother" in regard to the High Priest? It is directed to establish a comparison and to judge him through a similar decree: It is stated "his mother" regarding a Nazirite, and it is stated "his mother" regarding the High Priest.

hebrew_text: מָה ״אִמּוֹ״ הָאָמוּר בְּנָזִיר — בְּמוֹתָם אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא אֲבָל מִיטַּמֵּא הוּא לְנִגְעָם וּלְזִיבָתָם, אַף ״אִמּוֹ״ הָאָמוּר בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל — בְּמוֹתָם אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא אֲבָל מִיטַּמֵּא לְנִגְעָם וּלְזִיבָתָם.
human_translation: Just as “his mother” stated with regard to a nazirite in death he may not become impure but he may become impure for their leprosy and for their emission of a zav , so too, “his mother” stated with regard to a High Priest in death he may not become impure, but he may become impure for their leprosy and for their emission of a zav .
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "What is 'his mother' that is mentioned in regard to a Nazirite? — At their death, he does not become impure, but he becomes impure for their afflictions and their emissions. Similarly, 'his mother' that is mentioned in regard to the High Priest — At their death, he does not become impure, but he becomes impure for their afflictions and their emissions."

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל. נָזִיר מְנָלַן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״כׇּל יְמֵי הַזִּירוֹ לַה׳ עַל נֶפֶשׁ מֵת לֹא יָבֹא״,
human_translation: We found a High Priest from where do we a nazirite As it is taught “All the days that he consecrated himself to the Lord he shall not come near to a dead body [ nefesh met ]”
llm_translation: I found a High Priest. Where is the Nazirite mentioned? For it was taught: "All the days of his separation to the Lord, he shall not come near a dead person."

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי אֲפִילּוּ נֶפֶשׁ בְּהֵמָה בַּמַּשְׁמָע, כְּעִנְיָן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״מַכֵּה נֶפֶשׁ בְּהֵמָה״, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַל נֶפֶשׁ מֵת לֹא יָבֹא״, בְּנֶפֶשׁ אָדָם הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא יָבֹא״ — בִּנְפָשׁוֹת הַמְטַמְּאוֹת בְּבִיאָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: I derive including even the body of an animal, similar to that which is stated: he who smites the body [ nefesh ] of an animal” the verse states: “He shall not come near to a dead body,” the verse is speaking of the body of a person. Rabbi Yishmael says: is unnecessary, as states: “He shall not come near,” the verse is speaking of bodies that render ritually impure through going in,
llm_translation: I hear, even a soul in an animal in the hearing, as it is said "one who strikes the soul of an animal," Scripture states: "He shall not come upon a dead soul," Scripture speaks of a human soul. Rabbi Yishmael says: It is not necessary, for it says "he shall not come upon" - Scripture speaks of impure souls through intercourse.

hebrew_text: ״לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ״ אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא, אֲבָל מִיטַּמֵּא הוּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה.
human_translation: for his father, or for his mother” may not become impure, but he may become impure to a met mitzva .
llm_translation: "To his father and to his mother" - he does not become ritually impure, but he does become ritually impure for a deceased relative as a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁלֹּא יֵאָמֵר, יֵשׁ לִי בַּדִּין: וּמָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁקְּדוּשָּׁתוֹ קְדוּשַּׁת עוֹלָם, מִיטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה, נָזִיר שֶׁאֵין קְדוּשָּׁתוֹ קְדוּשַּׁת עוֹלָם — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמִּיטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה?
human_translation: if had not stated I have by right, And if a High Priest, whose sanctity is permanent, may become ritually impure to a met mitzva , a nazirite, whose sanctity is not permanent, is it not logical that he may become impure to a met mitzva
llm_translation: Until it is not said, "I have in the law," and what about the high priest whose holiness is eternal holiness, if he becomes impure for the sake of a mitzvah, or a Nazirite whose holiness is not eternal holiness - is it not the law that he becomes impure for the sake of a mitzvah?

hebrew_text: לֹא: אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, שֶׁכֵּן אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל טוּמְאָתוֹ, תֹּאמַר בְּנָזִיר, שֶׁמֵּבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל טוּמְאָתוֹ. הוֹאִיל וּמֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל טוּמְאָתוֹ לֹא יִטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ לֹא יִטַּמָּא״, אֲבָל מִיטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה.
human_translation: No; if you say with regard to a High Priest, who does not bring an offering for his impurity, shall you say with regard to a nazirite, who does bring an offering for his impurity? Since brings an offering for his impurity, not become impure to a met mitzva ? the verse states: “He shall not become defiled for his father, or for his mother” However, become impure to a met mitzva .
llm_translation: Not: if you said regarding a High Priest, that he does not bring an offering for his impurity, you should say regarding a Nazirite, that he does bring an offering for his impurity. Since he brings an offering for his impurity, should he not become impure for a deceased relative as a mitzvah? The verse teaches: "He shall not defile himself for his father or for his mother," but he does become impure for a deceased relative as a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: אוֹ: אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ, אֲבָל יִטַּמֵּא לִשְׁאָר מֵתִים! אָמַרְתָּ קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, שֶׁמִּיטַּמֵּא לִקְרוֹבִין — אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא לִשְׁאָר מֵתִים, נָזִיר, שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא לִקְרוֹבִין — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יִטַּמֵּא לִשְׁאָר מֵתִים?
human_translation: Or He may not become impure to his father or for his mother; however, he may become impure to other dead people. You say a fortiori : And if a common priest, who becomes impure to relatives, may not become impure to other dead people a nazirite, who may not become impure to relatives, is it not logical that he should not become impure to other dead people?
llm_translation: Or: He does not become impure for his father and mother, but he becomes impure for other dead bodies! You said an a fortiori argument: Just as a common priest, who becomes impure for relatives - does not become impure for other dead bodies, a Nazirite, who does not become impure for relatives - is it not logical that he should not become impure for other dead bodies?

hebrew_text: הָא מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ״, לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ הוּא דְּלֹא מִיטַּמֵּא, אֲבָל מִיטַּמֵּא הוּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה.
human_translation: what the verse states: “For his father, or for his mother” it is to his father and to his mother that he may not become impure; however, he may become impure to a met mitzva .
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: What is the Talmud teaching us by stating "to his father and his mother"? It is to his father and his mother that he does not become ritually impure, but he does become impure for the sake of a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁלֹּא יֵאָמֵר יֵשׁ לִי בַּדִּין: נֶאֶמְרוּ כְּלָלוֹת בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְנֶאֶמְרוּ כְּלָלוֹת בְּנָזִיר. מָה כְּלָלוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל — לְאָבִיו אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא, אֲבָל מִיטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה, אַף כְּלָלוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּנָזִיר — לְאָבִיו אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא, אֲבָל מִיטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה.
human_translation: if had not stated I have by right, General are stated with regard to a High Priest and general are stated with regard to a nazirite: Just as general stated with regard to a High Priest it is to his father that he may not become impure, but he may become impure to a met mitzva , so too, general stated with regard to a nazirite it is for his father that he may not become impure, but he may become impure to a met mitzva .
llm_translation: Until it is not said, "I have a claim": General principles were stated regarding the High Priest, and general principles were stated regarding a Nazirite. What are the general principles stated regarding the High Priest? — He does not become impure for his father, but he becomes impure for a deceased relative for the sake of fulfilling a commandment. Likewise, the general principles stated regarding a Nazirite? — He does not become impure for his father, but he becomes impure for a deceased relative for the sake of fulfilling a commandment.

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּלָךְ לְדֶרֶךְ זוֹ: נֶאֶמְרוּ כְּלָלוֹת בְּכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, וְנֶאֶמְרוּ כְּלָלוֹת בְּנָזִיר. מָה כְּלָלוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט — מִיטַּמֵּא לְאָבִיו, אַף כְּלָלוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּנָזִיר — מִיטַּמֵּא לְאָבִיו.
human_translation: Or go this way General are stated with regard to a common priest and general are stated with regard to a nazirite. Just as general stated with regard to a common priest may become impure to his father so too, general stated with regard to a nazirite may become impure to his father.
llm_translation: Or like this for the way: It was stated general principles regarding a commoner priest, and general principles were stated regarding a Nazirite. What are the general principles stated regarding a commoner priest? He defiles for his father. So too, the general principles stated regarding a Nazirite - he defiles for his father.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ לֹא יִטַּמָּא״, הָא לְמֵת מִצְוָה מִיטַּמֵּא. הָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין מִיטַּמֵּא לְאָבִיו?
human_translation: The verse states “He shall not become defiled for his father, or for his mother” he may become impure to a met mitzva . requires to say that may not become impure to his father.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "To his father and to his mother he shall not become impure." This teaches that one becomes impure for a deceased relative. But why does it need to say that he does not become impure for his father?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: ״לְאָבִיו״ — לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין מִיטַּמֵּא לְאָבִיו. ״לְאָחִיו״ אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא — הָא לְמֵת מִצְוָה מִיטַּמֵּא. ״וּלְאִמּוֹ״ — לִגְזֵרָה שָׁוָה, לְכִדְרַבִּי.
human_translation: Rather, “for his father” to say that he may not become impure to his father, “for his brother” he may not become impure he may become impure to a met mitzva . “And for his mother”; for a verbal analogy in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: Rather: "to his father" — to say that he does not become ritually impure for his father. "to his brother" — he does not become ritually impure — but for a deceased relative it is a mitzvah to become ritually impure. "and to his mother" — as a similar decree, in accordance with Rabbi.

hebrew_text: ״וּלְאַחוֹתוֹ״, לְכִדְתַנְיָא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״לְאַחוֹתוֹ״ מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר?
human_translation: “and for his sister,” for that which is taught as it is taught “And for his sister”; what the verse states
llm_translation: "And to his sister," as it was taught in a Baraita: "To his sister," what does the Talmud come to teach us?

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִשְׁחוֹט אֶת פִּסְחוֹ וְלָמוּל אֶת בְּנוֹ, וְשָׁמַע שֶׁמֵּת לוֹ מֵת — יָכוֹל יִטַּמֵּא? אָמַרְתָּ: ״לֹא יִטַּמֵּא״.
human_translation: If went to slaughter his Paschal offering or to circumcise his son, and he hears that his had died, might he should become impure You say he may not become impure,
llm_translation: Behold, one who went to slaughter his Passover offering and to circumcise his son, and he heard that his relative had died - is he permitted to become impure? You said: "He may not become impure."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יִטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְאַחוֹתוֹ״ — לַאֲחוֹתוֹ הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא, הָא לְמֵת מִצְוָה — מִיטַּמֵּא.
human_translation: might he may not become impure to a met mitzva . The verse states: “For his sister.” It is for his sister may not become impure, but he does become impure to a met mitzva .
llm_translation: He is able not to become impure for a dead relative, it is taught to say: "to his sister" - it is his sister that he does not become impure for, but for a dead relative - he becomes impure.
