hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״נְפָשׁוֹת״ — אֵלּוּ הָרְחוֹקִין, ״מֵת״ — אֵלּוּ הַקְּרוֹבִין, ״לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ״ אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא, אֲבָל מִיטַּמֵּא הוּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says “Body”; these are the distant “Dead”; these are the close “for his father or for his mother” he may not become impure; however, he does become impure to a met mitzva .
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "Nefashot" - these are the distant ones, "met" - these are the close ones, "to his father and his mother" he does not become impure, but he does become impure for a deceased relative as a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: ״לְאָחִיו״ — שֶׁאִם הָיָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וְהוּא נָזִיר, לְאָחִיו אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא, אֲבָל מִיטַּמֵּא הוּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה. ״לְאַחוֹתוֹ״, כִּדְתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה הוֹלֵךְ לִשְׁחוֹט אֶת פִּסְחוֹ וְלָמוּל אֶת בְּנוֹ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: “for his brother,” that if he was a High Priest and he was a nazirite, he may not become impure to his brother, but he may become impure to a met mitzva . “for his sister,” that which is taught If one was going to slaughter his Paschal offering or to circumcise his son
llm_translation: "To his brother" — if he was a High Priest and he is a Nazirite, to his brother he does not become impure, but he does become impure for the mitzvah of burying a deceased. "To his sister," as it was taught: if he was going to slaughter his Passover offering and circumcise his son, etc.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה דְּרַבִּי, מְנָלֵיהּ?
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Akiva, from where does he verbal analogy of Rabbi
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Akiva, a similar decree as Rabbi, from where is it derived?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר אִם הָיָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וְנָזִיר, לְאָחִיו אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא, אֲבָל מִיטַּמֵּא הוּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה — מָה לִי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל לְחוֹדֵיהּ, מָה לִי נָזִיר וְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: said to you: Since the Master said if was a High Priest and a nazirite, to his brother that he may not become impure but he does become impure to a met mitzva , What to me only a High Priest, what to me a nazirite and a High Priest?
llm_translation: He said to you: Since the Master said, "If he was a High Priest and a Nazirite, he does not become impure for his brother, but he does become impure for a corpse as a mitzvah" — What do I need the High Priest for his exclusivity, what do I need the Nazirite and the High Priest for?

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וְהוּא נָזִיר מְנָלֵיהּ? כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁרָא רַחֲמָנָא חַד לָאו גַּבֵּי מֵת מִצְוָה — מָה לִי חַד לָאו, מָה לִי תְּרֵין לָאוִין.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yishmael, from where does he a High Priest who is a nazirite Since the Merciful One permits one prohibition with regard to a met mitzva , what to me one prohibition what to me two prohibitions
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yishmael, the High Priest, and he was a Nazir, what is the reason? Since the Merciful One permitted one type of prohibition in the case of a corpse, what do I need one prohibition, what do I need two prohibitions.

hebrew_text: ״אַחוֹתוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא כִּי שְׁרָא רַחֲמָנָא לְמֵת מִצְוָה — נָזִיר וְכֹהֵן, דְּאִיסּוּר לָאוֵי הוּא. אֲבָל מִילָה וּפֶסַח, דְּכָרֵת — לֹא יִטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: why do I “his sister”? enter your mind to say when the Merciful One permits to a met mitzva , a nazirite and a priest, a negative prohibition However, circumcision and Paschal offering, of karet , not become impure to a met mitzva . teaches us
llm_translation: "His sister" - why do I need it? The reason for your opinion, I would say, is that the Merciful One permitted a Nazirite and a priest to become impure for a deceased relative, as it is not a prohibition. But circumcision and Passover, which incur karet - one should not become impure for a deceased relative, this is what is implied to us.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, מִכְּדֵי לָא שְׁנָא כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל לְחוֹדֵיהּ וְלָא שְׁנָא כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וְהוּא נָזִיר, נָפְקָא מִ״לְּאָחִיו״, ״לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Akiva, now is no different a High Priest alone, and is no different a High Priest who was a nazirite; derived from “for his brother,” why do I “for his father, or for his mother”
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Akiva, since it does not matter if the High Priest is his relative or if the High Priest is a Nazirite, it is derived from "from his brothers," "from his father and from his mother," why do I need it?

hebrew_text: צְרִיכִי: דְּאִי כְּתַב ״אָבִיו״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּלָא מִיטַּמֵּא לֵיהּ — מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲזָקָה בְּעָלְמָא הוּא. אֲבָל אִמּוֹ דְּיָדְעִין דִּילֵידְתֵּיהּ — לִיטַמֵּא לַהּ.
human_translation: are necessary, as had written his father,” I would say this is the reason may not become impure for Because it is merely a presumption However, his mother, whom we know gave birth to him, let him become impure to her.
llm_translation: I need: for if one writes "his father," I would say: this is the reason that he does not become impure - because it is a common assumption. But his mother, since they know that she gave birth to him - he becomes impure for her.

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אִמּוֹ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אִמּוֹ לָא לִיטַמֵּא לַהּ, דְּלָאו אָזֵיל זַרְעַהּ בָּתְרַהּ. אֲבָל אָבִיו, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר ״לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָם לְבֵית אֲבוֹתָם״, אֵימָא לִיטַמֵּא לֵיהּ — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One written his mother,” I would say to his mother he may not become impure, as her seed does not follow her, However, his father, since the Master said “by their families, by their fathers’ house” say: Let him become impure to him. teaches us
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "his mother," I would say: his mother does not become impure for him, for his seed does not go into her. But his father, since the Master said, "to their families, to their fathers' houses," I would say he does become impure for him — this is implied to us.

hebrew_text: ״וְעַל כׇּל נַפְשׁוֹת מֵת לֹא יָבֹא״, לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: why do I “neither shall he go in to any dead bodies”
llm_translation: "And upon all dead souls he shall not come," why do I need it?

hebrew_text: ״עַל כׇּל״ — לְאַפּוֹקֵי רְחוֹקִים, ״מֵת״ — לְאַפּוֹקֵי קְרוֹבִים, ״נַפְשׁוֹת״ — לְאַפּוֹקֵי רְבִיעִית דָּם שֶׁיָּצָא מִשְּׁנֵי מֵתִים, שֶׁמְּטַמֵּא בְּאֹהֶל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל כׇּל נַפְשׁוֹת מֵת לֹא יָבֹא״.
human_translation: “In to any” to exclude distant “dead” to exclude relatives; “bodies” to exclude a quarter- of blood that emerges from two corpses, for it renders impure in a tent, as it is stated: “Neither shall he go in to any dead bodies”
llm_translation: "Upon all" — to the distant ones, "from" — to the close ones, "souls" — to the fourth degree of blood that came out from two corpses, which imparts impurity in a tent, as it is stated: "Upon all souls of the dead he shall not come."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עַל אֵלּוּ טוּמְאוֹת הַנָּזִיר מְגַלֵּחַ: עַל הַמֵּת, וְעַל כְּזַיִת מִן הַמֵּת, וְעַל כְּזַיִת נֶצֶל, וְעַל מְלֹא תַּרְווֹד רָקָב. עַל הַשִּׁדְרָה, וְעַל הַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת, וְעַל אֵבֶר מִן הַמֵּת, וְעַל אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו בָּשָׂר כָּרָאוּי, וְעַל חֲצִי קַב עֲצָמוֹת, וְעַל חֲצִי לוֹג דָּם.
human_translation: A nazirite shaves for these ritual impurity: For a corpse; and for an olive-bulk of a corpse; and for an olive-bulk of fluid [ netzel ] and for a full ladle [ tarvad ] of dust for the spine; and for the skull; and for a limb from a corpse or for a limb from a living upon which there is a fitting flesh; and for a half- kav of bones and for a half- log blood.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: On these impurities the Nazir shaves: On a corpse, and on an olive's size of flesh from a corpse, and on an olive's size of a coal, and on a full handful of decayed matter. On a shedrah, and on a skull, and on a limb from a corpse, and on a limb from a living being that has flesh attached to it as is fitting, and on half a kab of bones, and on half a log of blood.

hebrew_text: וְעַל מַגָּעָן וְעַל מַשָּׂאָן וְעַל אֲהִילָן. וְעַל עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה עַל מַגָּעוֹ וְעַל מַשָּׂאוֹ.
human_translation: And by coming into contact with them; and for carrying them; and for their tent, And for a bone that is a barley-grain-bulk, for coming into contact with it and by carrying it.
llm_translation: "And regarding their touch, and regarding their carrying, and regarding their tent. And regarding the bone the size of a barleycorn, regarding its touch and regarding its carrying."

hebrew_text: עַל אֵלּוּ הַנָּזִיר מְגַלֵּחַ, וּמַזֶּה בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי וּבַשְּׁבִיעִי וְסוֹתֵר אֶת הַקּוֹדְמִין, וְאֵינוֹ מַתְחִיל לִמְנוֹת אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁיִּטְהַר וּמֵבִיא אֶת קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו.
human_translation: For these a nazirite shaves, and sprinkles on the third and on the seventh And he negates the previous and he begins counting only after he becomes pure and brings his offerings.
llm_translation: Concerning these, the Nazir shaves, and shaves on the third and seventh days, and invalidates the previous days, and does not begin to count except after he becomes purified and brings his sacrifices.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַחַר פְּטִירָתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי מֵאִיר אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְתַלְמִידָיו: אַל יִכָּנְסוּ תַּלְמִידֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְכָאן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקַּנְתְּרָנִין הֵן, וְלֹא לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה הֵן בָּאִין, אֶלָּא לְקַפְּחֵנִי בַּהֲלָכוֹת הֵן בָּאִין. דָּחַק סוֹמְכוֹס וְנִכְנַס.
human_translation: The Sages taught: After Rabbi Meir’s death, Rabbi Yehuda said to his students: Do not let the students of Rabbi Meir enter here, because they are vexatious and they do not come to study Torah, but they come to overwhelm me with halakhot . Sumakhos, forced his way and entered
llm_translation: The Sages taught: After the passing of Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Yehuda said to his students: The students of Rabbi Meir should not enter here, because they are quarrelsome, and they do not come to study Torah, but rather they come to engage in legal casuistry. Soma'kos was distressed and entered.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם, כָּךְ שָׁנָה לִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר: עַל אֵלּוּ טוּמְאוֹת הַנָּזִיר מְגַלֵּחַ: עַל הַמֵּת, וְעַל כַּזַּיִת מִן הַמֵּת. כָּעַס רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְאָמַר לָהֶן, לֹא כָּךְ אָמַרְתִּי לָכֶם: אַל יִכָּנְסוּ תַּלְמִידֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְכָאן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקַּנְתְּרָנִין הֵן? עַל כַּזַּיִת מִן הַמֵּת מְגַלֵּחַ — עַל הַמֵּת לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: said to them: Rabbi Meir taught me like this: A nazirite shaves for these ritual impurity: For a corpse and for an olive-bulk from a corpse. Rabbi Yehuda grew angry and said to Didn’t I say to you like this: Do not let the students of Rabbi Meir enter here because they are vexatious? must shave for an olive-bulk from a corpse, not all the more so for corpse?
llm_translation: He said to them, "So Rabbi Meir taught me: Concerning these impurities the Nazir shaves: for the dead, and for the olive size of the dead. Rabbi Yehuda became angry and said to them, 'This is not what I told you: Let not the students of Rabbi Meir enter here, because they are sharp-witted? Shaving for the olive size of the dead - for the dead, all the more so?!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: יֹאמְרוּ מֵאִיר שָׁכַב, יְהוּדָה כָּעַס, יוֹסֵי שָׁתַק — תּוֹרָה מַה תְּהֵא עָלֶיהָ? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְמֵת שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר. וַעֲדַיִין יֹאמַר: עַל אֵבֶר מִמֶּנּוּ מְגַלֵּחַ, עַל כּוּלּוֹ לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: they will say: Meir is dead, Yehuda is angry, Yosei remained silent what will become of the Torah? Rabbi Yosei said: not necessary but for a corpse upon which there is not an olive-bulk of flesh. But one could still say: shave for a limb from not all the more so for all of
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: Meir said, "He lay down," Yehuda was angry, Yosei remained silent - what should be the Torah's response to this? Rabbi Yosei said: It is only necessary for a dead person who does not have the size of an olive of flesh on him. And still, he says: For a limb from him, one may shave, for all of him, certainly not?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְנֵפֶל שֶׁלֹּא נִתְקַשְּׁרוּ אֵבָרָיו בְּגִידִין. הָכָא נָמֵי: בְּנֵפֶל שֶׁלֹּא נִתְקַשְּׁרוּ אֵבָרָיו בְּגִידִין.
human_translation: Rather, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said, necessary only for a miscarried fetus whose limbs had not become joined to sinews. Here too, to a miscarried fetus whose limbs had not become joined to sinews.
llm_translation: Rather, as Rabbi Yochanan said: It was necessary only for a miscarriage where its limbs were not yet intertwined with sinews. Here too: for a miscarriage where its limbs were not yet intertwined with sinews.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְרוֹב בִּנְיָינוֹ וּלְרוֹב מִנְיָינוֹ, שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת.
human_translation: Rava said necessary only for the majority of the structure or the majority of the number that they do not contain a quarter- of bones.
llm_translation: Rava said: It is needed only for the majority of its construction and for the majority of its substance, as they do not contain a majority of bones.

hebrew_text: עַל כְּזַיִת מֵת וְעַל כְּזַיִת נֶצֶל. וְאֵיזֶהוּ נֶצֶל — בְּשַׂר הַמֵּת שֶׁקָּרַשׁ, וּמוֹהַל שֶׁהִרְתִּיחַ.
human_translation: for an olive-bulk of a corpse and for an olive-bulk of fluid. And what is fluid? flesh of the corpse that congealed, and liquid [ mohal ] that to boil
llm_translation: Regarding an olive's size of a dead animal and an olive's size of a detached limb. And which is a detached limb? — The flesh of a dead animal that became dry, and the salted meat that was cooked.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּלָא יָדְעִינַן דְּדִידֵיהּ הוּא, כִּי קָרַשׁ מַאי הָוֵי? אֶלָּא דְּיָדְעִינַן דְּדִידֵיהּ הוּא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא קָרַשׁ!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say that we do not know that is if congealed, what of it? Rather, that we know that it even though not congealed.
llm_translation: "How are the laws of similarity? If we say that we do not know if it is his, what is the ruling? Rather, we know that it is his, even though it is not similar!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: בִּסְתָם. אִי קָרַשׁ — מוֹהֵל הוּא, לֹא קָרַשׁ — דִּלְמָא כִּיחוֹ וְנִיעוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to an unspecified If congeals, it is liquid not congeal, perhaps it is his phlegm and his spittle,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: In a case of doubt. If he read the Torah - he is circumcised, if he did not read - perhaps he is like a heathen and an idolater.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה: יֵשׁ נֶצֶל לִבְהֵמָה אוֹ אֵין נֶצֶל לִבְהֵמָה? מִי אָמְרִינַן גְּמִירִי נֶצֶל דְּאָתֵי מֵאָדָם, אֲבָל דְּאָתֵי מִבְּהֵמָה — לָא. אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא?
human_translation: Abaye raised a dilemma before Rabba: Is there fluid with regard to animals, or is there no fluid with regard to animals? Do we say is learned fluid that comes from a person but that comes from an animal not Or perhaps is no different,
llm_translation: Abaye asked Rabbah: Is there benefit for an animal or is there no benefit for an animal? Do we say that benefit comes from a person, but not from an animal? Or perhaps it is not different?

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה עַד לְגֵר, וְטוּמְאָה קַלָּה עַד לְכֶלֶב — שַׁפִּיר.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says a severe impurity, until for a stranger, And a light impurity until for a dog. it is well,
llm_translation: He left it for the one who said impurity is severe until conversion, and impurity is light until a dog - it is fine.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה עַד לְכֶלֶב, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: However, according to the one who says a severe impurity until for a dog, what is there to say?
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says that impurity is severe up to a dog, what can be said?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הִמְחוּהוּ בָּאוּר — טָמֵא, בַּחַמָּה — טָהוֹר. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ עַד לְכֶלֶב, אֲפִילּוּ בַּחַמָּה נָמֵי!
human_translation: Come hear that liquefied in fire is impure. in the sun, pure. And if it enters your mind until for a dog even in the sun also
llm_translation: Come and hear: If it is found in a pit - it is impure, in the sun - it is pure. And if you were to suggest that your reasoning extends even to a dog, even in the sun it is impure!

hebrew_text: אֵימַת מַמְחֵי לֵיהּ — בָּתַר דְּאַסְרַח בְּחַמָּה, כֵּיוָן דְּאַסְרַח — הָוֵה לֵיהּ עָפָר.
human_translation: When does liquefy? After it has putrefied, in the sun. once it putrefied, it had become dust
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When does one wipe it? — After it has been rinsed in hot water, once it has been rinsed, it has dust.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: כׇּל הַנִּצּוֹק — טָהוֹר.
human_translation: We learned Anything that is poured ritually pure.
llm_translation: We have learned: "All that is squeezed - pure."

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִדְּבַשׁ הַזִּיפִים וְהַצַּפִּיחִית.
human_translation: except for zifim honey, and batter,
llm_translation: Outside of the honey of wasps and the pitch.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אַף הַמִּקְפָּה שֶׁל גְּרִיסִין וְשֶׁל פּוֹל, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא סוֹלֶדֶת לַאֲחוֹרֶיהָ.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: Even of a stew crushed and broken beans or of whole beans because it returns backward.
llm_translation: House of Shammai say: Even the peel of nuts and of beans, because it is attached to its back.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: יֵשׁ נִצּוֹק לָאוֹכָלִין, אוֹ אֵין נִצּוֹק לָאוֹכָלִין. מִי אָמְרִינַן מִשּׁוּם דְּאִית בְּהוּ רִירֵי, וְהָנֵי לֵית בְּהוּ רִירֵי. אוֹ דִּלְמָא מִשּׁוּם דִּסְמִיכִין הוּא, וְהָכָא הָא סְמִיכִין?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises a dilemma: is there a stream for food, or is there not a stream for food? Do we say because they have a flow and these do not have a flow Or, perhaps because they are viscous, and here are viscous.
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ramei bar Ḥama asked: Is there a squeezing for foods, or is there no squeezing for foods? Who said this because there is moisture in them, and these do not have moisture. Or perhaps it is because they are adjacent, and here, are they adjacent?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: חֵלֶב הַמֵּת שֶׁהוּא שָׁלֵם וְהִתִּיכוֹ — טָמֵא, הָיָה מְפוֹרָד וְהִתִּיכוֹ — טָהוֹר. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אֵין נִצּוֹק לָאוֹכָלִין, שָׁלֵם וְהִתִּיכוֹ נָמֵי לִיטְהַר!
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear fat of a corpse that was whole and one melted it, ritually impure. was separated and one melted it, pure. And if it enters your mind there is no stream for food, whole and one melted it, it should also be pure,
llm_translation: Rava said, "Come and hear: The fat of a dead animal, whether it is whole or separated - it is impure; if it was detached and separated - it is pure. And if you think that it is not squeezed out for eating, even if it is whole and separated, it also becomes pure!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אֲנָא וּמָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא תַּרְגֵּימְנָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן דְּבַהֲדֵי דְּמַרְתַּח לֵיהּ, סָלֵיק עַמּוּדָא דְנוּרָא לְפוּמֵּיהּ דְּמָנָא וְקָרֵשׁ, דְּאִיתֵיהּ כּוּלֵּא גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: I and Mar, son of Ravina, explained With what are we dealing here? where as he was heating it, the column of fire rose to the mouth of the vessel, and congealed so that it was all together,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: I and the son of Ravina, we translated: Here with what we are dealing - for example, when he kindles it, he brings a pillar of fire in front of him, made of a reed and a board, which is all against the walls.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, תָּא שְׁמַע: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אַף הַמִּקְפָּה שֶׁל גְּרִיסִין וְשֶׁל פּוֹל — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן סוֹלְדִין לַאֲחוֹרֵיהֶן. מִידֵּי אִירְיָא? הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם דִּסְמִיכִין. הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם רִירֵי.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Come hear Beit Shammai say: Even a stew made of crushed and broken beans or of whole beans because it returns backward. Are the cases comparable? There, because is viscous. Here, due to flow,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi, come and hear: Beit Shammai say: Even the edge of the roof beams and of the mortar - because they are sloped backwards. Is it due to the roof? There, it is because they are adjacent. Here, it is because of the runoff.

hebrew_text: וְעַל מְלֹא תַּרְווֹד רָקָב. וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּרוֹ? חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר: מְלֹא פִּיסַּת הַיָּד, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו. תְּנַן: מְלֹא תַּרְווֹד רָקָב שֶׁאָמְרוּ, יֶשְׁנָן מֵעִיקַּר אֶצְבָּעוֹת וּלְמַעְלָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו.
human_translation: And for a full ladle of dust. And how much is measure Ḥizkiyya said: A full palm of the hand. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: His handfuls, We learned The full ladle of dust that spoke of includes from the base fingers and above; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: His handfuls.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And on a full handful of mold. And what is its measure? Hezekiah said: the fullness of the handbreadth, Rabbi Yochanan said: the fullness of his fists. We learned: a full handful of mold, as they said, they are from the knuckles and above, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: the fullness of his fists."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הוּא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבָּנַן. אֶלָּא חִזְקִיָּה כְּמַאן? לָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר וְלָא כְּרַבָּנַן! אָמְרִי: מְלֹא פִּיסַּת הַיָּד וּמְלֹא קִשְׁרֵי אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו לְמַעְלָה — חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא.
human_translation: Granted, Rabbi Yoḥanan spoke in accordance with the Rabbis. But with whose did Ḥizkiyya neither in accordance with Rabbi Meir nor in accordance with the Rabbis. say a full palm of hand and a full his finger joints and above are one measure.
llm_translation: In truth, Rabbi Yochanan is the one who said like Rabbanan. But Hezekiah is like whom? Not like Rabbi Meir and not like Rabbanan! They said: If the space of the hand is full and the knots of his fingers are full upwards - that is one Shiur.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אַדָּא לְרַב פָּפָּא: מִמַּאי דְּהַאי מִקִּשְׁרֵי אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו וּלְמַעְלָה לְרֹאשׁ? דִּלְמָא לְמַטָּה מִדִּידֵיהּ, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ מְלֹא פִּיסַּת הַיָּד? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Adda said to Rav Pappa: From where that this From his finger joints and above, toward the ends Perhaps to below it, in which it is A full palm of the hand. shall stand
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Shimi bar Adda to Rav Papa: From what is the reason that this one ties his fingers and above to his head? Perhaps it is below from him, for he would have a full handbreadth? It shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ מֵת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ רָקָב? מֵת שֶׁנִּקְבַּר עָרוֹם בְּאָרוֹן שֶׁל שַׁיִשׁ אוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי רִצְפָּה שֶׁל אֲבָנִים — זֶהוּ מֵת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ רָקָב. נִקְבַּר בִּכְסוּתוֹ, בְּאָרוֹן שֶׁל עֵץ, אוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי רִצְפָּה שֶׁל לְבֵנִים — זֶהוּ מֵת שֶׁאֵין לוֹ רָקָב.
human_translation: The Sages taught Which is a corpse that has dust, A corpse that was buried naked in a marble coffin or on a stone floor; this is a corpse that has dust buried in its cloak, in a wooden coffin, or on a brick floor, this is a corpse that does not have dust
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Who is a dead person that has decay? A dead person who was buried naked in a coffin of marble or on a stone floor - this is a dead person that has decay. If he was buried with his clothes, in a wooden coffin, or on a floor of bricks - this is a dead person that does not have decay.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: אֵין רָקָב, אֶלָּא הַבָּא מִן הַבָּשָׂר וּמִן הַגִּידִים וּמִן הָעֲצָמוֹת. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְעוּלָּא: רָקָב הַבָּא מִן הַבָּשָׂר טָהוֹר. הָא מִן הָעֶצֶם — טָמֵא, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵיכָּא בָּשָׂר! אֵימָא הָכִי: רָקָב הַבָּא מִן הַבָּשָׂר — טָהוֹר, עַד שֶׁיֵּשׁ עֶצֶם בַּבָּשָׂר.
human_translation: Ulla said: Dust is only that which comes from the flesh and from the sinews and from the bones Rava raised an objection to Ulla Dust that comes from the flesh is pure. from the bone it is impure, even though there is no flesh should say like this: Dust that comes from the flesh is pure, unless there is bone in the flesh.
llm_translation: Ula said: There is no decay, except that which comes from the flesh, sinews, and bones. Rava raised an objection to Ula: Decay that comes from the flesh is pure. But if it comes from the bone, it is impure, even though there is no flesh! Let us say thus: Decay that comes from the flesh is pure, as long as there is bone in the flesh.

hebrew_text: הָא לֵיכָּא גִּידִים! אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְבָשָׂר וְלַעֲצָמוֹת בְּלֹא גִּידִים.
human_translation: there is no sinews it is impossible for flesh and bones without sinews.
llm_translation: Here are sinews! If not possible for flesh and for bones without sinews.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁנֵי מֵתִים שֶׁקְּבָרָן זֶה עִם זֶה — נַעֲשׂוּ גַּלְגַּלִּין זֶה לָזֶה. מֵתִיב רַב נָתָן: רָקָב הַבָּא מִשְּׁנֵי מֵתִים — טָמֵא!
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Two corpses that were buried with one another become a mixture [ galgallin ] with one another. Rav Natan raises an objection dust that comes from two corpses is impure.
llm_translation: Said Rav Shmuel bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: Two deceased individuals who were buried together - their graves become like a threshing floor. Rav Natan objects: Only if a corpse comes from two deceased individuals - it is impure!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שֶׁקָּבְרוּ זֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וְזֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, וְהִרְקִיבוּ, וְעָמְדוּ עַל מְלֹא תַּרְווֹד רָקָב.
human_translation: Rava said: where they buried this by itself and that by itself, and they decayed and they stood at, a full ladle of dust.
llm_translation: Rava said: "That they buried this one separately and this one separately, and they hollowed out, and they stood on a full tarevot of decay."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גָּזַז שְׂעָרוֹ וּקְבָרוֹ עִמּוֹ — נַעֲשָׂה לוֹ גַּלְגַּלִּין. תְּנַן הָתָם: כׇּל שֶׁבַּמֵּת טָמֵא, חוּץ מִן הַשִּׁינַּיִם וְהַשֵּׂעָר וְהַצִּפּוֹרֶן. וּבִשְׁעַת חִיבּוּרָן — כּוּלָּן טְמֵאִין.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: cut the hair and buried with it, becomes mixture for We learned there Everything that is in a corpse impure, except for the teeth, the hair, and the nails, But when they are attached they are all impure.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: If one shaves his hair and buries it with him, he will have wheels made for him. We learned there: Anyone who dies is impure, except for the teeth, hair, and nails. And at the time of their separation, all of them are impure.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי חִזְקִיָּה: שְׂעָרוֹ הָעוֹמֵד לְגַלֵּחַ, צִפּוֹרֶן הָעוֹמֵד לִיגָּזֵז, מַאי? מִי אָמְרִינַן: כׇּל הָעוֹמֵד לִיגָּזֵז כְּגָזוּז דָּמֵי, אוֹ דִלְמָא הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא הָא מְחוּבָּרִין?
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya raised a dilemma: hair is ready to be shaved, nail is ready to be cut, what Do we say anything that is ready to be cut is considered cut, Or, perhaps now, in any event, they are attached,
llm_translation: Inquiries of Chizkiyah: His hair that stands to be shaven, his nails that stand to be trimmed, what? Do we say: anyone who stands to trim is like one who has trimmed, or perhaps now they are still attached?

hebrew_text: וְנִיפְשׁוֹט לֵיהּ מִדְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: טַעְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּגָזַז, הָא לֹא גָּזַז — לָא! הָכִי קָאָמַר: גָּזַז — הֲרֵי זֶה גַּלְגַּלִּים. לֹא גָּזַז — מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And let resolve from Rabba bar bar Ḥana, The reason because he cut not cut not this is what is saying: cut it a mixture; not cut he raises a dilemma.
llm_translation: And it was resolved according to Rabba bar bar Ḥana: The reason is because he cut off, but if he did not cut off — no! This is what he is saying: If he cut off — here are wheels. If he did not cut off — he requires it.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: רָקָב הַבָּא מִן הֶעָקֵב מַהוּ? כִּי גָּמְרִינַן רָקָב הַבָּא מִכּוּלֵּיהּ מֵת, אֲבָל דְּאָתֵי מִן עָקֵב — לָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raised dilemma dust that comes from the heel, what is when we learn dust that comes from all a corpse, but that comes from heel, no, or perhaps is no different?
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rabbi Yirmiyah: What is the ruling regarding a worm that comes from the heel? For we have learned: a worm that comes from all of it is dead, but if it comes from the heel - no, or perhaps it is not different?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי נָתָן בְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: רָקָב הַבָּא מִשְּׁנֵי מֵתִים — טָמֵא. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ הַבָּא מִן הֶעָקֵב לָא, זִיל הָכָא — דִּלְמָא דֶּרֶךְ עָקֵב קָאָתֵי, וְהָכָא — דִּלְמָא דֶּרֶךְ עָקֵב קָאָתֵי?
human_translation: Come hear, as Rabbi Natan, son of Rabbi Oshaya, taught: Dust that comes from two corpses impure. And if it enters your mind that comes from the heel not go here perhaps came from the heel, and here perhaps came from the heel.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught by Rabbi Natan son of Rabbi Oshaya: If a creeping thing comes from two dead bodies - it is unclean. And if you think that if it comes from the heel it is not unclean, go here - perhaps it comes from the path of the heel, and here - perhaps it comes from the path of the heel?

hebrew_text: אִי דְּאִירְקִיב כּוּלֵּיהּ מֵת וְקָאָתֵי דֶּרֶךְ עָקֵב — הָכִי נָמֵי. אֶלָּא הָכָא כְּגוֹן דְּאִירְקִיב חַד אֵבֶר, וְקָאָתֵי דֶּרֶךְ עָקֵב. מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: If the entire corpse decayed and came from the heel, so too, Rather, here where one limb decayed and came from heel. What shall stand
llm_translation: If one pierces all of it (the animal) and it dies, and it is lying on its side — so it is said. Rather, here (it is discussing) a case where one pierces one limb, and it is lying on its side. What is the resolution? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: עוּבָּר בִּמְעֵי אִשָּׁה, הָוֵי גַּלְגַּלִּים, אוֹ לָא? כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר עוּבָּר יֶרֶךְ אִמּוֹ — הִלְכָּךְ גּוּפַהּ הוּא, וְלָא הָוֵי גַּלְגַּלִּין, אוֹ דִלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּסוֹפוֹ לָצֵאת — מִיפְרָשׁ פָּרֵישׁ מִינַּהּ. וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר עוּבָּר דְּסוֹפוֹ לָצֵאת מִיפְרָשׁ פָּרֵישׁ מִינַּהּ,
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raised dilemma: Does fetus in its mother’s womb a mixture or not? since the Master said a fetus is the thigh of its mother, it is therefore her body and it not a mixture Or perhaps Since will ultimately emerge separated from her, And if you say a fetus, which will ultimately emerge, separated from her
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rabbi Yirmiyah: If a fetus in the womb of a woman, is it like "galgalim" or not? Since the Master said, "If the fetus is the thigh of its mother, therefore it is her body, and it is not like 'galgalim,' or perhaps since its end is to come out, it is considered as separated from her. And if you wish to say that if the fetus is to come out, it is considered as separated from her.

hebrew_text: שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע בִּמְעֵי אִשָּׁה, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן כֵּיוָן דְּלָא אִיתְּצַר — כִּי גוּפַהּ דָּמֵי, אוֹ דִלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּמֵעָלְמָא קָאָתֵי — לָא?
human_translation: semen in woman’s womb. What is Do we say since no was formed considered like her body? Or, perhaps since it comes from outside, not
llm_translation: The lying of seed in the bowels of a woman, what is the ruling? Do we say since it did not become formed - it is like the body of blood, or perhaps since it comes from the world - no?

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: פִּירְשָׁהּ, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מִקַּיְימָא בִּדְלָא אָכְלָה — חַיּוּתָא הוּא, אוֹ דִלְמָא הָא נָמֵי מֵעָלְמָא אָתֵי? בָּעֵי רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: עוֹרוֹ מַהוּ? בָּעֵי רַב הוּנָא בַּר מָנוֹחַ: כִּיחוֹ וְנִיעוֹ מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Pappa raised dilemma: her excrement, what is since she cannot subsist without food it is her life, Or perhaps this too comes from outside Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, raised a dilemma its skin, what is Rav Huna bar Manoaḥ raised a dilemma: its phlegm and its spittle, what is
llm_translation: The inquiry of Rav Papa: What is the ruling regarding a case where she did not fulfill her obligation, did not eat - is it considered a valid act, or perhaps it is as if it never came into the world? The inquiry of Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika: What is the ruling regarding his skin? The inquiry of Rav Huna, son of Manoach: What is the ruling regarding his spittle and his excrement?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַחָא לְרַב פָּפָּא: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כׇּל הָנֵי דְּקָאָמַר הָוֵי גַּלְגַּלִּין, רָקָב דִּמְטַמֵּא הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ! דְּאַשְׁקְיֵיהּ מֵי דְקָלִים, וְסַכְיֵא נָשָׁא, וּשְׁלָקוֹ בְּמֵי טְבֶרְיָא.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Aḥa said to Rav Pappa: But if it enters your mind all these which they spoke a mixture, what circumstances you find dust imparts impurity? if was given palm water [ mei dekalim ], to drink and was rubbed with a depilatory and was boiled in the waters of Tiberias
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Shmuel bar Acha to Rav Papa: And if it enters your mind, all those that he said should be like wheels, how do you find a worm that makes impure? For it drinks from palm tree water, eats a date, and then goes into the waters of Tiberias.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, נָקְטִינַן: מֵת שֶׁטְּחָנוֹ — אֵין לוֹ רָקָב. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: טְחָנוֹ וְחָזַר וְהִרְקִיב, מַהוּ? מִידֵּי הוּא טַעְמָא אֶלָּא דְּאִיכָּא בָּשָׂר וְגִידִים וַעֲצָמוֹת, וְהָאִיכָּא. אוֹ דִּלְמָא כִּבְרִיָּיתוֹ בָּעִינַן, וְלֵיכָּא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: We have a tradition a corpse that was ground has no dust. A dilemma was raised before was ground and later decayed, what is Is the halakha only there is flesh and sinews and bones, and are present Or perhaps, we require its initial state, and not shall stand
llm_translation: Abbaye said: We have learned: A dead person whose body has been ground up - does not have decay. They asked a question: If his body was ground up, then reconstituted and decayed, what is the ruling? It is immediately recognizable that there are flesh, sinews, and bones, and there is no issue. Or perhaps we require his original form, and there is none? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי עוּלָּא בַּר חֲנִינָא: מֵת שֶׁחָסַר — אֵין לוֹ רָקָב וְלֹא תְּפוּסָה וְלֹא שְׁכוּנַת קְבָרוֹת.
human_translation: Ulla bar Ḥanina teaches: A corpse that lacks does not have dust, nor caught [ tefusa ] Nor a graveyard
llm_translation: Tanna taught Ula bar Hanina: A person who died lacking - he has no decay, no decomposition, and no burial place.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: לֹא, אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּמֵת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ רוֹב וְרוֹבַע אוֹ מְלֹא תַרְווֹד רָקָב — תֹּאמַר בְּחַי, שֶׁאֵין לוֹ לֹא רוֹב, וְלֹא רוֹבַע, וְלֹא מְלֹא תַרְווֹד רָקָב?!
human_translation: raises an objection No, if you say with regard to a corpse, whose the majority or a quarter- or a full ladle of dust shall you say with regard to a living who does not have the majority nor a quarter- nor a full ladle of dust?
llm_translation: The Talmudic text you provided translates into English as follows: Talmudic text: Meitivi: Lo, im amarta b'met sheyesh lo rov v'rovah o m'lo tarvod rakav — tomer b'chai, she'ein lo lo rov, v'lo rovah, v'lo m'lo tarvod rakav?! English translation: It was raised in objection: No, if you say regarding a dead body that it has the majority and a quarter or the full measure of a quarter-rotten — should you say regarding a living body that it has neither the majority, nor a quarter, nor the full measure of a quarter-rotten?!

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי — דְּאַרְקִיב חַד אֵבֶר, דִּכְווֹתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי מֵת: אֲפִילּוּ חַד אֵבֶר אִיכָּא רָקָב! מִי קָתָנֵי הָא מֵת? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: שׁוּם מֵת — יֵשׁ לוֹ רָקָב, שׁוּם חַי — אֵין לוֹ רָקָב.
human_translation: What are the circumstances that one limb decayed, that in the corresponding with regard to a corpse, there is dust even one limb. Did teach that this corpse teaches us this: The name, of a corpse has dust. the name of a living does not have dust.
llm_translation: "How so are the similarities? For if one limb is exposed, worms will come upon the dead body. Even if only one limb is there, there is decay! Who taught this about the dead body? This is what we have heard: Any dead body - it has decay, any living body - it does not have decay."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: הִרְקִיב כְּשֶׁהוּא חַי, וְחָזַר וּמֵת, מַהוּ? כִּי גְּמִירִי רָקָב, דְּאִירְקִיב כְּשֶׁהוּא מֵת. אוֹ דִלְמָא הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא הָא מָיֵית?
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma: decayed when he was alive, and subsequently died, what is when is learned dust if decayed when he was dead, Or perhaps, now in any event he is dead,
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rava: If one spits while he is alive, and then he dies, what is the ruling? Is it because we learn from a maggot, that it spits while it is alive? Or perhaps now that he is dead, is it different?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לֹא אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּמֵת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ רוֹב וְרוֹבַע וּמְלֹא תַרְווֹד רָקָב, תֹּאמַר בְּחַי כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Come hear No, if you say with regard to a corpse, whose the majority or a quarter- or a full ladle of dust shall you say with regard to a living
llm_translation: Come and hear: If you say regarding a dead person that he has the majority and a quarter and a half of a lug of decomposed matter, you should say regarding a living person that he is impure.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא מִשּׁוּם חַי, הָא מֵת יֵשׁ לוֹ רָקָב! מִי קָתָנֵי הָא מֵת? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּשׁוּם מֵת — יֵשׁ לוֹ רָקָב, שׁוּם חַי — אֵין לוֹ רָקָב.
human_translation: The reason is due to a living a corpse, has dust, Did teach that this corpse teaches us this: The name, of a corpse has dust. the name of a living does not have dust.
llm_translation: Reason from life, this one who is dead has decay! Who is the one who is strict about the dead? This one who is dead? This teaches to us that regarding the dead — he has decay, regarding the living — he does not have decay.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: נְמָלָה שֶׁחָסְרָה, מַהוּ? שִׁיעוּרָא גְּמִירִין לַהּ — וְהָא חֲסַר. אוֹ בְּרִיָּה גְּמִירִי לַהּ — וְהָאִיכָּא.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma: an ant that lacks what is Is learned the amount and this one is lacking? Or we learn entity, and there is
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rava: nemalah shechasrah, mah? shi'ura gemirin la — veha chasar. o b'riyah gemiri la — veha'ikka.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה מִדִּיסְקַרְתָּא: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״בָּהֶם״, יָכוֹל בְּכוּלָּן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מֵהֶם״. אִי ״מֵהֶם״, יָכוֹל מִקְצָתָן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בָּהֶם״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda from Diskarta said: Come hear them might to all of them, the verse states: of them, If “of them,” might a small part The verse states: “Them,”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah from Diskarta said: Come and hear: "Among them," could include all of them - the Talmud teaches to say: "From them." If "from them," could mean some of them - the Talmud teaches to say: "Among them."

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? עַד שֶׁיִּגַּע בְּמִקְצָתָן שֶׁהוּא כְּכוּלָּן. וְשִׁיעֲרוּ חֲכָמִים בְּכַעֲדָשָׁה, שֶׁכֵּן הַחוֹמֶט תְּחִלַּת בְּרִיָּיתוֹ בְּכַעֲדָשָׁה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ שִׁיעוּרָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ.
human_translation: How so? unless he touches part of them that is to all of them, And the Sages calculated of a lentil-bulk. As the start of the formation of a skink, of a lentil-bulk. learn from here is learned the amount
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "How so? Until he touches some of them, which is like touching all of them. And the sages estimated it to be the size of a lentil, for that is the size of the initial formation of a creature in a lentil. Learn from it the measure that is learned from it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמַעְיָה: כִּי בָּעִינַן שִׁיעוּרָא דְּבִדְלָא הָוְיָא כַּעֲדָשָׁה לָא מְטַמָּא, דְּלָא נָפְלָה בַּהּ נְשָׁמָה. אֲבָל נָפְלָה בַּהּ נְשָׁמָה — לָא. תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ.
human_translation: Rav Shemaya said, When we require amount, that if it is not of a lentil-bulk it does not impart impurity, where does not have soul However, does have a soul, not the dilemma remains for you.
llm_translation: Rav Shemaya said: For we require the measurement of a separation, that it should be like a lentil, so it does not become impure, for a soul did not fall into it. But if a soul fell into it - no. You should ask.

hebrew_text: הַשִּׁדְרָה וְהַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שִׁדְרָה וְגוּלְגּוֹלֶת תְּנַן, אוֹ דִּלְמָא: אוֹ שִׁדְרָה אוֹ גוּלְגּוֹלֶת? אָמַר רָבָא: תָּא שְׁמַע: שִׁדְרָה שֶׁגֵּירַד רוֹב עִילְעִין שֶׁבָּהּ — טְהוֹרָה. וּבְקֶבֶר אֲפִילּוּ מְשׁוּבֶּרֶת אוֹ מְפוֹרֶקֶת — טְמֵאָה, מִפְּנֵי הַקֶּבֶר.
human_translation: a spine and skull. A dilemma was raised before we learn a spine and [ ve ] skull Or perhaps either a spine or a skull. Rava said: Come hear a spine, the majority of whose ribs were removed ritually pure. And in a grave, even broken or disassembled, it is impure, due to the grave,
llm_translation: The lattice and the skull. It was asked: Lattice and skull we learned, or perhaps: either lattice or skull? Rava said: Come and hear: A lattice that has the majority of its slats intact - is pure. But in a grave, even if it is shattered or broken - it is impure, because of the grave.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּגֵירַד, הָא לָא גֵּירַד — טָמֵא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אוֹ שִׁדְרָה אוֹ גוּלְגּוֹלֶת קָתָנֵי. הָא לָא קָתָנֵי. הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּכִי גֵּירַד — טְהוֹרָה, אִידַּךְ, תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ.
human_translation: The reason is due to that were removed, were not removed, impure Learn from this teaches: Either a spine or a skull. does not teach this teaches us this, that if removed pure. the other the dilemma remains for you.
llm_translation: Reason from that of Gird, this is not Gird - impure, hear from it: or a pot or a skull it teaches. This is not what it teaches. This is what it is teaching us: that when it is Gird - it is pure, otherwise, it requires you.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְטַמֵּא וַחֲכָמִים מְטַהֲרִין, וְחָזַר בּוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. וּמַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ קוּפָּה מְלֵאָה עֲצָמוֹת לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת שֶׁל טַרְסִיִּים, וְהִנִּיחוּהָ בַּאֲוִיר, וְנִכְנַס תּוֹדוֹס הָרוֹפֵא וְכׇל הָרוֹפְאִים [עִמּוֹ], וְאָמְרוּ: אֵין כָּאן שִׁדְרָה מִמֵּת אֶחָד.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda says Rabbi Akiva deems six items impure that the Rabbis deem pure, and Rabbi Akiva retracted And an incident which they brought a box full of bones to the synagogue of blacksmiths [ tarsiyyim ], and they placed it in airspace, And Todos the doctor entered and all the doctors with him, and they said, There is not spine from one corpse here.
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rabbi Yehuda says: Six things Rabbi Akiva declares impure, while the sages declare them pure, and Rabbi Akiva retracted. And there was an incident where they brought a basket full of bones to the synagogue of the Tarsians, and they left it in the air, and Tudos the doctor entered, and all the other doctors with him, and they said: "There is no demon here from a single dead person."

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּלֵיכָּא שִׁדְרָה דְּמֵחֲדָא. הָאִיכָּא אוֹ שִׁדְרָה אוֹ גוּלְגּוֹלֶת דְּמֵחֲדָא — נָזִיר מְגַלֵּחַ עָלֶיהָ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אוֹ שִׁדְרָה אוֹ גוּלְגּוֹלֶת תְּנַן. לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא שִׁדְרָה וְגוּלְגּוֹלֶת, דְּמִמֵּת אֶחָד לֵיכָּא, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אוֹ שִׁדְרָה מִמֵּת אֶחָד אוֹ גוּלְגּוֹלֶת מִמֵּת אֶחָד לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: The reason is due to that there was no spine from one there is either a spine or a skull from one a nazirite must shave due to it. Learn from this we learned either a spine or a skull. is speaking It is not necessary, It is not necessary there is no spine and skull from one corpse but even either a spine from one corpse or a skull from one corpse, not
llm_translation: Reason of not there a row of from one. The how there a row or skull from one — a Nazir shaves upon it, hear from it or row or skull we learn. Not requires saying: not requires row and skull, for from one not there, but even or row from one or skull from one there.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע מִמִּנְיָינָא: וּמָה הֵן שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים שֶׁרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְטַמֵּא וַחֲכָמִים מְטַהֲרִין: עַל אֵבֶר מִן הַמֵּת שֶׁבָּא מִשְּׁנֵי מֵתִים, וְעַל אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי שֶׁבָּא מִשְּׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם, וְעַל חֲצִי קַב עֲצָמוֹת שֶׁבָּא מִשְּׁנֵי מֵתִים, וְעַל רְבִיעִית דָּם הַבָּא מִשְּׁנַיִם, וְעַל עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה שֶׁנֶּחְלַק לִשְׁנַיִם, וְהַשִּׁדְרָה וְהַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת.
human_translation: Come hear from the tally And what are those six items that Rabbi Akiva deems ritually impure and the Rabbis deem ritually pure? of a limb from a corpse that comes from, two corpses; and limb from a living that comes from two people; and half- kav of bones that come from two corpses; and a quarter- of blood that comes from two and of a bone that is a barley-grain-bulk, that was divided into two; and the spine and the skull
llm_translation: Come and hear from where do we derive: And what are the six things that Rabbi Akiva declares impure, while the sages declare pure: On a limb from a corpse that came from two corpses, and on a limb from a living being that came from two human beings, and on half a kab of bones that came from two corpses, and on a quarter log of blood that came from two sources, and on a bone like a barleycorn that is divided into two, and the vertebra and the skull.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אוֹ שִׁדְרָה אוֹ גוּלְגּוֹלֶת, הָנֵי שִׁבְעָה הָוְיָין! כִּי קָתָנֵי (סִימָן: יָחִיד, שֶׁהוּא, גִּילַּח, וְאֶחָד) —
human_translation: And if it enters your mind either a spine or a skull these are seven as when teaches a mnemonic An individual that he; shaves and one
llm_translation: And if your mind or a demon or a skull, these seven are considered! For it is taught (sign: individual, which is, shaved, and one) —

hebrew_text: כׇּל הֵיכָא דִּפְלִיגִי עֲלֵיהּ רַבִּים. לְאַפּוֹקֵי עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה, דְּיָחִיד הוּא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ. דְּתַנְיָא: עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה שֶׁנֶּחְלַק לִשְׁנַיִם, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְטַמֵּא וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי מְטַהֵר.
human_translation: anywhere that many disagree with him, to the exclusion of a barley-grain-bulk, it is an individual who disagrees with as it is taught a bone that is a barley-grain-bulk was divided into two, Rabbi Akiva deems impure and Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri deems pure.
llm_translation: In every place where the majority dispute it, to the extent of a hair's breadth, it is an individual who disputes it. As it was taught: A bone the size of a barleycorn that is divided into two, Rabbi Akiva declares it impure, and Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri declares it pure.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: כִּי קָתָנֵי, אֵבֶר מִן הַמֵּת, אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say When he teaches a limb from a corpse, he does not teach a limb from a living
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: When it teaches, a limb from a dead animal, a limb from a living animal it does not teach.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כִּי קָתָנֵי, כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּנָזִיר מְגַלֵּחַ עַל אֲהִילוֹ, לְאַפּוֹקֵי עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה דְּלָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say When he teaches anywhere that a nazirite shaves for his overlaying, to the exclusion of a bone that is a barley-grain-bulk, as does not
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: When it is taught, wherever a Nazirite shaves his hair, it is to be treated like the skin of an animal that has not been flayed.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כִּי קָתָנֵי, כׇּל הֵיכָא דַּהֲדַר בֵּיהּ, לְאַפּוֹקֵי רְבִיעִית דָּם דְּלָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ. דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי לְבַר קַפָּרָא: לֹא תִּשְׁנֶה רְבִיעִית דָּם בַּחֲזָרָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי לִמּוּדוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say When he teaches anywhere that retracted to the exclusion of a quarter- of blood, as he did not retract his as Rabbi said to bar Kappara: Do not teach a quarter- of blood in the retractions, as Rabbi Akiva held onto his
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: When it is taught, wherever it is returned, to extract a quarter of blood that was not returned. For Rabbi said to Bar Kappara: Do not change the quarter of blood in the return, for it is the teaching of Rabbi Akiva that is in his hand.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, הַמִּקְרָא מְסַיְּיעוֹ: ״וְעַל כׇּל נַפְשׁוֹת מֵת לֹא יָבֹא״. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: עַד יָמָיו הָיָה מְטַמֵּא, אִם מִשֶּׁמֵּת חָזַר בּוֹ — אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ. תָּנָא: הוּשְׁחֲרוּ שִׁינָּיו מִפְּנֵי תַּעֲנִיּוֹתָיו.
human_translation: And furthermore, the verse supports his “Neither shall he go in to any dead bodies” Rabbi Shimon says: All his days, would deem ritually impure. Whether he retracted his after he died, I do not know. taught: teeth blackened due to his fasts,
llm_translation: The text states: "And furthermore, the verse supports him: 'But he shall not come upon any dead body.'" Rabbi Shimon says: Until his days, he was impure; if he returned from the dead, I do not know. It was taught: He blackened his teeth because of his afflictions.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע דְּתַנְיָא, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת — מִן הָעֲצָמִים אוֹ מִשְּׁנַיִם אוֹ מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: רוֹבַע מִן הַגְּוִיָּה, מֵרוֹב הַבִּנְיָן אוֹ מֵרוֹב הַמִּנְיָן. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: יָכוֹלְנִי לַעֲשׂוֹת דִּבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וְדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל כְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: Come hear as it is taught Beit Shammai say: quarter- of bones, from bones [ ha’atzamim ] or from two or from three And Beit Hillel say: quarter from the body, from the majority of the structure or from the majority of the number Rabbi Yehoshua said: I can establish the statement of Beit Shammai and the statement of Beit Hillel as one.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: Beit Shammai say: One quarter of the bones — from the bones or from two or from three. And Beit Hillel say: One quarter of the sinew, from the majority of the structure or from the majority of the count. Rabbi Yehoshua said: I am able to make the words of Beit Shammai and the words of Beit Hillel like one.

hebrew_text: שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מִשְּׁנַיִם אוֹ מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה — אוֹ מִשְּׁנֵי שׁוֹקַיִים וְיָרֵךְ אֶחָד, אוֹ מִשְּׁנֵי יְרֵכַיִים וְשׁוֹק אֶחָד, הוֹאִיל וְרוֹב גּוֹבְהוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מִגּוֹבַהּ. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מִן הַגְּוִיָּה אוֹ מֵרוֹב בִּנְיָן, אוֹ מֵרוֹב מִנְיָן — הוֹאִיל וְיֶשְׁנָן בְּמִפְרְקֵי יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם. שַׁמַּאי אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ עֶצֶם מִן הַשִּׁדְרָה אוֹ מִן הַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת.
human_translation: As Beit Shammai say: From two or three either from two shins and one thigh, or from two thighs and one shin. Since the majority of a person’s height in height And Beit Hillel say: from the body, or from the majority of the structure, or from the majority of the number since they include the joints of the hands and feet, Shammai says: Even a bone from the spine or from the skull
llm_translation: The School of Shammai says: From two or from three — or from two thighs and one leg, or from two legs and one thigh, since the majority of a person's height is from the height. And the School of Hillel says: From the neck or from the majority of the structure, or from the majority of the count — since they are in the joints of the hands and feet. Shammai says: Even from a bone of the spine or from the skull.

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי שַׁמַּאי דְּמַחְמִיר. לִיפְשׁוֹט מִינַּהּ: טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי דְּמַחְמִיר, הָא רַבָּנַן עַד דְּאִיכָּא שִׁדְרָה וְגוּלְגּוֹלֶת! לָא, עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּשַׁמַּאי אֶלָּא בְּעֶצֶם אֶחָד דְּאָתֵי מִן הַשִּׁדְרָה וּמִן הַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּעֵינֵיהּ, אֲפִילּוּ חֲדָא מִינְּהוֹן.
human_translation: Shammai is different, as he is stringent, let us resolve from The reason is that Beit Shammai are stringent, the Rabbis unless a spine and skull are present. No, the Rabbis disagree with Shammai only with regard to one bone that comes from the spine or from the skull, but when it is intact, even one of them,
llm_translation: The differences of Shammai are stringent. To explain it: the reason why Beit Shammai is stringent, the Rabbis said until there is a shedra and a gulgoleth! No, until here the Rabbis do not argue with Shammai except in one specific case that comes from the shedra and the gulgoleth, but where it is in its own right, even one of them.

hebrew_text: בְּעַי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת מִן שִׁדְרָה וְגוּלְגּוֹלֶת, מַאי? כִּי קָתָנֵי חֲצִי קַב עֲצָמוֹת — הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא מִשְּׁאָר אֵבָרָיו, אֲבָל מִן שִׁדְרָה וְגוּלְגּוֹלֶת דַּחֲמִירִי — אֲפִילּוּ רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת. אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raised a dilemma: a quarter- of bones from a spine and a skull, what When teaches a half- kav of bones, when are from his other limbs, but from spine and skull, which are stringent, even a quarter- of bones Or perhaps is no different.
llm_translation: Inquires Ramei son of Hama: A quarter of the bones from the spine and skull, what is the law? For it was taught: Half a kab of bones - where there are other limbs, but from the spine and skull, which are stringent - even a quarter of the bones. Or perhaps it is not different?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: הַשִּׁדְרָה וְהַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת דְּאָתֵי מִן שִׁדְרָה וְגוּלְגּוֹלֶת חֲמִיר — לִיתְנֵי: עַל רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת הַבָּא מִן הַשִּׁדְרָה כּוּ׳!
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear The spine and the skull. And if it enters your mind a quarter- of bones that come from a spine and skull is stringent let teach For a quarter- of bones that come from the spine
llm_translation: Rava said, come and hear: the shidra and the gulgolet. And if it enters your mind that the majority of the bones that come from the shidra and the gulgolet are stringent - let it be taught: regarding the majority of the bones that come from the shidra, so on and so forth!

hebrew_text: וְהָא רָבָא הוּא דְּאָמַר: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְשִׁדְרָה וְגוּלְגּוֹלֶת שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת! בָּתַר דְּשַׁמְעַהּ מֵרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: But Rava who said: necessary only for spine and skull that do not contain a quarter- of bones? After he heard from Rabbi Akiva
llm_translation: And Rava is the one who said: It is only needed for a shidra and a gulgolet that do not contain a majority of bones! After he heard it from Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, שַׁמַּאי אוֹמֵר: עֶצֶם אֶחָד מִן שִׁדְרָה אוֹ מִן גּוּלְגּוֹלֶת! שָׁאנֵי שַׁמַּאי דְּמַחְמִיר טְפֵי.
human_translation: Come hear Shammai says one bone from the spine or from the skull Shammai is different, as he is very stringent,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Shammai says, "One bone from the spine or from the skull!" This is the opinion of Shammai who is stringent in this matter.

hebrew_text: לִיפְשׁוֹט מִינַּהּ: טַעְמָא דְּשַׁמַּאי, דְּמַחְמִיר, הָא לְרַבָּנַן — עַד דְּאִיכָּא חֲצִי קַב עֲצָמוֹת!
human_translation: let us resolve in The reasoning of Shammai, who is stringent. according to the Rabbis, unless there is a half- kav of bones
llm_translation: To simplify her: the reason of Shammai, who is stringent, but the Rabbis say - until there is half a kab of bones!

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּשַׁמַּאי אֶלָּא בְּעֶצֶם אֶחָד, אֲבָל בְּרוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת — אֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן מוֹדוּ.
human_translation: Perhaps the Rabbis disagree with Shammai only with regard to one bone However, with regard to a quarter- of bones, even the Rabbis concede
llm_translation: Perhaps until here not argue sages about it of Shammai rather in one bone but in majority bones even sages concede.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: זְקֵנִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, מִקְצָתָן הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: חֲצִי קַב עֲצָמוֹת וַחֲצִי לוֹג דָּם — לַכֹּל. רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת, וּרְבִיעִית דָּם — לֹא לַכֹּל. וּמִקְצָתָן הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: אַף רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת וּרְבִיעִית דָּם — לַכֹּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said some of the early Elders would say: A half- kav of bones and a half- log of blood in all a quarter- of bones and a quarter- of blood, not in all And some of would say even a quarter- of bones and a quarter- of blood in all
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Eliezer: The elders of the earlier generations, some of them used to say: Half a kab of bones and half a log of blood - for everyone. A quarter of bones, and a quarter of blood - not for everyone. And some of them used to say: Even a quarter of bones and a quarter of blood - for everyone.

hebrew_text: בֵּית דִּין שֶׁלְּאַחֲרֵיהֶם אָמְרוּ: חֲצִי קַב עֲצָמוֹת וַחֲצִי לוֹג דָּם — לַכֹּל, רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת וּרְבִיעִית דָּם — לִתְרוּמָה וְקָדָשִׁים. אֲבָל לֹא לְנָזִיר וְעוֹשֵׂה פֶסַח.
human_translation: court that followed them said: A half- kav of bones and a half- log of blood in all A quarter- of bones and a quarter- of blood with regard to teruma and offerings, but not with regard to a nazirite. And one who performs the Paschal offering
llm_translation: The court of their successors said: Half a kab of bones and half a log of blood - for everyone, a quarter of bones and a quarter of blood - for terumah and holy items. But not for a Nazirite and one who observes the Passover.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי אֵין הַכְרָעַת שְׁלִישִׁית מַכְרַעַת! אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי, מִפִּי שְׁמוּעָה אָמְרוּ: מִפִּי חַגַּי זְכַרְיָה וּמַלְאָכִי.
human_translation: Now the decision third not a decision. Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi said: they said from tradition, from Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi,
llm_translation: From the fact that the third decision does not decide! Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi said, from hearsay they said: From the mouth of Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi.

hebrew_text: עַל אֵלּוּ הַנָּזִיר מְגַלֵּחַ. ״עַל אֵלּוּ״ דְּרֵישָׁא לְמַעוֹטֵי עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה, דְּעַל מַגָּעוֹ וְעַל מַשָּׂאוֹ — אִין, וְעַל אֲהִילוֹ — לָא. וְ״עַל אֵלּוּ״ דְּסֵיפָא — לְמַעוֹטֵי אֶבֶן הַסָּכוֹכִית.
human_translation: for these a nazirite shaves. For these, in first clause, to exclude a bone that is a barley-grain bulk. As for touching it and carrying it, yes, but for his overlying no, And For these, in the latter clause, to exclude an overhanging [ hasekhukhit ] stone.
llm_translation: Regarding those for whom it is prohibited to shave. "Regarding those" in the beginning is to exclude the bone like the hair, for regarding his touch and regarding his carrying - no, but regarding his eating - yes. And "regarding those" in the end is to exclude the glass vessel.

hebrew_text: וַחֲצִי קַב עֲצָמוֹת.
human_translation: And a half- kav of bones.
llm_translation: And half a kab of bones.

hebrew_text: חֲצִי קַב עֲצָמוֹת — אִין, רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת — לָא. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּאִית בְּהוֹן עֲצָמוֹת כִּשְׂעוֹרָה — תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה! אֶלָּא דְּאַקְמַח אַקְמוֹחֵי.
human_translation: A half- kav of bones, yes, a quarter- of bones, no, What are the circumstances? If we say that they contain bones a barley-grain bulk, let derive due to a bone that is a barley-grain bulk. Rather, where it has been made like flour. kav
llm_translation: Half a kab of bones - no, a quarter of bones - yes. How so? If you say that there are bones in them like hair - let it come out because of a bone like hair! Rather, I will establish the establishment.

hebrew_text: עַל אֵבֶר מִן הַמֵּת וְעַל אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי שֶׁיֵּשׁ עֲלֵיהֶן בָּשָׂר כָּרָאוּי. אֵין עֲלֵיהֶן בָּשָׂר כָּרָאוּי, מַאי? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵין הַנָּזִיר מְגַלֵּחַ עֲלֵיהֶן. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: הַנָּזִיר מְגַלֵּחַ עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: for a limb from a corpse and for a limb from a living upon which there is a fitting flesh. there is not a fitting flesh upon them, what Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The nazirite does not shave for them. Reish Lakish said: The nazirite does shave for them.
llm_translation: Regarding a limb from a dead body and a limb from a living body that have flesh attached to them - if the flesh is fitting, there is an obligation to remove it. If the flesh is not fitting, what is the ruling? Rabbi Yochanan said: The Nazirite does not shave the flesh off of them. Reish Lakish said: The Nazirite shaves the flesh off of them.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵין הַנָּזִיר מְגַלֵּחַ עֲלֵיהֶן, דְּהָא קָתָנֵי בְּרֵישָׁא: עַל אֵבֶר מִן הַמֵּת וְעַל אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי וְכוּ׳ שֶׁיֵּשׁ עֲלֵיהֶן כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר — אִין, אֲבָל אֵין עֲלֵיהֶם — לָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The nazirite does not shave for them, as teaches in the first clause For a limb from a corpse and for a limb from a living Those upon which there is an olive-bulk of flesh, yes, but there is not upon them, no,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The Nazirite does not shave over them, for it is taught at the beginning: over a limb from a dead body and over a limb from a living body, etc., that has on them the size of an olive of flesh - no, but if they do not have on them - yes.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: מְגַלֵּחַ. מִדְּלָא קָתָנֵי בְּסֵיפָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says he shaves, From does not teach in the latter clause,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: "Shaving." Because it does not teach in the latter part.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר לָךְ: כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּמַשְׁמַע מִכְּלָלָא, לָא קָתָנֵי בְּסֵיפָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said to you, does not teach in the latter clause anything that can be understood by inference
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said to you: wherever it is heard from the general principle, it is not taught in the conclusion.

hebrew_text: וְהָא חֲצִי קַב עֲצָמוֹת, דְּמַשְׁמַע חֲצִי קַב עֲצָמוֹת — אִין, רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת — לָא, וְקָתָנֵי בְּסֵיפָא רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת.
human_translation: But a half- kav of bones, indicates: A half- kav of bones, yes, a quarter- of bones, no, And teaches in the latter clause a quarter- of bones.
llm_translation: And this, half a kab of bones, as it implies half a kab of bones - no, a quarter of bones - no, and it teaches in the latter part a quarter of bones.

hebrew_text: הָתָם אִי לָאו רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אֲפִילּוּ עַל מַגָּעוֹ וְעַל מַשָּׂאוֹ לָא, לְהָכִי אִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיתְנֵי רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת, דְּעַל אֲהִילָן הוּא דְּאֵין הַנָּזִיר מְגַלֵּחַ.
human_translation: There, had not a quarter- of bones, I would say not even for touching it or carrying it. For this was necessary to teach a quarter- of bones, it is for their a tent a nazirite does not shave.
llm_translation: There, if not the majority of his bones, I would say: even on his touch and on his carrying not, therefore it is necessary to say the majority of his bones, for it is on his food that the Nazirite does not shave.

hebrew_text: וְהָא חֲצִי לוֹג דָּם, דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ חֲצִי לוֹג דָּם — אִין, רְבִיעִית דָּם — לָא, וְקָתָנֵי בְּסֵיפָא רְבִיעִית דָּם! הָתָם, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: רְבִיעִית דָּם הַבָּא מִשְּׁנֵי מֵתִים מְטַמֵּא בְּאֹהֶל.
human_translation: But a half- log of blood from which you learn a half- log of blood, yes, a quarter- of blood, no, And the latter clause teaches a quarter- of blood. there, to exclude of Rabbi Akiva, as Rabbi Akiva said: A quarter- of blood that comes from two corpses renders impure in a tent,
llm_translation: And this, half a log of blood, that you heard from it half a log of blood - no, a quarter of blood - not, and it teaches in the end a quarter of blood! There, to distinguish from Rabbi Akiva, for Rabbi Akiva said: A quarter of blood that comes from two corpses defiles in a tent.

hebrew_text: הַאי אֵבֶר מִן הַמֵּת, הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאִית בֵּיהּ עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? וְאִי דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לְעוֹלָם דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי רַחֲמָנָא רַבְּיֵיהּ.
human_translation: What are the circumstances this limb from a corpse If it contains a bone that is a barley-grain bulk, what is Rabbi Yoḥanan’s reason And if it does not contain a bone that is a barley-grain bulk, what is Reish Lakish’s reason Reish Lakish said to you: Actually that does not contain a bone that is a barley-grain bulk, and even so the Merciful One includes it
llm_translation: This limb from a corpse, what is its status? If it contains bone like skin, what is the reason for Rabbi Yochanan's opinion? And if it does not contain bone like skin, what is the reason for Reish Lakish's opinion? Reish Lakish said to you: Always, if it does not contain bone like skin, even so, the Merciful One is compassionate towards it.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְכֹל אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע עַל פְּנֵי הַשָּׂדֶה בַּחֲלַל חֶרֶב אוֹ בְמֵת״, ״עַל פְּנֵי הַשָּׂדֶה״ — זֶה הַמַּאֲהִיל עַל פְּנֵי הַמֵּת, ״בַּחֲלַל״ — זֶה אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי וְיֵשׁ לוֹ לְהַעֲלוֹת אֲרוּכָה.
human_translation: as it is taught “And whoever in the open field touches one who is slain by the sword, or one who dies on his own, “In the open field”; this one who overlies a corpse, “One who is slain”; this a limb from a living that contains for to heal.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And all that touches the surface of the field in the hollow of a sword or in a corpse," "'on the surface of the field' — this refers to one who walks over the face of the deceased," "'in the hollow' — this refers to a limb from a living creature, and it requires ritual washing."

hebrew_text: ״חֶרֶב״ הֲרֵי זֶה כְּחָלָל, ״אוֹ בְּמֵת״ — זֶה אֵבֶר הַנֶחְלָל מִן הַמֵּת, ״אוֹ בְּעֶצֶם אָדָם״ — זֶה רוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת, ״אוֹ בְּקֶבֶר״ — זֶה קֶבֶר סָתוּם.
human_translation: sword is like one who is slain, “Or one who dies on his own”; this is a limb that was slain, from a corpse “Or a bone of a man”; this is a quarter- of bones. “Or a grave”; this is a sealed grave,
llm_translation: "Sword" - this is like a wound, "or in a corpse" - this is a limb wounded from a corpse, "or in a human bone" - this is crushing bones, "or in a grave" - this is a sealed grave.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר מָר: טוּמְאָה בּוֹקַעַת וְעוֹלָה, בּוֹקַעַת וְיוֹרֶדֶת. וְאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי נְגִיעָה, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, תַּנְיָא: ״(וְכׇל) הַנּוֹגֵעַ בַּעֶצֶם אוֹ בֶחָלָל״, ״בַּעֶצֶם״ — זֶה עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה, ״אוֹ בֶחָלָל״ — זֶה אֵבֶר הַנֶחְלָל מִן הַחַי וְאֵין בּוֹ לְהַעֲלוֹת אֲרוּכָה,
human_translation: As the Master said: Ritual impurity breaks through ascends and breaks through and descends, While with regard to contact Rav Yehuda said it is taught “and him that touched a bone, or the slain, “A bone”; this is a bone that is a barley-grain bulk. “Or the slain”; this is a limb slain, from the living, which does not contain for it to heal.
llm_translation: The Master said: If a tumah (impurity) pierces and ascends, it pierces and descends. And regarding nega (skin affliction), Rav Yehudah said, it was taught: "And whoever touches the bone or the slain," "the bone" - this is a bone like a barleycorn, "or the slain" - this is a limb that was wounded from a living animal and does not have the capacity to heal.

hebrew_text: ״אוֹ בְּמֵת״ — זֶה אֵבֶר הַנֶחְלָל מִן הַמֵּת, ״אוֹ בְקָבֶר״ — אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: זֶה קֶבֶר שֶׁלִּפְנֵי הַדִּיבּוּר.
human_translation: “Or the dead”; this is a limb slain from a corpse, “Or the grave”; Reish Lakish said: This is a grave before the command
llm_translation: "Or in a corpse" - this is a limb that was injured from a corpse, "or in a grave" - Reish Lakish said: this is a grave from before the speaking.

hebrew_text: הַאי אֵבֶר מִן הַמֵּת, הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאִית בֵּיהּ עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה הַיְינוּ הַנּוֹגֵעַ בַּעֶצֶם! אֶלָּא דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי רַחֲמָנָא רַבְּיֵיהּ!
human_translation: this limb from a corpse, what are the circumstances If contains a bone that is a barley-grain bulk, this is one who touches a bone, Rather, that it does not contain a bone that is a barley-grain bulk, and even so the Merciful One includes it
llm_translation: This limb from a corpse, what is its status? If it contains bone like skin, that is the one who touches the bone! But if it does not contain bone like skin, even so, may the Merciful One have mercy on it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְעוֹלָם דְּאִית בֵּיהּ. וְאִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְמַגָּעוֹ — תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְמַשָּׂאוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to you: Actually, that it does contain and if it does not the matter of its contact, have it refer to the matter of its carrying,
llm_translation: He said to you, Rabbi Yochanan: Always there is in it. And if it is not a matter for his touch - give it as a matter for his carrying.

hebrew_text: וּמַזֶּה בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי וּבַשְּׁבִיעִי וְסוֹתֵר וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: And sprinkles on the third and on the seventh and he negates
llm_translation: And one who sprinkles on the third day and on the seventh day, and invalidates, and so forth.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״עַד שֶׁיִּטְהַר״, בַּשְּׁבִיעִי קָאֵי — עַד דְּעָבֵיד הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ, וּמַנִּי — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא. אוֹ דִילְמָא בַּשְּׁמִינִי קָאֵי, וּמַאי ״עַד שֶׁיִּטְהַר״ — עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו. וּמַנִּי — רַבָּנַן הִיא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before that which is taught until he is purified? standing on the seventh Until performs sunset? And whose It is Rabbi Eliezer, Or perhaps standing on the eighth And what Until he is purified? Until he brings his offerings. And who is It is the Rabbis,
llm_translation: He asked them: This that is taught "until he becomes purified," on the seventh he stands - until he performs the evening service, and who is the authority? Rabbi Eliezer. Or perhaps it is on the eighth he stands, and what is "until he becomes purified" - until he brings his sacrifices. And who is the authority? The Rabbis?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: ״מַתְחִיל וּמוֹנֶה מִיָּד״, הָא רֵישָׁא מַאי ״עַד שֶׁיִּטְהַר״ — עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו, וּמַנִּי — רַבָּנַן הִיא דְּאָמְרִי: נְזִירוּת דְּטׇהֳרָה עַד שְׁמִינִי לָא חָיְילָא.
human_translation: Come hear from that it teaches in the latter clause starts counting immediately what is the first clause: Until he is purified? until he brings his offerings, and whose It is the Rabbis, who say naziriteship of purity does not commence until the eighth
llm_translation: Come and hear, from the end of the Mishnah: "He begins and counts immediately," what is the beginning? "Until he becomes purified" - until he brings his sacrifices, and count - the Rabbis say: the Nazirite status of purity is not effective until the eighth day.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֲבָל הַסְּכָכוֹת, וְהַפְּרָעוֹת, וּבֵית הַפְּרָס,
human_translation: However, The hanging and the projecting and a beit haperas ,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: However, the sukkahs, and the peraots, and the house of the Persians,

hebrew_text: וְאֶרֶץ הָעַמִּים, וְהַגּוֹלֵל, וְהַדּוֹפֵק, וּרְבִיעִית דָּם, וְאֹהֶל, וְרוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת, וְכֵלִים הַנּוֹגְעִים בְּמֵת, וּבִימֵי סְפָרוֹ, וּבִימֵי גְמָרוֹ — עַל אֵלּוּ אֵין הַנָּזִיר מְגַלֵּחַ.
human_translation: And the land of the nations, And the grave cover; and the grave walls and a quarter- of blood and a tent; and a quarter- of bones and vessels that are touching a corpse. And in the days of his counting, or in his days of full for these the nazirite does not shave.
llm_translation: The land of the nations, and the roller, and the hammer, and a quarter of blood, and a tent, and a quarter of bones, and vessels that touch a corpse, and in the days of his counting, and in the days of his completion - concerning these the Nazirite does not shave.

hebrew_text: וּמַזֶּה בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי וּבַשְּׁבִיעִי,
human_translation: And one sprinkles on the third and on the seventh
llm_translation: And one who sprinkles on the third day and on the seventh day,

hebrew_text: וְאֵינוֹ סוֹתֵר אֶת הַקּוֹדְמִים, וּמַתְחִיל וּמוֹנֶה מִיָּד, וְקׇרְבָּן אֵין לוֹ. בֶּאֱמֶת אָמְרוּ: יְמֵי הַזָּב וְהַזָּבָה וִימֵי הֶסְגֵּרוֹ שֶׁל מְצוֹרָע, הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ עוֹלִין לוֹ.
human_translation: and he does not negate the earlier And he starts counting immediately and he has no an offering Actually they said days of the zav and the zava and the days of the confinement of a leper count for him
llm_translation: And he does not contradict the earlier ones, and he begins and counts immediately, and he does not have a sacrifice. In truth they said: The days of a male zav, a female zavah, and the days of the isolation of a metzora, these ascend for him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְאֵלּוּ הֵן הַסְּכָכוֹת — אִילָן הַמֵּיסֵךְ עַל הָאָרֶץ. וּפְרָעוֹת — הַיּוֹצְאוֹת מִן הַגָּדֵר.
human_translation: And these are the hangings: A tree that overhangs the earth. And projections that protrude from a fence.
llm_translation: Gemara: And these are the "sukkot" - a tree that leans over the ground. And "peraot" - those that come out from the fence.

hebrew_text: וְאֶרֶץ הָעַמִּים. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אֶרֶץ הָעַמִּים, מִשּׁוּם אַוֵּירָא גָּזְרוּ עָלֶיהָ, אוֹ דִילְמָא מִשּׁוּם גּוּשָּׁא גָּזְרוּ עָלֶיהָ?
human_translation: And the land of the nations A dilemma was raised before decree the land of the nations with regard to the air, Or perhaps they decreed with regard to the earth,
llm_translation: "And the land of the nations." It was asked of them: The land of the nations, is it because of the air that they decreed upon it, or perhaps because of the soil that they decreed upon it?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: וּמַזֶּה בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי וּבַשְּׁבִיעִי. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם אַוֵּירָא, הַזָּאָה לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Come hear And one sprinkles on the third and on the seventh And if you say with regard to the air, why do I sprinkling?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: u'mazeh bashlishi u'bashvi'i. Ve'ei amrati mishum avira, hazah l'mah li?" English translation: "Come and hear: and sprinkle on the third day and on the seventh day. And if you say it is due to the atmosphere, why do I need this sprinkling?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, מִשּׁוּם גּוּשָּׁא? לָא, לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ מִשּׁוּם אַוֵּירָא, וְכִי קָתָנֵי — אַשְּׁאָרָא.
human_translation: Rather, is it not with regard to the earth No, actually I say to you due to the air, and when teaches to the other
llm_translation: Rather, is it because of the wall? No, I will say to you from the air, and when it is taught - the remainder.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי: וְכֵלִים הַנּוֹגְעִים בְּמֵת. הָנֵי כֵּלִים בְּנֵי הַזָּאָה אִינּוּן? אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אַשְּׁאָרָא.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable from that teaches: And vessels that are touching a corpse. these vessels require sprinkling? Rather, learn from this to the others.
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: from the Mishnah - "and vessels that come into contact with a corpse." Are these vessels the offspring of the impure? Rather, infer from it another matter.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: הַנִּכְנָס לְאֶרֶץ הָעַמִּים בְּשִׁידָּה תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל, רַבִּי מְטַמֵּא, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְטַהֵר. מַאי לָאו: רַבִּי סָבַר מִשּׁוּם אַוֵּירָא, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר מִשּׁוּם גּוּשָּׁא?
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im , one who enters the land of the nations in a chest, a box, or a cabinet, Rabbi deems impure. And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, deems pure. What, is it not Rabbi holds with regard to the air, and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds with regard to the earth,
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: One who enters the land of the nations with a box and a tower, Rabbi declares impure, and Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, declares pure. What is the reason? Rabbi holds due to a grave, and Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds due to a vault?

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִשּׁוּם גּוּשָּׁא. מָר סָבַר: אֹהֶל זָרוּק — שְׁמֵיהּ אֹהֶל, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא שְׁמֵיהּ אֹהֶל.
human_translation: not that everyone with regard to the earth, Sage, holds a moving tent, is called a tent, And Sage, holds a moving tent is not called a tent.
llm_translation: Not, all, of the world, because of a trespass. Master thought: a tent thrown - its name is tent, and master thought: not its name tent.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: תֵּיבָה שֶׁהִיא מְלֵאָה כֵּלִים, וּזְרָקָהּ עַל פְּנֵי הַמֵּת בְּאֹהֶל — טְמֵאָה, וְאִם הָיְתָה מוּנַּחַת — טְהוֹרָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: A box that is full of utensils that one threw over a corpse in a tent, is impure, And if it was placed down it is pure,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: A chest that is full of vessels, and one throws it on the face of a dead person in a tent - it is impure, but if it was placed there - it is pure.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִשּׁוּם אַוֵּירָא, וּמָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָא — לָא גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן, וּמָר סָבַר: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָא — גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rather, that everyone with regard to its air, and Sage, holds since it is not common the Sages did not decree with regard to And Sage, holds although it is not common the Sages decreed with regard to it.
llm_translation: Rather: the entire world due to fear, and Master holds: since it is not common - the Rabbis did not decree upon it, and Master holds: even though it is not common - the Rabbis decreed upon it.

hebrew_text: וְהַתַּנְיָא: הַנִּכְנָס לְאֶרֶץ הָעַמִּים בְּשִׁידָּה תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל — טָהוֹר, בְּקָרוֹן וּבִסְפִינָה וּבְאִיסְקַרְיָא — טָמֵא.
human_translation: And it is taught One who enters the land of the nations in a chest, a box, or a cabinet ritually pure. in a wagon [ karon ], boat, or raft [ iskareya ], ritually impure.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught: One who enters the land of the nations with a chest, a tower, and a fortress - is pure; with a wagon, a ship, and a galley - is impure.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָכָא שֶׁמָּא יוֹצִיא רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ לְשָׁם פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say here they disagree lest he remove his head and the majority of his body into there,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Here, perhaps he will extend his head and majority there, they dispute.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַנִּכְנָס לְאֶרֶץ הָעַמִּים בְּשִׁידָּה תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל — טָהוֹר, עַד שֶׁיּוֹצִיא לְשָׁם רֹאשׁוֹ אוֹ רוּבּוֹ.
human_translation: And it is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: One who enters the land of the nations in a chest, a box, or a cabinet is pure, unless he removes his head or the majority of his body into
llm_translation: And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: One who enters the land of the nations with a box or a tower - is pure, until he brings out his head or the majority of his body there.

hebrew_text: וּמַתְחִיל וּמוֹנֶה. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּנְזִירוּת מוּעֶטֶת. אֲבָל בִּנְזִירוּת מְרוּבָּה — מִיסְלָק נָמֵי סָלְקִין לֵיהּ.
human_translation: starts counting Rav Ḥisda said: They taught only with regard to a short naziriteship However, with regard to a lengthy naziriteship, also count toward his
llm_translation: And begins and counts. Rav Ḥisdah said: They only taught this regarding a small Nazirite vow. But with a large Nazirite vow - his mind becomes confused.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא: מַתְחִיל וּמוֹנֶה מִיָּד, וְאֵין מְבַטֵּל בָּהֶן אֶת הַקּוֹדְמִין. בְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא בִּנְזִירוּת מוּעֶטֶת — קָבָעֵי גִּידּוּל שֵׂיעָר!
