human_translation: From where Perhaps is excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ], that he is not liable but does become impure. the verse states: “And the pure shall sprinkle upon the impure”; anyone who has ritual purity has ritual impurity, and anyone who does not have purity does not have impurity
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps it is a כָּרֵת (excision) that he is not liable, but his טֻמְאָה (impurity) is impure? The verse says, "And he shall sprinkle the clean upon the unclean," anything that has purity - has impurity, and anything that does not have purity - does not have impurity.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: טׇהֳרָה הוּא דְּלָא הָוְיָא לֵיהּ, טוּמְאָה הָוְיָא לֵיהּ! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִטְמָא וְלֹא יִתְחַטָּא״.
human_translation: But say it is purity that he does not have, he does have impurity. the verse states: “But the man who shall be impure and shall not purify himself”
llm_translation: And why? Pure it is for not was to him, impure it was to him! Said scripture: "And a man who becomes impure and does not purify himself."

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהִתְנַחַלְתֶּם אֹתָם לִבְנֵיכֶם אַחֲרֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said Here, is different, as the verse states: “And you shall make them an inheritance for your children after you”
llm_translation: Rav Ahah bar Yaakov said: It is different here, as the verse states: "And you shall inherit them for your children after you."

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ נַחֲלָה — יֵשׁ לוֹ טוּמְאָה, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ נַחֲלָה — אֵין לוֹ טוּמְאָה. אִי הָכִי עֲבָדִים נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: anyone who has inheritance, has impurity, But anyone who does not have inheritance does not have impurity. If so, slaves should also not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Kol sheyesh lo nachalah - yesh lo tum'ah, v'kol she'ein lo nachalah - ein lo tum'ah. Iy hakhi avadim namei la!" English translation: "Whoever has an inheritance - has impurity, and whoever does not have an inheritance - does not have impurity. If so, even slaves also not!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא גַּבֵּי עֲרָכִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״ — בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מַעֲרִיכִין, וְאֵין הַגּוֹיִם מַעֲרִיכִין. יָכוֹל לֹא יְהוּ נֶעֱרָכִין, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ״.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said Granted, with regard to valuations, as it is stated: the children of Israel” the children of Israel can take a valuation vow but gentiles cannot take a valuation vow. might cannot be valuated the verse states: “Man”
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Regarding evaluations, as it is stated: "Bnei Yisrael" - Bnei Yisrael evaluate, and the nations do not evaluate. One might have thought they should not be evaluated, therefore the verse states: "a man."

hebrew_text: הָכָא, בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל נוֹזְרִין וּמְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן, וְאֵין הַגּוֹיִם נוֹזְרִין וּמְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן. יָכוֹל אַף לֹא יְהוּ נְזִירִין כְּלָל — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ״?
human_translation: here, the children of Israel can take a vow naziriteship and bring offering, but gentiles cannot take a vow naziriteship and bring offering, might cannot be nazirites at all; the verse states: “Man,”
llm_translation: Here, the children of Israel abstain and bring an offering, and the nations do not abstain and bring an offering. One might have thought that even Nazirites should not abstain at all — the Talmud teaches: "a man."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: אִי מִשּׁוּם קׇרְבָּן לָאו מֵהָכָא נָפְקָא לֵיהּ, אֶלָּא מֵהָתָם: ״לְעוֹלָה״ — פְּרָט לִנְזִירוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי!

llm_translation: They said: If regarding a sacrifice, it does not emerge from here, but from there: "for a burnt offering" - excluding Naziriteship, the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean!

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל נוֹזְרִין נְזִירוּת עוֹלָם, וְאֵין הַגּוֹיִם נוֹזְרִים נְזִירוּת עוֹלָם. יָכוֹל לֹא יְהוּ נְזִירִים — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ״! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִי כְּתִיב ״נְזִיר עוֹלָם״?
human_translation: say the children of Israel can take a vow permanent naziriteship, but gentiles cannot take a vow permanent naziriteship, might cannot be nazirites The verse states: “Man,” Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Is it written: A permanent nazirite?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima: Bnei Yisrael nozrin nezirut olam, ve'ein hagoyim nozrim nezirut olam. Yakhol lo yehu nezirim — Talmud lomar: 'Ish'! Amar Rabbi Yochanan: Mi k'tiv 'nezir olam'?" English translation: "Say: The children of Israel vow perpetual Naziriteship, and the nations do not vow perpetual Naziriteship. One might think they should not be Nazirites — Scripture states: 'Man'! Rabbi Yochanan said: Who is it written as 'perpetual Nazirite'?"

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מַדִּירִין בְּנֵיהֶם בְּנָזִיר, וְאֵין הַגּוֹיִם מַדִּירִין בְּנֵיהֶם בְּנָזִיר. יָכוֹל לֹא יְהוּ נְזִירִים — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ״! הָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר.
human_translation: say “the children of Israel” can vow their sons be nazirites, but gentiles cannot vow their sons be nazirites; might cannot be nazirites The verse states: “Man,” Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say is a halakha with regard to a nazirite?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima: Bnei Yisrael madirin bneihem benazir, ve'ein hagoyim madirin bneihem benazir. Yakhol lo yehu nezirim — Talmud lomar: 'Ish'! Ha'amar Rabbi Yochanan: Halakhah hi benazir." English translation: "Say: The children of Israel vow vows for their sons to be Nazirites, but the nations do not vow vows for their sons to be Nazirites. One might think they should not be Nazirites — the Scripture states: 'man'! Rabbi Yochanan said: It is a halakhah regarding Nazirites."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מְגַלְּחִין עַל נְזִירוּת אֲבִיהֶן, וְאֵין הַגּוֹיִם מְגַלְּחִין עַל נְזִירוּת אֲבִיהֶן.
human_translation: say “the children of Israel” can shave by their fathers’ naziriteships, but gentiles cannot shave by their fathers’ naziriteships.
llm_translation: אֵימָא: - Say: בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל - the children of Israel מְגַלְּחִין - shave עַל - over נְזִירוּת - the vows of נָזִיר - a Nazirite אֲבִיהֶן - their father, וְאֵין - but the nations הַגּוֹיִם - the Gentiles מְגַלְּחִין - shave עַל - over נְזִירוּת - the vows of נָזִיר - a Nazirite אֲבִיהֶן - their father.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יְהוּ נְזִירִין — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ״! הָאִיתְּמַר אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה הִיא בְּנָזִיר.
human_translation: might cannot be nazirites The verse states: “Man,” Wasn’t it stated Rabbi Yoḥanan said is a halakha with regard to a nazirite?
llm_translation: He can not Nazirites — Talmud to say: "man"! If it was said Rabbi Yochanan: Halacha in Nazir.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי ״אִישׁ כִּי יַפְלִא נֶדֶר בְּעֶרְכְּךָ״, בַּעֲרָכִין, לְמָה לִי? מִכְּדֵי הָאִיתַּקַּשׁ עֲרָכִין לִנְדָרִים, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״אִישׁ כִּי יַפְלִא נֶדֶר בְּעֶרְכְּךָ״, וְהָתַנְיָא גַּבֵּי נְדָרִים: ״אִישׁ״. מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַגּוֹיִם שֶׁהֵן נוֹדְרִים נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: If so, why do I “When a man shall clearly utter a vow according to your valuation” with regard to valuations, After all, aren’t valuations juxtaposed to vows, as the verse states: “When a man shall clearly utter a vow according to your valuation.” And isn’t it taught with regard to vows: man [ ish ] what the verse states “Any man [ ish ish ]”? to include the gentiles, that they can take a vow vow and gift like a Jew.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, "When a man makes a vow to the Lord or takes an oath to obligate himself by a pledge," why do I need appraisals? Because appraisals are connected to vows, as the verse states, "When a man makes a vow to the Lord or takes an oath to obligate himself by a pledge," and it was taught regarding vows: "A man." What is the Talmud coming to teach by saying "a man, a man"? To include the Gentiles who make vows, vows, and voluntary offerings like Israel. English translation:

hebrew_text: ״אִישׁ כִּי יַפְלִא״ בַּעֲרָכִין לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא הַאי ״אִישׁ״, מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מוּפְלָא סָמוּךְ לְאִישׁ.
human_translation: why do I “when a man shall clearly utter with regard to valuations? Rather, this “man,” necessary to include a minor one year before reaches majority.
llm_translation: "אִישׁ כִּי יַפְלִא״ - When a man makes a vow of valuation, why do I need it? Rather, this 'אִישׁ' - he requires it for the proximity of a wonder adjacent to a man."

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מוּפְלָא סָמוּךְ לְאִישׁ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דְּרַבָּנַן, ״אִישׁ כִּי יַפְלִיא״ לְמָה לִי? לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מוּפְלָא סָמוּךְ לְאִישׁ דְּגוֹי.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says a minor one year before reaches majority by Torah law, However, according to the one who says by rabbinic law, why do I “when a man shall clearly utter to include a minor one year before reaches majority who is a gentile,
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says "muf'la samuch to a man of Torah." Rather, for the one who says of the Rabbis, "A man when he is wondrous," why do I need it? To include a wondrous person close to a man of the nations.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל נֶעֱרָכִין, וְאֵין הַגּוֹיִם נֶעֱרָכִין. יָכוֹל לֹא יְהוּ מַעֲרִיכִין, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ״ — שַׁפִּיר.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says Jews can be valuated but gentiles cannot be valuated; might cannot take a valuation vow. the verse states: “Man.” fine,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He left it for the one who says that the Israelites are prepared, and the nations are not prepared. One might think they should not be prepared, therefore the Scripture states: 'man' - it is fitting."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מַעֲרִיכִים, וְאֵין הַגּוֹיִם מַעֲרִיכִים. יָכוֹל לֹא יְהוּ נֶעֱרָכִין, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ״ — אֲפִילּוּ תִּינוֹק בֶּן חֹדֶשׁ בַּר עָירוּכִי הוּא, ״כִּי יַפְלִיא״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: However, according to the one who says the children of Israel can take a valuation vow but gentiles cannot take a valuation vow, might cannot be valuated; the verse states “Man,” even a month-old baby, can be valuated Why do I “when shall clearly utter
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says: The children of Israel arrange, and the nations do not arrange. One might think they should not be arranged, therefore the Scripture says: "man" — even an infant of one month is considered arranged, "for he is wonderful" — why do I need it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: לְאֵיתוֹיֵי גּוֹי גָּדוֹל, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּגָדוֹל הוּא — אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ לְהַפְלוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: to include, adult gentile, who although he is an adult, he does not know to clearly utter
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: For the benefit of a great nation, even though it is great, it does not know how to pray.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: ״כִּי יַפְלִיא״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי נְזִירוּת, לְמָה לִי? מִכְּדֵי הָאִיתַּקַּשׁ נְזִירוּת לִנְדָרִים, ״כִּי יַפְלִיא״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: However, “When shall clearly utter which the Merciful One writes with regard to naziriteship, why do I After all, isn’t naziriteship juxtaposed to vows; why do I “when shall clearly utter”?
llm_translation: Rather: "When he shall separate himself" - for the Merciful One wrote regarding Nazirites, why do I need it? Because Nazirites are compared to vows, "When he shall separate himself" - why do I need it?

hebrew_text: לְאֵיתוֹיֵי יָדַיִם שֶׁאֵינָן מוֹכִיחוֹת. דְּאִיתְּמַר: יָדַיִם שֶׁאֵינָן מוֹכִיחוֹת, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: הָוְיָין יָדַיִם. רָבָא אָמַר: לָא הָוְיָין יָדַיִם. לְאַבָּיֵי נִיחָא. אֶלָּא לְרָבָא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: to include ambiguous intimations, As it was stated ambiguous intimations, Abaye said they are intimations Rava said they are not intimations According to Abaye, works out well, However, according to Rava, what is there to say?
llm_translation: Regarding non-protruding hands. As it was stated: non-protruding hands, Abbaye said: they are considered hands. Rava said: they are not considered hands. It is satisfactory according to Abbaye. But according to Rava, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: ״כִּי יַפְלִיא״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: אֵין אֶחָד מֵהֶן נָזִיר, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִיתְּנָה נְזִירוּת אֶלָּא לְהַפְלָאָה. הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Rather, “when shall clearly utter” necessary for that by Rabbi Tarfon, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Tarfon: not one of a nazirite, as naziriteship is imposed only if explicitly This works out well according to Rabbi Tarfon. However, to the Rabbis, what is there to say?
llm_translation: Rather: "When he shall separate himself" - what does he require according to Rabbi Tarfon? For it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Tarfon: None of them is a Nazir, because the vow of Naziriteship was only given for wonderment. This is well according to Rabbi Tarfon, but according to the Rabbis, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: הֶיתֵּר נְדָרִים — פּוֹרְחִין בָּאֲוִיר, וְאֵין לָהֶן עַל מַה שֶּׁיִּסְמוֹכוּ.
human_translation: Rather, necessary for that which is taught dissolution of vows, fly in the air and have nothing to lean upon,
llm_translation: Rather, it is necessary according to the one who taught: Vows that are permitted - they float in the air, and they have nothing upon which to rely.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לָהֶם עַל מַה שֶּׁיִּסְמוֹכוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִישׁ כִּי יַפְלִא״, ״כִּי יַפְלִא״, שְׁתֵּי פְעָמִים. אֶחָד הַפְלָאָה לְאִיסּוּר, וְאֶחָד הַפְלָאָה לְהֶיתֵּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: have upon which to lean, as it is stated: “When a man shall clearly utter “When shall clearly utter twice. One explicit utterance is for prohibition, and one explicit utterance is for dissolution,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: They have upon what they can rely, as it is stated: "If a man commits a wonder," "commits a wonder," twice. One wonder for prohibition, and one wonder for permission.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חוֹמֶר בָּעֲבָדִים מִבַּנָּשִׁים, שֶׁהוּא מֵפֵר נִדְרֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ מֵפֵר נִדְרֵי עַבְדּוֹ. הֵפֵר לְאִשְׁתּוֹ — הֵפֵר עוֹלָמִית. הֵפֵר לְעַבְדּוֹ — יָצָא לְחֵירוּת וּמַשְׁלִים נְזִירוּתוֹ.
human_translation: stringency in slaves than in women, as can nullify the vows of his wife but he cannot nullify the vows of his slave, he nullified of his wife it is permanently nullified, he nullified of his slave is emancipated he completes his naziriteship.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: More stringent are the laws regarding slaves than regarding women, for he annuls the vows of his wife but does not annul the vows of his slave. If he annuls the vows of his wife, it is an eternal annulment. If he annuls the vows of his slave, he goes out to freedom and completes his Nazirite vow.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לְמָה רַבּוֹ כּוֹפוֹ? לִנְזִירוּת, אֲבָל לֹא לִנְדָרִים וְלַעֲרָכִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught to what his master force With regard to naziriteship. However, cannot of vows and valuations.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Why did Rabbo flog him? For Naziriteship, but not for vows and valuations.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא גַּבֵּי נָזִיר — דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״לֶאְסֹר אִסָּר עַל נַפְשׁוֹ״, בְּמִי שֶׁנַּפְשׁוֹ קְנוּיָה לוֹ — יָצָא עֶבֶד שֶׁאֵין נַפְשׁוֹ קְנוּיָה לוֹ. אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ גַּבֵּי נְדָרִים נָמֵי!
human_translation: What is different with regard to a nazirite as the Merciful One states: “To bind his soul with a bond” to one whose soul is in his possession, excludes a slave, whose soul is not in his possession If so, even with regard to vows as well,
llm_translation: What is different about a Nazirite? - For the Merciful One said, "to forbid a prohibition upon himself," regarding one whose life is acquired by him - a slave who does not have his life acquired by him is exempt. If so, even regarding vows it is also the same!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה אֶשְׁכּוֹל שֶׁל עֲנָבִים מוּנָּח לְפָנָיו. גַּבֵּי נְדָרִים, דְּכִי מִיתְּסַר בְּהַאי לָא מִיתְּסַר בְּאַחֲרִינֵי — לָא מָצֵי כָּפֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: With what are we dealing here? where a cluster of grapes was placed before With regard to vows, when is prohibited from this is not rendered prohibited from others; cannot force him
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said, here we are dealing with what: for example, there was a cluster of grapes placed before him. Regarding vows, for when one becomes prohibited by this, he does not become prohibited by others - he cannot retract.

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי נְזִירוּת, דְּכִי מִיתְּסַר בְּהַאי אִיתְּסַר בְּכוּלְּהוּ — מָצֵי כָּפֵי לֵיהּ. וְגַבֵּי נְדָרִים, מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּלֵיכָּא אֶלָּא הַאי אֶשְׁכּוֹל, דְּאִי לָא אָכֵיל לֵיהּ, חָלֵישׁ?
human_translation: with regard to naziriteship, when is prohibited from this is rendered prohibited from all others; can force him And with regard to vows, are we not dealing where he has only this cluster which if he does not eat it he is weakened?
llm_translation: Regarding vows, since we are only dealing with this cluster of grapes, if one does not eat it, is it not weak?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה חַרְצָן מוּנָּח לְפָנָיו. גַּבֵּי נְדָרִים, בְּהַאי הוּא דְּמִיתְּסַר — לָא מָצֵי כָּפֵי לֵיהּ. גַּבֵּי נָזִיר, דְּאִיתְּסַר נָמֵי בְּאַחֲרֵינִי — מָצֵי כָּפֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said where there was a grape seed, placed before With regard to vows, which he is prohibited to this cannot force him With regard to a nazirite, who is prohibited from other as well, can force him.
llm_translation: Rava said: For example, if the vessel was placed before him. Regarding vows, in this case where he became prohibited - he cannot annul it. Regarding a Nazirite, if he became prohibited due to another - he can annul it.

hebrew_text: וְגַבֵּי נְדָרִים, מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּלֵיכָּא אֶלָּא הַאי חַרְצָן, דְּאִי לָא אָכֵיל לֵיהּ, חָלֵישׁ?
human_translation: And with regard to vows, are we not dealing where he has only this grape seed which if he does not eat it he would be weakened?
llm_translation: Regarding vows, who are we dealing with that there is only this potsherd, for if he does not eat it, is it weak?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְמָה רַבּוֹ צָרִיךְ לִכְפּוֹתוֹ — לִנְזִירוּת. וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לִכְפּוֹתוֹ לִנְדָרִים, וְאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִכְפּוֹתוֹ לִשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said With regard to what is a master required to force of naziriteship. But he is not required to force him in vows and he is not required to force him in an oath,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Why does Rav need to annul it? — For Naziriteship. And he does not need to annul it for vows, and he does not need to annul it for oaths.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לְהָרַע אוֹ לְהֵיטִיב״, מָה הֲטָבָה רְשׁוּת — אַף הֲרָעָה רְשׁוּת. יָצָא לְהָרַע לַאֲחֵרִים — שֶׁאֵין הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: What is the reason as the verse states to do evil, or to do good” Just as “good” a voluntary so too “evil” voluntary, excludes would cause evil to others, as it is not in his power
llm_translation: What is the reason? For the verse says: "For evil or for good," just as permission for good - so too permission for evil. If one goes out to harm others - the permission is not in his hands.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עָבַר מִכְּנֶגֶד פָּנָיו, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִשְׁתֶּה, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יִשְׁתֶּה.
human_translation: left his presence, Rabbi Meir says: He may not drink And Rabbi Yosei says: He may drink
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one passed in front of him, Rabbi Meir says: He should not drink, and Rabbi Yosei says: He may drink.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לֵימָא בְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ יָצָא לְחֵירוּת, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁיחְרוּר.
human_translation: Shall we say disagree with regard to of Shmuel? As Shmuel said: who renounces ownership of his slave, is emancipated, and he does not require a bill of manumission.
llm_translation: Gemara: Let us say in the name of Shmuel: One who emancipates his slave is considered as if he has gone out to freedom, and he does not require a bill of manumission.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אִית לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לֵית לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir is of of Shmuel, Rabbi Yosei is of not of Shmuel?
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir has a son named Shmuel. Rabbi Yosei does not have a son named Shmuel.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. אֶלָּא: מַאן דְּאָמַר יִשְׁתֶּה, סָבַר: סוֹף סוֹף מִיהְדָּר הָדַר וְאָתֵי גַּבֵּיהּ, לִישְׁתֵּי חַמְרָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִיכְחוֹשׁ. וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר לֹא יִשְׁתֶּה, סָבַר: לֶיהֱוֵי לֵיהּ צַעְרָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִיהְדַּר גַּבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: No, that everyone is of of Shmuel. Rather, the one who says he may drink maintains will ultimately return and come back to to drink wine so that he should not be weakened And according to the one who says he may not drink maintains should suffer so that he will return to
llm_translation: Not that in all the world there is one named Shmuel. Rather, one who says he should drink, he thinks: eventually he will return and come to his senses, and he will drink wine so that he will not feel the effects. And one who says he should not drink, he thinks: it will be a source of distress for him so that he will not return to his senses.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָזִיר שֶׁגִּילַּח, וְנוֹדַע לוֹ שֶׁהוּא טָמֵא, אִם טוּמְאָה יְדוּעָה — סוֹתֵר, וְאִם טוּמְאַת תְּהוֹם — אֵינוֹ סוֹתֵר. אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא גִּילַּח, בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ — סוֹתֵר.
human_translation: a nazirite who shaved and it became known to him that he was ritually impure if a known impurity, he negates And if it was ritual impurity in the depths, he does not negate If before he shaved, he negates in either case.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A Nazirite who shaved his hair, and it became known to him that he is impure, if the impurity is known — he invalidates his vow, but if it is impurity of the abyss — he does not invalidate it. If it was before he shaved, whether this way or that way — he invalidates it.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? יָרַד לִטְבּוֹל בִּמְעָרָה וְנִמְצָא מֵת צָף עַל פִּי הַמְעָרָה — טָמֵא, נִמְצָא מְשׁוּקָּע בְּקַרְקַע הַמְּעָרָה,
human_translation: How descended to immerse in a cave, and a corpse was found floating at the mouth of the cave, impure, was found sunk into the ground of the cave
llm_translation: How so? If one descended to immerse in a cave and a dead person was found floating at the mouth of the cave - he is impure. If he was found sunk in the ground of the cave -

hebrew_text: יָרַד לְהָקֵר — טָהוֹר. לִיטָּהֵר מִטּוּמְאַת מֵת — טָמֵא. שֶׁחֶזְקַת טָמֵא — טָמֵא, וְחֶזְקַת טָהוֹר — טָהוֹר, שֶׁרַגְלַיִם לַדָּבָר.
human_translation: descended to cool pure. to purify himself from the impurity from a corpse, impure. that the presumptive status of impurity impure, and the presumptive status of purity pure, as there is a basis for the matter.
llm_translation: He descended to investigate — pure. To become purified from the impurity of a corpse — impure. When there is a presumption of impurity — impure, and when there is a presumption of purity — pure, for actions speak louder than words.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכִי יָמוּת מֵת עָלָיו בְּפֶתַע פִּתְאֹם״, ״עָלָיו״ — בִּמְחֻוֶּורֶת לוֹ.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rabbi Eliezer said that the verse states “And if any man shall die very suddenly beside him” “beside him” that clear to him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mena hanei milei? Amar Rabbi Eliezer, de'amar kra: "ve'chi yamut met alav be'feta pit'om," "alav" - bimchuvveret lo. English translation: What is the completion of these matters? Rabbi Eliezer said, as the verse states: "And if sudden death comes upon him, upon him" - with a clear warning to him.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אָמַר קְרָא ״כִּי יִהְיֶה טָמֵא לָנֶפֶשׁ אוֹ בְדֶרֶךְ רְחֹקָה״. כִּי דֶרֶךְ: מָה דֶּרֶךְ בְּגִלּוּי, אַף כֹּל בְּגִלּוּי.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said The verse states who shall be ritually impure due to a corpse or on a road far away” like a road. Just as a road is in the open, so too, every in the open.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: The verse says, "If he shall be unclean by reason of a dead body, or in a distant way." Just as the way is in public, so too everything is in public.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָדִתְנַן: אֵיזוֹהִי טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם — כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַכִּירָהּ אֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם. אֲבָל מַכִּירָהּ אֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם — אֵין זוֹ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם.
human_translation: But that which we learned Which is the ritual impurity in the depths? any of which no one is aware, at the end of the earth. However, one is aware of it, at the end of the earth, this is not impurity in the depths.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And rather, didn't we learn: What is the impurity of the abyss - anything that does not recognize it, one at the end of the world. But if one recognizes it, one at the end of the world - this is not the impurity of the abyss."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כִּי דֶרֶךְ — שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר — בִּמְחֻוֶּורֶת לוֹ, כִּי מַכִּירָהּ אֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם מַאי הָוֵי?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says like a road, fine, However, according to the one who says to clear to him, if one at the end of the earth is aware of what of it?
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says "because it is the way" - it is good. But according to the one who says - "with a ring for him," since he recognizes her at the end of the world, what is the status?

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, הָא דְּתַנְיָא: הַמּוֹצֵא מֵת מוּשְׁכָּב לְרׇחְבָּהּ שֶׁל דֶּרֶךְ, בִּתְרוּמָה — טָמֵא, בְּנָזִיר וּבַעֲשִׂיַּית פֶּסַח — טָהוֹר. מַאי שְׁנָא? אֶלָּא טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ.
human_translation: And furthermore, that which is taught one who finds a corpse lying the width of a road, with regard to teruma , impure. with regard to a nazirite and one performing the Paschal offering, pure. What is different Rather, impurity in the depths is learned as a tradition
llm_translation: And come, this that was taught: One who finds a dead body lying in the breadth of a road, with regard to terumah — it is impure, but with regard to a nazirite and the performance of the Passover offering — it is pure. What is the difference? Rather, the impurity of the abyss is definitively established for it.

hebrew_text: אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא גִּילַּח וְכוּ׳. מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: תִּגְלַחַת מְעַכֶּבֶת.
human_translation: if before he shaved, Who taught Rabbi Yoḥanan says: It is Rabbi Eliezer, who says shaving is indispensable
llm_translation: "If until not he shaved, etc." Who is the Tanna? Rabbi Yochanan said: It is Rabbi Eliezer, who said: 'Shaving delays.'"

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: נִטְמָא בְּתוֹךְ מְלֹאת וְנוֹדַע לוֹ לְאַחַר מְלֹאת, מַהוּ? בָּתַר יְדִיעָה אָזְלִינַן, וִידִיעָה אַחַר מְלֹאת הִיא, אוֹ לָא? וּלְמַאי: לְמִיסְתַּר?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raised a dilemma: What is became impure during the full term but became known to him after the full term we go knowledge, and it is knowledge after the full term, or not And with regard to what with regard to negation
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ramei bar Ḥama inquired: If one becomes impure within a full vessel and it becomes known to him after the vessel is full, what is the law? Do we follow the subsequent knowledge, and is knowledge after the vessel is full considered valid or not? And for what reason? For concealment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא גִּילַּח — בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ סוֹתֵר. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאִיתְיְדַע לֵיהּ בְּתוֹךְ מְלֹאת — צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר? אֶלָּא לָאו, לְאַחַר מְלֹאת, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear If before he shaved, he negates in either case. What are the circumstances If became known to him during the full term need this be said, Rather, is it not after the full term Conclude from
llm_translation: Rava said, come and hear: If one did not shave - whether this way or that way he contradicts. What is the case? If it is known to him within the fullness - is it necessary to say? Rather, not within the fullness, learn from it.

hebrew_text: וַעֲדַיִין תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ: כּוּלּוֹ סוֹתֵר אוֹ שִׁבְעָה סוֹתֵר? לְמַאן? אִילֵּימָא לְרַבָּנַן — פְּשִׁיטָא דְּכוּלּוֹ סוֹתֵר. וְאִי לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: כׇּל אַחַר מְלֹאת — שִׁבְעָה סוֹתֵר!
human_translation: And you still raise the dilemma: he negate entire or he negate seven According to whom If we say to the Rabbis it is obvious that negates it all, And if to Rabbi Eliezer, any after the full term negates seven
llm_translation: And still you should argue: does he entirely negate or seven negates? According to whom? If you say according to the Rabbis - it is obvious that he entirely negates. And if according to Rabbi Eliezer: after the filling of all - seven negates!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי, כִּי נִטְמָא אַחַר מְלֹאת, וְהַאי לִפְנֵי מְלֹאת הוּא. אוֹ דִילְמָא: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דִּידִיעָה אַחַר מְלֹאת הִיא?
human_translation: said to you: This statement if he became impure after the full term but this one before the full term, Or perhaps it is different here, as it is knowledge after the full term
llm_translation: He said to you: These matters, when they become impure after being filled, but this one is before being filled. Or perhaps, is it different here because knowledge comes after being filled?

hebrew_text: וּמִינַּהּ: קָתָנֵי בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ סוֹתֵר, וְלָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: And from this teaches he negates in either case. And it does not distinguish
llm_translation: And its species: it teaches both this and this invalidates, and does not divide.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמּוֹצֵא מֵת מוּטָל לְרׇחְבָּהּ שֶׁל דֶּרֶךְ, לִתְרוּמָה — טָמֵא, וּבְנָזִיר וּבְעוֹשֵׂה פֶסַח — טָהוֹר. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מָקוֹם לַעֲבוֹר,
human_translation: The Sages taught one who finds a corpse lying the width of a road, with regard to teruma impure. But with regard to a nazirite and one performing the Paschal offering, pure, In what is this statement said, where he does not have space to pass by
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who finds a corpse lying in the open expanse of a road, with regard to terumah - he is impure. But with regard to a Nazirite and one who is preparing for the Passover offering - he is pure. In what case are these words said? When he has no place to pass over.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל יֵשׁ לוֹ מָקוֹם לַעֲבוֹר — אַף לִתְרוּמָה טָהוֹר.
human_translation: But he has space to pass by, even with regard to teruma pure.
llm_translation: But he has a place to pass - even for terumah pure.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁמְּצָאוֹ שָׁלֵם. אֲבָל מְשׁוּבָּר אוֹ מְפוֹרָק, אֲפִילּוּ אֵין מָקוֹם לַעֲבוֹר חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא בֵּין פִּרְקִין עָבַר. וּבְקֶבֶר, אֲפִילּוּ מְשׁוּבָּר וּמְפוֹרָק — טָמֵא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקֶּבֶר מְצָרְפוֹ.
human_translation: in what is this statement said? where one finds whole. However, broken or dismembered even there is no space to pass by. we suspect perhaps he passed between the parts But in a grave, even broken dismembered, impure. because the grave joins
llm_translation: In what case are these words spoken? — When it was found intact. But if it is broken or disassembled, even if there is no space to pass through, we are concerned that perhaps between the beams he passed. And in a grave, even if it is broken and disassembled — it is impure, because a grave imparts impurity.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּמְהַלֵּךְ בְּרַגְלָיו. אֲבָל טָעוּן אוֹ רָכוּב — טָמֵא. לְפִי שֶׁמְּהַלֵּךְ בְּרַגְלָיו — אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא יִגַּע וְשֶׁלֹּא יָסִיט וְשֶׁלֹּא יַאֲהִיל. טָעוּן אוֹ רָכוּב — אִי אֶפְשָׁר שֶׁלֹּא יִגַּע וְשֶׁלֹּא יָסִיט וְשֶׁלֹּא יַאֲהִיל.
human_translation: In what is this statement said, with regard to travels by foot. However, loaded or riding impure. because one who travels by foot, it is possible that he will not touch and will not move and will not pass over loaded or riding it is impossible that he will not touch and will not move and will not pass over
llm_translation: In what matters are these words said? — In one who walks on foot. But if one is carried or riding — he is impure. Because when one walks on foot — it is possible for him not to touch, not to move, and not to be defiled. But if one is carried or riding — it is impossible for him not to touch, not to move, and not to be defiled.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּטוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם. אֲבָל טוּמְאָה יְדוּעָה — שְׁלׇשְׁתָּן טְמֵאִים.
human_translation: In what is this statement said, with regard to impurity in the depths. However, impurity known three of them, impure.
llm_translation: In what matters are these things said? — Regarding the impurity of the abyss. But impurity that is known — three of them are impure.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם — כֹּל שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירָהּ אֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם. מַכִּירָהּ אֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם — אֵין זוֹ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם.
human_translation: And which is impurity of the depths? Any of which no one is aware, at the end of the earth. one is aware of it, at the end of the earth, this is not impurity in the depths.
llm_translation: "And what is the impurity of the abyss - anything that no one recognizes at the end of the world. If someone recognizes it at the end of the world - this is not the impurity of the abyss."

hebrew_text: הָיָה טָמוּן בְּתֶבֶן אוֹ בִּצְרוֹרוֹת — הֲרֵי זוֹ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם. בַּיַּמִּים וּבָאֲפֵילָה וּבִנְקִיקֵי הַסְּלָעִים — אֵין זוֹ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם.
human_translation: was concealed in hay or in pebbles, this is impurity in the depths. in water, or in a dark or in the clefts of the rocks, this is not impurity in the depths.
llm_translation: He was hidden in straw or in bundles - this is the impurity of the abyss. In the sea, in darkness, and in crevices of rocks - this is not the impurity of the abyss.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא אָמְרוּ טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם אֶלָּא לְמֵת בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: And said impurity in the depths only with regard to a corpse,
llm_translation: And not they said, impurity of the deep, rather for the dead alone.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד יָרַד. צָפָה אֵינָהּ מְטַמְּאָה לְעִנְיַן שֶׁרֶץ, דְּתַנְיָא: סְפֵק טוּמְאָה צָפָה, בֵּין בְּכֵלִים, בֵּין בְּקַרְקַע — טְהוֹרָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בְּכֵלִים טְמֵאָה, בְּקַרְקַע טְהוֹרָה.
human_translation: How descended A floating does not render impure in the case of a creeping animal. As it is taught uncertain impurity, floating, either in a vessel or in the ground, pure. Rabbi Shimon says: in a vessel, impure; in the ground, pure.
llm_translation: How does it descend? If it is covered, it does not render susceptible to impurity regarding a creeping thing, as it was taught: If there is doubt regarding impurity, if it is covered, whether with vessels or with the ground - it is pure. Rabbi Shimon says: With vessels it is impure, with the ground it is pure.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אֲבוּדִימִי, כְּתִיב: ״בְּכׇל הַשֶּׁרֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵץ״, כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהוּא שׁוֹרֵץ, וּכְתִיב ״עַל הָאָרֶץ״. הָא כֵּיצַד? וַדַּאי מַגָּעוֹ — טָמֵא, סְפֵק מַגָּעוֹ — טָהוֹר.
human_translation: What is the reason of the first tanna Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avudimi says: it is written: “With any swarming thing that swarms” any place where it swarms. And it is written: upon the earth” How so? Definite contact it impure; uncertain contact it, pure.
llm_translation: What is the reason that the first Tanna taught? Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avudimi said, as it is written: "In all swarming things that swarm," anywhere it swarms, and it is written "on the ground." How so? If its touch is definite — it is impure; if its touch is uncertain — it is pure.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר עוּלָּא: כְּתִיב ״אַךְ מַעְיָן״, וּכְתִיב ״יִטְמָא״ (עַד הָעָרֶב), הָא כֵּיצַד? צָפָה בְּכֵלִים — טָמֵא, בְּקַרְקַע — טָהוֹר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, what is the reason Ulla said it is written: “Nevertheless a fountain And it is written shall be impure How so? floating in vessels, is impure, in the ground pure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon, what is the reason? Ulla said: It is written "only from a spring," and it is written "it shall become impure" (until evening), how so? If one looked at vessels - impure, at the ground - pure.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל הַנִּיטָּלִין וְהַנִּגְרָרִין — סְפֵיקָן טָמֵא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן כְּמוּנָּחִין. וְהַנִּזְרָקִין — סְפֵיקָן טָהוֹר.
human_translation: The Sages taught All that are carried or that are dragged uncertainty impure, as though at rest. And that are thrown uncertain pure.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: All detached and dragged items - their status is uncertainly impure, because they are like resting objects. And those that are thrown - their status is uncertainly pure.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִן כְּזַיִת הַמֵּת, וְהַמַּאֲהִיל עַל פְּנֵי טוּמְאָה, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁמְּטַמֵּא מִלְּמַעְלָה כִּלְמַטָּה. לְאֵיתוֹיֵי זָב וְזָבָה.
human_translation: except for an olive-bulk a corpse, and that which overlies impurity and anything that renders above impure like below to include a zav and a zava ,
llm_translation: Outside of an olive's size of a dead body, and one who causes impurity on the surface of impurity, and anything that imparts impurity from above like from below. For the purification of a male and a female discharge.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: מֵת בִּכְלִי, וּכְלִי צָף עַל פְּנֵי הַמַּיִם, מַהוּ? בָּתַר כְּלִי אָזְלִינַן, אוֹ בָּתַר מִיתָא אָזְלִינַן?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises a dilemma: a corpse in a vessel and the vessel is floating on water, what is we go according to vessel or we go according to corpse,
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ramei bar Ḥama inquired: If one dies in a vessel, and the vessel floats on the surface of the water, what is the law? Do we follow the vessel, or do we follow the corpse?

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר בָּתַר כְּלִי אָזְלִינַן: מֵת עַל גַּבֵּי שֶׁרֶץ, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּהַאי טוּמְאַת עֶרֶב, וְהַאי טוּמְאַת שִׁבְעָה, כְּמַאן דְּמַחֲתָא טוּמְאָה בִּכְלִי דָּמְיָא, אוֹ דִילְמָא טוּמְאָה סְמִיכְתָּא הִיא.
human_translation: If you say we go according to the vessel a corpse on top of a creeping animal, what is since this an impurity for an evening, and this an impurity for seven it is considered as though the impurity were placed in a vessel, Or, perhaps it is solid impurity,
llm_translation: If you would say that after the vessel we go out: one who dies on top of a creeping creature, what is the law? Since this impurity is of the evening, and this impurity is of seven, like who that extinguishes impurity in a vessel of blood, or perhaps it is a contiguous impurity.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר כְּמַאן דְּמַחֲתָא טוּמְאָה בִּכְלִי דָּמְיָא, וְטָמֵא וַדַּאי. שֶׁרֶץ עַל גַּבֵּי נְבֵלָה, וּנְבֵלָה צָפָה, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ טוּמְאַת עֶרֶב אִינּוּן — טוּמְאָה סְמִיכְתָּא הִיא. אוֹ דִילְמָא: הַאי כְּזַיִת וְהַאי כַּעֲדָשָׁה?
human_translation: And if you say it is considered as though the impurity were placed in a vessel and definitely impure, a creeping animal atop animal carcass and the animal carcass floating, what is since they are both an impurity for an evening, it is solid impurity, or perhaps this an olive-bulk, and this of a lentil-bulk.
llm_translation: And if you might say, like the one who renders impure in a vessel of blood, and he is impure for sure. A creeping thing on top of a carcass, and the carcass is covered, what is the ruling? Since both of them are rendering impure due to the proximity of the evening, it is a case of impurity by contact. Or perhaps: Is this like an olive and that like a lentil?

hebrew_text: שֶׁרֶץ עַל גַּבֵּי שֶׁרֶץ מַהוּ? הָנֵי וַדַּאי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא נִינְהוּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּמִפַּסְקִי מֵהֲדָדֵי — לָא.
human_translation: a creeping animal atop creeping animal, what is these certainly same measurement Or, perhaps, since are separate from each other not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Sheretz al gabbei sheretz mahu? Hanai vadai chad shiura ninhu, o dilmah keivun de'mipaski mehadadei - la." English translation: "A creeping thing upon another creeping thing, what is the law? These are certainly one measure, or perhaps since they are separated from each other - no."

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר: שֶׁרֶץ עַל גַּבֵּי שֶׁרֶץ כֵּיוָן דְּמִפַּסְקִי מֵהֲדָדֵי כְּמַאן דְּמַנְּחָא בִּכְלִי דָּמֵי, שֶׁרֶץ עַל גַּבֵּי נְבֵלָה שֶׁנִּימּוֹחָה, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּנִימּוֹחָה הָוְיָא לַיהּ מַשְׁקֶה, אוֹ דִּלְמָא הַאי אוּכְלָא הוּא.
human_translation: And if you say a creeping animal atop a creeping animal, since are separate from each other, it is considered as though were placed in a vessel a creeping animal atop an animal carcass that has dissolved, what is since it has dissolved it has become liquid, Or, perhaps this is food,
llm_translation: "And if you might say: a creeping thing on top of another creeping thing, since they are separated from each other, like one who places a vessel in a utensil, a creeping thing on top of a carcass that is decomposed, what is the ruling? Since it is decomposed, does it render it a liquid, or perhaps it is food."

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר דְּאוּכְלָא הוּא, שֶׁרֶץ עַל גַּבֵּי שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע, מַהוּ? וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר כֵּיוָן דְּמִיתְעַקְּרָא הָוְיָא לַהּ כִּי אוּכְלָא, שֶׁרֶץ עַל גַּבֵּי מֵי חַטָּאת וּמֵי חַטָּאת צָפִין עַל גַּבֵּי הַמַּיִם, מַהוּ? לָא יָדְעִינַן, תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: And if you say that is food, a creeping animal on top of semen, what is And if you say once is ejaculated it is considered like food a creeping animal atop waters of purification, and waters of purification are floating on water, what is We do not know shall stand
llm_translation: And if you should say that it is food, a creeping thing on the surface of a seminal emission, what? And if you should say since it is uprooted it is considered like food, a creeping thing on the surface of the waters of the sin-offering, and the waters of the sin-offering float on the surface of the water, what? We do not know, let it stand undecided.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: נָזִיר וְעוֹשֵׂה פֶסַח שֶׁהָלְכוּ בְּקֶבֶר הַתְּהוֹם בַּשְּׁבִיעִי שֶׁלָּהֶן — טְהוֹרִים. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּלָא אַלִּימָא טוּמְאַת הַתְּהוֹם לְמִיסְתַּר.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna says: a nazirite and one performing the Paschal who walked by a grave in the depths, on their seventh their they are pure. What is the reason because the ritual impurity in the depths is not strong to negate
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: A Nazirite who observes the Passover that they went into the cave of the abyss on their seventh day - they are pure. What is the reason? - Because the impurity of the abyss does not apply to concealment.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: יָרַד לִיטָּהֵר מִטּוּמְאַת הַמֵּת — טָמֵא, שֶׁחֶזְקַת טָמֵא — טָמֵא, שֶׁחֶזְקַת טָהוֹר — טָהוֹר.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection descended to purify himself from the ritual impurity a corpse, impure, that has the presumptive status of impurity impure, and the presumptive status of purity pure.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: If one descended to purify himself from the impurity of a corpse - he is impure; because the presumption is impurity - he is impure; because the presumption is purity - he is pure.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹדֵינָא לָךְ בְּנָזִיר, שֶׁמְחוּסָּר תִּגְלַחַת.
human_translation: said to I agree with you with regard to a nazirite who is lacking shaving.
llm_translation: He said to him: We concede to you regarding a Nazirite, that he is lacking in shaving.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אַף אֲנָא מוֹדֵינָא לָךְ בְּעוֹשֵׂה פֶסַח, דְּלָא מְחוּסָּר וְלָא כְלוּם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא מְחוּסָּר הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שִׁימְשָׁא מִמֵּילָא עָרְבָא.
human_translation: Rava said to him: I, too, agree with you with regard to one performing the Paschal offering as he is not lacking anything. Abaye said to him: But is lacking sunset, said to The sun sets by itself,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: I also agree with you regarding one who performs the Passover sacrifice, that it is not lacking and it is not nothing. Abaye said to him: But isn't it lacking the evening twilight? He said to him: The twilight is considered as part of the night.

hebrew_text: וְאַף אַבָּיֵי הֲדַר בֵּיהּ. דְּתַנְיָא:
human_translation: And even Abaye retracted, as is taught
llm_translation: And also Abbaye returned to it. As it was taught:

hebrew_text: יוֹם מְלֹאת — תָּבִיא. תּוֹךְ מְלֹאת — לֹא תָּבִיא.
human_translation: the day of the fulfillment she must bring during the fulfillment, she does not bring
llm_translation: Day of fullness — bring. Middle of fullness — do not bring.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא תָּבִיא עַל לֵידָה שֶׁלִּפְנֵי מְלֹאת, אֲבָל תָּבִיא עַל לֵידָה שֶׁלְּאַחַר מְלֹאת, וְתִיפָּטֵר מִשְּׁתֵּיהֶן —
human_translation: might she should not bring for her childbirth, that before the fulfillment but she should bring for her childbirth that after completion. and discharge both
llm_translation: He is able not to bring for birth before the completion, but to bring for birth after the completion, and she will be exempt from both —

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבִמְלֹאת יְמֵי טׇהֳרָה״. בְּיוֹם מְלֹאת — תָּבִיא, תּוֹךְ מְלֹאת — לֹא תָּבִיא.
human_translation: the verse states: “And when the days of her purity are fulfilled… on the day of the fulfillment she must bring before the fulfillment she does not bring
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Talmud teaches: "And on the completion of her days of purity." On the day of completion - she shall bring, in the midst of completion - she shall not bring.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דִּמְחַסְּרָא קׇרְבָּן. הָתָם נָמֵי, מְחַסְּרָא הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ!
human_translation: Rav Kahana said Here it is different. that she lacks offering. There too, lacks sunset.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: The case here is different, as it lacks a sacrifice. There, it is stated: "The evening shall bring it to light."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: שִׁימְשָׁא מִמֵּילָא עָרְבָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to The sun sets by itself
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: "Place it from the top of the mound."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוֹצֵא מֵת בַּתְּחִילָּה, מוּשְׁכָּב כְּדַרְכּוֹ — נוֹטְלוֹ וְאֶת תְּפוּסָתוֹ.
human_translation: One who finds a corpse for the first lying in usual manner he removes it and its surrounding
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who finds a corpse at the outset, lying in the manner of his death — he takes it and its covering.

hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם — נוֹטְלָן וְאֶת תְּפוּסָתָן. מָצָא שְׁלֹשָׁה, אִם יֵשׁ בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וְעַד שְׁמוֹנֶה — הֲרֵי זוֹ שְׁכוּנַת קְבָרוֹת.
human_translation: two he removes them and their surrounding found three if there is between this and that of four to eight cubits, this is a graveyard.
llm_translation: Two — they take and their acquisition. He found three, if there is between this and that from four cubits to eight — this is the proximity of graves.

hebrew_text: בּוֹדֵק הֵימֶנּוּ וּלְהַלָּן עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה, מָצָא אֶחָד בְּסוֹף עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה — בּוֹדֵק הֵימֶנּוּ וּלְהַלָּן עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה. שֶׁרַגְלַיִם לַדָּבָר. שֶׁאִילּוּ תְּחִילָּה מְצָאוֹ — נוֹטְלוֹ וְאֶת תְּפוּסָתוֹ.
human_translation: examine from that outward twenty cubits. finds at the end of twenty cubits, examines outward twenty cubits, as there is a basis for the matter. that if he had found at first removed it and its surrounding
llm_translation: He measures it and beyond twenty cubits, if he found one at the end of twenty cubits - he measures it and beyond twenty cubits. This is a matter of feet. If he found it initially - he takes it and its handle.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מָצָא — פְּרָט לְמָצוּי. מֵת — פְּרָט לְהָרוּג. מוּשְׁכָּב — פְּרָט לְיוֹשֵׁב. כְּדַרְכּוֹ — פְּרָט לְשֶׁרֹאשׁוֹ מוּנָּח בֵּין יַרְכוֹתָיו.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said found, excludes that been found. corpse [ met ] excludes a killed [ harug ] lying excludes a sitting In manner, excludes whose head was placed between his thighs,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said: "Found" - excludes something that is found. "Dead" - excludes something that is killed. "Lying down" - excludes someone who is sitting. "In his own way" - excludes when his head is placed between his thighs.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי עוּלָּא בַּר חֲנִינָא: מֵת שֶׁחָסַר, אֵין לוֹ תְּפוּסָה וְלֹא שְׁכוּנַת קְבָרוֹת. וְכׇל הָנֵי מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? אָמְרִינַן דִּילְמָא גּוֹי הוּא.
human_translation: Ulla bar Ḥanina taught A corpse that is lacking has no surrounding Nor a graveyard, And all these what is the reason not We say perhaps was a gentile,
llm_translation: Tanna taught: Ulla son of Hanina said: A deceased person who is lacking does not have a holding and not a burial place. And all those, what is the reason? We say perhaps he is a non-Jew.

hebrew_text: מָצָא שְׁנַיִם, רֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל זֶה בְּצַד מַרְגְּלוֹתָיו שֶׁל זֶה, וְרֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל זֶה בְּצַד מַרְגְּלוֹתָיו שֶׁל זֶה — אֵין לָהֶן תְּפוּסָה וְלֹא שְׁכוּנַת קְבָרוֹת. מָצָא שְׁלֹשָׁה, הָאֶחָד יָדוּעַ וּשְׁנַיִם תְּחִילָּה, אוֹ שְׁנַיִם תְּחִילָּה וּשְׁנַיִם יְדוּעִים — אֵין לָהֶם תְּפוּסָה, וְאֵין לָהֶם שְׁכוּנַת קְבָרוֹת.
human_translation: found two the head of this by the feet of that and the head of that by the feet of this they do not have surrounding earth, nor a graveyard. found three one known, while two for the first or two for the first and two known, they do not have surrounding and they do not have a graveyard.
llm_translation: He found two, the head of this one alongside the feet of that one, and the head of that one alongside the feet of this one - they have no ownership and no fixed burial place. If he found three, one is known and two are initially placed, or two are initially placed and two are known - they have no ownership, and they have no fixed burial place.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי יְשֵׁבָב שֶׁבָּדַק וּמָצָא שְׁנַיִם יְדוּעִין וְאֶחָד תְּחִילָּה, וּבִיקֵּשׁ לַעֲשׂוֹתָן שְׁכוּנַת קְבָרוֹת. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כׇּל שֶׁיָּגַעְתָּ — לָרִיק יָגַעְתָּ. לֹא אָמְרוּ שְׁכוּנַת קְבָרוֹת אֶלָּא לִשְׁלֹשָׁה יְדוּעִין, אוֹ לִשְׁלֹשָׁה תְּחִילָּה.
human_translation: An incident involving Rabbi Yeshevav, who examined and found two known and one for the first and he wished to deem a graveyard. Rabbi Akiva said to him: All your toil is in vain. They said a graveyard only of three known or three for the first
llm_translation: The story of Rabbi Yeshivav who examined and found two known graves and one grave initially, and he sought to make them like a burial plot. Rabbi Akiva said to him: "All that you have labored for - you have labored in vain." They only said it is considered like a burial plot for three known graves, or for three initially identified graves.

hebrew_text: נוֹטְלָן וְאֶת תְּפוּסָתָן. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי תְּפוּסָה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אָמַר קְרָא ״וּנְשָׂאתַנִי מִמִּצְרַיִם״ — טוֹל עִמִּי.
human_translation: he removes them and their surrounding What are the circumstances surrounding Rav Yehuda said: The verse states “You shall carry me out from Egypt” Take with me,
llm_translation: They take and their capture. How is the value of capture? Rav Yehudah said: The verse says, "And you shall take me out of Egypt" - take with me.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר תְּפוּסָה? פֵּירֵשׁ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר (בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק): נוֹטֵל עָפָר תִּיחוּחַ, וְחוֹפֵר בַּבְּתוּלָה שָׁלֹשׁ אֶצְבָּעוֹת.
human_translation: And what is the measure of surrounding Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, explained: One takes loose dirt and digs virgin, three fingerbreadths,
llm_translation: "And how much is the measure of a Tefusah? Rabbi Elazar (son of Rabbi Tzadok) explained: He takes a clod of dust, and digs into a virgin ground with three fingers."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר תְּפוּסָה? פֵּירֵשׁ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק: נוֹטֵל אֶת הַקֵּיסָמִין וְאֶת הַקְּסָסוֹת.
human_translation: raises an objection And what is the measure of surrounding Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, explained: One takes wood chips and lumps
llm_translation: Challenger: And how much is the measure of acquisition? Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok explained: He takes the bundles and the stalks.

hebrew_text: וְזוֹרֵק אֶת הַוַּודָּאִין וּמַנִּיחַ אֶת הַסְּפֵיקוֹת. וְהַשְּׁאָר מִצְטָרֵף לְרוֹב בִּנְיָנוֹ שֶׁל מֵת, וּלְרוֹבַע עֲצָמוֹת, לִמְלֹא תַּרְווֹד רָקָב.
human_translation: And he discards certainly he sets aside the uncertain And the rest, combine to of the majority of the structure of a corpse, or of a quarter- of bones, of a full ladle of dust
llm_translation: And he throws the vavdaiin and places the sefikot. And the rest joins the majority of the construction of a corpse, and a quarter of its bones, to fill the measure of decay.

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר תְּפוּסָה? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם בֶּן עַזַּאי: נוֹטֵל עָפָר תִּיחוּחַ, וְחוֹפֵר בַּבְּתוּלָה שָׁלֹשׁ אֶצְבָּעוֹת.
human_translation: he who said in accordance with that tanna , as it is taught And how much is the measure of surrounding Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of ben Azzai: One takes loose earth and digs virgin three fingerbreadths.
llm_translation: He who said: for this Mishnah, as it was taught: And how much is the measure of a Tefusah? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Ben Azai: He takes a handful of dust and digs into a virgin soil with three fingers.

hebrew_text: בּוֹדֵק הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: examine from that
llm_translation: Examining him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בָּדַק וּפִנָּה, בָּדַק וּפִנָּה, בְּדַק וְאַשְׁכַּח — לָא הַאי מְפַנֵּי לֵיהּ גַּבֵּי הָנָךְ תְּרֵי, וְלָא הָנֵי תְּרֵי לְגַבַּי הַאי חַד.
human_translation: Rava said: examined, and removed examined and removed examined and discovered he does not move this alongside these two And he does not these two alongside this one
llm_translation: Rava said: He checked and he found, he checked and he found, he checked and he found — not this one because of that one two, and not those two because of this one.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּתְּנָה רְשׁוּת לִפְנוֹת, מְפַנֶּה לְהוֹן. וְלִישַׁוִּינְהוּ שְׁכוּנַת קְבָרוֹת! אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: עִילָּא, מָצְאוּ וְטִיהֲרוּ אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: There are who say Rava said: Since permission was granted to move move them And let us deem them a graveyard. Reish Lakish said: They found a pretext and deemed Eretz Yisrael ritually pure.
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rava said: Once permission was granted to turn the bodies, they turn them. And let them establish it as a burial ground! Reish Lakish said: Above, they found and purified the land of Israel.

hebrew_text: בָּדַק מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה וְלֹא מָצָא, מַאי? אָמַר רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַב: שְׁכוּנַת קְבָרוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: עִילָּא מָצְאוּ וְטִיהֲרוּ אֶת אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: examined twenty cubits and did not find what is Rav Menashya bar Yirmeya says Rav says: a graveyard. What is the reason Reish Lakish said: They found a pretext and deemed Eretz Yisrael ritually pure.
llm_translation: He measured twenty cubits and did not find, what is the reason? Rav Menashya son of Yirmeya said Rav: the neighborhood of graves. What is the reason? Reish Lakish said: Above they found and purified the land of Israel.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל סְפֵק נְגָעִים בַּתְּחִילָּה, טָהוֹר — עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִזְקַק לְטוּמְאָה. מִשֶּׁנִּזְקַק לְטוּמְאָה — סְפֵקוֹ טָמֵא.
human_translation: Any uncertainty leprous sores initially pure until it is established that of ritual impurity. Once has been determined of impurity, uncertainty it is impure.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Any doubt regarding skin afflictions at the outset, is pure - until it becomes confirmed as impure. Once it becomes confirmed as impure - its doubt is impure.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אָמַר קְרָא ״לְטַהֲרוֹ אוֹ לְטַמְּאוֹ״, הוֹאִיל וּפָתַח [בּוֹ] הַכָּתוּב בְּטׇהֳרָה תְּחִילָּה. אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ מִשֶּׁנִּזְקַק לְטוּמְאָה נָמֵי סְפֵקוֹ טָהוֹר!
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The verse states: to pronounce it pure or to pronounce it impure” Since the verse opened with purity first, If so, even once has been determined of impurity, uncertainty it pure as well,
llm_translation: Gemara: What are these words teaching us? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The verse says, "To purify him or to make him impure," since the Scripture began with purity. If so, even if he is leaning towards impurity, his status is considered pure!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, אַהָא אִיתְּמַר: אִם בַּהֶרֶת קָדְמָה לְשֵׂעָר לָבָן — טָמֵא, וְאִם שֵׂעָר לָבָן קוֹדֵם לַבַּהֶרֶת — טָהוֹר. סָפֵק — טָמֵא. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר: כִּיהָה.
human_translation: Rather, when that Rav Yehuda Rav said, was stated, it was stated with regard to the following If snow-white leprous sore [ baheret ], preceded white hair, he is impure. And if white hair preceded baheret pure, uncertainty impure. And Rabbi Yehoshua said: Keiha .
llm_translation: Rather, when it was stated that Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, "Aha, it was stated: If white hair preceded leprosy - impure, and if leprosy preceded white hair - pure. Doubtful - impure. And Rabbi Yehoshua said: Thus it is."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כִּיהָה״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כִּיהָה וְטָהוֹר. וְדִילְמָא כִּיהָה וְטָמֵא? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אָמַר קְרָא ״לְטַהֲרוֹ אוֹ לְטַמְּאוֹ״. הוֹאִיל וּפָתַח בּוֹ הַכָּתוּב בְּטׇהֳרָה תְּחִילָּה.
human_translation: What is keiha ? Rav Yehuda said: pronounced unsolvable and pure. And perhaps pronounced unsolvable and impure? Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The verse states: “To pronounce it pure or to pronounce it impure” since the verse opened with purity first,
llm_translation: What is "kihah"? Rav Yehudah said: Kihah and pure. And perhaps kihah and impure? Rav Yehudah said Rav: Scripture says, "for his purification or for his defilement." Since the verse begins with purity.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּשִׁבְעָה דְּרָכִים בּוֹדְקִין אֶת הַזָּב עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִזְקַק לְזִיבָה: בְּמַאֲכָל וּבְמִשְׁתֶּה, בְּמַשָּׂא וּבִקְפִיצָה, וּבְחוֹלִי, וּבְמַרְאֶה, וּבְהִירְהוּר.
human_translation: One examines a man who experienced a gonorrhea-like discharge [ zav ] in seven ways, as long as he has not been confirmed as a gonorrhea-like discharge [ ziva ]. with regard to food and with regard to drink, with regard to a burden, and with regard to jumping, and with regard to sickness; and with regard to sight; and with regard to thought
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: In seven ways do we examine a zav until he is no longer in need of examination for his zivah: through eating and drinking, through carrying a burden and through jumping, through illness, through sight, and through contemplation.

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁנִּזְקַק לְזִיבָה — אֵין בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ. אוֹנְסוֹ וּסְפֵיקוֹ וְשִׁכְבַת זַרְעוֹ — טְמֵאִים. שֶׁרַגְלַיִם לַדָּבָר.
human_translation: Once he has been confirmed as a ziva , one no examines him his circumstances beyond his control, and his uncertain and his semen, are impure. because there is a basis for the matter.
llm_translation: When he is afflicted with a discharge - they do not examine him. His rape, his doubt, and his seminal emission - are impure. For they are feet to the matter.

hebrew_text: הַמַּכֶּה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ וַאֲמָדוּהוּ לְמִיתָה, וְהֵקֵל מִמַּה שֶּׁהָיָה, לְאַחַר מִכָּאן הִכְבִּיד וָמֵת — חַיָּיב. רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: פָּטוּר, שֶׁרַגְלַיִם לַדָּבָר.
human_translation: one who strikes another and assessed he would die but his improved from what it was, afterward worsened and he died, liable Rabbi Neḥemya says: exempt, because there is a basis for the matter.
llm_translation: The one who strikes his fellow and it is established for him to die, and he lightened from what he was, afterwards he aggravated and died - liable. Rabbi Nechemyah says: exempt, for there are legs to the matter.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי נָתָן: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְהַזָּב אֶת זוֹבוֹ״, לִרְאִיָּה שְׁלִישִׁית אִיתַּקַּשׁ לִנְקֵיבָה.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rabbi Natan says the verse states: “And the zav who has an issue [ zav et zovo ], to the third sighting, juxtaposes of a female:
llm_translation: Gemara: What are these words referring to? Rabbi Natan said: The verse says, "And the one who emits his discharge," it is connected to the third sighting for a woman.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר בַּשְּׁלִישִׁית בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ, בָּרְבִיעִית אֵין בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ! אֶלָּא בְּאֶתִּים קָמִיפַּלְגִי: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דָּרֵישׁ אֶתִּים. וְרַבָּנַן לָא דָּרְשִׁי אֶתִּים.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Eliezer says: For the third one examines him; for the fourth one does not examine him. Rather, they disagree with regard to “ et ,” Rabbi Eliezer expounds “ et ,” And the Rabbis do not expound “ et ,”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says, "On the third day one examines it, on the fourth day one does not examine it!" Rather, they dispute with regard to two days: Rabbi Eliezer expounds the law with regard to two days, but the Rabbis did not expound the law with regard to two days.

hebrew_text: אוֹנְסוֹ וּסְפֵיקוֹ.
human_translation: his circumstances beyond his control, and his uncertain
llm_translation: His compulsion and his doubt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לָא תֵּימָא סָפֵק חֲזָא סָפֵק לָא חֲזָא. אֶלָּא וַדַּאי חֲזָא, סָפֵק מֵחֲמַת שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע, סָפֵק מֵחֲמַת רְאִיָּיה. כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּזְקַק לְטוּמְאָה — סְפֵיקוֹ טָמֵא.
human_translation: Rava said: Do not say uncertain saw uncertain did not see Rather, he certainly saw a uncertain due to, semen, uncertain due to sighting once he has been confirmed as being ritually impure his uncertain impure.
llm_translation: Rava said: Do not say, "Perhaps he saw, perhaps he did not see." Rather, if he definitely saw, whether due to seminal emission or due to visual perception. Once he is inclined towards impurity - his doubt is impure.

hebrew_text: שִׁכְבַת זַרְעוֹ טְמֵאָה. לְמַאי? אִילֵימָא לְמַגָּע — מִי גָּרַע מִשִּׁכְבַת זֶרַע דְּטָהוֹר? אֶלָּא זַרְעוֹ שֶׁל זָב מְטַמֵּא בְּמַשָּׂא.
human_translation: his semen is impure. to what If we say to contact, Is it worse than the semen of a pure Rather, the semen of a zav renders impure by carrying,
llm_translation: Lying of his seed is impure. For what? If you will say for touching - who diminishes from lying of seed of pure? Rather, the seed of a zav renders impure through carrying.

hebrew_text: מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לְהָא דְּאָמַר שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע שֶׁל זָב מְטַמֵּא בְּמַשָּׂא? אִילֵּימָא הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: שִׁכְבַת זַרְעוֹ שֶׁל זָב אֵינוֹ מְטַמֵּא בְּמַשָּׂא, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מְטַמֵּא בְּמַשָּׂא, לְפִי שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לָהּ בְּלֹא צִיחְצוּחֵי זִיבָה. אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לָא אָמַר אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם צִיחְצוּחֵי זִיבָה, אֲבָל בְּעֵינֵיהּ, לָא אָמַר!
human_translation: Who did you hear that said that semen of a zav renders impure by carrying? If we say this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: The semen of a zav does not render impure by carrying, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: It render impure by carrying, because it is impossible for to be without droplets of ziva ; even Rabbi Yehoshua said only due to the droplets of ziva However, he did not say in its unadulterated
llm_translation: Who heard to this that said lying of seed of zav defiles in carrying? If you will say this teaching, as it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer says: The lying of his seed of zav does not defile in carrying, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: It defiles in carrying, because it is impossible for her without the emissions of zivah. Even Rabbi Yehoshua did not say except because of the emissions of zivah, but in her eyes, he did not say!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין תּוֹלִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Adda bar Ahava said: to say that one does not attribute to it.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Adda bar Ahava said: to say that we do not rely on it.

hebrew_text: סְבַר רַב פָּפָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא לְמֵימַר אַיְּידֵי חוּלְשָׁא הוּא דְּחָזֵי. אָמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא, וְהָתְנַן: גֵּר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר מְטַמֵּא מִיָּד בְּזִיבָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין לְךָ חוֹלִי גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה.
human_translation: before Rava, Rav Pappa thought to say Since he sees out of weakness Rava said to him: But didn’t we learn A convert who converted can immediately become impure as a zav . said to There is no greater illness than this.
llm_translation: Rav Papa thought before Ravah to say: Since he is weak, he sees. Ravah said to him: But didn't we learn: A convert who converts immediately becomes impure with zavah! He said to him: You have no greater illness than this.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע שֶׁל זָב מְטַמֵּא בְּמַשָּׂא כׇּל מֵעֵת לְעֵת. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, is tanna’im , as it is taught The semen of a zav renders impure by carrying for period. And Rabbi Yosei says its day,
llm_translation: Rather, it is a teaching. As it was taught: The emission of semen of a zav renders anything carrying impurity from time to time. And Rabbi Yosei says: His day.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? בְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל. דִּשְׁמוּאֵל רָמֵי: כְּתִיב: ״כִּי יִהְיֶה בְךָ אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר לֹא יִהְיֶה טָהוֹר מִקְּרֵה לָיְלָה״. וּכְתִיב: ״לִפְנוֹת עֶרֶב יִרְחַץ בַּמָּיִם״.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? with regard to by Shmuel, as Shmuel raises a contradiction: It is written: “If there be among you any man who is not pure, by reason of that which chances him by night, And it is written: “When evening comes on, he shall bathe himself in water,
llm_translation: In what does he differ? In the opinion of Shmuel. Shmuel raises an objection: It is written, "If there be among you any man, that is not clean by reason of that which chanceth him by night." And it is also written, "And at the going down of the sun, he shall bathe himself in water."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר מֵעֵת לְעֵת דָּיֵיק מִ״לִּפְנוֹת עֶרֶב״, וְאִידַּךְ דָּיֵיק ״מִקְּרֵה לָיְלָה״.
human_translation: The one who says for period infers from “when evening comes on” And the other infers “by reason of that which chances him by night”
llm_translation: The one who says "from time to time is precise from evening to evening," and the other one is precise "from incident to night."

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִ״לִּפְנוֹת עֶרֶב״, הָכְתִיב ״מִקְּרֵה לָיְלָה״! אָמַר לָךְ, אוֹרְחָא דְקֶרִי לֵמֵתֵיא בְּלֵילְיָא.
human_translation: But the one who says “when evening comes on,” isn’t it written: “By reason of that which chances him by night”? said to you it is the manner of a seminal emission to occur at night.
llm_translation: And one who says "from before evening," it is written "from the occurrence of night"! He says to you, the way of a man towards the dead is at night.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָזִיר הָיָה שְׁמוּאֵל, כְּדִבְרֵי רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וּמוֹרָה לֹא יַעֲלֶה עַל רֹאשׁוֹ״. נֶאֱמַר בְּשִׁמְשׁוֹן ״וּמוֹרָה״, וְנֶאֱמַר בִּשְׁמוּאֵל ״וּמוֹרָה״. מָה ״מוֹרָה״ הָאֲמוּרָה בְּשִׁמְשׁוֹן — נָזִיר, אַף ״מוֹרָה״ הָאֲמוּרָה בִּשְׁמוּאֵל — נָזִיר.
human_translation: Samuel was a nazirite, in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Nehorai, as it was stated “And no mora shall come upon his head” It is stated with regard to Samson: “And razor [ mora ] and it is stated: “And mora ,” with regard to Samuel. Just as “ mora ” that is stated with regard to Samson a nazirite, so too “ mora ” that is stated with regard to Samuel a nazirite.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one's name is Nazir, like the words of Rabbi Nehorai, as it is stated, "And no razor shall come upon his head." It is stated regarding Samson "razor," and it is stated regarding Samuel "razor." Just as the "razor" mentioned in connection with Samson refers to a Nazir, so too the "razor" mentioned in connection with Samuel refers to a Nazir.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: וַהֲלֹא אֵין מוֹרָה אֶלָּא שֶׁל בָּשָׂר וָדָם! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֵיךְ אֵלֵךְ וְשָׁמַע שָׁאוּל וַהֲרָגָנִי״, שֶׁכְּבָר הָיָה עָלָיו מוֹרָא שֶׁל בָּשָׂר וָדָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: But doesn’t “ mora ” nothing other of flesh and blood? Rabbi Nehorai said to him: But isn’t it already stated: “And Samuel said: How can I go; if Saul hears it he will kill me” that there was fear of flesh and blood upon
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: "But isn't teaching only of flesh and blood!" Rabbi Nehorai said to him: "But hasn't it already been said, 'And Samuel said, "How can I go? If Saul hears, he will kill me,"' indicating that he already had fear of flesh and blood upon him."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְחִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ:
human_translation: Rav said to his son Ḥiyya:
llm_translation: "Gema said to him, Rav said to Hiyya his son:"

hebrew_text: חֲטוֹף וּבָרֵיךְ. וְכֵן אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא לְרַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ: חֲטוֹף וּבָרֵיךְ.
human_translation: Seize and recite a blessing And similarly, Rav Huna said to his son, Rabba: Seize and recite a blessing.
llm_translation: Snatch and bless. And so Rav Huna said to Rabbah his son: Snatch and bless.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דִּמְבָרֵךְ עֲדִיף? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גָּדוֹל הָעוֹנֶה ״אָמֵן״ יוֹתֵר מִן הַמְבָרֵךְ. וְאָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי: הַשָּׁמַיִם! כָּךְ הוּא: תֵּדַע שֶׁהֲרֵי גּוּלְיָירִים מִתְגָּרִין בַּמִּלְחָמָה, וְגִבּוֹרִים נוֹצְחִין.
human_translation: Is this to say that one who recites a blessing is preferable But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei says: The one who answers amen is greater than the one who recites the blessing? And Rabbi Nehorai said to him: By Heavens, it is so. Know as the military assistants [ gulyarim ] initiate the war and the mighty prevail.
llm_translation: In the matter of who is superior in reciting blessings? And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: Greater is the one who responds "Amen" than the one who recites the blessing. And Rabbi Nehorai said to him: Heaven! This is how it is: Know that the troops of the House of David engage in battle, and the brave are victorious.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: אֶחָד הַמְבָרֵךְ וְאֶחָד הָעוֹנֶה ״אָמֵן״ בַּמַּשְׁמָע, אֶלָּא שֶׁמְּמַהֲרִין לַמְבָרֵךְ תְּחִילָּה.
human_translation: is tanna’im , as it is taught Both the one who recites a blessing and the one who answers amen are included but one hurries to first the one who recites the blessing.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: One who recites the blessing and one who responds "Amen" during the hearing, but they hurry the one reciting the blessing first.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מַרְבִּים שָׁלוֹם בָּעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכׇל בָּנַיִךְ לִמּוּדֵי ה׳ וְרַב שְׁלוֹם בָּנָיִךְ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said: Torah scholars increase peace in the world, as it is stated: “And all your children [ banayikh ] shall be taught of the Lord, and great shall be the peace of your children”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Chanina said: The disciples of the sages increase peace in the world, as it is stated: "And all your children shall be taught of the Lord, and great shall be the peace of your children."

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ הַגּוֹיִם אֵין לָהֶם נְזִירוּת וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת נָזִיר
llm_translation: We shall return to you, O nations, they do not have the vow of a Nazirite, and it is concluded for her the tractate Nazir.
